Text

" If [you]3143-you will allow [me]385-the audience , [I]385-the audience shall have the pleasure of reading aloud to [you]3143-you some passages from ' [[Mrs. Lirriper]179-mrs. lirriper 's Lodgings]3144-mrs. lirriper 's lodgings , ' by [Charles Dickens]180-charles . [I]385-the audience do not know much about the book [myself]385-the audience , as [I]385-the audience have never read it . [I]385-the audience dare say that [you]3143-you know more about it than [I]385-the audience do ; but [I]385-the audience am given to understand "[385-the audience] ( with a glance at the page before [him]384-him ) " that [Mrs. Lirriper]179-mrs. lirriper was [a lodging - house - keeper]3145-a lodging - house - keeper , that [she]179-mrs. lirriper kept lodgings in [London]1-london . [She]179-mrs. lirriper was [a very good sort of woman]3146-a very good sort of woman , [I]385-the audience believe "[385-the audience] ( another hasty glance ) , " but [she]179-mrs. lirriper sometimes had trouble with [[her]179-mrs. lirriper servants]3147-her servants . [I]385-the audience am told that [servants]3148-servants are troublesome sometimes "[385-the audience] ( a slight nervous laugh , the more nervous because it does not seem to be followed by any echo from [the audience]385-the audience ) . " If [you]3143-you will allow [me]181-jim then , as [I]181-jim say , and if [you]3143-you think it will amuse [you]3143-you , [I]181-jim will read [you]3143-you a little of what [she]3149-she says about these troubles . "[181-jim] The foregoing remarks are uttered in a loud , shy , dogged voice by [James Burgoyne]181-jim to the " [Oxford Women 's Provident Association]3150-oxford women 's provident association . "[181-jim] [His]181-jim voice is loud because , being quite unused to public reading , [he]181-jim does not know how to modulate it ; it is shy from the same cause of unaccustomedness ; it is dogged because [he]181-jim is very much displeased with [his]181-jim present occupation , and has not been successful in concealing that displeasure . When [a man]386-a man runs down to [Oxford]2-oxford for a couple of nights , to see how the six years that have passed since [he]386-a man turned [his]386-a man undergraduate back upon [the old place]387-the old place have treated [her]388-her — runs down to [a college chum unseen]389-a college chum unseen for the same six years — this is certainly not the way in which [he]386-a man expects to spend one of [his]386-a man two evenings . " [I]390-the college friend hope [you]3143-you will not mind , Jim"—ominous[390-the college friend] phrase — [the college friend]390-the college friend has said ; " but [I]390-the college friend am afraid [we]3151-we shall have to turn out for half an hour after dinner . It is rather a nuisance , particularly as it is such a wet night ; but the fact is , [I]390-the college friend have promised to read to the ' Oxford Women 's Provident Association . ' Ah , by - the - bye , that is new since [you]3143-you were here — [we]3151-we had [no Provident Women]3152-no provident women in [your]3143-you day ! "[390-the college friend] " On the other hand , [we]3151-we had [a great many improvident men]3153-a great many improvident men , "[181-jim] returns [Jim]181-jim dryly . " Well , the fact is , [[my]181-jim wife]3154-my wife is on the committee , and a good deal interested in it , and [we]3151-we give [them]3153-a great many improvident men a sort of entertainment once a month through the winter terms — tea and buns , that kind of thing , sixpence a head ; [they]3153-a great many improvident men enjoy it far more than if [we]3151-we gave it [them]3153-a great many improvident men for nothing ; and after tea [we]3151-we get [people]3155-people to recite and read and sing to [them]3153-a great many improvident men . [I]181-jim am sure [I]181-jim wish [them]3153-a great many improvident men joy of [my]181-jim reading to - night , for [I]181-jim do not see how [I]181-jim am to make [myself]181-jim audible ; [I]181-jim am as hoarse as a crow . "[181-jim] " [I]181-jim know those Oxford colds of old , "[181-jim] returns [Burgoyne]181-jim , with that temperate compassion in [his]181-jim voice which [we]391-we accord to [[our]391-we neighbours]392-our neighbours ' minor diseases . [He]181-jim is sorry that [[his]181-jim friend]393-his friend has a cold ; but [he]181-jim little knows how much sorrier [he]181-jim will be in the course of the next hour as [he]181-jim adds : " Do not distress [yourself]393-his friend about [me]181-jim ; [I]181-jim shall be quite happy in [[your]393-his friend den]3156-your den with a book and a cigarette . [Mrs. Brown]182-brown does not object , does [she]182-brown ? And [I]181-jim dare say [you]393-his friend will not be very long away . "[181-jim] As [he]181-jim speaks [he]181-jim realizes , with a sort of pang — the pang [we]391-we pay sometimes to [our]391-we dead pasts — that , though it is only three hours since [he]181-jim was reunited to [[his]181-jim once inseparable [Brown]182-brown]394-his once inseparable brown , [he]181-jim is already looking forward with relief to the prospect of an hour 's freedom from [his]181-jim society — so terribly far apart is it possible to grow in six years . But , before [his]181-jim half - fledged thought has had time to do more than traverse [his]181-jim brain , [Brown]182-brown has broken into it with the eager remonstrances of [a mistaken species of hospitality]395-a mistaken species of hospitality . " Leave [you]181-jim behind ? Could not hear of such a thing ! Of course [you]181-jim must come too ! It will be a new experience for [you]181-jim ; a wholesome change . Ha ! ha ! and [we]3157-we can talk all the way there and back ; [we]3157-we have had no talk worth speaking of yet . "[182-brown] Again it flashes across [the other]396-the other 's mind , with the same pensive regret as before , that talk worth speaking of is for ever over between [them]397-them ; but , seeing that further attempts at evasion will seriously hurt [the good - natured Brown]182-brown , [he]181-jim acquiesces , with as fair a grace as [he]181-jim may . While putting on [his]181-jim own mackintosh , [he]181-jim watches , with a subdued wonder , [[his]181-jim friend]393-his friend winding [himself]393-his friend into a huge white woollen comforter , and stepping into a pair of goloshes ( [he]181-jim had been rather [a smart undergraduate]399-a smart undergraduate in [his]181-jim day ) , while outside the opened hall door the rain is heard to swish , and the wind to bellow . " Had not [we]3157-we better have a hansom ? "[181-jim] suggests [Burgoyne]181-jim , blinking , as the slant gust sends two or three stinging drops into [his]181-jim eyes . " A hansom ! nonsense ! "[396-the other] returns [the other]396-the other , laughing , and with difficulty unfurling an umbrella in the teeth of the blast . " It is all very well for [a bloated bachelor like [you]396-the other]3158-a bloated bachelor like you ; but [a man whose family is increasing at the rate [mine]181-jim is]3159-a man whose family is increasing at the rate mine is can not afford [himself]3159-a man whose family is increasing at the rate mine is such luxuries ; come along , [you]396-the other are not sugar or salt . "[396-the other] [Burgoyne]181-jim feels that at this moment [he]181-jim can at all events conscientiously disclaim affinity with the first of the two . It is indeed a wet night , wet as the one immortalized by [Browning]183-browning in " Christmas Eve and Easter Day ; "[183-browning] and who ever brought a wet night and wet umbrellas " wry and flapping "[393-his friend] so piercingly [home]401-home to [us]402-us as [he]393-his friend ? The talk so cheerfully promised by [[Burgoyne]181-jim 's sanguine friend]403-burgoyne 's sanguine friend is rendered absolutely impossible by the riot of the elements . It is a good step from [the suburban villa]404-the suburban villa , which is the scene of [Brown]182-brown 's married joys , to [the room in [the heart of [the town]407-the town where [the Provident Matrons]408-the provident matrons hold [their]408-the provident matrons sabbat]406-the heart of the town where the provident matrons hold their sabbat]405-the room in the heart of the town where the provident matrons hold their sabbat ; and by the time that [the two men]409-the two men have reached [that room]410-that room there is , despite [his]181-jim mackintosh , little of [Burgoyne]181-jim left dry except [his]181-jim speech . [They]408-the provident matrons are under shelter at last , however , have entered [the building]411-the building , added [their]408-the provident matrons umbrellas to many other streaming wrecks of whalebone huddled in a corner , and exchanged the dark blustering drench for a flare of gas , a reek of tea , and a sultry stream of wet clothes and humanity . The tea , indeed , is a thing of the past — all its apparatus has been removed . The rows of chairs are all set to face [the platform]412-the platform , and on those chairs [the Provident Women]413-the provident women sit , smiling , if damp , with here and there [a little boy]414-a little boy , evidently too wicked to be left at [home]401-home , comfortably wedged between [a couple of matronly figures]416-a couple of matronly figures . The entertainment has already begun , and [an undergraduate — damp]417-an undergraduate — damp , like [everyone else]418-everyone else — is singing , in a booming bass voice , something of a vaguely boastful nature about what [he]417-an undergraduate — damp once did " In [[Bilboa]3-bilboa 's Bay]3160-bilboa 's bay . "[417-an undergraduate — damp] [Burgoyne]181-jim has for the moment lost sight of [[his]181-jim chaperon]419-his chaperon , and remains standing near the door , looking upon the scene around [him]181-jim with an eye from which philanthropy is all too criminally absent . About [him]181-jim are grouped [a few ladies]420-a few ladies and [gentlemen]421-gentlemen — [more of the former than [the latter]423-the latter — who are obviously about to give [their]422-more of the former than the latter — who are obviously about to give their services , judging by their rolls of music and the books in their hands services , judging by [their]422-more of the former than the latter — who are obviously about to give their services , judging by their rolls of music and the books in their hands rolls of music and the books in [their]422-more of the former than the latter — who are obviously about to give their services , judging by their rolls of music and the books in their hands hands]422-more of the former than the latter — who are obviously about to give their services , judging by their rolls of music and the books in their hands . [His]181-jim look passes over [them]422-more of the former than the latter — who are obviously about to give their services , judging by their rolls of music and the books in their hands indifferently — [he]181-jim has no acquaintance among [them]422-more of the former than the latter — who are obviously about to give their services , judging by their rolls of music and the books in their hands . [He]181-jim had never known [many of [the Oxford householders]425-the oxford householders]424-many of the oxford householders , and there is no place where [a man]386-a man becomes superannuated after so short a lapse of years . Here are [new arrivals]427-new arrivals . [He]181-jim turns [his]181-jim head mechanically as the opening door reveals the advent of [more umbrellaed and mackintoshed waterfalls]428-more umbrellaed and mackintoshed waterfalls . [Two men]429-two men and [a lady]430-a lady . As [his]181-jim eye alights on [the woman]431-the woman , [he]181-jim does not start — [we]432-our [Anglo - Saxons]184-anglo - saxons are not apt to make [our]432-our slow grave bodies the indexes of [our]432-our emotions — but [he]181-jim is conscious of an odd and puzzling sensation . Where has [he]181-jim seen that face before ? " [Bilboa 's Bay]4-bilboa 's bay "[181-jim] has come to an end without [his]181-jim perceiving it . [He]181-jim is putting [his]181-jim memory through [her]431-the woman paces , trying to find some niche in [his]181-jim three happy Oxford years in which to place [that strangely known yet unknown figure]433-that strangely known yet unknown figure . There is no such niche . It is not an Oxford memory at all . What is it then ? An earlier or a later one ? [His]181-jim eyebrows are drawn together in the effort of recollection , making [him]181-jim look , if possible , crosser than before , when [he]181-jim is made aware of the return of [Brown]182-brown by finding [his]181-jim arm seized , and [[his]181-jim friend]393-his friend 's voice — a good deal hoarser even than when [they]435-they left [home]401-home — in [his]181-jim ear , " [Jim]181-jim , do [you]181-jim feel inclined to do a very good - natured thing ? "[393-his friend] " Not in the least , "[181-jim] replies [Burgoyne]181-jim promptly ; " if [anyone]3161-anyone wishes to borrow £ 5 from [me]181-jim , [I]181-jim should advise [him]3161-anyone to choose a moment when [I]181-jim am drier about the legs . "[181-jim] [Burgoyne]181-jim has very often stood up to and over [his]181-jim knees in water for hours , watching for ducks among whistling reeds on winter mornings , and never thought [himself]181-jim at all to be pitied ; but [he]181-jim is thoroughly vexed now at [his]181-jim moist trousers . [Brown]182-brown , however , is not so easily rebuffed . " [I]181-jim should be awfully obliged to [you]181-jim , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim says croakily ; " [you]181-jim would be laying [me]181-jim under a very real obligation if [you]181-jim would — — "[181-jim] [He]181-jim stops to cough . " If [I]396-the other would what ? "[396-the other] returns [the other]396-the other curtly , and looking apprehensively at a book which [Brown]182-brown is expanding before [his]181-jim eyes . " If [you]181-jim would read instead of [me]182-brown . "[182-brown] " [I]396-the other ! "[396-the other] " Why , the fact is"—coughing[396-the other] noisily again as if to show that there is no imposition—"I suppose the fog must have got down [my]396-the other throat ; but [I]396-the other find [I]396-the other can not speak above a whisper . [I]396-the other should not be heard beyond the front row ; come , [old man]3162-old man , do a good - natured thing for once in [your]3162-old man life . "[396-the other] There is a pause ; [Burgoyne]181-jim is not very fond of being asked to do a good - natured thing . [He]181-jim can do a big one every now and then , but [he]181-jim is not particularly fond of being asked to do a small one . " Surely there must be many people here much better suited for it than [I]181-jim am , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim says presently , looking uncomfortably round in search of [the little group of booked and musicked persons whom [he]181-jim had seen but now standing near [him]181-jim]438-the little group of booked and musicked persons whom he had seen but now standing near him , but it had melted . " That is just what there are not , "[181-jim] rejoins [Brown]182-brown , pressing [his]181-jim point with the more eagerness , as [he]181-jim thinks [he]181-jim sees signs of yielding ; " [we]3163-we are very short of hands to - night , and [[my]181-jim wife]3154-my wife has just heard that [the girl upon whom [she]3154-my wife was counting for a couple of songs]3165-the girl upon whom she was counting for a couple of songs is in bed with influenza . "[181-jim] " [Happy girl]3166-happy girl ! [I]181-jim wish [I]181-jim too was in bed with influenza , "[181-jim] says [Jim]181-jim sardonically , for [he]181-jim sees [his]181-jim fate about to overtake [him]181-jim . And so it comes to pass that , five minutes later , as described at the opening of this chapter , [he]181-jim is seated on the platform with " [Mrs. Lirriper]179-mrs. lirriper 's Lodgings "[185-provident matrons] before [him]181-jim , rows of [Provident Matrons]185-provident matrons ' eyes fastened expectantly upon [him]181-jim , and horrid qualms of strange shyness racing over [him]181-jim . [Brown]182-brown has indicated by a dog's - ear the page at which [he]181-jim is to begin ; so [he]181-jim is spared indecision on this head . But has [Brown]182-brown indicated the page at which [he]181-jim is to stop ? [He]181-jim is gnawed by a keen anxiety as to this point all through [his]181-jim performance . It is hot upon [the platform]412-the platform , the smell of tea potent , and the naked gas - jets close above [his]181-jim head throw an ugly yellow glare upon [his]181-jim book . Having offered [his]181-jim prefatory observations in the manner [I]0-i have indicated , [he]181-jim rushes in media res . " [Girls]3167-girls , as [I]181-jim was beginning to remark , are one of [your]3167-girls first and [your]3167-girls lasting troubles , being like [your]3167-girls teeth , which begin with convulsions , and never cease tormenting [you]3167-girls from the time [you]3167-girls cut them till [they]440-the matrons cut [you]3167-girls , and then [you]3167-girls do not want to part with [them]440-the matrons , which seems hard , but [we]3168-we must all succumb , or buy artificial . "[181-jim] ( Do [his]181-jim ears deceive [him]181-jim ? Is there already a slight titter ? Have the simile of the convulsions and the necessity for a râtelier already struck a chord in [the matrons]440-the matrons ' breasts ? ) " And , even where [you]3167-girls get a will , nine times out of ten [you]3167-girls get a dirty face with it , and naturally [lodgers]3169-lodgers do not like good society to be shown in with a smear of black across the nose , or a smudgy eyebrow ! "[181-jim] ( Is [he]181-jim managing [his]181-jim voice alright ? Is [he]181-jim mumbling , or is [he]181-jim bellowing ? [He]181-jim rather inclines to a suspicion of the latter . Why did not [they]441-they laugh at the " smudgy eyebrow "[181-jim] ? [They]441-they ought to have done so , and [he]181-jim had paused to give [them]441-they the opportunity . Perhaps it is among [them]441-they too familiar a phenomenon to provoke mirth . ) " Where [they]441-they pick the black up is a mystery [I]181-jim can not solve , as in the case of [the willingest girl that ever came into [a house]3171-a house , half - starved , poor thing]3170-the willingest girl that ever came into a house , half - starved , poor thing ; [a girl so willing that [I]181-jim called [her]3172-a girl so willing that i called her ' willing sophy ' [Willing Sophy]186-willing sophy]3172-a girl so willing that i called her ' willing sophy ; ' down upon [her]3172-a girl so willing that i called her ' willing sophy knees scrubbing early and late , and ever cheerful , but always with a black face . And [I]181-jim says to [Sophy]186-willing sophy , ' Now , [Sophy]186-willing sophy , [[my]181-jim good girl]3173-my good girl , have a regular day for [your]186-willing sophy stoves , and do not brush [your]186-willing sophy hair with the bottoms of the saucepans , and do not meddle with the snuffs of the candles , and it stands to reason that it can not be . ' "[181-jim] ( Ah ! what welcome sound is this ? " [Willing Sophy]186-willing sophy "[181-jim] has produced an undoubted giggle , which [Burgoyne]181-jim hears spreading and widening through [the room]442-the room . Heartened by this indication , [he]181-jim goes on in a more emphatic and hilarious voice :) " Yet there it was , and always on [her]3172-a girl so willing that i called her ' willing sophy nose , which , turning up , and being broad at the end , seemed to boast of it , and caused warning from [a steady gentleman]3174-a steady gentleman , [an excellent lodger]3175-an excellent lodger , with breakfast by the week . "[181-jim] There can be no mistake about it now ; the giggle has changed into a universal resonant laugh , which goes on swelling and rising , until , in the final roar of approbation which greets the concluding paragraph , [the reader]443-the reader 's voice is drowned . [The matrons]440-the matrons have all along been ready to be amused ; it is only that , owing to the gravity of [his]181-jim face and solemnity of [his]181-jim manner , it was some time before [they]440-the matrons recognised that [his]181-jim intention was comic . As soon as [they]440-the matrons do so , [they]440-the matrons reward that intention with more than adequate mirth . [Burgoyne]181-jim has reached the second dog's - ear , that dog's - ear which [his]181-jim eye has been earnestly searching for throughout . [His]181-jim task then is ended . [He]181-jim heaves a deep sigh of relief , and , with a reflection that , after all , [he]181-jim is glad [he]181-jim was obliging , is preparing to shut the volume , when [he]181-jim feels the inevitable [Brown]182-brown 's hand on [his]181-jim shoulder , and [his]181-jim husky voice in [his]181-jim ear . " Capital ! [you]181-jim got on capitally ! Could not be better ; but [you]181-jim will not mind going on a little longer , will [you]181-jim ? [You]181-jim have only read for ten minutes . [I]181-jim want [you]181-jim to try something different this time — a little pathos , for a change . [I]181-jim have marked the page . Here ! "[181-jim] What is there to do but acquiesce ? [Burgoyne]181-jim , complying , finds [himself]181-jim at once in the middle of a melancholy tale of [a poor young woman left ruined and deserted in [[Mrs. Lirriper]179-mrs. lirriper 's Lodgings]3144-mrs. lirriper 's lodgings , and only rescued from suicide by the efforts of [that good lady , who , however , is unable to save [her]179-mrs. lirriper from a tragic and premature death]447-that good lady , who , however , is unable to save her from a tragic and premature death]445-a poor young woman left ruined and deserted in mrs. lirriper 's lodgings , and only rescued from suicide by the efforts of that good lady , who , however , is unable to save her from a tragic and premature death . [The reader]443-the reader has reached the point at which [Mrs. Lirriper]179-mrs. lirriper has met the poor creature on [her]179-mrs. lirriper way to [the river]449-the river . " ' [Mrs. Edson]187-mrs. edson , [I]179-mrs. lirriper says , [[my]179-mrs. lirriper dear]3176-my dear , take care ! However , did [you]187-mrs. edson lose [your]187-mrs. edson way , and stumble in [a dangerous place like this]3177-a dangerous place like this ? No wonder [you]187-mrs. edson 're lost , [I]179-mrs. lirriper 'm sure . ' "[179-mrs. lirriper] ( What is this sound ? Is it possible that the giggle is rising again ? the giggle which [he]181-jim was so glad to welcome a little while ago , but which is so disastrously out of place here . [He]181-jim redoubles [his]181-jim efforts to put an unmistakably serious and pathetic tone into [his]181-jim voice . ) " [She]179-mrs. lirriper was all in a shiver , and [she]179-mrs. lirriper so continued till [I]181-jim laid [her]179-mrs. lirriper on [her]179-mrs. lirriper own bed , and up to the early morning [she]179-mrs. lirriper held [me]181-jim by the hand and moaned , and moaned , ' Oh , wicked , wicked , wicked!—-- ' "[181-jim] What can [the Provident Matrons]408-the provident matrons be made of ? [They]408-the provident matrons are laughing unrestrainedly . Too late [Burgoyne]181-jim realizes that [he]181-jim had not made it sufficiently clear that [his]181-jim intention is no longer comic . The idea of [his]181-jim being [a funny man]451-a funny man has so firmly rooted itself in [[his]181-jim hearers]452-his hearers ' minds , that nothing can now dislodge it . Such being the case , [he]181-jim feels that the best thing [he]181-jim can do is to reach the end as quickly as possible . [He]181-jim begins to read very fast , which is taken for a new stroke of facetiousness , the result of which is that the last sigh of [the poor young would - be suicide]453-the poor young would - be suicide is drowned in a storm of hilarity even heartier and more prolonged than that which greeted " [Willing Sophy]186-willing sophy 's "[188-browns] smudged nose . In much confusion , greatly abashed by the honours so mistakenly heaped upon [him]181-jim , [Burgoyne]181-jim hastily leaves [the platform]412-the platform . Twenty thousand [Browns]188-browns shall not keep [him]181-jim [there]455-there ! " There is no reason why [we]457-we should not go [home]401-home now ; are [you]181-jim ready ? "[182-brown] cries [Brown]182-brown , bustling up to [[his]181-jim friend]393-his friend , who has not waited for this question to make straight , as the needle to the pole , for the corner where the collected umbrellas stand in [[their]457-we little area of [lake]459-lake]458-their little area of lake . [Burgoyne]181-jim would probably have laughed at the unconscious irony of this inquiry if [he]181-jim had heard it ; but [he]181-jim has not , [his]181-jim attention being otherwise directed . On the same umbrella quest as [himself]181-jim , being helped on with [her]393-his friend mackintosh by one of [the two men who had accompanied [her]393-his friend]460-the two men who had accompanied her , [a pepper - and - salt - haired , sturdy gentleman of an obviously unacademic cut]461-a pepper - and - salt - haired , sturdy gentleman of an obviously unacademic cut , is [the lady whose face had flashed upon [him]181-jim with that puzzling sense of unfamiliar familiarity]462-the lady whose face had flashed upon him with that puzzling sense of unfamiliar familiarity . Since [they]463-they are now in close proximity , and both employed alike in struggling into [their]463-they wraps , there is nothing more natural than that [she]393-his friend should turn [her]393-his friend eyes full upon [him]181-jim . [They]464-they are very fine eyes , though far from [young ones]465-young ones . Is it a trick of [his]181-jim imagination , or does [he]181-jim see a look of half - recognition dawn in them , such as must have been born in [his]181-jim own when [they]463-they first alighted on [her]393-his friend ? At all events , if there is such a look of half - recognition in [her]393-his friend eyes , [she]393-his friend is determined that it shall not have a chance of becoming [a whole one]466-a whole one . Either [he]181-jim is mistaken , and [she]393-his friend has not recognised [him]181-jim , or [she]393-his friend is determined not to acknowledge [the acquaintance]467-the acquaintance , for [she]393-his friend looks away again at once , nor does [she]393-his friend throw another glance in [his]181-jim direction . Indeed , it seems to [him]181-jim that [she]393-his friend hurries on [her]393-his friend preparations with added speed , and walks out into the night accompanied by [[her]393-his friend double escort before [him]181-jim]468-her double escort before him . The weather has changed , and for the better . The rollicking wind has lulled , the pattering rain ceased . Between the ragged , black cloud - sheets star - points shine , and a shimmering moon shows [her]393-his friend wet face reflected in the puddles . Talk , which had been impossible on [their]469-their way to the meeting , is not only possible but easy now , and [Brown]182-brown is evidently greatly inclined for it . [Burgoyne]181-jim , on the other hand , had never felt more disinclined . It is not so much that [he]181-jim is out of humour with [[his]181-jim tiresome friend]470-his tiresome friend , though [he]181-jim is that too , as that [his]181-jim whole mind is centred on making [his]181-jim memory give up the secret of that face that has come back to [him]181-jim out of some vague cavern of [his]181-jim past . Who is [the woman whom [he]181-jim knows]471-the woman whom he knows , and who knows [him]181-jim ( for on reflection [he]181-jim is sure that that look of [hers]393-his friend was one of half — of more than half — recognition ) , and yet whose place in [his]181-jim history , whose very name , [he]181-jim seeks so vainly ? [She]393-his friend does not belong to [his]181-jim Oxford days , as [he]181-jim has already ascertained . [He]181-jim explores the succeeding years of [his]181-jim life . [He]181-jim must hark back to earlier days — [his]181-jim school - time , the six months [he]181-jim spent in [Devonshire]5-devonshire with [a coach]479-a coach before [he]181-jim came up to [New]6-new . Ah ! [he]181-jim has it — [he]181-jim has it at last ! just as [they]477-they have reached [Brown]182-brown 's door , while [he]181-jim is fumbling with [his]181-jim latch - key for the keyhole , imprecating the moon for withdrawing [her]393-his friend shining at the very instant [he]181-jim most needs [her]393-his friend , [Burgoyne]181-jim has come up with the shy object of [his]181-jim chase . " [I]181-jim have it , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim says to [himself]181-jim ; " [her]393-his friend hair has turned white , that was why [I]181-jim did not recognise [her]393-his friend ; it used to be raven - black . But it is [she]393-his friend — of course it is [she]393-his friend ! To think of [my]181-jim not knowing [her]393-his friend again ! Of course it is [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant . "[181-jim] What a door into the distance that name has opened!—a door through which [he]181-jim passes into [a Devonshire garden]480-a devonshire garden , and romps with [rose - faced Devonshire children]481-rose - faced devonshire children . The very names of [those children]482-those children are coming back to [him]181-jim . [Tom]190-tom and [Charles]180-charles , those were [the schoolboys]483-the schoolboys ; [Rose]191-rose and [Miriam]192-miriam , and — [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth . [He]181-jim recalls — absurd trick of freakish memory — [those children]482-those children 's pets . [Tom]190-tom and [Charles]180-charles had guinea - pigs ; [Miriam]192-miriam had a white rat ; [Rose]191-rose — what had [Rose]191-rose ? [Rose]191-rose must have had something ; and [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth had a kangaroo . [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth 's kangaroo was short - lived , poor beast , and died about hay - time ; the guinea - pigs and the white rat have been dead too for ages now , of course . And are [Tom]190-tom and [Charles]180-charles , and [Rose]191-rose and [Miriam]192-miriam , and bright [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth dead also ? Absurd ! Why should [they]485-they be ? Nothing more unlikely ! Why , it is only ten years ago , after all . [He]181-jim is roused from [his]181-jim meditations by [Brown]182-brown 's voice , to find [himself]181-jim in [[Brown]182-brown 's study]486-brown 's study , where [its owner]487-its owner is filling [himself]487-its owner a pipe , and festally offering [him]487-its owner whisky - and - water . But it is only an abstracted attention that [Burgoyne]181-jim lends , either to the whisky or [the whisky 's master]488-the whisky 's master ; and [his]181-jim answers are sometimes inattentively beside the mark , to talk , which indeed is not without some likeness to the boasted exploits in [[Clement]194-clement 's Inn]489-clement 's inn , and the affectionate inquiries after [Jane Nightwork]195-jane nightwork , of [a more famous fool]490-a more famous fool than [he]181-jim . It is a relief to [the guest]491-the guest when , earlier than [he]181-jim had expected — a blessing [he]181-jim , no doubt , owes to [Mrs. Brown]182-brown — [[his]181-jim host]492-his host breaks up the séance , and [he]181-jim is free to retire to [[his]181-jim own room]493-his own room . At once [he]181-jim is back in [that Devonshire garden]494-that devonshire garden , [he]181-jim is there almost all night , between sleep and wake . It is strange that [persons]495-persons and circumstances banished from [his]181-jim memory for ten long years should rush back with such tyrannous insistence now . Such silly recollected trifles crowd back upon [his]181-jim mind . The day on which [Tom]190-tom nearly choked [himself]190-tom by swallowing a barley beard ; the day on which the lop - eared rabbit littered — ah , rabbits , of course ! those were what [Rose]191-rose had!—the day on which [Tom]190-tom pushed [Miriam]192-miriam into the moat , and [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth fell in , too , in trying to fish [her]193-elizabeth out . [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth , [the eldest]496-the eldest , [the almost grown - up one]497-the almost grown - up one , embarrassed by [her]193-elizabeth newly lengthened petticoats , so harassing at cricket , in races , in climbing apple - trees . [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth was sixteen ; [he]181-jim remembers the fact , because [her]193-elizabeth birthday had fallen two days before [his]181-jim own departure . [He]181-jim had given [her]193-elizabeth a gold thimble set with turquoises upon the occasion ; it was not a surprise , because [he]181-jim recalls measuring [her]193-elizabeth finger for the size . [He]181-jim can see that small middle finger now . [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth must now be twenty - six years of age . Where is [she]193-elizabeth ? What is [she]193-elizabeth — [maid]498-maid , [wife]499-wife , or [widow]500-widow ? And why has [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant 's hair turned snow - white ? Had it been merely gray [he]181-jim would not have complained , though [he]181-jim would have deplored the loss of the fine smooth inky sweep [he]181-jim remembers . [She]189-mrs. le marchant has a fair right to be gray ; [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant must be about forty - six or forty - seven , bien sonné . But white , snow - white — the hue that [one]501-one connects with a venerable extremity of age . Can it be bleached ? [He]181-jim has heard of [women]502-women bleaching [their]502-women hair ; but not [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant , not [the Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant [he]181-jim remembers . [She]189-mrs. le marchant would have been as incapable of bleach as of dye . Then why is [she]189-mrs. le marchant snow - haired ? Because [Providence]196-providence has so willed it is the obvious answer . But somehow [Burgoyne]181-jim can not bring [himself]181-jim to believe that [she]189-mrs. le marchant has come fairly by that white head . With the morning light the might of the [Devonshire]5-devonshire memories grows weaker ; and , as the day advances , [the Oxford ones]503-the oxford ones resume [their]503-the oxford ones sway . How can it be otherwise , when all day long [he]181-jim strays among [the unaltered buildings]504-the unaltered buildings in [the sweet sedate college gardens]505-the sweet sedate college gardens , down [the familiar " High]3179-the familiar " high , "[506-a jolly fresh voice] where , six years ago , [he]181-jim could not take two steps without being hailed by [a jolly fresh voice]506-a jolly fresh voice , claiming [his]181-jim company for some new pleasure ; but where now [he]181-jim walks ungreeted , where [the smooth - faced boys [he]181-jim meets]507-the smooth - faced boys he meets , and who strike [him]181-jim as so much more boyish than [[his]181-jim own contemporaries]508-his own contemporaries had done , pass [him]181-jim by indifferently , unknown to [the whole two thousand]509-the whole two thousand as [he]181-jim is . [He]181-jim feels a sort of irrational anger with [them]503-the oxford ones for not recognising [him]181-jim , though [they]503-the oxford ones have never seen [him]181-jim before . Yes , there is no place where [a man]386-a man is so quickly superannuated as in [Oxford]2-oxford . [He]181-jim is saying this to [himself]181-jim all day , is saying it still as [he]181-jim strolls in the afternoon down [Mesopotamia]7-mesopotamia , to fill up the time before the hour for [college chapel]511-college chapel . Yes , there is no place where [men]512-men so soon turn into [ghosts]513-ghosts . [He]181-jim has been knocking up against [them]512-men all day at [every street - corner]514-every street - corner ; [they]512-men have looked out at [him]181-jim from every gray window in [the Quad]515-the quad at New — jovial , athletic young ghosts , so much painfuller to meet than [rusty , century - worn old ones]516-rusty , century - worn old ones . [They]512-men are rather less plentiful in [Mesopotamia]7-mesopotamia than elsewhere ; perhaps , because in [his]181-jim day , as now , [Mesopotamia]7-mesopotamia on Sundays was given over to [the mechanic]517-the mechanic and [the perambulator]518-the perambulator . Oh , that [Heaven]197-heaven would put it into the head of [some Chancellor of [the Exchequer]520-the exchequer]519-some chancellor of the exchequer to lay a swingeing tax upon [that all - accursed vehicle]521-that all - accursed vehicle ! But not even [mechanic and perambulator]522-mechanic and perambulator can hinder [Mesopotamia]7-mesopotamia from being fair on a fine February day , when the beautiful floods are out , the floods that [the Thames Conservators]523-the thames conservators and [the Oxford authorities]524-the oxford authorities have combined to put down , as [they]522-mechanic and perambulator have most other beautiful things within [their]522-mechanic and perambulator reach . But [they]522-mechanic and perambulator have not yet quite succeeded . To - day , for instance , the floods are out in might . [Burgoyne]181-jim is pacing along [a brown walk]525-a brown walk , like [a raised causeway]526-a raised causeway , with a sheet of white water on either hand , rolling strong ripples to [the bank]527-the bank . Gnarled willows stand islanded in [the coldly argent water]528-the coldly argent water . A blackbird is flying out of the bushes , with a surprised look at finding [himself]181-jim turned into a sea - bird . No sun ; an even sweep of dull silver to right and left . No sun ; and yet as [he]181-jim looks , after days of rain , the " grand décorateur , "[529-someone] as [someone]529-someone happily called [him]181-jim , rides out in royalty on a cleared sky - field , turning [the whole drenched country]530-the whole drenched country into mother - of - pearl — a sheet of opal stretched across [the drowned meadows]531-the drowned meadows ; the distance opal too , a delicate , dainty , evanescent loveliness snatched from the ugly brown jaws of winter . [Burgoyne]181-jim is leaning over [the wooden bridge beneath which , in its normal state , the water of the lasher]532-the wooden bridge beneath which , in its normal state , the water of the lasher rushes down impetuously ; but it is now raised to such a height that [it]533-it lies level , almost flush with the planking . [He]181-jim is staring across [the iridescent water - plain]534-the iridescent water - plain to where , in the poetic atmosphere of sun and mist , dome , and schools and soaring spires stand etherealized . " [Dear old place]3180-dear old place ! "[181-jim] [he]181-jim says , under [his]181-jim breath , " [everybody]3181-everybody is dead ; and [I]181-jim am dead ; and [Brown]182-brown is deader than [anyone]3161-anyone . [I]181-jim am glad that [you]3180-dear old place , at least , are still alive ! "[181-jim] Are these more ghosts coming round the corner ? [A man]386-a man and [a woman]536-a woman ghost strolling along , and looking about [them]537-they as [strangers]538-strangers look . When [they]537-they are within a pace or two of [him]181-jim [the woman]431-the woman says something — something about the floods — to [[her]431-the woman companion]540-her companion , and at the sound [Burgoyne]181-jim starts . " [She]431-the woman did not speak last night ; if [she]431-the woman had spoken [I]181-jim should have known [her]431-the woman at once . [She]431-the woman always had such a sweet voice . "[181-jim] [He]181-jim raises [his]181-jim arms from the bridge - top , and , turning , meets [them]537-they face to face , eye to eye , and in an instant [he]181-jim has seen that [both]541-both recognise [him]181-jim . At the same instant [he]181-jim is aware of a simultaneous inclination on the part of [man]542-man and [wife]499-wife to avert [their]537-they heads , and pass [him]181-jim without claiming [his]181-jim acquaintance . Perhaps , if [he]181-jim had had time to reflect , [he]181-jim would have allowed [them]537-they to do so , but the impulse of the moment forbids it . Why should [they]537-they wish to cut [him]181-jim ? What has [he]181-jim done to deserve it ? Ten years ago , [they]537-they were [[his]181-jim very good friends]544-his very good friends , and [he]181-jim was [the familiar comrade of [[their]537-they children]546-their children , [the daily guest at [their]537-they table]547-the daily guest at their table]545-the familiar comrade of their children , the daily guest at their table . What has the unavoidable lapse of those years done to make [him]181-jim less fit for [their]537-they company at twenty - nine than [he]181-jim was at nineteen ? There must be some misconception , which a moment will set right . " [I]181-jim am afraid that [you]537-they do not remember [me]181-jim , [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim says , lifting [his]181-jim hat . But what formula has [a man to employ in such a case]548-a man to employ in such a case ? [They]537-they both look back at [him]181-jim with a sort of irresolution . " [I]181-jim am sure that [you]549-she have no intention of cutting [me]181-jim , "[181-jim] [Jim]181-jim goes on , with a smile , seeing that [she]549-she is apparently struggling with a difficulty in utterance ; " at least , [you]549-she must be very much changed from what [you]549-she were ten years ago if [you]549-she have . [My]181-jim name is — — "[181-jim] " [I]549-she know — [I]549-she know ! "[549-she] [she]549-she interrupts , finding speech at last — speech low and hurried . " [I]549-she remember perfectly . [You]181-jim are [Mr. Burgoyne]198-burgoyne . "[549-she] [Her]549-she confusion — [she]549-she used always to be such [a placid , even - mannered woman]552-a placid , even - mannered woman — is so patent , born of whatever unaccountable feeling it may be , that [he]181-jim now heartily wishes [he]181-jim had let [the poor woman]553-the poor woman pass unmolested . But such repentance is too late . [He]181-jim has arrested [her]549-she ; [she]549-she is standing on [the gravel path before [him]181-jim]554-the gravel path before him , and though [he]181-jim feels that [her]549-she extraordinary shyness — mauvaise honte , whatever it may be — has infected [himself]181-jim , [he]181-jim must make some further remark to [her]549-she . Nothing better occurs to [him]181-jim than the obvious one : " It is a long time — it is ten years since [we]555-we met . "[181-jim] " Yes , ten years ; it must be quite ten years , "[549-she] [she]549-she assents , evidently making a great effort to regain composure . [She]549-she does not feign the slightest pleasure in the meeting , and [Burgoyne]198-burgoyne feels that the one thought that occupies [her]549-she mind is how [she]549-she can soonest end it . But [his]181-jim roused curiosity , together with the difficulty of parting without further observation after having forced [his]181-jim presence upon [them]555-we , combine to prevent [her]549-she succeeding . " And how is [the Moat]8-the moat ? "[181-jim] [he]181-jim asks , reflecting that this , at least , is a safe question ; [a brick and mortar house]556-a brick and mortar house , at all events , can not be dead . " How is [Devonshire]5-devonshire ? "[181-jim] Apparently it is not so harmless a question as [he]181-jim had imagined ; at least , [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant is obviously quite incapable of answering it . [[Her]189-mrs. le marchant husband]474-her husband , for the first time , comes to [her]189-mrs. le marchant rescue . " [The Moat]8-the moat is let , "[474-her husband] [he]474-her husband says , in a dry voice ; " [we]3183-we have left [Devonshire]5-devonshire a long while — nine , nine and a half years ago . "[474-her husband] [The Moat]558-the moat let ! Judging by the light of [Burgoyne]198-burgoyne 's recollections , it would have seemed less surprising to [him]181-jim to hear that [Windsor Castle]10-windsor castle had been turned into [a Joint Stock Company Hotel]559-a joint stock company hotel . It is probably , then , some money trouble that has turned [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant 's hair white — snow white , as [he]181-jim now sees it to be . But no ; [he]181-jim rejects the explanation as insufficient . [She]189-mrs. le marchant is not [the woman to have taken a diminished income so much to heart]560-the woman to have taken a diminished income so much to heart . Good manners forbid [him]181-jim to ask , " Why is [the Moat]8-the moat let ? "[181-jim] so all that [he]181-jim says is , " Nine and a half years ago ? Why , that must have been very soon after [I]181-jim left [Devonshire]5-devonshire . "[181-jim] [He]181-jim addresses [his]181-jim remark involuntarily rather to [the wife]561-the wife than [the husband]562-the husband , but [she]189-mrs. le marchant does not answer it . [Her]189-mrs. le marchant eyes are fixed upon the bubbles sailing so fast upon [the swollen river]563-the swollen river , which is distinguishable only by [its]563-the swollen river current from the sameness of [the surrounding water]564-the surrounding water . A lark — there is always a lark in [Mesopotamia]7-mesopotamia — [a tiny , strong - throated singer , that never seems to have to stop to take breath]565-a tiny , strong - throated singer , that never seems to have to stop to take breath , fills up the silence , shouting somewhere out of sight among the black clouds , in and out of which the uncertain sun is plunging . Whether of a moneyed nature or not , there is evidently something very unpleasant connected with [their]566-their leaving [[their]566-their native county]567-their native county and [[their]566-their immemorial home]568-their immemorial home , so [he]181-jim had better get away from the subject as fast as possible . " Anyhow , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim says , with a rather nervous smile , " [I]181-jim hope that [the world]3184-the world has been treating [you]189-mrs. le marchant kindly — that things have gone well with [you]189-mrs. le marchant since those dear old days when [you]189-mrs. le marchant were so good to [me]181-jim . "[181-jim] There is an instant 's pause — perhaps [he]181-jim would not have noticed it had not [his]181-jim suspicions been already roused — before [the husband]562-the husband , again taking upon [him]181-jim the task of replying , answers , with a sort of laboured carelessness : " Oh , yes , thanks ; [we]566-their do not complain . It has not been a very rosy time for [landlords]3185-landlords lately , as [you]181-jim are aware . "[562-the husband] " And [you]181-jim ? "[561-the wife] cries [the wife]561-the wife , striking in with a species of hurry in [her]561-the wife voice — a hurry due , as [his]181-jim instinct tells [him]181-jim , to the fact of [her]561-the wife fear of [his]181-jim entering into more detailed inquiries . " And [you]181-jim ? [We]566-their must not forget [you]181-jim . Have [you]181-jim been well , flourishing , all this long time ? Do [you]181-jim still live with [your]181-jim — — "[561-the wife] [She]561-the wife stops abruptly . It is apparent that [she]561-the wife has entirely forgotten what was the species of relation with whom [he]181-jim lived . [I]572-i have been a rolling stone ; [I]572-i have rolled pretty well round [the world]3184-the world since [we]3190-we parted . "[572-i] [They]572-i do not care in the least where [he]181-jim has rolled , nor how much nor how little moss [he]181-jim has collected in the process . [They]572-i are only thinking how [they]572-i can best get rid of [him]181-jim . But the past is strong upon [him]181-jim ; [he]181-jim can not let [them]572-i slide out of [his]181-jim life again for another ten — twenty years perhaps , without finding out from [them]572-i something about [[his]181-jim five merry playmates]573-his five merry playmates . [His]181-jim inquiry must needs be a vague one . " And [you]577-the mother of those young comrades , to whom he thus cautiously alludes are all well ? "[181-jim] [he]181-jim says , with a certain wistfulness lurking in the indifferent banal phrase . " Dear [me]181-jim , what a jolly party [we]3191-we used to be ! " And so it came to pass that a fortnight later , while [April]204-april is still young , [Burgoyne]181-jim , en route to [[his]181-jim Amelia]3218-his amelia , is standing at a window of [the Hotel de Gênes]3219-the hotel de gênes at [Genoa]23-genoa , noisiest of [hotels]3220-hotels , though , to be sure , that is its only fault . [He]181-jim is looking out at [the gay market that is held in [the piazza below]3222-the piazza below]3221-the gay market that is held in the piazza below — [the gay market that is over and gone by nine o'clock]3223-the gay market that is over and gone by nine o'clock . It seems odd that [so many women]3224-so many women , so many umbrellas , so many baskets , so many oranges and lemons — each lemon with a glossy green leaf still adhering to its inch of stalk — so many fresh vegetables can be swept away in so short a time . But they are ; [all the gay kerchiefs]3225-all the gay kerchiefs are fled , and have been replaced by a row of fiacres with sad droop - headed horses , a good hour before [Byng]203-byng appears — appears radiantly well washed and apologetic . "[0-i] How many morning [chapels]618-chapels did [you]619-you attend last term ? " asks [Burgoyne]181-jim with some dryness . "[0-i] It is a vile habit , " replies [the other sweetly]3226-the other sweetly , sitting down at a little table , and unfolding [his]181-jim breakfast napkin . "[0-i] [I]0-i do not mean going to [chapel]620-chapel , but being so late ; however , [I]0-i really am improving . [I]0-i am a quarter of an hour — twenty minutes earlier than [I]0-i was yesterday , and , thank God , [we]621-they have [no train]622-no train to catch to - day . " [Burgoyne]181-jim is rather inclined to echo the thanksgiving a little later in the day , as [they]621-they stroll with the pleasant vagueness with which [one]501-one strays about [a little - known foreign town]3228-a little - known foreign town , not exactly knowing whither , through [the streets of [the queenly city]3230-the queenly city]3229-the streets of the queenly city , with which neither of [them]621-they has much acquaintance ; [Byng]203-byng 's twenty - two years of school and college , of cricket , and grouse , and stalking , having left not much margin for aught else ; and [Burgoyne]181-jim being in the case of [some widely - wandered shots and explorers]3231-some widely - wandered shots and explorers , to whom [the Nyanza Lake]24-the nyanza lake and [the Australian Bush]3232-the australian bush are more familiar than [Giotto 's Campanile]25-giotto 's campanile or [the Lagoons]3233-the lagoons . There is a grayish - looking English sky , with now and then little sprays of rain , and now and then flashes of warm sun . [Neither of [the young men]3235-the young men]3234-neither of the young men knows much [Italian]205-italian , and such as [they]621-they possess [they]621-they are ashamed to air before each other in asking [their]621-they way , so [they]621-they wander wherever chance or fancy leads [them]621-they . [They]621-they look curiously into [churches]3236-churches , [they]621-they walk down [deep narrow streets]3237-deep narrow streets , whose [houses]3238-houses have for three centuries been threatening to embrace each other across the strait sky strip far , far above [their]621-they heads . [They]621-they glance at [palace]3239-palace - fronts , and wonder at the sculptured portals where fresco and fruit garland and fine tracery speak of a time at more leisure for delicate work that has no end but beauty , than this breathless one . Everywhere in [the gardens]3240-the gardens [they]621-they see budding green , untrained roses making bowers , ripe oranges hanging over the walls . [They]621-they jostle against [women]502-women , each made charming , even the ugliest of [them]502-women , by the black lace kerchief tied about [her]502-women head . "[206-jim] [Henry James]206-jim says that [an English crowd]623-an english crowd is the best - looking in [the world]3184-the world , " says [Byng]203-byng , in a tone of strong dissent , following with [his]206-jim eyes a little tripping figure , and with an expression of pronounced approbation in those eyes , which gives [Burgoyne]181-jim a momentary twinge of misgiving as to [his]181-jim chaperonship . " "[625-all crowds] [All crowds]625-all crowds are ugly , and [most individuals]626-most individuals , " replies [Burgoyne]181-jim , misanthropically looking up from [his]181-jim guide - book . [They]621-they are sauntering down [the Via Garibaldi]3242-the via garibaldi , [street of [palaces that]3244-palaces that deserves an antiquer name than that of [the somewhat shoddy and recent hero who has god - fathered it]3245-the somewhat shoddy and recent hero who has god - fathered it]3243-street of palaces that deserves an antiquer name than that of the somewhat shoddy and recent hero who has god - fathered it . Into the noblest of all , up the echoing stone stairs , down which the feet of [the masters]3246-the masters have for ever ceased to tread , [they]3246-the masters enter . As [we]3247-we all know , it has been given to [the city of [Genoa]23-genoa]3248-the city of genoa — [lovely queen - city meriting so great a gift]3249-lovely queen - city meriting so great a gift — by the dying hand of [its latest possessor]3250-its latest possessor , the last of that high and beautiful race — if [we]3247-we may judge of the dead by [their]623-an english crowd pictures — who paced [its]3248-the city of genoa floors , and went forth in final funeral pomp through [its]3248-the city of genoa [worthy - to - be - imperial]3251-worthy - to - be - imperial portals . After awhile [the other tourists]3264-the other tourists drift away , but [the two men]409-the two men still stand and gaze . Into [Burgoyne]181-jim 's mind has come a sense of disgust with the present , a revolt against steam trams and the Cromwell Road — most perfect symbol of that bald , unending , vulgar ugliness , which , in some moods , must seem to everyone the dominant note of nineteenth - century life . [Rose]191-rose ? or is it , can it be , the dead [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth ? In a ripe civilization such as [ours]3282-us there are formulas provided to meet the requirements of every exigency that may possibly arise ; but amongst them there is not one which teaches [us]3282-us how to greet [a person come back from the dead]3283-a person come back from the dead , because it is held impossible that such a contingency can occur . Perhaps this is the reason why [Jim Burgoyne]181-jim , usually [a docile and obedient member of the society to which [he]181-jim belongs]3284-a docile and obedient member of the society to which he belongs , now flies in the face of all the precepts instilled into [him]181-jim by [that society]3285-that society 's code . At the sight of [Elizabeth Le Marchant]193-elizabeth entering [the room]442-the room , clad in a very neat tailor gown , instead of the winding - sheet with which [he]181-jim had credited [her]193-elizabeth , [he]181-jim at first stands transfixed , staring at [her]193-elizabeth with a hardness of intensity which is allowed to [us]3282-us in the case of [Titian]212-titian 's "[0-i] Bella , " or [Botticelli]213-botticelli 's "[0-i] Spring , " but has never been accounted permissible in the case of a more living loveliness . Then , before [he]181-jim can control , or even question the impulse that drives [him]181-jim , it has carried [him]181-jim to [her]193-elizabeth . "[193-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth ! " [he]181-jim says , in that sort of awed semi - whisper with which one would salute [a being plainly returned from the other side]3287-a being plainly returned from the other side , fearing that the fulness of a living voice might strike too strongly on [his]181-jim disused ear—"is[193-elizabeth] it really [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth ? " Had [Burgoyne]181-jim been quite sure , even now , of that fact ; if [he]181-jim had had [his]181-jim wits well about [him]181-jim , [he]181-jim would certainly not have addressed [her]193-elizabeth by [her]193-elizabeth Christian name . But from the dead the small pomps and ceremonies of earth fall off . [We]3282-us think of [them]3288-them by [their]3288-them naked names — must [we]3282-us not then appeal to [them]3288-them by the same when [they]3288-them reappear before [us]3282-us ? [The girl]3289-the girl — for [she]3289-the girl does not look much more — thus rudely and startlingly bombarded , drops [her]3289-the girl Baedeker out of [her]3289-the girl slim - gloved hand , and with a positive jump at the suddenness of the address , looks back apprehensively at [[her]3289-the girl interlocutor]3290-her interlocutor . In [her]3289-the girl eyes is , at first , only the coldly frightened expression of one discourteously assailed by [an insolent stranger]3291-an insolent stranger ; but in a space of time as short as had served [him]181-jim to note the same metamorphosis in the case of [[her]3289-the girl parents]583-her parents , [he]181-jim sees the look of half — three - quarter — whole recognition dawn in [her]3289-the girl eyes , followed — alas ! there can be no mistake about it — by the same aspiration after flight . There is no reason why [she]3289-the girl should not recognise [him]181-jim again at once . [He]181-jim has fallen [a prey neither to hair nor fat]3293-a prey neither to hair nor fat — [the two main disguisers and disfigurers of humanity]3294-the two main disguisers and disfigurers of humanity . [His]181-jim face is as smooth and [his]181-jim figure as spare as when , ten years ago , [he]181-jim had given [the pretty tomboy of sixteen lessons in jumping the ha - ha]3295-the pretty tomboy of sixteen lessons in jumping the ha - ha . And as to [her]3289-the girl identity , no shadow of doubt any longer lingers in [his]181-jim mind . The violence and shock of [his]181-jim attack have made [her]3289-the girl crimson , have matched [her]3289-the girl cheeks with those long - withered damasks in [the Moat garden]3296-the moat garden , with which they used to vie in bloomy vividness . But even yet [he]181-jim does not treat [her]3289-the girl quite as if [she]3289-the girl were really and veritably living ; [he]181-jim has not yet got back [his]181-jim conventional manners . "[193-elizabeth] [I]0-i thought [you]633-you were dead , " [he]181-jim says , [his]181-jim voice not even yet raised to its ordinary key , some vague awe still subduing it . It must be a trick of [his]181-jim excited imagination that makes it seem to [him]181-jim as if [she]3289-the girl said under [her]3289-the girl breath , "[0-i] So [I]0-i am ! " But before [he]181-jim has had time to do more than distrust the testimony of [his]181-jim ears , [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant strikes in quickly — "[0-i] [We]634-we can not help what [Mr. Burgoyne]198-burgoyne thinks , " says [she]3289-the girl , with a constrained laugh ; "[198-burgoyne] but [you]0-i are not dead , are [you]0-i , [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth ? "[189-mrs. le marchant] [She]189-mrs. le marchant accompanies the last words , as if to take the sting out of them , with as sweet and friendly a smile as any [he]181-jim remembers in the [Devonshire]5-devonshire days . But the sting is not taken out , all the same ; it lingers , pricking and burning still , after both [the tall , thin , black figure]648-the tall , thin , black figure , and [the slim , little gray one]649-the slim , little gray one have disappeared . The moment that this is the case , [Byng]203-byng rejoins [[his]181-jim friend]393-his friend ; a curiosity and alert interest in [his]181-jim young eyes , which [[his]181-jim companion]603-his companion feels no desire to gratify . [He]181-jim is unable , however , to maintain the entire silence [he]181-jim had intended upon the subject , since [Byng]203-byng , after waiting for what , to [his]181-jim impatience , appears a more than decent interval , is constrained to remark — " Did [I]203-byng hear [you]181-jim tell [that lady]3317-that lady , when first [you]181-jim spoke to [her]3317-that lady , that [she]3317-that lady was dead ? "[203-byng] " [I]203-byng thought [she]3317-that lady was . "[203-byng] " Had [you]181-jim heard it ? "[203-byng] " No . "[203-byng] " Did [you]181-jim see it in the papers ? "[203-byng] " No . "[203-byng] A pause . " [I]396-the other wonder why [you]181-jim thought [she]3317-that lady was dead . "[396-the other] [The other]396-the other makes a rather impatient movement . " [I]396-the other had no reason — none whatever . It was an idiotic inference . "[396-the other] [Byng]203-byng draws a long breath of satisfaction . " Well , at all events , [I]181-jim am very glad that [she]3317-that lady is not . "[181-jim] [Jim]181-jim turns upon [him]181-jim with something of the expression of face worn by [Mrs. Sarah Gamp]216-mrs. sarah gamp on hearing [Mrs. Prig]217-mrs. prig express [her]217-mrs. prig belief that it was not by [Mrs. Harris]218-mrs. harris that [her]217-mrs. prig services would be required . " Why should [you]181-jim be glad of that , [Betsy]193-elizabeth ? [She]3317-that lady is unbeknown to [you]181-jim except by hearing . Why should [you]181-jim be glad ? "[217-mrs. prig] As [Byng]203-byng 's case is a more aggravated one than [Mrs. Prig]217-mrs. prig 's , seeing that [Elizabeth Le Marchant]193-elizabeth is ' unbeknown ' to [him]181-jim even by hearing , so is the warmth , or rather coldness , with which [[his]181-jim friend]393-his friend receives [his]181-jim remark not inferior to that of " [Sairey]219-sairey . "[654-the younger man] " [I]654-the younger man do not quite see how it affects [you]181-jim . Why are [you]181-jim glad ? "[654-the younger man] " Why am [I]654-the younger man glad ? "[654-the younger man] replies [the younger man]654-the younger man , with a lightening eye . " For the same reason that [I]654-the younger man am glad that [Vandyke]207-vandyke painted that picture"—pointing[654-the younger man] to it—"or that [Shakespeare]220-shakespeare wrote As [You]181-jim Like It . [The world]3184-the world is the richer by [them]3319-them all three . "[654-the younger man] But to this poetic and flattering analogy , [Jim]181-jim 's only answer is a surly " Humph ! "[654-the younger man] " There are no more by - path meadows where [you]181-jim may innocently linger , but [the road]3320-the road lies long and straight and dusty to the grave . [You]181-jim may think [you]181-jim had a conscience and believed in [God]214-god ; but what is conscience to [a wife]3321-a wife ? .... To marry is to domesticate [the Recording Angel]3322-the recording angel . Once [you]181-jim are married , there is nothing left for [you]181-jim — not even suicide — but to be good . "[654-the younger man] There is no particular reason why [Burgoyne]181-jim should not impart to [[his]181-jim companion]603-his companion what [he]181-jim knows — after all it is not very much — about [[their]656-their two countrywomen]657-their two countrywomen . Upon reflection [he]181-jim had told [himself]181-jim this , and conquered a reluctance , that [he]181-jim can not account for , to mentioning [their]656-their name ; and to relating the story of those shadowy idyllic two months of [his]181-jim life , which form all of it that has ever come into contact with [theirs]656-their . So that by the time — some thirty - six hours later — when [they]656-their reach [Florence]20-florence , [the younger man]654-the younger man is in possession of as much information about the objects of [their]656-their common interest as it is in the power of [the elder one]659-the elder one to impart . To neither of [them]656-their , meanwhile , is any second glimpse vouchsafed of those objects , eagerly — though with different degrees of overtness in that eagerness — as [they]656-their both look out for [them]656-their among the luggage - piles and [the tweed - clad English ladies at [the station]661-the station]660-the tweed - clad english ladies at the station . It had been the intention of [Burgoyne]181-jim that [he]181-jim and [[his]181-jim friend]393-his friend should put up at [the same hotel]663-the same hotel as that inhabited by [[his]181-jim betrothed]605-his betrothed and [[her]605-his betrothed family]645-her family ; hut , finding that [it]663-the same hotel is full , [he]181-jim orders [rooms at [the Minerva]667-the minerva]666-rooms at the minerva , and in the fallen dusk of a rather chill spring night , finds [himself]181-jim traversing the short distance from [the railway]668-the railway to [that hotel]669-that hotel . As [he]181-jim and [Byng]203-byng sit over [their]670-their coffee after dinner in [the salle à manger]671-the salle à manger , [almost [its]671-the salle à manger only tenants]672-almost its only tenants at that late hour , [the younger man]654-the younger man remarks matter - of - factly , as if stating a proposition almost too obvious to be worth uttering — " [I]654-the younger man suppose [you]181-jim are off to [the Anglo - Américain]3323-the anglo - américain now . "[654-the younger man] " [I]181-jim think not , "[181-jim] replies [Jim]181-jim slowly ; " it is past ten , [you]181-jim see , and [they]3324-they are [early people]3325-early people . "[181-jim] [He]181-jim adds a moment later , as if suspecting [his]181-jim own excuse of insufficiency , " [Mr. Wilson]202-mr. wilson is rather [an invalid]3326-an invalid , and there is also [an invalid or semi - invalid sister]3327-an invalid or semi - invalid sister ; [I]181-jim think that [I]181-jim had better not disturb [them]3324-they to - night . "[181-jim] [Byng]203-byng has never been engaged to be married , except in theory , and it is certainly no business of [his]181-jim to blow [[his]181-jim friend]393-his friend 's flagging ardour into flame , so [he]181-jim contents [himself]181-jim with an acquiescent observation to the effect that [the train]675-the train must have been late . But at all events the next morning finds [Burgoyne]181-jim paying [his]181-jim fiacre at the door of [the Anglo - Américain]3323-the anglo - américain , with the confidence of [a person who is certain of finding those [he]181-jim seeks]677-a person who is certain of finding those he seeks , a confidence justified by the result ; for , having followed [a waiter]678-a waiter across [a courtyard]679-a courtyard , and heard [him]678-a waiter knock at a door on [the ground - floor]680-the ground - floor , that door opens with an instantaneousness which gives the idea of an ear having been pricked to catch the expected rap , and the next moment , [the intervening garçon]681-the intervening garçon having withdrawn , [Jim]181-jim stands face to face with [his]181-jim Amelia . [Her]393-his friend features are all alight with pleasure , but [her]393-his friend first words are not particularly amorous . " Would [you]181-jim mind coming into [the dining - room]3328-the dining - room ? [Sybilla]221-sybilla is in [the drawing - room]3329-the drawing - room already this morning . [She]393-his friend said [she]393-his friend was afraid it was going to be one of [her]393-his friend bad days , so [I]393-his friend thought "[393-his friend] ( rather regretfully ) " that possibly [she]393-his friend would be a little later than usual in coming down ; but , on the contrary , [she]393-his friend is much earlier . "[393-his friend] It is possible that an extremely ardent love may be independent of surroundings ; may burn with as fierce a flame , when [its owner]487-its owner or [victim]683-victim is seated on a hard horsehair chair beside a dining - room table , in [a little dull hotel back room]684-a little dull hotel back room , as when the senses are courted by softly - cushioned lounges , penetrating flower - scents , and cunningly arranged bric - à - brac ; but perhaps [Jim]181-jim 's passion is not of this intense and Spartan quality . At all events a chill steals over [him]181-jim as [Amelia]201-amelia leads the way into [that small and uncheerful chamber where [the Wilson family]686-the wilson family daily banquet]685-that small and uncheerful chamber where the wilson family daily banquet . [He]181-jim is not so lost to all sense of what [England]11-england and [Amelia]201-amelia expect of [him]181-jim as not to take [her]201-amelia in [his]181-jim arms and kiss [her]201-amelia very kindly and warmly , before [they]687-they sit down on two hard chairs side by side ; and even when [they]687-they have done so , [he]181-jim still holds [her]201-amelia hand , and kisses it now and then . [He]181-jim has a great many things to say to [her]201-amelia , but " out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaketh "[181-jim] is not invariably true . Sometimes that very abundance clogs the utterance , and , after a ten months ' separation , the hinges of even [lovers]688-lovers ' tongues are apt at first to be somewhat rusty . " And are [you]181-jim really glad to see [me]431-the woman again ? "[431-the woman] asks [the woman]431-the woman — [she]431-the woman is scarcely [a girl]690-a girl , having the doubtful advantage of being [[her]431-the woman betrothed]691-her betrothed 's senior by two years . The horsehair chairs are obviously powerless to take the edge off [her]431-the woman bliss ; and [she]431-the woman can scarcely command [her]431-the woman voice as [she]431-the woman asks the question . " [I]181-jim decline to answer all such futile inquiries , "[181-jim] replies [he]181-jim , smiling not unkindly ; but there is no tremor in [his]181-jim voice . " Even if [I]181-jim did not discourage [them]3330-them on principle , [I]181-jim should have no time to answer them to - day ; [I]181-jim have so much to say to [you]431-the woman that [I]181-jim do not know where to begin . "[181-jim] " After ten months that is not very surprising , "[431-the woman] rejoins [she]431-the woman , with a stifled sigh . There is no sentimental reproach in [her]431-the woman words or tone ; but in both lurks a note of wistfulness which gives [his]181-jim conscience a prick . " Of course not ! of course not ! "[181-jim] [he]181-jim rejoins hastily ; " but it is not really ten months — no , surely — — "[181-jim] " Ten months , one week , two days , four hours and a half ! "[431-the woman] Against such exactitude of memory what appeal has [he]181-jim ? [He]181-jim attempts none , and only thinks with a faint unjust irritation that [she]431-the woman might have spared [him]181-jim the odd hours . " And how are things going ? How are [you]431-the woman all getting on ? "[181-jim] [he]181-jim asks , precipitating [himself]181-jim upon a fresh subject , since [he]181-jim feels prevented by circumstances from saying anything likely to bring [him]181-jim much distinction upon [the old one]692-the old one . " [[Your]431-the woman father]3331-your father ? "[181-jim] " [His]181-jim throat is better"—with[181-jim] an accent of hesitating filial piety , as if there were something else about [him]181-jim that was not better . " And [Sybilla]221-sybilla ? "[181-jim] " Oh , poor [Sybilla]221-sybilla ! [she]221-sybilla has [her]221-sybilla bad days now and then . "[181-jim] " And , like [the early Christians]3332-the early christians , [she]221-sybilla resolves to have all things in common . " Well , [we]3334-we do sometimes , "[201-amelia] replies [Amelia]201-amelia with reluctant admission ; " but [she]221-sybilla really does try to control [herself]221-sybilla , poor thing ; [she]221-sybilla is hardly ever unbearable now . "[201-amelia] " And [Cecilia]222-cecilia ? "[181-jim] " [She]222-cecilia is rather in trouble just now ; [I]181-jim fear there is no doubt that [the man [she]222-cecilia was engaged to]3335-the man she was engaged to has thrown [her]222-cecilia over . [You]181-jim never saw [him]3335-the man she was engaged to ? Oh no ! Of course , the affair came on after [you]181-jim left [England]11-england . "[181-jim] [Burgoyne]181-jim 's eyebrows have gone up , and [his]181-jim face has assumed an expression less of surprise than admiration at this piece of news . " How many does that make ? Four ? Well , courage ! There is luck in odd numbers ; perhaps [she]222-cecilia will land the fifth . "[181-jim] " [She]222-cecilia will tell [you]181-jim about it [herself]222-cecilia , "[201-amelia] says [Amelia]201-amelia ; " [she]222-cecilia tells [everybody]3181-everybody ; [she]222-cecilia likes talking about it — it is very odd , but [she]222-cecilia does .
