"[201-amelia] " When [I]181-jim do ! "[181-jim] repeats [he]181-jim with laughing emphasis ; but to [his]181-jim own ear both the emphasis and the laughter sound flat . This is perhaps the cause why [he]181-jim , a second time , runs away from [his]181-jim subject ; or , more probably , [he]181-jim is really in haste to get to the new one . " Meanwhile , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim says , [his]181-jim eyes involuntarily dropping to the carpet , as if [he]181-jim had rather not see the effect of [his]181-jim words upon [her]693-she ; " meanwhile , [someone]529-someone has thrown [me]181-jim over . "[181-jim] " [You]181-jim ? "[181-jim] " Yes , [me]181-jim ; [I]181-jim did not write it to [you]693-she , because [I]181-jim do not see much use in putting down bad news in black and white , and even with this little delay , [I]181-jim am afraid , "[181-jim] with a dry smile , " that [you]693-she will have plenty of time to enjoy it . "[181-jim] [He]181-jim pauses for an instant , and [she]693-she does not hurry [him]181-jim with any teasing questions ; but waits , with meek patience , till [he]181-jim feels inclined to go on . " [[My]693-she aunt]3187-my aunt is going to be married . "[693-she] If [he]181-jim has wished that [his]181-jim news shall produce the effect of a torpedo , [he]181-jim has no cause to complain of [his]181-jim want of success . [His]181-jim placid [Amelia]201-amelia vaults to [her]201-amelia feet . " Married ! "[201-amelia] [she]201-amelia repeats with a gasp . " Why , [she]3187-my aunt is quite , quite old ! "[201-amelia] " [She]3187-my aunt is sixty - five ! "[201-amelia] The colour has flooded all [Amelia]201-amelia 's face ; the blazing colour that means not pleasure , but consternation . It is some moments before [she]201-amelia can frame [her]201-amelia next query . " And is he?—do you?—has [she]3187-my aunt chosen wisely , [I]201-amelia mean ? "[201-amelia] [Jim]181-jim laughs again . " Can [one]501-one choose wisely at sixty - five ? Well , whether [she]3187-my aunt has or no is a matter of opinion ; [she]3187-my aunt has chosen [the curate of [the parish]3342-the parish]3341-the curate of the parish , who , by reason of [his]3341-the curate of the parish extreme juvenility , is still in [deacon]3343-deacon 's orders . "[181-jim] [Miss Wilson]200-miss wilson 's limbs are shaking so that [she]200-miss wilson can not maintain [her]200-miss wilson standing attitude . [She]200-miss wilson sinks down by the dining - table again in [her]200-miss wilson hard chair . It is a very hard chair on which to receive such ill news . " And can not [you]181-jim hinder it , can not [you]181-jim dissuade [her]3187-my aunt ? "[201-amelia] [she]201-amelia asks falteringly . " [I]201-amelia shall not try ; [poor old woman]3344-poor old woman ! After all , [she]3187-my aunt has a right to pursue [her]3187-my aunt own happiness in [her]3187-my aunt own way , only [I]201-amelia wish that [she]3187-my aunt had made up [her]3187-my aunt mind twenty years ago ; though , to be sure , how could [she?"—with]3345-she?"—with[201-amelia] another smile—"since , at that time , [[her]3187-my aunt bridegroom]3346-her bridegroom was not much more than born . "[200-miss wilson] A dead silence supervenes — a silence of shocked stupefaction on the one side , of rather dismal brooding on the other . At length [Amelia]201-amelia nerves [herself]201-amelia to put a question upon which it seems to [her]201-amelia , not very incorrectly , that [her]201-amelia whole future hangs . [She]201-amelia does it in such a low voice that none but very sharp ears could have caught it . [Jim]181-jim 's ears are so ; practised as they are in listening for the stealthy tread of wild animals , and for the indescribable sounds of mountain solitudes at night . " Will it — will it — make a great difference to [you]201-amelia ? "[181-jim] [Burgoyne]181-jim lifts [his]181-jim eyes , which have been idly bent on the floor , and looks straight and full at [her]201-amelia across the corner of the table . " It will make all the difference ! "[181-jim] [he]181-jim answers slowly . [Poor Amelia]201-amelia is holding [her]201-amelia handkerchief in [her]201-amelia hand . [She]201-amelia lifts it to [her]201-amelia mouth and bites a corner of it to hide the quivering of [her]201-amelia lips and chin . [She]201-amelia does not wish to add to [his]181-jim pain by any breakdown on [her]201-amelia own part . But [Jim]181-jim divines the quivering even under the morsel of cambric , and looks away again . " [Her]201-amelia money is almost entirely in [her]201-amelia own power , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim continues , in an unemotional voice ; " and when [she]201-amelia announced [her]201-amelia marriage to [me]181-jim , [she]201-amelia also announced [her]201-amelia intention of settling the whole of it upon [her]201-amelia — [her"—he]181-jim[181-jim] pauses a second , as if resolved to keep out of [his]181-jim voice the accent of satire and bitterness that pierces through its calm—"her husband . "[181-jim] [Amelia]201-amelia has dropped both shielding hand and handkerchief into [her]201-amelia lap . [She]201-amelia has forgotten [her]201-amelia effort to conceal the blankness of [her]201-amelia dismay . Unless [she]201-amelia conceals the whole of [her]201-amelia face , indeed , the attempt would be in vain , since each feature speaks it equally . " [Her]201-amelia whole fortune ? "[201-amelia] [she]201-amelia repeats , almost inaudibly . " All ? "[181-jim] says [Jim]181-jim , oppressed by [her]201-amelia overwhelmed look into an artificial and dreary levity , and in not particularly apt quotation . " [[My]181-jim dear]3176-my dear , do not look so broken - hearted . [I]181-jim am not absolutely destitute ; [I]181-jim need not become [a sandwich man]3348-a sandwich man . [I]181-jim have still got [my]181-jim £ 800 a year , [my]181-jim very own , which [neither man]3349-neither man nor mouse , neither [curate nor vicar]3350-curate nor vicar , can take from [me]181-jim . [I]181-jim can still go on rioting upon that ; the question is"—his[181-jim] words coming more slowly , and [his]181-jim tone growing graver—"have [I]181-jim any right to ask [you]201-amelia to riot on it too ? "[181-jim] [Her]201-amelia hand has gone in feverish haste out to [his]181-jim for answer , and [her]201-amelia eyes , into which the tears are welling , look with an intense dumb wistfulness into [his]181-jim ; but , for the moment , it remains dumb . There is something painful to [Burgoyne]181-jim in that wistfulness , almost more painful than the telling of that news which has produced it . [He]181-jim looks down upon the tablecloth , and , with [his]181-jim disengaged hand , the one not imprisoned in [[his]181-jim betrothed]605-his betrothed 's fond hold , draws patterns with a paper - knife accidentally left there . " The one thing that [I]181-jim blame [her]201-amelia for , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim continues , not following up the branch of the subject that [his]181-jim last speech had begun to open up , and speaking with a composure which , to the stricken [Amelia]201-amelia , appears to evidence [his]181-jim attainment of the highest pinnacle of manly fortitude , " the only thing [I]181-jim blame [her]201-amelia for , is [her]201-amelia having hindered [my]181-jim adopting any profession . [Poor old woman]3344-poor old woman , it was not malice prepense , [I]181-jim know ; [she]201-amelia had not seen [her]201-amelia [Jessamey]223-jessamey then , probably had not even a prophetic instinct of [him]181-jim , but as things turned out"—stifling[181-jim] a sigh—"it would have been kinder to have put [me]201-amelia in the way of earning [my]201-amelia own living . "[201-amelia] [Amelia]201-amelia 's head has sunk down upon [his]181-jim hand — [he]181-jim feels [her]201-amelia hot tears upon it ; but now that the theme has no longer reference to [herself]201-amelia , [she]201-amelia can speak . [She]201-amelia straightens [herself]201-amelia , and there is a flash , such as [he]181-jim has very seldom seen there , in [her]201-amelia rather colourless orbs . " It was monstrous of [her]201-amelia ! "[201-amelia] [she]201-amelia cries , with the almost exaggerated passion of [a usually very self - controlled person]695-a usually very self - controlled person . " After having always told [you]181-jim that [you]181-jim were to be [[her]201-amelia heir]3352-her heir ! "[201-amelia] " But had [she]201-amelia told [me]181-jim so ? "[181-jim] replies [Jim]181-jim , passing [his]181-jim hand with a perplexed air over [his]181-jim own face . " That is what [I]181-jim have been trying to recall for the last few days . [I]181-jim never remember the time when [I]181-jim did not believe it , so [I]181-jim suppose that [someone]529-someone must have told [me]181-jim so ; but [I]181-jim could not swear that [she]201-amelia [herself]201-amelia had ever put it down in black and white . However , "[181-jim] tossing [his]181-jim head back with a gesture as of one who throws off [his]181-jim shoulders a useless burden , " what does that matter now ? [I]181-jim am not [[her]201-amelia heir]3352-her heir , [I]181-jim am [nobody 's heir]3355-nobody 's heir ; [we]3356-we must look facts in the face ! [Amelia]201-amelia , dear"—in[181-jim] a tone of reluctant tender affection , as of one compelled , yet most unwilling , to give [a little child]696-a little child , or [some other soft , helpless creature , pain—"we]3357-some other soft , helpless creature , pain—"we must look facts in the face ! "[181-jim] There is something in [his]181-jim voice that makes [Amelia]201-amelia 's heart stand still ; but [she]201-amelia attempts no interruption . " It is very hard for [me]181-jim , [dear]3358-dear , after all these"—he[181-jim] pauses a second ; [he]181-jim is about to say " weary years ' waiting , "[181-jim] but [his]181-jim conscience arrests [him]181-jim ; to [him]181-jim [they]697-they have not been weary , so , after a hardly - perceptible break , [he]181-jim goes on—"after all these many years ' waiting , to have come to this , is not it ? "[181-jim] [He]181-jim had not calculated on the effect which would be produced by [his]181-jim melancholy words and [his]181-jim caressing tone . [She]201-amelia buries [her]201-amelia face on [his]181-jim shoulder , sobbing uncontrollably . " [They]697-they were not long ! "[201-amelia] [she]201-amelia murmurs brokenly . " Nothing is , nothing can be , long to [me]201-amelia as long as [I]201-amelia have [you]181-jim , or the hope of [you]181-jim ! "[201-amelia] It is , perhaps , fortunate for [Amelia]201-amelia that [she]201-amelia can not see the expression of the face which looks out above [her]201-amelia prostrate head into space , with a blankness equal to what has been [her]201-amelia own , a blankness streaked , as [hers]201-amelia was not , with remorse . [He]181-jim would give anything to be able to answer [her]201-amelia in [her]201-amelia own key , to tell [her]201-amelia that , as long as [he]181-jim can keep [her]201-amelia , the going or coming of any lesser good hurts [him]181-jim as little as the brushing past [his]181-jim cheek of a summer moth or windblown feather . But when [he]181-jim tries to frame a sentence of this kind , [his]181-jim tongue cleaves to the roof of [his]181-jim mouth . [He]181-jim can only hold [her]201-amelia to [him]181-jim in an affectionate clasp , whose dumbness [he]181-jim hopes that [she]201-amelia attributes to silencing emotion . [She]201-amelia [herself]201-amelia indulges in no very prolonged manifestation of [her]201-amelia passion . In a few moments [she]201-amelia is again sitting up beside [him]181-jim with wiped eyes , [none the handsomer , poor soul]698-none the handsomer , poor soul , for having cried , and listening with a deep attention to an exposition of [[her]201-amelia lover]699-her lover 's position and prospects , which [he]181-jim is at no pains to tinge with a factitious rose colour . " Have [you]201-amelia realized , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim says , " that [I]181-jim shall never be better off than [I]181-jim am now ? never ! never ! For though of course [I]181-jim shall try to get work , [one]501-one knows how successful that quest generally is in the case of [a man with no special aptitudes , no technical training]3360-a man with no special aptitudes , no technical training , and who starts in the race handicapped by being ten years too late ! "[181-jim] But the dismalness of this panorama raises no answering gloom in [the young woman]700-the young woman 's face . [She]201-amelia nods [her]201-amelia head gently . " [I]201-amelia realize it . "[201-amelia] " And this is what [I]181-jim have brought [you]700-the young woman to , after all these years ' waiting , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim continues , in a tone of profound regret . " All [I]181-jim can offer [you]700-the young woman at the end of [them]3361-them is [a not particularly genteel poverty , not even [a cottage]3363-a cottage with [a double coach - house!"—laughing]3364-a double coach - house!"—laughing]3362-a not particularly genteel poverty , not even a cottage with a double coach - house!"—laughing[181-jim] grimly . " [I]201-amelia do not want [a double coach - house]3365-a double coach - house , nor even a single one ! "[201-amelia] replies [Amelia]201-amelia stoutly , and laughing too , a little , through returning tears . " Do not [you]700-the young woman know that [I]201-amelia had rather drive [[a costermonger]3366-a costermonger 's barrow]3367-a costermonger 's barrow with [you]700-the young woman than go in [a coach]479-a coach and six without [you]700-the young woman ! "[201-amelia] This is the highest flight of imagination of which [Jim]181-jim has ever known [his]181-jim matter - of - fact [Amelia]201-amelia guilty , and [he]181-jim can pay [her]201-amelia [his]181-jim thanks for it only in compunctious kisses . Perhaps it is [they]701-they , perhaps it is the thought which dictates [her]201-amelia next hesitating speech , that bring a light into [Amelia]201-amelia 's tear - reddened eyes . " If [you]700-the young woman will never be better off — — "[201-amelia] [She]201-amelia stops . " Yes , [dear]3358-dear , go on ; ' if [I]201-amelia shall never be better off'—I certainly never shall ; [I]201-amelia feel sure that [you]700-the young woman will be able to put [my]201-amelia earnings for the next ten years into [your]700-the young woman eye , and see none the worse for [them]3370-them ! "[201-amelia] " If — [you]700-the young woman — will — never — be — better — off — — "[201-amelia] [she]201-amelia repeats again , more slowly , and breaking off at the same place . " Well , [dear]3358-dear ? "[201-amelia] " If [you]700-the young woman will never be better off"—this[201-amelia] time [she]201-amelia finishes [her]201-amelia sentence ; but it is rendered almost inaudible by the fact of [her]201-amelia flushed face and quivering lips being pressed against [his]181-jim breast—"why should [we]702-we wait any longer ? "[201-amelia] Why should [we]702-we wait any longer ? To [most persons]703-most persons , granted the usual condition of feeling of [a betrothed couple]704-a betrothed couple , this would seem a very natural and legitimate deduction from [the premises]705-the premises ; but , strange to say , it comes upon [Burgoyne]181-jim with the shock of a surprise . [He]181-jim has been thinking vaguely of [his]181-jim change of fortune as a cause for unlimited delay , perhaps for the rupture of [his]181-jim engagement , never as a reason for its immediate fulfilment . [He]181-jim gives a sort of breathless gasp , which is happily too low for [Amelia]201-amelia with [her]201-amelia still hidden face to hear . To be married at once ! To sit down for all time to [Amelia]201-amelia and £ 800 a year ! To forego for ever the thrilling wandering life ; the nights under the northern stars , the stealthy tracking of shy forest creatures ; the scarce coarse delicious food , the cold , the fatigue , the hourly peril , that , since its probable loss is ever in sight , make life so sweetly worth having — all , in short , that goes to make up so many an [Englishman]224-englishman 's ideal of felicity ; that has certainly hitherto gone to make up [Jim]181-jim 's . To renounce it all ! There is no doubt that the bitterness of this thought comes first ; but presently , supplanting it , chasing it away , there follows another , a self - reproachful light flashing over [his]181-jim past eight years , showing [him]181-jim [his]181-jim own selfishness colossal and complete for the first time . In a paroxysm of remorse , [he]181-jim has lifted [Amelia]201-amelia 's face , and , framing it with [his]181-jim hands , looks searchingly into it . " [I]181-jim believe , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim says in a shaken voice , " that [you]201-amelia would have married [me]181-jim eight years ago , on [my]181-jim pittance , if [I]181-jim had asked [you]201-amelia ! "[181-jim] No " Yes "[181-jim] was ever written in larger print than that which [he]181-jim read in [her]201-amelia patient pale eyes . Even at this instant there darts across [him]181-jim a wish that they were not quite so pale , but [he]181-jim detests [himself]181-jim for it . " And [I]181-jim never suspected it ! "[181-jim] [he]181-jim cries compunctiously . " [I]181-jim give [you]201-amelia [my]181-jim word of honour , [I]181-jim never suspected it ! [I]181-jim thought [you]201-amelia looked upon [my]181-jim poverty in as prohibitory a light as [I]181-jim did [myself]181-jim . "[181-jim] " [I]201-amelia do not call it such great poverty , "[201-amelia] replies [Amelia]201-amelia , [her]201-amelia practical mind resuming its habitual sway over [her]201-amelia emotions . " Of course , it is an income that would require a little management ; but if [we]3372-we cut [our]3372-we coat according to [our]3372-we cloth , and did not want to move about too much , [we]3372-we might live either in [a not very fashionable part of [London]1-london]3373-a not very fashionable part of london , or in [some cheap district in [the country]3375-the country]3374-some cheap district in the country very comfortably . "[201-amelia] Despite [his]706-his remorse , a cold shiver runs down [Burgoyne]181-jim 's spine at the picture that rises , conjured up with too much distinctness by [her]201-amelia words , before [his]706-his mind 's eyes ; the picture of [a snug Bayswater villa]707-a snug bayswater villa , with [a picturesque parlour - maid]708-a picturesque parlour - maid , or [the alternative cottage in [some dreary Wiltshire]710-some dreary wiltshire or [Dorsetshire village]711-dorsetshire village]709-the alternative cottage in some dreary wiltshire or dorsetshire village , with [a shrubbery of three aucuba bushes]712-a shrubbery of three aucuba bushes , and [a kitchen - garden of half an acre]713-a kitchen - garden of half an acre . It may be that , [her]201-amelia frame being in such close proximity to [his]706-his , [she]201-amelia feels the influence of [his]706-his shiver , and that it suggests [her]201-amelia next sentence , which is in a less sanguine key . " But it would not be fair ; it would be asking [you]706-his to give up too much . "[201-amelia] The meek abnegation of [her]201-amelia rather worn voice brings [his]706-his remorse uppermost again on the revolving wheel of [his]706-his feelings . " Is not it [my]706-his turn to give up something ? "[706-his] [he]706-his asks tenderly ; " and besides , it is time for [me]706-his to settle ! [I]706-his am — [I]706-his am tired of wandering ! "[706-his] As this atrocious lie passes [his]706-his lips , [he]706-his catches [his]706-his breath . Tired of [the Sierras]29-the sierras ! Tired of the bivouacs among the dazzling snow ! Tired of the august silence of [the ever - lasting hills]714-the ever - lasting hills ! [Heaven]197-heaven forgive [him]706-his for saying so ! Perhaps there is no great air of veracity in [his]706-his assertion , for [she]201-amelia looks at [him]706-his distrustfully ; so distrustfully that [he]706-his reshapes [his]706-his phrase : " At least , if [I]201-amelia am not , [I]201-amelia ought to be ! "[201-amelia] But still [she]201-amelia gazes at [him]706-his with a wistful and doubting intentness . " If [I]201-amelia could only believe that that was true ! "[201-amelia] " It is true , "[706-his] replies [he]706-his , evading [her]201-amelia look ; " at least , true enough for all working purposes ; [we]3376-we all know that life is a series of compromises , a balancing of gain and loss . [I]706-his shall lose something , [I]706-his do not deny that , but [I]706-his gain more — [I]706-his gain [you]201-amelia ! "[706-his] " That is such a mighty gain , is it not ? "[201-amelia] [she]201-amelia says with a melancholy smile , as that intuition of the truth which sometimes comes to [unloved or tepidly loved women]715-unloved or tepidly loved women flashes upon [her]201-amelia . " A matter of taste — a mere matter of taste ! "[706-his] rejoins [he]706-his hurriedly ; aware of the unreal ring in [his]706-his own words , and trying , with all [his]706-his might , to feel as well as speak light - heartedly . [She]201-amelia shakes [her]201-amelia head in a way which tells [him]706-his how poorly [he]706-his has succeeded . In a desperate if not very well - judged attempt to convince [her]201-amelia of [his]706-his sincerity , [his]706-his next speech is uttered . " Why should not [we]3377-we be married at once ? to - morrow ? the day after to - morrow ? at [the Consulate]3378-the consulate — of course there is [a Consulate]3379-a consulate — or [the English church]3380-the english church ; [I]706-his suppose there are half [a dozen English churches]3381-a dozen english churches . Why not ? [We]3377-we have nothing to wait for , and [we]3377-we are both of age ! "[706-his] [He]706-his has had no unkindly intention in the last words , but the moment that these are out of [his]706-his mouth , a glance at [Amelia]201-amelia 's unblooming face and unyouthful figure tell [him]706-his that [they]716-they were not happily chosen . At the first instant that the suggestion of an immediate marriage reaches [the hearer]717-the hearer 's brain , it sends a dart of joy over [her]201-amelia features . To be married at once ! To put an end for ever to the interminable waiting , to enter at last — at last upon the possession of the so long deferred [Canaan]30-canaan . But in a second , that first bright flash is chased away , and gives place to a look of almost humiliation . " [You]706-his must be making fun of [me]201-amelia , to suggest such a thing ! "[201-amelia] [she]201-amelia says in a wounded voice ; " [you]706-his know how wildly impossible it would be that [I]201-amelia should leave [them]3382-them all — [[my]201-amelia father]3383-my father — [Sybilla]221-sybilla — without any preparation . "[201-amelia] " Without any preparation ! "[181-jim] replies [Jim]181-jim , raising [his]181-jim eyebrows . " Have not [you]201-amelia been preparing them for the last eight years ? "[706-his] [He]706-his feels a vague unjust irritation with [her]201-amelia for opposing [his]706-his proposition , though deep down in [his]706-his heart [he]706-his knows that [he]706-his would have felt a much greater annoyance had [she]201-amelia eagerly closed with it . As [she]201-amelia does not answer a question , which the moment that it is uttered [he]706-his feels to have been rather brutal , [he]706-his goes on , against [his]706-his will , in the same sarcastic key : " [I]706-his am afraid that [you]201-amelia will have to leave them all some day ; [I]706-his am afraid that [[our]3384-our [Bayswater]32-bayswater mansion]3385-our bayswater mansion — by - the - bye , [I]706-his am sure [it]3385-our bayswater mansion will not be [a mansion]3386-a mansion , for [I]706-his am sure [it]3385-our bayswater mansion will not have a back - door — will not be likely to contain all . [[Your]201-amelia father]3331-your father — [Sybilla]221-sybilla — [Sybilla]221-sybilla and [her]221-sybilla physic bottles take up a good deal of room , do not [they]3388-they ? "[706-his] It is fortunate for [Amelia]201-amelia that [she]201-amelia is too preoccupied by the thought of [her]201-amelia own next speech to take in the full acerbity of the last remark . " If [you]181-jim would consent to wait till [we]718-we get [home]401-home — [father]3390-father does not mean to stay in [Italy]18-italy beyond the end of next month — [we]718-we might be married in June ; that "[201-amelia] ( with a pink flush of happiness ) " would not be so long to wait . "[201-amelia] In a second a sum of the simplest description executes itself in [Burgoyne]181-jim 's head . It is now the second week of April ; [they]718-we are to be married in June , [he]181-jim has then eight weeks left . "[181-jim] [No lover]719-no lover could have been overheard giving utterance to a more proper or suitable sentiment ; so that it is lucky that this is just the moment that [Cecilia]222-cecilia chooses for entering . " [I]181-jim think [you]181-jim will live to fight another day , will not [you]181-jim ? But [I]181-jim really am extremely sorry ; tell [me]181-jim all about it . "[181-jim] " [He]181-jim was perfectly right when [we]3396-we left [England]11-england , "[222-cecilia] says [Cecilia]222-cecilia , mollified at once , and apparently relieved by the invitation to unbosom [herself]222-cecilia of [her]222-cecilia woes ; " [nobody]3337-nobody could have been more so ; [he]181-jim came to see [us]3396-we off at [Folkestone]33-folkestone , and the tears were in [his]181-jim eyes ; they were really , it was not [my]222-cecilia imagination , was it , [Amelia]201-amelia ? And at first [he]181-jim wrote all right , and said all the usual things ; but then [his]181-jim letters gradually grew fewer and fewer , and after [I]222-cecilia had written and telegraphed a great many times — [I]222-cecilia do not know how many times [I]222-cecilia did not telegraph to ask whether [he]181-jim was ill , and [you]201-amelia know how expensive foreign telegrams are — [he]181-jim sent [me]222-cecilia a few lines , oh , such cruel lines , were not they , [Amelia]201-amelia ? to say that , on reflection , [he]181-jim feared that the feeling [he]181-jim had for [me]222-cecilia was not such as to justify [his]181-jim entering on so sacred an engagement as marriage with [me]222-cecilia ; but [he]181-jim ought to have thought of that before , ought not [he]181-jim ? "[222-cecilia] " Undoubtedly ! "[222-cecilia] " [I]222-cecilia will never engage [myself]222-cecilia to [a clergyman]3215-a clergyman again , "[222-cecilia] says [Cecilia]222-cecilia pensively . "[222-cecilia] A moment later , [she]222-cecilia adds , with a suspicion of malice in [her]222-cecilia tone : " [We]3407-we are certainly [an unlucky family]3408-an unlucky family in [our]3407-we loves ! " [Amelia]201-amelia is not going to be engaged any longer , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim says , putting [his]181-jim arm round [[his]181-jim betrothed]605-his betrothed . " [Amelia]201-amelia is going to be married at once ! "[181-jim] It would seem natural that , after so long a separation , [Burgoyne]181-jim should dine and spend the evening with [[his]181-jim betrothed]605-his betrothed ; but such is not the case . For this , however , [he]181-jim is not to blame ; [he]181-jim is quite prepared to stay with [her]222-cecilia until [she]222-cecilia turns [him]181-jim out . Had [he]181-jim not better school [himself]181-jim to domestic habits , since [he]181-jim is so soon to assume them for life ? But in consideration for [Sybilla]221-sybilla [he]181-jim is dismissed undined . It is not that [she]221-sybilla ever shares [the family]728-the family dinner at [their]728-the family table à part in the salle à manger , but the thought of [their]728-the family entertaining [a guest]729-a guest with a conviviality far greater in [her]221-sybilla imagination than would be the case in reality , while [she]221-sybilla [herself]221-sybilla lies lonely on [her]221-sybilla couch of suffering , preys upon [her]221-sybilla spirits so much that [[her]221-sybilla family]645-her family have to abandon the idea . So , towards sunset , [Jim]181-jim is dismissed . [He]181-jim has no opportunity for any parting endearments to [[his]181-jim lady - love]731-his lady - love , as [the whole family]732-the whole family are in [the room]442-the room , and it is [Cecilia]222-cecilia , not [Amelia]201-amelia , who volunteers to walk across [the hotel courtyard]734-the hotel courtyard with [him]181-jim , for the advantage of a last word . What that last word is [he]181-jim is not slow to learn . " [You]181-jim will take [us]645-her family some excursions , will not [you]181-jim ? "[221-sybilla] [she]221-sybilla says , with a persuasive air , putting [her]221-sybilla arm through [his]181-jim . " [Father]225-father is so unenterprising , [we]645-her family have really seen scarcely anything ; but [you]181-jim will take [us]645-her family some excursions now , will not [you]181-jim ? "[221-sybilla] " Are [you]181-jim sure that [your]181-jim spirits are equal to [them]3409-them ? "[181-jim] inquires [Burgoyne]181-jim unkindly . "[221-sybilla] " [Poor Amelia]201-amelia will shortly have the distraction of being married , "[643-the young man] rejoins [the young man]643-the young man , who feels as if [he]643-the young man could not repeat the statement of this fact too often to [himself]643-the young man and [others]736-others . " And [I]222-cecilia think it would be only civil , "[222-cecilia] continues [Cecilia]222-cecilia persistently , " in fact , [I]222-cecilia do not see how [you]181-jim could avoid it , if [you]181-jim invited [[your]181-jim friend]3412-your friend to join [us]3413-us . "[222-cecilia] But [Jim]181-jim escapes without having committed [himself]181-jim to this promise , and wanders about [the town]407-the town in the lovely , lowering light ; finds [himself]181-jim on [the Lung Arno]34-the lung arno , strolling along with [the leisurely loiterers]738-the leisurely loiterers , among whom , for every two soft Tuscan voices , there is a loud metallic Anglo - Saxon one . [He]181-jim watches [the carriages]739-the carriages rolling back from [their]739-the carriages drive on [the Cascine]35-the cascine ; [the river]449-the river falling over [the weir]741-the weir ; [the river yellow as Tiber yesterday]742-the river yellow as tiber yesterday , and to day shot with blue and green and silver , as it tumbles with a pleasant noise . [The houses on either side of the Arno]743-the houses on either side of the arno , [the domes and roofs]744-the domes and roofs , are all clothed in a strange serenity of yellow light ; a golden air so transparent and line and crystal clear , so free from the soft blur of mist — lovely too — through which [we]745-we see objects in [[our]745-we wet green home]746-our wet green home , that [Jim]181-jim feels as if [he]181-jim could stretch out [his]181-jim hand and touch [the hill that backs [gold towers and bridges]748-gold towers and bridges]747-the hill that backs gold towers and bridges , and see whether [it]747-the hill that backs gold towers and bridges really is made out of one whole amethyst , as it looks . The beauty of [the world]3184-the world has always been very much to [Burgoyne]181-jim , though hitherto it has been chiefly in the austerity of [[her]750-he high and desert places]751-her high and desert places that [he]750-he has bowed the knee before the Universal Mother . [This little gold evening city]752-this little gold evening city , sunset clad in the colours of [the New Jerusalem]753-the new jerusalem , lifting [her]753-the new jerusalem heavenly campanile to as heavenly a sky , is to [him]750-he a new and wonderful thing . [Her]753-the new jerusalem loveliness sinks into [his]750-he soul , and with it a companion sadness as deep . From henceforth the sight of [earth]754-earth 's fair shows will be , for the most part , forbidden [him]750-he . [He]750-he has always loved to look and adore in silence and alone ; henceforth [he]750-he will never have the right to be alone ; henceforth [he]750-he will never have the right to go anywhere without [[his]750-he wife]755-his wife . Strange and terrible word to which [he]750-he tries in vain to accustom [his]750-he mental ears ; and , thanks to the narrowness of [their]756-their means , [neither of [them]756-their]757-neither of them will be able to stir from [the strait precincts of [[their]756-their pinched home]759-their pinched home]758-the strait precincts of their pinched home . [He]750-he comes back to [[his]750-he hotel]760-his hotel , through [the Piazza of [the Duomo]36-the duomo]761-the piazza of the duomo . All the infinite richness of cupola and arch , high up , are still wrapped in the fiery rose cloak of sunset , while below the body of [the great church]762-the great church , with all [its]762-the great church marbles and traceries and carved wonders , is clad in the sobriety of twilight . On reaching [the Minerva]37-the minerva , [he]750-he finds that [Byng]203-byng has not yet returned , or rather that [he]750-he has been in and gone out again . [He]750-he waits dinner half - an - hour for [him]750-he , and then dines without [him]750-he ; dines in solitude , since it is not till [his]750-he cup of coffee is before [him]750-he , and [his]750-he cigarette between [his]750-he lips , that [[his]750-he young friend]763-his young friend appears . It is evidently no unpleasant errand that has detained [him]750-he , for [he]750-he arrives beaming , and too excited even to perceive the menu which [a waiter]678-a waiter offers [him]750-he . " [They]3414-they have arrived ! "[750-he] [he]750-he cries . Oddly enough it never occurs to [Burgoyne]181-jim to inquire who " [they]3414-they "[181-jim] may be ; it seems as much a matter - of - course to [him]181-jim as to [the handsome pink and white boy before [him]181-jim]765-the handsome pink and white boy before him , that the pronoun must relate to [Elizabeth Le Marchant]193-elizabeth and [[her]193-elizabeth mother]3300-her mother . [His]181-jim only answer , however , is an " Oh ! "[181-jim] whose tone is rather more eagerly interested than [he]181-jim could have wished . " [I]203-byng thought that [they]3414-they could not stay more than another day in [Genoa]23-genoa , "[203-byng] continues [Byng]203-byng , at length becoming aware of the menu at [his]181-jim elbow ; but only to wave it impatiently away . " So [I]203-byng thought [I]203-byng would just run down to [the station]661-the station to meet [the evening train]3416-the evening train , [the one [we]3418-we came by last night]3417-the one we came by last night ; however , it must have been more punctual than yesterday , for before [I]203-byng reached [the station]661-the station , [I]203-byng met [them]3414-they ; [I]203-byng mean [they]3414-they passed [me]203-byng in [a fiacre]3420-a fiacre . [I]203-byng only caught a glimpse of [her]3420-a fiacre face , but [I]203-byng saw [her]3420-a fiacre hand ; it was lying on the carriage door like a snow - flake . "[203-byng] " Like [[my]181-jim grandmother]3421-my grandmother ! "[181-jim] cries [Burgoyne]181-jim in a rage , for which [he]181-jim can not quite account to [himself]181-jim , at this ingenious and novel simile . [Byng]203-byng laughs ; the laugh of [a thoroughly sweet - natured person , who , in addition , has some special cause for good - humour]767-a thoroughly sweet - natured person , who , in addition , has some special cause for good - humour . " [I]181-jim do not know what colour [[your]181-jim grandmother]3422-your grandmother was ; but [she]3420-a fiacre must have been very unlike [most people]3423-most people 's if [she]3420-a fiacre was like a snow - flake . "[181-jim] [Jim]181-jim 's cross mouth unbends into a reluctant smile . It is not the first time that [he]181-jim has discovered how useless , and also impossible , it is to be out of humour with [Byng]203-byng . " [I]203-byng had a good mind to tell [[my]203-byng fiacre man]3424-my fiacre man to follow [them]3424-my fiacre man , "[203-byng] continued [Byng]203-byng , in an excited voice ; " but , in the first place , [I]203-byng did not know how to say it — really , [Jim]181-jim , [we]768-they must get up a little of the lingo — and , in the second place , [I]203-byng thought it would perhaps be rather too much in the private detective line . "[203-byng] " [I]181-jim think it would have been extremely ungentlemanlike ! "[181-jim] rejoins [Jim]181-jim severely . [Byng]203-byng reddens ; but still without losing [his]181-jim temper . " That is coming it rather strong , is not it ? but anyhow , [I]203-byng did not do it . "[203-byng] And then , by tacit agreement , [they]768-they both drop the subject . During the next three or four days it is not named between [them]768-they , nor indeed do [they]768-they see much of [each other]607-each other . [Burgoyne]181-jim spends the greater part of [his]181-jim days with [Amelia]201-amelia . Whatever cause for the accusation [he]181-jim may have given during the previous eight years , [nobody]3337-nobody can say that [he]181-jim neglects [her]201-amelia now . [He]181-jim passes long hours at [her]201-amelia side , on the same hard chair that had supported [him]181-jim on [their]768-they first interview , in [the little dismal dining - room]771-the little dismal dining - room ; going into calculations of [house]772-house - rent and taxes , drawing up lists of necessary furniture . [He]181-jim even makes a bid for [[Cecilia]222-cecilia 's drawing - room grate]773-cecilia 's drawing - room grate ; but [that young lady , whose forecasting mind can look beyond present grief to future sunshine]774-that young lady , whose forecasting mind can look beyond present grief to future sunshine , refuses to part with it . [The lovers]775-the lovers are not always , however , studying [Maple]226-maple 's and [Oetzmann]227-oetzmann 's lists . Sometimes [Jim]181-jim varies the diversion by taking [[his]181-jim future wife]776-his future wife to [picture - galleries]777-picture - galleries and [churches]3236-churches , to [the Uffizi]38-the uffizi , [the Accademia]39-the accademia , [San Lorenzo]40-san lorenzo . It is doubtful whether [Amelia]201-amelia enjoys these excursions as much as [she]201-amelia does the selection of bedsteads and saucepans , [her]201-amelia pleasure being in some degree marred by a feverish anxiety to say what [she]201-amelia thinks [[her]201-amelia lover]699-her lover expects of [her]201-amelia as [they]775-the lovers stand before each immortal canvas . In [her]201-amelia heart [she]201-amelia thinks the great statues in [the Medici Chapel]780-the medici chapel frightful , a heresy in which [she]201-amelia is kept in countenance by no less a light than [George Eliot]228-george eliot , who in one of [her]201-amelia letters dares to say of [them]781-them , " they remained to [us]775-the lovers as affected and exaggerated in the original , as in copies and casts . "[228-george eliot] To [Amelia]201-amelia many of the frescoes appear lamentably washed out , nor are [her]201-amelia efforts to hide these sentiments attended with any conspicuous success , since nothing is more hopeless than for one utterly destitute of a feeling for works of art to feign it , without having the imposture at once detected . [Burgoyne]181-jim 's mind during these expeditions is a battle - ground for pity and rage ; pity at the pathos of [[his]181-jim poor love]782-his poor love 's endeavours ; rage at [their]775-the lovers glaring failure . [Cecilia]222-cecilia sometimes accompanies [the lovers]775-the lovers , but this does not make matters much better . [Cecilia]222-cecilia devotes but a very cursory notice to the pictures ; [her]222-cecilia attention being almost wholly centred on [the visitors]784-the visitors , and on finding resemblances for [them]784-the visitors among [the inhabitants of [[her]222-cecilia own village]786-her own village at [home]401-home , for the accuracy of which [she]222-cecilia appeals at every moment to [[her]222-cecilia sister]720-her sister]785-the inhabitants of her own village at home , for the accuracy of which she appeals at every moment to her sister . Every day [she]222-cecilia asks [Burgoyne]181-jim to fulfil [his]181-jim promise — a promise which [he]181-jim as punctually assures [her]222-cecilia that [he]181-jim never made — to introduce [[his]181-jim friend]393-his friend to [her]222-cecilia . [He]181-jim has a strangely strong reluctance to comply with this simple request , which yet , [he]181-jim knows , will have to be complied with some day . When [Amelia]201-amelia is [[his]181-jim wife]755-his wife , [Byng]203-byng will have to know [Cecilia]222-cecilia , for [she]222-cecilia will probably spend a great deal of [her]222-cecilia time with [them]791-their — make [[their]791-their house]792-their house a second home , in fact . And meanwhile [Jim]181-jim is keenly , and for some reason sorely , conscious of the fact that , during the hours in which [he]181-jim is stooping [his]181-jim weary head over catalogues of fenders and fire - irons , carving - knives and fish - slices , blankets and ticking , [Byng]203-byng is searching [Florence]20-florence through [her]203-byng length and breadth for [[their]791-their two countrywomen]657-their two countrywomen . It is not indeed necessary to credit [[his]181-jim friend]393-his friend with any special quest to account for [his]181-jim wanderings through [the " adorable little city]3425-the " adorable little city , "[206-jim] as [Henry James]206-jim most truly calls it , since [he]181-jim is [a young man of a wide and alert curiosity , with a large appetite for pleasure both intellectual and the reverse]795-a young man of a wide and alert curiosity , with a large appetite for pleasure both intellectual and the reverse . [Jim]206-jim , whose acquaintance with [him]393-his friend has chiefly been with [his]206-jim rowdy undergraduate side , bear - fighting , and proctor - defying , is astonished at [his]206-jim almost tremulous appreciation of the Ghirlandajos , [the Lorenzo di Credis]796-the lorenzo di credis , the Giottos , that in [a hundred chapels]797-a hundred chapels , from a hundred walls , shine down in their mixed glory of naïve piety and blinding colour upon [him]206-jim . One day [the elder man]798-the elder man is sitting in [[his]798-the elder man bedroom]799-his bedroom with a despatch - box and a sheet of paper before [him]798-the elder man . [He]798-the elder man is embarked upon a dreary calculation as to what [his]798-the elder man guns will fetch . [He]798-the elder man has made up [his]798-the elder man mind to sell [them]800-them . Of what further use can [they]800-them be to [him]798-the elder man ? [He]798-the elder man will not be allowed to shoot at [the Bayswater omnibuses]801-the bayswater omnibuses , which will be the only game henceforth within [his]798-the elder man reach . While [he]798-the elder man is thus employed upon an occupation akin to , and about as cheerful as , that of [Rawdon Crawley]230-rawdon crawley before [Waterloo]41-waterloo , [Byng]203-byng enters . " [You]393-his friend look as if [you]393-his friend had a headache , [old chap]3426-old chap , "[798-the elder man] [he]798-the elder man says , sitting down upon [[his]798-the elder man friend]393-his friend 's bed . " If [you]393-his friend had been going through as many [kitchen - ranges]3427-kitchen - ranges as [I]206-jim have this morning , perhaps [you]393-his friend would have a headache , "[206-jim] replies [Jim]206-jim gravely . " [You]393-his friend know that [I]206-jim am going to be married as soon as [I]206-jim get [home]401-home . "[206-jim] [Byng]203-byng nods ; and [Burgoyne]181-jim , while inwardly blessing the tact that spares [him]181-jim any congratulations , takes [himself]181-jim to task for having made the announcement so lugubriously as to render felicitation obviously inapplicable . " When are [you]393-his friend going to introduce [me]203-byng to [Miss Wilson]200-miss wilson ? "[203-byng] asks [Byng]203-byng presently . " If [you]393-his friend shirk it much longer , [I]181-jim shall think that [you]393-his friend are ashamed of [me]181-jim . "[181-jim] [Jim]181-jim glances affectionately , yet not quite comfortably , at [[his]181-jim young friend]763-his young friend , and the thought dashes across [his]181-jim mind that , in [his]181-jim last remark , [the latter]423-the latter has put the saddle on the wrong horse . " [You]393-his friend have so large an acquaintance in [Florence]20-florence already , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim says , with some stiffness , " that [I]181-jim did not know that [you]393-his friend would care to add to it . "[181-jim] " [One]501-one can not have too much of a good thing , "[396-the other] replies [the other]396-the other joyously . " [You]393-his friend know [I]181-jim love [my]181-jim fellow - creatures ; and in this case , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim adds civilly , " [I]181-jim do care very much . "[181-jim] [Burgoyne]181-jim 's eyes are bent on the paper before [him]181-jim , which contains the melancholy enumeration of [his]181-jim firearms—"A 500 double - barrelled express , by [Henry]206-jim , of [Edinburgh]42-edinburgh ; a 450 single - barrelled ditto , by [same maker]3430-same maker , "[181-jim] etc . , etc.—as [he]181-jim says slowly : " [I]181-jim shall be very happy . "[181-jim] [His]181-jim acceptance of the proposition can hardly be called eager ; but of this [Byng]203-byng appears unawares . " When shall it be , then ? To - day — this afternoon ? "[203-byng] " No - o - o ; not to - day , [I]181-jim think . It has been arranged that [we]3431-we are to go to [San Miniato]43-san miniato — [Amelia]201-amelia , [[her]201-amelia sister]720-her sister , and [I.]181-jim "[181-jim] " Three of [you]3433-you ? "[181-jim] cries [Byng]203-byng , raising [his]181-jim eyebrows . " Then why not four ? Why may not [I]181-jim come too ? "[181-jim] There being , in point of fact , no reason why [he]181-jim should not , and [Cecilia]222-cecilia 's morning prayer being still ringing in [[her]222-cecilia future brother - in - law]806-her future brother - in - law 's ears , [he]181-jim gives a dull and lagging assent ; so that at about three o'clock [the two men]409-the two men present [themselves]409-the two men at the door of [[the Wilsons]231-the wilsons ' apartment]808-the wilsons ' apartment at [the Anglo - Américain Hotel]809-the anglo - américain hotel . That [Sybilla]221-sybilla is not expecting [visitors]810-visitors is evident by the fact that , at the moment of [their]409-the two men entrance , [she]221-sybilla is taking [her]221-sybilla own temperature — a very favourite relaxation of [hers]221-sybilla — with a clinical thermometer . [She]221-sybilla removes the instrument from [her]221-sybilla mouth without indecent haste , and holds out a languid white hand to [Byng]203-byng . " So [you]203-byng are going off on a long afternoon 's pleasuring ? "[221-sybilla] [she]221-sybilla says , with a pathetic smile . " [I]221-sybilla am so glad that [neither of [[my]221-sybilla sisters]3435-my sisters]3434-neither of my sisters is going to stay at [home]401-home with [me]221-sybilla . [[We]3437-we invalids]3438-we invalids must guard against growing selfish , though [I]221-sybilla think that is perhaps more the danger with [malades imaginaires]3439-malades imaginaires ; [[we]3437-we real ones]3440-we real ones have learnt [our]3437-we lesson of suffering better , [I]221-sybilla hope . "[221-sybilla] " [You]221-sybilla do not look so very ill , "[203-byng] replies [Byng]203-byng , in [his]811-his sympathetic voice , letting [his]811-his eyes rest caressingly on the prostrate figure , which has yet no smallest sign of emaciation about it . " Ah , that is because of [my]221-sybilla colour , "[221-sybilla] replies [Sybilla]221-sybilla , with an animation slightly tinged with resentment . " [You]221-sybilla , too , fall into that common error . [[My]221-sybilla [London]1-london doctor]3441-my london doctor tells [me]221-sybilla that there is no such unerring indication of radical delicacy of constitution as a fixed pink colour like [mine]221-sybilla ; the more feverish [I]221-sybilla am , the deeper it grows . It is very hard"—smiling[221-sybilla] again sadly—"for [one]501-one gets no pity ! "[811-his] " Where is [Cecilia]222-cecilia ? "[206-jim] cries [Jim]206-jim brusquely , and fidgeting in [his]206-jim chair . " Why is not [she]222-cecilia ready ? "[206-jim] As [he]206-jim speaks , [the young lady in question]812-the young lady in question enters — so obviously arrayed for conquest , in so patently new a hat , and such immaculate pale gloves , that across [Burgoyne]181-jim 's mind there flashes , in vexed mirth , the recollection of the immortal caution addressed by [Major O'Dowd]232-major o'dowd to [[his]206-jim friend]393-his friend and [comrade]814-comrade , " Moind [your]812-the young lady in question oi , [Dob]233-dob , [[my]206-jim boy]3443-my boy ! "[206-jim] Would [he]206-jim not do well to repeat it to [[his]206-jim friend]393-his friend ? [They]816-they are off now , there being nothing further to retard [them]816-they , leaving [Sybilla]221-sybilla tête - à - tête with [her]221-sybilla thermometer . [They]816-they are off , sociably packed in one fiacre — Not , indeed , that there is much dash about the Florentine cab - horses — saddest among [[God]214-god 's many sad creatures]817-god 's many sad creatures — with not a sound leg among [them]816-they , with staring coats and starting ribs , and poor broken knees ; and with [their]816-they sadness emphasized by the feathers stuck in [their]816-they tired heads , as if to mock [their]816-they wretchedness by a sort of melancholy smartness ! Sad as [they]816-they are , it must be owned that [they]816-they are the only sad things in [the cheerful Florentine streets]818-the cheerful florentine streets , where [no one]819-no one seems over - busy , where , out of [the deep - eaved , green - shuttered houses]820-the deep - eaved , green - shuttered houses , [people]3155-people lean , talking to [acquaintances]822-acquaintances on the shadowed pavement below . [All the narrow thorough - fares]823-all the narrow thorough - fares are full of bustling life ; but there is no haggard squalor apparently , no dreadful [gin - palace]824-gin - palace gaiety . It does not follow here that [a man]386-a man must be drunk because [he]386-a man sings . And down [the strait , colourful streets]826-the strait , colourful streets [one]501-one looks — down a vista of houses diversely tall , each with [its]828-its cream - yellow face and [its]828-its green shutters , varied here and there by the towering bulk of [some giant - blocked mountain - palace]829-some giant - blocked mountain - palace , through whose grim , barred windows [a woman]536-a woman peeps , or a little dog shows [his]831-his pointed nose — looks to where , in dwindling perspective , the view is closed by a narrow picture of [lucent purple hill]832-lucent purple hill , [Fiesole or Bellosguardo]44-fiesole or bellosguardo — names to which the tongue cleaves lovingly . Through [the gay streets]833-the gay streets , over bridge and blue [Arno]45-arno , [[our]834-our travellers]835-our travellers go ; [[their]835-our travellers driver]836-their driver cracking a prodigious whip , and with a tiny red dog , absurdly shaven , and with nothing but a small woolly head and tail left of the original design , seated gravely beside [him]836-their driver . Away [they]835-our travellers go , pleasuring ; but pleasure and pleasuring are not always identical . [Burgoyne]181-jim sits opposite [Amelia]201-amelia ; and as for [Cecilia]222-cecilia , it is to be supposed that [her]222-cecilia heartache is for the moment dulled , since the same carriage - rug covers [her]222-cecilia knees and those of [Byng]203-byng . [Burgoyne]181-jim does not look at [Amelia]201-amelia ; nor , though [his]181-jim eyes are fixed upon the passing objects , does [he]181-jim at first see aught of them . [His]181-jim vision is turned inwards , and to [his]181-jim own soul [he]181-jim is mechanically repeating in dismal recitative , " A double - barrelled , central fire , breech - loading gun , by [Lancaster]234-lancaster ; made strong enough at the breech to shoot a spherical bullet . "[181-jim] As for [Amelia]201-amelia , [her]201-amelia features are not of a build to express any emotion with much brilliancy ; but over them lies a deep and brooding content . [Amelia]201-amelia has not had much undiluted happiness in [her]201-amelia life , but [she]201-amelia is exceedingly happy to - day . [She]201-amelia is even strangely free from the carking fear which usually assails [her]201-amelia , of praising mistakenly , of being enthusiastic in the wrong places , and passing over the right ones unnoticed . If [she]201-amelia keep to a vague generality of handsome adjectives , [she]201-amelia will surely do well enough , and , on this high holiday that [her]201-amelia heart is holding , [he]181-jim can not be cross to [her]201-amelia . As to [Byng]203-byng , [he]181-jim is emphatically of the school of divinity taught by [Tommy Moore]190-tom , nor was [he]181-jim ever known , when lacking " the lips that [he]181-jim loved , "[181-jim] to fail to make love to " the lips that are near . "[181-jim] [His]181-jim taste is too good for [him]181-jim to have chosen [Cecilia]222-cecilia as [a companion]837-a companion ; but , since fate has allotted [her]222-cecilia to [him]181-jim for the afternoon , [he]181-jim finds no difficulty in making the best of [her]222-cecilia . Nor , to do [her]222-cecilia justice , is [she]222-cecilia destitute of charms of a certain kind , though [her]222-cecilia face has the inevitable air of commonness incident upon a very short nose and a very long upper lip . But [she]222-cecilia has a good deal of bloom , and of crisp , showy - coloured hair , and a very considerable eye - power . [Byng]203-byng 's attachment to the fair sex being of far too stout a quality to be blunted by such trifles as an inch too much or too little of nose or lip , [he]181-jim also , like [Amelia]201-amelia , is thoroughly prepared to enjoy [himself]181-jim . Up [the turning Via Galileo]838-the turning via galileo [they]839-they climb , to the Basilica at the top — stock - drive of [all tourists]840-all tourists — hackneyed as only [Yankeedom]46-yankeedom and [Cockneydom]47-cockneydom , rushing hand in hand through [all earth]841-all earth 's sacredness , can hackney . But even hackneying is powerless to take off the freshness to the eye that sees it for the first time , of that view when [he]181-jim beholds [the Lily City lying close at [his]181-jim feet]842-the lily city lying close at his feet , so close that it seems [he]181-jim could throw a stone into [[her]222-cecilia [Arno]45-arno]843-her arno . [They]839-they have left [[their]839-they fiacre]844-their fiacre , and , as naturally happens in a partie carrée — more especially when [one couple]845-one couple are [betrothed lovers]846-betrothed lovers — have broken into pairs . [Burgoyne]181-jim leans pensively on [the terrace parapet]847-the terrace parapet , and [his]181-jim sombre eyes rest on the band of sister hills , joining hands in perpetual watch round [valley]848-valley and [town]849-town ; hills over which , in this late spring , there is more a promise than a performance of that green and many - coloured wealth of verdure and blossom that one associates with [Firenze]235-firenze 's fair name . But it is a promise that is plainly on the verge of a bounteous fulfilment . Then [his]181-jim look drops slowly to [the city]850-the city [herself]850-the city . In what a little space comparatively does the [Florence]20-florence that is immortal lie ! [The Duomo]36-the duomo , [the lily Campanile]48-the lily campanile " made up of dew and sunshine , "[181-jim] [the Baptistery]851-the baptistery , [Santa Croce]49-santa croce , [the Palazzo Vecchio]50-the palazzo vecchio ; [he]181-jim could compass [them]852-them in a ten minutes ' walk . And around [this small nucleus of [the undying dead]854-the undying dead and [their]854-the undying dead work]853-this small nucleus of the undying dead and their work , what [a nation of gleaming villas of the polyglot living — [a nation of every tongue , and [people]3155-people]856-a nation of every tongue , and people , and language]855-a nation of gleaming villas of the polyglot living — a nation of every tongue , and people , and language ! All over [the hills]858-the hills is the sheen of white walls , the verdure of [tended gardens]859-tended gardens ; [they]858-the hills stretch away almost to where [the Apennines]51-the apennines raise their cold white fronts against the sky . [He]181-jim rouses [himself]181-jim to remember that [Amelia]201-amelia is beside [him]181-jim , and that [he]181-jim ought to say something to [her]201-amelia . So [he]181-jim makes a rather banal observation upon the smallness of the enceinte that encloses so much loveliness . " Yes , is not it tiny ? "[201-amelia] replies [she]201-amelia , with the eager pleasure of having a remark made to [her]201-amelia which [she]201-amelia can not go wrong in answering . " Think of [London]1-london ! Why , the whole thing is not as big as [South Kensington]52-south kensington or [Bayswater]32-bayswater ! "[181-jim] [He]181-jim shudders . Must [the accursed suburb]860-the accursed suburb pursue [him]181-jim even here ? " Let [us]3444-us go into [the church]3445-the church , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim says , in a tone that a little dulls [[his]181-jim companion]603-his companion 's buoyancy . [She]201-amelia follows [him]181-jim crestfallenly , asking [herself]201-amelia whether [she]201-amelia has answered amiss here also . [She]201-amelia does not trust [herself]201-amelia to any comment upon the interior . [Byng]203-byng and [Cecilia]222-cecilia are standing before the high altar , from over which a mosaic Madonna stiffly beams upon [them]862-them ; and as [the other couple]863-the other couple approach [them]862-them , [Burgoyne]181-jim hears the words " drawing - room grate "[181-jim] issue from [[his]181-jim future sister - in - law]864-his future sister - in - law 's lips . " [Bravo]236-bravo , [Cis]222-cecilia ! "[181-jim] [he]181-jim says in a dry aside ; " [you]222-cecilia are getting on nicely ! [I]181-jim did not think that [you]222-cecilia would have reached [the drawing - room grate]3446-the drawing - room grate till to - morrow . "[181-jim] To avoid intruding further on [her]201-amelia delicate confidences , and also to escape from [two Americans]865-two americans , who are nasally twanging [Hare]237-hare and [Horner]238-horner at each other , varied by trips into [Baedeker]53-baedeker , [he]181-jim passes into [a side chapel made famous by [one of the loveliest tombs that ever feigned to simulate in marble death 's ugliness]867-one of the loveliest tombs that ever feigned to simulate in marble death 's ugliness]866-a side chapel made famous by one of the loveliest tombs that ever feigned to simulate in marble death 's ugliness . The Yankee voices are high and shrill , but they had need to be higher and shriller still before [they]868-they could break the slumber of [him]181-jim whose resting - place [Jim]181-jim has invaded in [his]181-jim flight from [Cecilia]222-cecilia and [New York]55-new york . Was ever rest so beautiful as this of [the young sleeper]869-the young sleeper ? [A priest]870-a priest [he]181-jim was , [nay cardinal]871-nay cardinal , and youthful and lovely and chaste ! and now in how divine a slumber is [he]181-jim lapt ! But how should that four hundred years ' slumber not be divine , watched by such [a gentle Mary - mother]872-a gentle mary - mother as is watching [his]181-jim ; smiling as if to tell [him]181-jim that [he]181-jim does well to sleep , that sleep is better than waking , that death is better than life ! There is a sunken look about [his]181-jim fair eyelids , as if [he]181-jim had gone through suffering to [his]181-jim rest ; and [his]181-jim reposeful hands are thin ; but below [him]181-jim , as [he]181-jim lies in [his]181-jim spotless marble tranquillity , upon [his]181-jim sarcophagus , the rose garlands wave in lovely frieze , and the riotous horses rear and plunge in fulness of life . [Burgoyne]181-jim has not perceived that [Amelia]201-amelia did not follow [him]181-jim . [She]201-amelia has , in point of fact , remained in the body of [the church]3445-the church , immersed in [her]201-amelia guide - book , steadily working through the marble screen and pulpit , and still five good minutes off [the side chapel]874-the side chapel , in which [[her]201-amelia lover]699-her lover stands in so deeply brown a study , that [he]181-jim is not aware of the intrusion upon [his]181-jim solitude of [two women]876-two women , until [he]181-jim is roused with a leap by the voice of [one of [them]876-two women addressing — not [him]181-jim , of whose presence [she]201-amelia is obviously as unaware as was [he]181-jim of [hers]201-amelia , until this moment — but [[her]201-amelia companion]540-her companion]877-one of them addressing — not him , of whose presence she is obviously as unaware as was he of hers , until this moment — but her companion . " Oh , [mother]3447-mother ! am [I]181-jim not [a fool]3448-a fool , at [my]181-jim age , too ? but [I]181-jim can not help it , it makes [me]181-jim cry so ! "[181-jim] [Burgoyne]181-jim does not need the evidence of [his]181-jim eyes . [The mother]579-the mother 's answer is inaudible ; and then again comes the voice of [Elizabeth Le Marchant]193-elizabeth , tearful and vibrating . " [You]181-jim know [I]579-the mother have seen so few beautiful things in [my]579-the mother life , [I]579-the mother shall get used to them presently ; it is only sheer happiness that makes [me]579-the mother — — "[579-the mother] [She]579-the mother stops abruptly , having evidently discovered for [herself]579-the mother , or been made aware by [[her]579-the mother mother]3300-her mother of [his]181-jim vicinity ; and even if [she]579-the mother had not done so , [he]181-jim feels that [he]181-jim must lose no time in announcing [himself]181-jim . " [Florence]20-florence is a place that does make [one]501-one often choky , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim says , eagerly taking the hand which [she]579-the mother hesitatingly , and with some confusion , offers [him]181-jim . It is not quite true ; [Florence]20-florence has never made [him]181-jim feel choky ; and , if [he]181-jim is experiencing that sensation now , it is certainly not [the dead cardinal of [Portugal]239-portugal who is giving it to [him]181-jim]881-the dead cardinal of portugal who is giving it to him . " [I]193-elizabeth am [a fool]3448-a fool , [a perfect fool]3451-a perfect fool ! "[193-elizabeth] replies [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth , hastily and shamefacedly wiping away [her]193-elizabeth tears . " Did not [I]181-jim tell [you]193-elizabeth that [we]884-their should meet here ? " [I]193-elizabeth do not think that [I]193-elizabeth contradicted [you]181-jim , "[193-elizabeth] [she]193-elizabeth answers , smiling . [He]181-jim may steal another look at [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth now . [She]193-elizabeth is not crying any longer . Indeed , despite the real moisture on [her]193-elizabeth cheeks , [she]193-elizabeth strikes [him]181-jim as looking happier than at [their]884-their last meeting ; and though the interval between now and then is too short for any such alteration to have taken place in reality , yet [he]181-jim can not help imagining that the hollows in those very cheeks are less deep than when [they]884-their stood together before the great Vandyke in [the Brignoli Sala Palace]885-the brignoli sala palace . " And the entresol ? is it all [your]193-elizabeth fancy painted it ? [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth 's face breaks into a soft bright smile . [She]193-elizabeth has a dimple in one cheek and not in the other . [She]193-elizabeth must have had it ten years ago ; how comes [he]181-jim to have forgotten so sweet and strange a peculiarity ? " It is delightful — perfectly delightful ! "[193-elizabeth] [She]193-elizabeth is looking doubtfully and half uneasily in [his]181-jim face , as [she]193-elizabeth gives this answer , but [he]181-jim has scarcely time for a flash of self - congratulation at having obtained the information , which [he]181-jim had never realized the eagerness of [his]181-jim desire for until this moment , before [he]181-jim becomes aware that [[his]181-jim interlocutor]646-his interlocutor 's eyes are no longer meeting [his]181-jim , but have wandered to some object over [his]181-jim shoulder . What that object is [he]181-jim is not long left in doubt . Whether it is a genuine accident , or one of those spurious ones , of which [those who profit by them]888-those who profit by them are [the artificers]889-the artificers , [Jim]181-jim does not know ; and , as [he]181-jim is at the time , and will be when [he]181-jim thinks of the circumstance to the end of [his]181-jim life , too angry to question [Byng]203-byng on the subject , it is pretty certain that [he]181-jim never will know ; but so it is that at this moment the voice of [his]181-jim protégé breaks upon [his]181-jim ear : " [You]181-jim are not going to give [us]891-all four the slip like this , [old chap]3426-old chap — oh ! [I]181-jim beg [your]181-jim pardon ! "[181-jim] But begging pardon ever so sweetly does not alter the fact that [he]181-jim has rushed , like a bull in [a china shop]890-a china shop , into the middle of the dialogue . [All four]891-all four look at [each other]607-each other for a second ; then , since there is no help for it , [Jim]181-jim presents [[his]181-jim disciple]893-his disciple , and the next moment [the latter]423-the latter has slid into talk with [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth , and [she]193-elizabeth is responding with an ease and freedom from embarrassment such as had never marked [her]193-elizabeth sparse and hardly won utterances to [the elder man]798-the elder man . [Byng]203-byng has the advantage of [him]798-the elder man , as [he]181-jim somewhat bitterly thinks . [Byng]203-byng has no connection with " old times ; "[203-byng] those poor old times which [she]193-elizabeth and [[her]193-elizabeth mother]3300-her mother have so unaccountably taken en grippe . [He]181-jim seems suddenly relegated , as by some natural affinity , to [the mother]579-the mother . Oh , here [she]899-a young lady is ! "[899-a young lady] For even while the words are on [his]181-jim lips , [Amelia]201-amelia and [Cecilia]222-cecilia come into sight . [She]189-mrs. le marchant thinks that [he]181-jim is engaged to [Cecilia]222-cecilia . The mistake is intolerable to [him]181-jim , and yet a second 's reflection tells [him]181-jim that it is a natural one . In a second [he]181-jim sees [[his]181-jim [Amelia]201-amelia]3218-his amelia as [she]201-amelia presents [herself]201-amelia to a strange eye . [Miss Wilson]200-miss wilson is only thirty - one , but upon [her]200-miss wilson has already come that set solid look of middle age , which overtakes [some women]902-some women before [they]902-some women are well over the borders of youth , and which [other women]903-other women manage to stave off till [they]903-other women are within near hail of forty . Yes ; the mistake is quite a natural one . [Most people]3423-most people would suppose that [the showy Cecilia]905-the showy cecilia , still fairly youthful , and with so many obvious and well - produced " points , "[181-jim] must be [his]181-jim choice ; and yet , as [I]0-i have said , the idea that [anyone]3161-anyone should credit [him]181-jim with [her]200-miss wilson ownership is intolerable to [him]181-jim . " Here [she]200-miss wilson is ! "[181-jim] [he]181-jim cries precipitately . " [The one to the right side]3459-the one to the right side , the other is [[her]200-miss wilson sister]720-her sister ; may [I]181-jim — may [I]181-jim present them to [you]189-mrs. le marchant ? "[181-jim] Perhaps it is [his]181-jim irritated fancy that dictates the idea , but it seems to [him]181-jim as if [he]181-jim detected a sort of surprise in [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant 's face , when [he]181-jim effects the introduction [he]181-jim has proposed , and to which [she]189-mrs. le marchant accedes courteously , after a pause of hesitation about as long as had followed [his]181-jim inquiry of [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth as to [their]907-their address . Five minutes later [they]907-their have all sauntered out again on [the terrace]908-the terrace , and [Burgoyne]181-jim is again leaning on the wall ; but this time [he]181-jim has no fear of hearing of [Bayswater]32-bayswater , for it is [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth who is beside [him]181-jim . Since last [he]181-jim looked at it half an hour ago , a sort of glorification has passed over the divine view . Down where [the river]449-the river twists through [the plain country]910-the plain country , there is a light , dainty mist , but [the mountains]911-the mountains have put on their fullest glory . They are not green , or brown , or purple , or blue ; but clad in that ineffable raiment woven by the sun , that defies [our]912-our weak vocabulary to provide it with a name . A little snow - chain lies on [the sun - warmed neck of [Morello]57-morello]913-the sun - warmed neck of morello , and along [the tops of [the further Apennines]915-the further apennines]914-the tops of the further apennines , right against the acute blue of the heavens , lies a line of snow , that looks like a fleece - soft cloud resting from its journeyings on their crests ; but it is no cloud , nor is there any speck upon the gigantic complete arch that over - vaults [town]849-town and valley and [radiant mountains]917-radiant mountains . In the folds of these last , the shadows slumber ; but over all [the city]850-the city is the great gold glory of spring . The one thing in [Florence]20-florence that frowns among so many smiles is [the scowling Pitti]919-the scowling pitti , and that , from here , is invisible . Nearer to [him]181-jim , against the azure , stand the solemn flame - shaped cypresses arow , and beside [them]911-the mountains — as unlike as life to death — a band of quivering poplars , a sort of transparent gold - green in their young spring livery . The air is so clear that [one]501-one can go nigh to counting the marbles on the Duomo walls . In a more transparent amber light , fuller of joy and gaiety , can not [the saved]921-the saved be dancing around , as in [Fra Angelico]244-fra angelico 's divine picture ? can not [they]921-the saved be walking in [the New [Jerusalem]58-jerusalem of [St. John]245-st. john 's great dream]922-the new jerusalem of st. john 's great dream ? Only in [the New Jerusalem]753-the new jerusalem there are no galled and trembling - kneed fiacre horses . [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth is sitting on the wall , [her]193-elizabeth light figure — is it possible that it has been in [the world]3184-the world only four years less than [Amelia]201-amelia 's solid one?—half - supported by one small gray hand outspread on the stone ; [her]193-elizabeth little fine features all tremulous with emotion , and half a tear gathered again in each sweet eye . As [Jim]181-jim looks at [her]193-elizabeth , a sort of cold covetous gripe pinches [his]181-jim heart . " What [a woman with whom to look at all earth 's loveliness]3461-a woman with whom to look at all earth 's loveliness — with [whom to converse without speech]3462-whom to converse without speech ! "[193-elizabeth] Even as [he]181-jim so thinks , [she]193-elizabeth turns [her]193-elizabeth head towards [him]181-jim , and , drawing in [her]193-elizabeth breath with a long low sigh , says : " Oh , how glad [I]193-elizabeth am [I]193-elizabeth did not die before to - day ! "[193-elizabeth] [Her]193-elizabeth eyes are turned towards [him]181-jim , and yet , as once before , [he]181-jim realizes that it is not to [him]181-jim that either [her]193-elizabeth look or [her]193-elizabeth thoughts are directed . Both are aimed at an object over [his]181-jim shoulder , and , as before , that object is [Byng]203-byng . [Byng]203-byng , too , has been gazing at the view . [Byng]203-byng cries easily and genuinely , and enjoys it ; and , as [he]181-jim is [a remarkably fine young man]927-a remarkably fine young man , there is something piquant in the contrast between [his]181-jim wet blue orbs and [his]181-jim shoulders . " Was it 12 , or 12 bis , Piazza d'Azeglio ? "[930-a smallish woman , perennially looking , through brilliant tears] There are no tears in [Byng]203-byng 's eyes as [he]181-jim asks this question next morning — asks it of [[his]181-jim friend]393-his friend , as [the latter]423-the latter sits in the Fumoir , with an English paper in [his]423-the latter hands , and a good cigar between [his]423-the latter clean - shaven lips . " [I]181-jim mean [Miss Le Marchant]240-miss le marchant 's address , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim answers , explaining as amiably as if [he]181-jim had not been perfectly aware that it was only " cussedness "[181-jim] that had dictated the query . There is a slight pause . "[181-jim] Having obtained the information [he]181-jim wanted , and finding [[his]181-jim companion]603-his companion not conversationally disposed , [Byng]203-byng is moving away again , when [he]181-jim is arrested by [Jim]181-jim 's voice , adding to the intelligence [he]181-jim has just given the monosyllable : " Why ? "[203-byng] ( in a snubbing voice ) . [Byng]203-byng nods . " And [she]189-mrs. le marchant said yes ? "[203-byng] The plural pronoun has dropped out of sight , but neither of [them]940-them perceives it . [The younger man]654-the younger man shakes [his]654-the younger man sleek head . [Jim]181-jim lays down [his]181-jim paper with an air of decision . " If [she]189-mrs. le marchant did not say ' Yes'—if [she]189-mrs. le marchant said ' No , ' "[181-jim] [he]181-jim begins , with an accent of severity , " [I]181-jim fail to understand — — "[181-jim] " [She]189-mrs. le marchant did not say ' No , ' "[203-byng] interrupts [Byng]203-byng , still half laughing , and yet reddening as well . " [She]189-mrs. le marchant began to say it ; but [I]181-jim suppose that [I]181-jim looked so broken - hearted — [I]181-jim am sure [I]181-jim felt it — that [she]189-mrs. le marchant stopped . "[181-jim] As [Jim]181-jim makes no rejoinder , [he]181-jim continues by - and - by : " After all , [she]189-mrs. le marchant can but send [me]181-jim away . [One]501-one is always being sent away "[181-jim] ( [Jim]181-jim wishes [he]181-jim could think this truer than [he]181-jim does ) ; " but now and again [one]501-one is not sent , and those are the times that pay for [the others]3469-the others ! [I]181-jim 'll risk it . "[181-jim] There is a hopeful ring in [his]181-jim voice as [he]181-jim ends , and again a pause comes , broken a third time by [the younger man]654-the younger man . " Come now , [Jim"—looking]248-jim"—looking[654-the younger man] with a straight and disarming good humour into [[his]181-jim friend]393-his friend 's overcast countenance—"speak up ! Do [you]393-his friend know of any cause or impediment why [I]181-jim should not ? "[181-jim] Thus handsomely and fairly appealed to , [Burgoyne]181-jim , who is by nature [a just man]944-a just man , begins to put [his]181-jim conscience through [her]393-his friend paces as to the real source of [his]181-jim dislike to the idea of [[his]181-jim companion]603-his companion 's taking advantage of that introduction which [he]181-jim [himself]181-jim has been the means — however unwillingly — of procuring for [him]181-jim . It is true that [[Byng]203-byng 's mother]946-byng 's mother had adjured [him]181-jim , with tears in [her]946-byng 's mother eyes , to preserve [[her]946-byng 's mother boy]947-her boy from [undesirable acquaintances]948-undesirable acquaintances ; but can [he]181-jim , [Burgoyne]181-jim , honestly say that [he]181-jim looks upon [Elizabeth Le Marchant]193-elizabeth as an undesirable acquaintance for [anyone]3161-anyone ? The result of [his]181-jim investigations is the discovery of how infinitesimal a share in [his]181-jim motives regard for [[his]181-jim young friend]763-his young friend 's welfare has had . The discovery is no sooner made than [he]181-jim acts upon it . " [[My]181-jim dear boy]3470-my dear boy , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim says — and to [his]181-jim credit says it heartily—"I see no earthly reason why [you]3470-my dear boy should not go ; [you]3470-my dear boy could not make [nicer friends]3471-nicer friends . "[181-jim] " Then why will not [you]396-the other come too ? "[203-byng] asks [Byng]203-byng , with boyish generosity . [The other]396-the other shakes [his]396-the other head . " [They]3472-they had much rather [I]396-the other stayed away ; [they]3472-they have taken [me]396-the other en grippe . "[396-the other] " Pooh ! Nonsense ! [You]396-the other fancy it . "[181-jim] " [I]396-the other think not"—speaking[396-the other] slowly and thoughtfully—"I am not [a fanciful person]3473-a fanciful person , nor apt to imagine that [[my]396-the other acquaintances]3474-my acquaintances bother [their]3474-my acquaintances heads about [me]396-the other one way or another ; but when [people]3155-people try [their]3155-people best , in the first instance , to avoid recognising [you]3476-you at all , and on every subsequent occasion endeavour to disappear as soon as [you]3476-you come in sight , it is not a very forced assumption that [they]3155-people are not exactly greedy for [your]3476-you society . "[396-the other] This reasoning is so close that [Byng]203-byng is for the moment silenced ; and it is the other who shortly resumes : " [I]181-jim think it is because [I]181-jim remind [them]3155-people of the past ; [they]3155-people have evidently some unpleasant association of ideas with that past . " On the contrary — [they]3155-people are all — one more flourishing than another .
