"[203-byng] cries [Byng]203-byng sanguinely ; adding , " What could have been pleasanter than [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant 's manner when [you]203-byng presented [her]189-mrs. le marchant to [Miss Wilson]200-miss wilson ? "[203-byng] The mention of [Miss Wilson]200-miss wilson recalls to [Jim]181-jim the extremely unpleasant moment of that presentation , thus brought back to [him]181-jim — the moment when [Amelia]201-amelia had looked so middle - aged , and [Cecilia]222-cecilia so flashy ; recalls to [him]181-jim also the conviction that has been growing upon [him]181-jim since yesterday , of the more than wisdom , the absolute imperative duty on [his]181-jim part , of avoiding a repetition of that comparison which had forced itself upon [his]181-jim notice in [the church of [San Miniato]43-san miniato]953-the church of san miniato . " [You]393-his friend had better come , "[203-byng] persists [Byng]203-byng still , like [a magnanimous child]954-a magnanimous child , holding out half [his]181-jim cake to [[his]181-jim friend]393-his friend ; whether , like [the same child]956-the same child , with a semi - hope that it may be refused , or whether , on the other hand , it may have crossed [his]181-jim mind that , where there are [two visitees]957-two visitees , the chances of a tête - à - tête are improved by there being also [two visitors]958-two visitors . " [[My]181-jim dear boy]3470-my dear boy , "[181-jim] returns [Jim]181-jim , this time with a testiness handsomely streaked with irony , " [you]3470-my dear boy are really too obliging ; but , even if [I]181-jim wished it — which [I]181-jim do not — or even if [they]957-two visitees wished it — which [they]957-two visitees do not — it is in this case quite impossible , as [I]181-jim am engaged to go shopping with [Amelia]201-amelia . "[181-jim] Probably the blow is not a knockdown one to [Byng]203-byng ; at all events , [he]181-jim bears the rebuff with [his]181-jim habitual healthy good temper , and goes off to put on a smarter tie . [Burgoyne]181-jim , thinking no such improvement in [his]181-jim toilette necessary , strolls away to [the Anglo - Américain]3323-the anglo - américain . It is true that [he]181-jim has covenanted to escort [Amelia]201-amelia to [the shop]960-the shop for Cantagalli ware , though there is no particular reason why , had [he]181-jim so wished it , the purchase of the dinner - service that is to grace [their]961-their Bayswater symposia might not have been deferred for twenty - four hours ; and indeed , as things turn out , it has to be so deferred . As [he]181-jim opens the door of [the Wilson sitting - room]962-the wilson sitting - room [[his]181-jim future father - in - law]963-his future father - in - law brushes past [him]181-jim , with evident signs of discomposure all over [his]181-jim clerical figure and spectacled face ; and , on entering , [he]181-jim finds equal , if not superior , marks of upset equanimity on the countenances of [the three women that are [the room]442-the room 's occupants]964-the three women that are the room 's occupants . [The other two]967-the other two are looking on with an air of vexed interest . [Sybilla]221-sybilla is the first to address [him]181-jim . " [You]181-jim have appeared at a not very happy moment , "[221-sybilla] [she]221-sybilla says , with a sigh ; " [we]3479-we have been having a family breeze ; it has sent [my]221-sybilla temperature up nicely ! It is 100 , 100 , Point 2 . "[221-sybilla] The mention of [Sybilla]221-sybilla 's temperature is always enough to put [Jim]181-jim in a rage . [I]181-jim am very fond of wedding - cake ; so , as soon as [father]3390-father 's back was turned , [I]181-jim fished it out again ! " [I]200-miss wilson could not say so , of course , before [her]201-amelia , "[200-miss wilson] remarks [Miss Wilson]200-miss wilson , as soon as [they]981-we are out of earshot , " or [she]201-amelia might have insisted upon [my]200-miss wilson going . " [I]201-amelia have so much of [you]3499-you now — oh , so much!—not to speak of — — "[201-amelia] " [Cecilia]222-cecilia , of course , is incapacitated by grief ? But [[your]3499-you father]3331-your father ? [He]3331-your father will be at [home]401-home , will [he]3331-your father not ? "[181-jim] " Yes , [he]3331-your father will be at [home]401-home , "[201-amelia] replies [Amelia]201-amelia , slowly and doubtfully , as if not finding a very satisfactory solution in this suggested arrangement ; " but , as [you]3499-you know , it never answers to leave [father]3390-father and [Sybilla]221-sybilla alone together for long . "[181-jim] [Jim]181-jim laughs . " And to - day , "[201-amelia] continues [Amelia]201-amelia , " [he]3331-your father is naturally a good deal upset about [Cecilia]222-cecilia and that wedding - cake ; it was very impertinent to send it — was not it?—though [she]222-cecilia does not seem to see it . " If [we]3506-we are going to talk nonsense , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim breaks in brusquely , and with no attempt to return or reward [her]201-amelia caressing gesture , " [I]181-jim may as well go . "[181-jim] " Go to [the Piazza d'Azeglio]241-piazza , "[201-amelia] says [she]201-amelia coaxingly , [her]201-amelia spirits raised by the harshness of tone of [his]181-jim interruption of [her]201-amelia speech , and half persuading [herself]201-amelia that it owes its birth to the supposition being too painful to be faced by [him]181-jim . [He]181-jim looks at [her]201-amelia strangely for a moment , then—"Why do [you]201-amelia wish [me]181-jim to go to [the Piazza d'Azeglio]3491-the piazza d'azeglio ? "[181-jim] [he]181-jim asks , in a tone that is no longer overtly cross , only constrained and odd . " Why are [you]201-amelia driving [me]181-jim [there]455-there ? "[181-jim] " Because [I]201-amelia think [you]181-jim would like it , "[201-amelia] [she]201-amelia answers ; " because"—taking[201-amelia] [his]181-jim hand and passing [her]201-amelia lips , which [he]181-jim feels to be trembling a little , very gently over the back of it—"because all through [your]181-jim life [I]181-jim want [you]181-jim to have exactly what [you]181-jim like , always . "[181-jim] [He]181-jim draws [his]181-jim hand away ; not unkindly , but as if shocked at the humility of [her]201-amelia action . " That is so likely , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim says mournfully . There is no particular mirth in [Burgoyne]181-jim 's mind as [he]181-jim mounts the stone stairs of [the house]986-the house which announces itself as 12 bis , in [the commonplace new square of [the Piazza d'Azeglio]3491-the piazza d'azeglio]987-the commonplace new square of the piazza d'azeglio . But yet it is evident that , if [he]181-jim wishes to be in tune with the mood of [the family to whom [he]181-jim is going to pay [his]181-jim respects]989-the family to whom he is going to pay his respects , [he]181-jim must be not only mirthful , but musical . As the door of [the entresol]990-the entresol , to which [he]181-jim is directed by [the porter]3201-the porter , opens in answer to [his]181-jim ring , bursts of laughter , among which [he]181-jim can plainly detect the voice of [Byng]251-byng , assail [his]181-jim ear , mingled with music , or rather noise of a sort , but what sort [his]181-jim ear , without fuller evidence than is yet before it , is unable to decide . [The person who has admitted [him]181-jim]992-the person who has admitted him is [an elderly Englishwoman]993-an elderly englishwoman , whose features at once strike [him]181-jim as familiar — so familiar that it needs scarcely one reaching back of memory 's hand to capture the fact of [her]992-the person who has admitted him having filled [the office of nurse at [the Moat]558-the moat]994-the office of nurse at the moat , at the period when [the nursery]996-the nursery there had been the scene of those frantic romps in which [he]181-jim [himself]181-jim had taken a prominent part , and in which [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth had been to [him]181-jim by turns so able a second , or so vigorous [an adversary]997-an adversary . [He]181-jim would like to claim acquaintance with [her]193-elizabeth , and , perhaps , if [she]193-elizabeth had made any difficulty as to admitting [him]181-jim , might have screwed up [his]181-jim courage to do so ; but as [she]193-elizabeth lets [him]181-jim in without delay or hesitation , [he]181-jim follows [her]193-elizabeth in silence along the passage of a by no means imposing little entresol — [they]998-they are not so well off as [they]998-they used to be , is [his]181-jim passing thought — is ushered into [a small sitting - room]999-a small sitting - room , and , entering behind [his]181-jim own name , which has been completely drowned by the din issuing from within , has time , before the consciousness of [his]181-jim own appearance has disturbed it , to take in the details of a group which [his]181-jim entry naturally breaks up . Set slantwise across one angle of [the room]442-the room is an open cottage - piano , and beside [it]1001-it stands [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth , [her]193-elizabeth elbow resting on the top , and all [her]193-elizabeth pensive face convulsed with helpless laughter . Upon the music - stool is seated a large collie dog , supported from behind in an upright position by [Byng]251-byng . Before [him]181-jim is a score of music , from which [he]181-jim is obviously supposed to be playing , as indeed [he]181-jim is doing in a sense — that is to say , [he]181-jim is bringing down first one large paw and then another heavily on the keys , accompanying each crash with a short howl to express the agony inflicted upon [his]181-jim nerves by [his]181-jim own performance . The scene is so entirely different a one from what [he]181-jim had expected : the immoderately laughing [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth has so much more kinship with [the sweet hoyden of the Moat]1002-the sweet hoyden of the moat than with [the pale woman with a history of [his]181-jim two last meetings]1003-the pale woman with a history of his two last meetings , that for a second or two [Burgoyne]181-jim stands in the doorway as if stunned . It is not till [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant , coming out of [an inner room]1004-an inner room , advances to greet [him]181-jim , that [he]181-jim recovers [himself]181-jim . " How do [you]181-jim do ? "[189-mrs. le marchant] [she]189-mrs. le marchant says , smiling , and with less constraint than [he]181-jim has of late learnt to expect . " Are [you]181-jim fond of music ? "[189-mrs. le marchant] ( putting , as [she]189-mrs. le marchant speaks , [her]189-mrs. le marchant hands up to [her]189-mrs. le marchant ears ) . " [I]189-mrs. le marchant hope so ! Did [you]181-jim ever hear such a shocking noise ? "[189-mrs. le marchant] " [I]181-jim do not know which [I]181-jim admire most , the vocal or the instrumental part of the performance , "[181-jim] replies [he]181-jim , laughing ; but even as [he]181-jim speaks both cease . [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth lifts [her]193-elizabeth elbow from the piano , and [Byng]251-byng removes [his]251-byng hands from under the dog 's arms , who at once , joyful and released , jumps down , upsetting [his]251-byng music - stool with the impetus of [his]251-byng descent , and yet immediately , with all a dog 's real good - heartedness , begins to swing a handsome tail , to show that [he]251-byng bears no real malice for the odious practical joke that has been played upon [him]251-byng . The clamorous fall of dog and music - stool reveals an object which had been hidden behind both , in the shape of [a little boy]414-a little boy , in whose behalf , as it darts across [Jim]181-jim 's mind , the eccentric concert , for which [he]181-jim has come in , must have been got up . " Oh , do go on ! "[1006-the child] cries [the child]1006-the child shrilly . " Oh , do make [him]251-byng do it again ! Oh , why do [you]181-jim stop ? "[1006-the child] And indeed through the whole of the ensuing conversation this cry recurs at short intervals with the iteration of a guinea - hen . But [none of [the three performers]1008-the three performers]1007-none of the three performers seems disposed to comply with this request . Two of [them]1008-the three performers sit down decorously on chairs , and [the third]1009-the third throws [himself]1009-the third upon the floor panting , showing a fine red tongue , and dragging [himself]1009-the third luxuriously along on [his]1009-the third stomach to show [his]1009-the third relief at [his]1009-the third corvée being ended . [The child]1006-the child has followed [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth , and now stands beside [her]193-elizabeth , tiresomely pulling at [her]193-elizabeth white hands . " [Bertie]215-bertie has come to spend the day with [us]3509-us , "[193-elizabeth] [she]193-elizabeth says , looking explanatorily up at [Jim]181-jim , but speaking with a formality very different , as [he]181-jim feels , from the exuberant ease and mirth that had marked [her]193-elizabeth intercourse with [Byng]251-byng . [Jim]181-jim had already had a flash of speculation about [the child]1006-the child , as to whether [he]1006-the child might be [a late - come little brother]1012-a late - come little brother , arrived on the scene at a period subsequent to [his]1006-the child own connection with [the family]728-the family ; since plainly the span of [his]1006-the child small life did not stretch to a decade . " [Bertie]215-bertie is [a new friend]3510-a new friend , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim says kindly . " [I]181-jim do not know [Bertie]215-bertie . "[181-jim] " [[His]215-bertie mother]3511-his mother , [Mrs. Roche]252-mrs. roche , is [a cousin of [ours]3513-ours]3512-a cousin of ours ; [she]3511-his mother has [a villa on [Bellosguardo]61-bellosguardo]3514-a villa on bellosguardo . Perhaps [you]181-jim know [her]3511-his mother ? "[181-jim] " [I]181-jim am going to a party at [[her]3511-his mother house]3515-her house on Wednesday , "[181-jim] cries [Jim]181-jim , in a tone of eager pleasure at the discovery of this fresh link , and of the vista of probable meetings which it opens up . " [I]193-elizabeth shall meet [you]181-jim there ? "[193-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth turns [her]193-elizabeth head slightly aside and shakes it as slightly . " No ? "[193-elizabeth] " [We]3513-ours are not going out . "[240-miss le marchant] The formula implies mourning , and yet the clothes both of [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth and [[her]193-elizabeth mother]3300-her mother are unmistakably coloured ones , and give no indication of an even moderately recent loss . But it is so clear that [Miss Le Marchant]240-miss le marchant means to add no explanation that [he]181-jim has to change the subject . " Though [Bertie]215-bertie is not [an old friend]3516-an old friend , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim says , smiling , " yet [I]181-jim have come across one here to - day — [she]3511-his mother opened the door to [me]181-jim ; [I]181-jim should have liked to shake hands with [her]3511-his mother , only [she]3511-his mother looked so haughty — [she]3511-his mother never used to look haughty at [the Moat]8-the moat . "[181-jim] " Do [you]181-jim mean [nurse]3517-nurse ? "[193-elizabeth] [she]193-elizabeth asks . " Yes , [I]181-jim knew [her]3511-his mother in an instant ; [she]3511-his mother is not in the least changed , less even"—hesitating[181-jim] a little , as if doubtful whether the stiffness of [their]1015-their new relations warranted a personality—"less even than [you]181-jim . "[193-elizabeth] [She]193-elizabeth snatches a hasty look at [him]181-jim , a look upon which [he]181-jim sees , to [his]181-jim surprise , imprinted a character of almost fear . " [You]181-jim must be laughing at [me]193-elizabeth , "[193-elizabeth] [she]193-elizabeth says , in a voice in which [he]181-jim detects an undoubted tremor ; " [I]193-elizabeth am very much changed . "[193-elizabeth] There is such obvious apprehension in [her]193-elizabeth whole manner , that [his]181-jim one thought — after a first flash of astonishment — is to reassure [her]193-elizabeth . " Of course [I]181-jim was only speaking of externals , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim says quickly ; " ten years could hardly be expected to leave any of [us]3518-us quite where [we]3518-us were as to [our]3518-us inner selves ; "[181-jim] then , seeing [her]193-elizabeth still look flurried , and becoming [himself]181-jim nervous , [he]181-jim adds , rather stupidly , the hackneyed Swinburnian couplet — though [I]0-i never could see that that was quite a necessary alternative ! " Ere the words are out of [his]181-jim mouth [she]193-elizabeth has risen with precipitation , and begun hurriedly to re - arrange the branches of lilac in a scaldino on the table near [her]193-elizabeth . [She]193-elizabeth is apparently so awkward about it that one odorous white bough falls out on the floor . Before [Jim]181-jim can stoop to pick it up , [Byng]251-byng has rushed to the rescue . In eagerly thanking [him]181-jim , in receiving it back from [him]181-jim , and accepting [his]181-jim services in replacing it among [its perfumed brothers]3519-its perfumed brothers , [the girl]3289-the girl , perhaps involuntarily , turns [her]3289-the girl back upon [[her]3289-the girl former interlocutor]3521-her former interlocutor , who sits for a moment staring rather blankly at [her]3289-the girl , and wondering what sting there could have lurked in [his]181-jim apparently harmless words to drive [her]3289-the girl away so abruptly . Whatever may have driven [her]3289-the girl away , there is certainly no doubt as to [her]3289-the girl being gone . Nor as [Jim]181-jim sees [her]193-elizabeth moving about [the room]442-the room , followed by [Byng]251-byng , and showing [him]181-jim [her]193-elizabeth treasures — the little wild red and yellow tulips [she]193-elizabeth plucked in [the field]3523-the field this morning ; the chicken - skin box [she]193-elizabeth bought at [Ciampolini]254-ciampolini 's yesterday , and mixing all that [she]193-elizabeth shows with [her]193-elizabeth delicate light laughter — can [he]181-jim buoy [himself]181-jim up with any reasonable hope of [her]193-elizabeth ever , with [her]193-elizabeth own good will , returning . [He]181-jim must be looking more blank than [he]181-jim is conscious of , for [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant 's voice sounds quite apologetic in [his]181-jim ears , when , having been , like [himself]181-jim , deserted by [[her]193-elizabeth companion]540-her companion , [she]193-elizabeth takes a seat near [him]181-jim . "[181-jim] [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth is so proud of [her]193-elizabeth bargains , " [she]193-elizabeth says , glancing with a lenient smile towards [[her]193-elizabeth daughter]3525-her daughter ; "[193-elizabeth] [she]193-elizabeth must show them to [everybody]3181-everybody . " "[193-elizabeth] [She]193-elizabeth never offered to show them to [me]0-i , " replies [Jim]181-jim , rather morosely ; then , becoming aware of the almost puerile jealousy evidenced by [his]181-jim last remark , [he]181-jim adds : "[193-elizabeth] [I]0-i am afraid [I]0-i said something that annoyed [Miss Le Marchant]240-miss le marchant ; [I]0-i can not think what it could have been . [I]0-i told [her]193-elizabeth how wonderfully little changed [I]0-i thought [her]193-elizabeth in the last ten years ; but it could not have been that , could it ? " [The mother]579-the mother 's eye is still following [[her]579-the mother child]3527-her child , and , if it were not an absurd assumption , [Burgoyne]181-jim could have fancied that there was a sudden moisture in it . "[193-elizabeth] [She]193-elizabeth is very sensitive , " [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant answers slowly ; "[193-elizabeth] perhaps it would be safer not to say anything about [herself]193-elizabeth to [her]193-elizabeth . " "[193-elizabeth] Perhaps it would be safer , " rejoins [Jim]181-jim , with some ill - humour , "[240-miss le marchant] if [you]240-miss le marchant were to draw up a list of subjects for [me]0-i to avoid ; [I]0-i have no wish to play the part of bull in [a china shop]890-a china shop ; and yet [I]0-i seem to be always doing it ; imprimis " ( striking the forefinger of [his]181-jim left hand with the right ) , "[8-the moat] imprimis [the Moat]8-the moat . " [He]181-jim pauses , as if expecting a disclaimer , but none such comes—"The[8-the moat] past generally " ( moving on to the second finger and again halting ; but with no more result than before ) . "[1018-you] [Yourselves]1018-you " ( reaching the third finger ) . Still that silence , which , if it mean anything , must mean assent . [He]181-jim looks impatiently in [her]189-mrs. le marchant face , to seek the response which [her]189-mrs. le marchant lips refuse [him]181-jim . "[1018-you] On [your]1018-you own showing , " [she]189-mrs. le marchant says gently , though in a rather troubled voice , "[1018-you] [you]1018-you have the whole field of the present and the future left [you]1018-you ; are not they wide enough for [you]1018-you ? " [His]181-jim brows draw together into a painful frown . "[0-i] Perhaps [I]0-i have as little cause to be fond of them as [you]1018-you have of the past . " It is a random shot , a bow drawn at a venture ; but it could not have hit more true apparently had it been levelled with the nicest aim . As [[her]189-mrs. le marchant daughter]3525-her daughter had done before [her]189-mrs. le marchant , [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant rises hastily , and leaves [him]181-jim — leaves [him]181-jim to reflect ironically upon how wisely [Amelia]201-amelia had acted in insisting upon [his]181-jim visiting [these "[0-i] dear old friends]3529-these " dear old friends , " upon whom the effect of [his]181-jim conversation is so obviously exhilarating . "[0-i] [I]0-i wish [I]0-i had not come ; [I]0-i wish it was time to go [home]401-home ! " The small fractious voice that wails the two preceding sentences seems to be [Jim]181-jim 's own mouthpiece . It is , in point of fact , the voice of [Bertie]215-bertie , who , tired of uttering [his]215-bertie unregarded request for the repetition of the concert which had filled [him]215-bertie with such delight , has of late been trying the effect of [his]215-bertie unassisted powers to bring about the desired consummation , by putting [his]215-bertie arms as far as [he]215-bertie can round the dog 's body , and endeavouring to lug [him]215-bertie towards the music - stool . [The collie]3530-the collie has been enduring this treatment for five minutes — enduring it with an expression of magnanimous patience , which seems to say , that , though it is undoubtedly an unpleasant experience , yet , as it is inflicted upon [him]181-jim by [one of [[his]181-jim own family]3532-his own family]3531-one of his own family , [he]181-jim must of course put up with it , when [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth goes to the rescue . [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth goes alone , since [Byng]251-byng is held in converse by [[her]193-elizabeth mother]3300-her mother at the other side of [the room]442-the room . Verbal persuasions having entirely failed , [she]193-elizabeth tries to loosen [the child]1006-the child 's arms ; but [his]1020-him grasp , though puny , is obstinate , and the only perceptible result of [her]193-elizabeth endeavours is the utterance by [[her]193-elizabeth young friend]3536-her young friend of the two polite aspirations above recorded . "[1020-him] [He]1020-him does not want to sing any more to - day , " [Jim]181-jim hears [her]193-elizabeth saying in [her]193-elizabeth gentle voice ; "[1021-you] [you]1021-you really are hurting [him]1020-him ; [he]1020-him is too polite to say so ; but [you]1021-you are squeezing [him]1020-him so tight that [you]1021-you really are hurting [him]1020-him . Why now " ( with a little accent of pain ) , "[1021-you] [you]1021-you are hurting [me]0-i . " [Jim]181-jim has been looking with a lack - lustre eye out of the open window at the young plane trees exchanging their frowsy buds for infant leaves ; at the one Judas tree pranking in its purple blossoms in [the Piazza]3537-the piazza ; but at that low complaint [he]181-jim makes one step across [the room]442-the room , and , whipping off [Master Bertie]215-bertie alike from long - enduring dog and [plaintive woman]3539-plaintive woman , stoops over [the latter]423-the latter as [she]423-the latter sits upon the floor , passing one hand over the other , upon which [the child]1006-the child 's angry fingers , transferred from [[his]1006-the child first victim]3542-his first victim , have left rosy prints of pain . "[1021-you] [I]0-i wish [I]0-i had not come ; [I]0-i wish it was time to go [home]401-home ! " whimpers [the little boy]3543-the little boy . "[0-i] Since [he]1020-him is so anxious to go [home]401-home , [I]0-i will take [him]1020-him , if [you]1024-her like , " says [Jim]181-jim in a stiff voice ; "[0-i] [I]0-i must be going [myself]0-i . " [She]1024-her looks up at [him]181-jim from [her]1024-her lowly posture , a charming , half - apologetic , wholly peace - making smile fleeting across [her]1024-her small face , while [she]1024-her still chafes [her]1024-her hand — that little pinched hand which makes [him]181-jim feel so ridiculously tender . "[0-i] Are [you]0-i , too , sorry that [you]0-i came ? " [she]1024-her asks . The question takes [him]181-jim by surprise . [He]181-jim is not prepared for so friendly and almost intimate a sequel to [her]1024-her short , shy answers , and [her]1024-her abrupt quitting of [him]181-jim . [He]181-jim hesitates how to answer it ; and as [he]181-jim hesitates , [she]1024-her rises and stands beside [him]181-jim . It is not easy for [a grown person]3544-a grown person to rise gracefully from a seat on the floor . [Jim]181-jim catches [himself]181-jim thinking with what a roll and [a flounder Cecilia]3545-a flounder cecilia would have executed [the same manœuvre]3546-the same manœuvre ; but [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth , supple and light , rises as smoothly as an exhalation from [a summer meadow]3547-a summer meadow . "[0-i] If [I]0-i was rude to [you]0-i just now , " [she]0-i says , rather tremulously ; "[0-i] if [I]0-i am ever rude to [you]0-i in the future , [I]0-i hope [you]0-i will understand — [I]0-i hope [you]0-i will put it down to the fact that [I]0-i — [I]0-i — am very ignorant of — that [I]0-i know very little of [the world]3184-the world . " [The two men]409-the two men are gone ; so is [the child]1006-the child ; so is the dog ; and [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth is shutting up the piano and removing the score . "[1027-the signora] What a noise [we]1026-we made ! " [she]0-i says , smiling at the recollection . "[1027-the signora] If [you]0-i make such a shocking noise again , [the signora]1027-the signora and [the other lodgers]1028-the other lodgers will infallibly interfere . " [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant has followed [[her]189-mrs. le marchant daughter]3525-her daughter , and now throws one arm about [her]189-mrs. le marchant slight neck , with a gesture of passionate affection . "[1028-the other lodgers] If [you]0-i knew , " [she]0-i says , in a voice of deep and happy agitation , "[0-i] what it was to [me]0-i to hear [you]0-i laugh as [you]0-i did to - day ! " "[0-i] [I]0-i have a good many arrears in that way to make up , have not [I]0-i , [mammy]1029-mammy ? And so have [you]0-i too , " answers [the younger woman]3551-the younger woman , laying [her]3551-the younger woman sleek head down caressingly on [[her]3551-the younger woman mother]3300-her mother 's shoulder ; then , in a changed and restless voice : "[0-i] Oh , if [we]1030-we could stop [that man]574-that man talking about the Moat ! Why does [he]574-that man go on hammering about it ? " "[574-that man] Why indeed ? " replies [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant with a shrug . "[512-men] [Men]512-men are so thick - skinned ; but it is rather touching , [his]574-that man having remembered [us]1030-we all these years , is not it ? For [my]0-i part , [I]0-i had almost entirely forgotten [his]574-that man existence — had not [you]0-i ? " "[0-i] Absolutely ! " replies [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth , with emphasis ; "[574-that man] and if [he]574-that man will only let [me]0-i , [I]0-i am more than willing to forget it over again . Oh , [mammy]1029-mammy " ( turning [her]193-elizabeth face round , and burying it on [[her]193-elizabeth mother]3300-her mother 's breast ) , "[1029-mammy] why ca n't [we]1030-we forget everything ? begin everything afresh from now — this delightful now ? " A reconciliation is seldom effected without some price being paid for it . [Jim]181-jim 's with [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth , if it can be called such , is bought at the cost of a small sacrifice of principle on [his]181-jim part . No later than this morning [he]181-jim had laid it down as a Median rule that [he]181-jim should avoid opportunities of finding [himself]181-jim in [[Miss Le Marchant]240-miss le marchant 's company]3554-miss le marchant 's company ; and yet , not only has [he]181-jim spent the major part of the afternoon in [her]240-miss le marchant society , but , as [he]181-jim walks away from [her]240-miss le marchant door , [he]181-jim finds that [he]181-jim has engaged [himself]181-jim to help [Byng]251-byng , on no distant day , in doing the honours of the Certosa Monastery to [her]240-miss le marchant and [[her]240-miss le marchant mother]3300-her mother . On reflection , [he]181-jim can not quite explain to [himself]181-jim how the arrangement has come about . The proposal certainly did not originate with [him]181-jim , and still less with [the two ladies]3556-the two ladies so strangely shy of all society . [The three]971-the three have somehow been swept into it by [Byng]251-byng , who , either with the noblest altruism , or because [he]181-jim feels justly confident that [he]181-jim has no cause for jealousy of [[his]181-jim friend]393-his friend ( [Jim]181-jim 's cynical reflection is that the latter is the much more probable reason ) , has insisted on drawing [him]181-jim into the project . [Jim Burgoyne]181-jim is [not a man whom , as a rule , it is easy either to wile or cudgel into any course that does not recommend itself to [his]181-jim own judgment or taste — a fact of which [he]181-jim [himself]181-jim is perfectly aware , and which makes [him]181-jim remorsefully acknowledge that there must indeed have been [a traitor]3560-a traitor in [the citadel of [his]181-jim own heart]3561-the citadel of his own heart before [he]181-jim could have so weakly yielded at the first push to what [his]181-jim reason sincerely disapproves]3559-not a man whom , as a rule , it is easy either to wile or cudgel into any course that does not recommend itself to his own judgment or taste — a fact of which he himself is perfectly aware , and which makes him remorsefully acknowledge that there must indeed have been a traitor in the citadel of his own heart before he could have so weakly yielded at the first push to what his reason sincerely disapproves . But yet it is not true that remorse is the leading feature of [his]181-jim thoughts , as [he]181-jim walks silently beside [[his]181-jim friend]393-his friend down [the Via di Servi]3563-the via di servi . It ought to be , perhaps ; but it is not . The picture that holds the foreground of [his]181-jim memory is that of [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth sitting on the floor , and sending [him]181-jim peace - offerings from [her]193-elizabeth pathetic eyes and across [her]193-elizabeth sensitive lips . It was very sweet of [her]193-elizabeth to think it necessary to make [him]181-jim amends at all for [her]193-elizabeth trifling incivility , and nothing could be sweeter than the manner of it . How gladly would [he]181-jim buy some little rudeness from [her]193-elizabeth every day at such a price ! But yet , as [he]181-jim thinks it over , the manner of it , the ground on which [she]193-elizabeth rested [her]193-elizabeth excuse , is surely a strange one . That [she]193-elizabeth should attribute [her]193-elizabeth light lapse from courtesy to want of knowledge of [the world]3184-the world comes strangely from the mouth of [a woman of six - and - twenty]3565-a woman of six - and - twenty . If it be true — and there was a naïve veracity in lip and eye as [she]193-elizabeth spoke — how is it to be accounted for ? Has [her]193-elizabeth mind , has [her]193-elizabeth experience of life , remained absolutely stationary during the last ten years ? [Her]193-elizabeth tell - tale face , over which some pensive story is so plainly written , forbids the inference . It is no business of [his]181-jim , of course . [Amelia]201-amelia , thank Heaven ! has no story ; but , oh ! if [someone]529-someone would tell [him]181-jim what that history is ! And yet , three days later , [he]181-jim voluntarily puts away from [himself]181-jim the opportunity of hearing it . During those three days [he]181-jim sees no more of [her]193-elizabeth . [He]181-jim does not again seek [her]193-elizabeth out , and accident does not throw [her]193-elizabeth in [his]181-jim way . [He]181-jim buys [his]181-jim Cantagalli dinner - service in company with [Amelia]201-amelia ; chooses the soup - tureen out of which [he]181-jim is to ladle mutton broth for [the inhabitants of [Westbourne Grove]62-westbourne grove]3567-the inhabitants of westbourne grove ; [he]181-jim tastes of the wedding - cake that has cost [Cecilia]222-cecilia so dear , and [he]181-jim avoids [Byng]251-byng . On the third day [he]181-jim can no longer avoid [him]251-byng , since [he]181-jim is to occupy , as on the San Miniato occasion , the fourth seat in the fiacre which conveys [himself]181-jim and [the Misses Wilson]255-the misses wilson to the garden - party at [the villa in [Bellosguardo]61-bellosguardo inhabited by [Mrs. Roche]252-mrs. roche]3568-the villa in bellosguardo inhabited by mrs. roche , [the mother of [the amiable Bertie]215-bertie]3569-the mother of the amiable bertie . [[The Wilsons]231-the wilsons ' acquaintances in [Florence]20-florence]3570-the wilsons ' acquaintances in florence are few , and , as far as [Burgoyne]181-jim has at present had the opportunity of judging , evil . It is , therefore , with a proportionate elation that [Cecilia]222-cecilia dresses for a party at which [she]222-cecilia will meet the bulk , or at least [the cream , of [the English society]3572-the english society]3571-the cream , of the english society . It is to [Byng]251-byng 's good nature that [she]222-cecilia and [[her]222-cecilia sister]720-her sister owe the introduction to [a hostess whose acquaintance is already too large to make [her]222-cecilia eager for any causeless addition to it]3574-a hostess whose acquaintance is already too large to make her eager for any causeless addition to it ; but whose hand has been forced by [Byng]251-byng , in the mistaken idea that [he]251-byng is doing a service to [[his]251-byng friend]393-his friend [Jim]181-jim . [They]3576-they are late in setting off , as [Amelia]201-amelia is delayed by the necessity of soothing [Sybilla]221-sybilla , who has been reduced to bitter tears by a tête - à - tête with [[her]221-sybilla father]3214-her father , in which [that well - intentioned but incautious gentleman]3578-that well - intentioned but incautious gentleman has been betrayed into suggesting to [her]221-sybilla that [she]221-sybilla may possibly be suffering from biliousness . The administering of bromide , to calm [her]221-sybilla nerves under such a shock ; the reiterated assurances that [every member of [the family except its head]3580-the family except its head]3579-every member of the family except its head realizes the monstrosity of the suggestion , take up so much time that [Amelia]201-amelia [herself]201-amelia has to reduce to a minimum the moments allotted to [her]201-amelia own toilette . [She]201-amelia has cried a little with [Sybilla]221-sybilla , for company partly , and partly out of weariness of spirit . That and hurry have swollen [her]221-sybilla eyelids , and painted [her]221-sybilla cheeks with a hard , tired red , so that it is an even more homespun figure and a homelier face than usual , that seat [themselves]3576-they opposite [Burgoyne]181-jim , when at length [they]3576-they get under weigh . [He]181-jim , [Burgoyne]181-jim , has been impatient of the delay , impatient to set off and to arrive ; yet [he]181-jim would be puzzled to say why . [He]181-jim knows , on no less authority than [her]221-sybilla own word , that [he]181-jim shall not meet [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth ; and yet the mere feeling that [the mistress of the house to which [he]181-jim is going]3581-the mistress of the house to which he is going is of the same blood as [she]221-sybilla ; that [he]181-jim shall see [the rude , spoilt child , whose ill - tempered pinch]3582-the rude , spoilt child , whose ill - tempered pinch made [her]221-sybilla utter that low cry of pain , suffice to give a tartness to [his]181-jim tone , as [he]181-jim inquires the cause of [her]221-sybilla lagging , of [the panting , flushed , apologetic Amelia]3583-the panting , flushed , apologetic amelia . [Byng]251-byng and [Cecilia]222-cecilia have been sitting waiting for some time in [the salon]3584-the salon , from which [Sybilla]221-sybilla has removed [her]221-sybilla prostrate figure and tear - stained face ; but [they]3585-they have been entertaining [each other]607-each other so well — [she]221-sybilla in paying [him]181-jim a series of marked attentions , and [he]181-jim in civilly and pleasantly accepting them — that the half - hour has not seemed long to either . But [the party]3587-the party , in motion at last , has passed the Roman Gate , and is climbing up and up between the high walls , each step giving it a greater vantage ground over [the Flower City]3588-the flower city , before [Burgoyne]181-jim recovers [his]181-jim equanimity . The spring comes on apace . In [the gardens]3240-the gardens above [their]3585-they heads laurestinus bushes , with all [their]3585-they flowers out ( as they are never seen in [England]11-england , where always the east wind nips half the little round buds before they can expand into blossom ) , stand in white and green ; rosemary trees , covered with gray bloom , hang down ; and against the azure of the high heaven purple irides stand up arow . It is one of those days on which [one]501-one can with bodily eyes see [the Great Mother]256-mother at [her]256-mother quickening work ; can see [her]256-mother flushing the apple - boughs , unfolding the fig - leaves , and driving the lusty green blood through the sappy vines . And in the slow creeping of the fiacre up [the twisting white road]3591-the twisting white road , each turn lays [the divine Tuscan city]3592-the divine tuscan city before [them]3585-they in some new aspect of arresting loveliness . At [Florence]20-florence , one is like [Balaam]257-balaam with [the Israelites]3593-the israelites . [One]501-one is taken to see [her]256-mother from one point after another , each point seeming fairer than the last ; but the likeness ends there , for no wish to curse [the sweet town]3595-the sweet town could ever arise in even the morosest heart . [The hills]858-the hills have put on [their]858-the hills summer look of dreamy warmth and distance . Before [they]3585-they have reached [the hilltop]3597-the hilltop the boon Italian air has kissed most of the creases out of [Jim]181-jim 's temper , and the brick - red from [Amelia]201-amelia 's cheek - bones . [He]181-jim looks remorsefully from the triumphant beauty around , into the poor , fond face opposite to [him]181-jim — looks at [her]256-mother with a sort of compassion for being so unlovely , mixed with a compunctious admiration and tenderness for [her]256-mother gentle qualities . [He]181-jim may touch [her]256-mother hand without fear of observation , so wholly is [Byng]251-byng enveloped in the mantle of [Cecilia]222-cecilia 's voluble tenderness . "[1034-you] Have [you]1034-you forgiven [me]0-i ? " [he]181-jim asks , smiling ; "[1034-you] [I]0-i will make any apologies , eat any dirt , say anything , short of allowing that [Sybilla]221-sybilla is not bilious . " [They]3585-they have reached [the villa]3598-the villa , and turned out of [the dusty highway]3599-the dusty highway into [a great cool courtyard]3600-a great cool courtyard , that has a Moorish look , with [its]3600-a great cool courtyard high arches , over which the Banksia roses tumble in cascades of yellow and white . It seems wrong that the voices which come from the tea - tables under [the Loggia]3601-the loggia should be chattering English or Yankee , instead of cooing that "[221-sybilla] sweet bastard Latin " that better suits place and day . [The hostess]3602-the hostess shakes hands absently with [Burgoyne]181-jim , offers [his]181-jim fair charges iced coffee , and then , having discharged [her]3602-the hostess conscience towards [them]3585-they , draws [Byng]251-byng away for an intimate chat . From [her]3602-the hostess hands [he]251-byng passes into those of [several other willing matrons]3603-several other willing matrons and [maids]3604-maids , and it seems likely that [the party who brought [him]251-byng]3605-the party who brought him will see [him]251-byng no more . [Amelia]201-amelia , unused to , and unexpectant of attention , is perfectly content to sit silent , sipping [her]201-amelia cold coffee ; but [Cecilia]222-cecilia is champing [her]222-cecilia bit in a way which frightens [[her]222-cecilia future brother - in - law]806-her future brother - in - law so much that [he]806-her future brother - in - law cowardly takes the opportunity of [her]222-cecilia looking in another direction to lure [[his]806-her future brother - in - law docile fiancée]3607-his docile fiancée on to [the broad terrace]3608-the broad terrace , whence all the young green glory of [[the Arno]45-arno 's plain]3609-the arno 's plain , and [the empurpled slopes and dreamful breast of [Morello]57-morello]3610-the empurpled slopes and dreamful breast of morello , are to be seen by [the looker]3611-the looker 's beauty - drunk eye . Upon [this terrace]3612-this terrace [many people]3613-many people are walking and sitting in twos and threes , and in one of the little groups [Amelia]201-amelia presently discovers a female acquaintance , who at once fastens upon [her]201-amelia , and happening to be afflicted with [a relative visited by a disorder of something the same nature]3614-a relative visited by a disorder of something the same nature as [Sybilla]221-sybilla 's , subjects [her]201-amelia to a searching and exhaustive catechism as to the nature of [[her]201-amelia sister]720-her sister 's symptoms . [Sybilla]221-sybilla 's symptoms , whether at first or second hand , have invariably the property of driving [Jim]181-jim into [desert places]3616-desert places ; and , in the present instance , seeing no likelihood of an end to the relation of them , [he]181-jim turns impatiently away , and , without much thought of where [he]181-jim is going , follows [a steep downward path that ends in a descent of old stone steps]3617-a steep downward path that ends in a descent of old stone steps , between whose crevices green plants and little hawkweed blow - balls flourish undisturbed , to a large square well , framed by a low broad parapet , with flower - beds set around [it]3618-it , and the whole closed in by rugged stone walls . [No one]819-no one apparently has had the same impulse as [he]181-jim , for , at first , [he]181-jim has the cool solitude to [himself]181-jim . [He]181-jim sits down on the parapet of [the still well]3620-the still well , and drops in pebbles to see how deep [the water]3621-the water is ; and anon lifts [his]181-jim idle look to the empty niches in the crumbling wall — niches where once [wood - god]3622-wood - god , or water - nymph , or [rural Pan]64-rural pan stood in stone , now empty and forsaken . Out of the wall two ilexes grow , and lift themselves against the sapphire arch , which yet is no sapphire , nor of any name that belongs to cold stone ; a blue by which all other blues are but feeble colourless ghosts of that divinest tint . [He]181-jim is roused from the vague reverie into which the cool silence and the brooding beauty around have lulled [him]181-jim , by the sound of approaching voices . [He]181-jim is not to have [his]181-jim well any longer to [himself]181-jim . [He]181-jim looks up with that scarcely latent hostility in [his]181-jim eye with which [one]501-one regards [the sudden intruder]3624-the sudden intruder into [a railway carriage]3625-a railway carriage , when — counting on keeping it to [one]501-one 's self for a long night journey — one has diffused limbs and parcels over [its]3625-a railway carriage whole area . [The owners of the voices]3627-the owners of the voices , having descended , as [he]181-jim had done , the age - worn steps , come into sight . [They]3627-the owners of the voices are [both men]3628-both men , and one of [them]3627-the owners of the voices [he]181-jim recognises at once as a [Mr. Greenock]259-mr. greenock , [a well - known stock figure in Florentine society]3629-a well - known stock figure in florentine society , [a mature bachelor diner - out]3630-a mature bachelor diner - out , [a not ill - natured retailer of news]3631-a not ill - natured retailer of news , [collector of bons - mots , and harmless appendage of pretty women]3632-collector of bons - mots , and harmless appendage of pretty women . Of the other , at whom [he]181-jim scarcely glances , all [he]181-jim grasps is the fact that [he]181-jim is dressed in clerical attire , and that the first words audible of [his]181-jim speech , as [he]181-jim comes within hearing , is the name of [an English county]3633-an english county — [Devonshire]5-devonshire . The answer comes in a tone of keen interest : "[221-sybilla] Ah , [I]0-i thought there must be a screw loose ! " As [the new arrivals]3634-the new arrivals become aware of the presence of [a third person]3635-a third person , [they]3634-the new arrivals pause in [their]3634-the new arrivals talk ; but presently , [Mr. Greenock]259-mr. greenock having recognised [Jim]181-jim and greeted [him]181-jim with a friendly nod and a trivial remark upon the splendour of the day , [they]3634-the new arrivals resume [their]3634-the new arrivals interrupted theme , standing together a few yards distant from [him]259-mr. greenock on the walk — resume it in a rather lower but still perfectly audible key . "[0-i] [I]0-i thought there must be some reason for [their]1035-their shutting [themselves]1035-their up so resolutely , " continues [Mr. Greenock]259-mr. greenock in the gratified tone of one who has at length solved a long - puzzling riddle . "[0-i] [I]0-i thought that there must be a screw loose , in fact ; but are [you]0-i quite sure of it ? " [The other]396-the other gives a sigh and a shrug . "[0-i] Unfortunately there can be no doubt on that head ; the whole lamentable occurrence took place under [my]0-i own eyes ; [the Moat]8-the moat is in [[my]0-i parish]1036-my parish . " "[0-i] [Devonshire]5-devonshire ! " "[0-i] A screw loose ! " "[0-i] [The Moat]8-the moat ! " [Burgoyne]181-jim is still sitting on [the well - brim]3637-the well - brim ; but [he]181-jim no longer sees the lapis vault above , nor [the placid dark water below]3638-the placid dark water below . A sort of horrible mist is swimming before [his]181-jim eyes ; it is of [Elizabeth Le Marchant]193-elizabeth that [they]1035-their are speaking . Through that mist [he]181-jim snatches a scared look at [the speaker]3271-the speaker ; at [him]3271-the speaker whom but two minutes ago [he]181-jim had glanced at with such a cursory carelessness . Does [he]181-jim recognise [him]3271-the speaker ? Alas ! yes . Though changed by the acquisition of a bald head and a grizzled beard , [he]181-jim sees [him]3271-the speaker at once to be [the man who , at the time of [his]181-jim own acquaintance with [the Le Marchant family]3641-the le marchant family]3640-the man who , at the time of his own acquaintance with the le marchant family , had filled the office of [vicar of [their]3641-the le marchant family parish]3642-vicar of their parish ; under whom [he]181-jim had sat on several drowsy summer Sunday mornings , trembling at [the boys]3643-the boys ' perilous antics in the great curtained pew , and laughing inwardly at [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth 's mirth - struggling efforts to control [them]1038-they . "[0-i] And [you]1037-you say that [they]1038-they never held up [their]1038-they heads again afterwards ? " pursues [Mr. Greenock]259-mr. greenock in a tone of good - natured compassion , that is yet largely tinged with gratified curiosity . "[1037-you] [They]1038-they left [the neighbourhood]1039-the neighbourhood at once , " returns [the clergyman]3644-the clergyman . "[1038-they] Dear [me]0-i , how time flies ! it must be ten years ago now , and [I]0-i never saw [them]1038-they again until [I]0-i met [the unhappy girl]1040-the unhappy girl and [[her]1040-the unhappy girl mother]3300-her mother yesterday , driving in [the Via Tornabuoni]1042-the via tornabuoni ; but"—lowering [his]3644-the clergyman voice a little more—"you[1037-you] will understand that this is strictly entre nous ; that it must not go any further . " "[1037-you] What do [you]1037-you think [I]0-i am made of ? " cries [Mr. Greenock]259-mr. greenock in a burst of generous indignation ; "[1037-you] but"—stepping a pace or two nearer to [his]3644-the clergyman interlocutor—"I[1037-you] am not quite sure that [I]0-i have got the details of the story right ; would [you]1037-you mind just running it over to [me]0-i again ? " [Jim]181-jim has been sitting in such a stunned stillness that it is perhaps no wonder that [they]1038-they have forgotten [[his]181-jim neighbourhood]3645-his neighbourhood . At all events , [the clergyman]3644-the clergyman is evidently about to comply with [[his]3644-the clergyman companion]603-his companion 's request and recapitulate the tale . If [Jim]181-jim preserves [his]181-jim motionless attitude but five minutes longer , [he]181-jim will be put into possession of that story whose existence [he]181-jim has already heavily conjectured , and the imagining of which has made [him]181-jim often , within the last week or two , turn with nausea from [his]181-jim food , and toss restlessly upon [his]181-jim bed . Without any trouble on [his]181-jim part , without any possible blame attaching to [him]181-jim , [he]181-jim will learn [the poor soul]3648-the poor soul 's secret . Never ! If [the devil]3649-the devil wish to tempt [him]181-jim with a prospect of success , it must be with a less unhandsome bait . Almost before [the two startled scandalmongers]3650-the two startled scandalmongers have recalled the fact of [his]181-jim existence by the abrupt noise of [his]181-jim departure , [he]181-jim is half - way back to [the terrace]908-the terrace , that mist still before [his]181-jim eyes , and a singing in [his]181-jim ears . "[1037-you] A merry going out bringeth often a mournful return [home]401-home ; and a joyful evening makes many times a sad morning . " The return drive , as it is quicker , being all downhill , so is it a more silent one than that to [the villa]3598-the villa had been . [Byng]251-byng , indeed , is as gaily willing to be fondled by [Cecilia]222-cecilia as [he]251-byng was on [his]251-byng way up ; but there is a mixture of maidenly reserve and sub - tender reproach in [her]222-cecilia manner which makes [their]3653-their relations somewhat strained . The afternoon 's pleasuring has had a jading effect upon [Amelia]201-amelia 's spirits , as , after having been sucked dry on the subject of [Sybilla]221-sybilla 's maladies , and afterwards at once shaken off , by [[her]201-amelia female acquaintance]3654-her female acquaintance , [she]201-amelia has not been fortunate enough to meet with [anyone else to exchange talk with]3655-anyone else to exchange talk with , and has sat in disconsolate yet patient loneliness on a stone bench , afraid to stir from the spot where [he]181-jim had left [her]201-amelia , lest [she]201-amelia might miss [[her]201-amelia lover]699-her lover , of whom , however , [she]201-amelia has unaccountably seen nothing , until when [the Angelus]260-the angelus is ringing , and the shadows spreading , [he]181-jim has come to give [her]201-amelia curt notice , with half - averted face , that [the fiacre]3657-the fiacre is at the door . In point of fact , [he]181-jim has been too conscious of the disorder of [his]181-jim features to dare to expose them sooner than [he]181-jim can help to [her]201-amelia fond scrutiny . [He]181-jim would give anything to be able to sit beside , instead of opposite to [her]201-amelia during [their]3658-their drive [home]401-home , as a profile is a much less tell - tale and more governable thing than a full face ; and [he]181-jim is painfully conscious that as often as [she]201-amelia imagines [she]201-amelia can do it without being detected by [him]181-jim , [she]201-amelia is stealing looks of inquiring anxiety at [him]181-jim . [He]181-jim tries to put [her]201-amelia off the scent by spasmodic comments upon the entertainment that [they]3658-their have just quitted ; and [she]201-amelia does [her]201-amelia best to keep up the ball of conversation , since [she]201-amelia sees that it is [his]181-jim wish . But in vain . Each forced remark falls still - born , leading to nothing . It is [Cecilia]222-cecilia who at last succeeds in giving a fillip to the languid talk . "[0-i] [I]0-i did not know that [Mrs. Roche]252-mrs. roche was [a cousin of [your]1045-your beauty]1044-a cousin of your beauty , [Miss Le Marchant]240-miss le marchant , " [she]201-amelia says suddenly , growing tired of [her]201-amelia pensive attitude , and addressing [herself]201-amelia to [Jim]181-jim . [He]181-jim starts guiltily . "[1045-your] Did not [you]1045-your ? " [He]181-jim must look odd ; for even [Cecilia]222-cecilia 's large and preoccupied cow eyes rest upon [him]181-jim with an expression of surprise . "[1045-your] [I]0-i wonder why [she]252-mrs. roche was not there to - day . " It is not exactly a question , yet [her]222-cecilia great shallow orbs do not seem to be going to leave [his]181-jim face until [he]181-jim makes some response . [He]181-jim forces [himself]181-jim to do so . "[252-mrs. roche] [I]0-i understood [Miss Le Marchant]240-miss le marchant to say that [they]1046-they are not going out just now . " "[240-miss le marchant] And why are not [they]1046-they , pray ? " inquires [Cecilia]222-cecilia , in an injured voice , as if the retirement from the world of [the two ladies in question]3660-the two ladies in question were a personal injury to [herself]222-cecilia ; "[240-miss le marchant] [they]1046-they are not in mourning , all [their]1046-they gowns are coloured ones , and [they]1046-they do not look as if [they]1046-they had bad health — perhaps , however " ( after a moment 's thoughtful attempt to find a solution)—"perhaps[1046-they] , however , [they]1046-they may have something — [one]501-one never knows — [people]3155-people have such unexpected diseases nowadays — hysteria , perhaps , or fits . " At this ingenious suggestion [Jim]181-jim is conscious of a writhing motion passing over the stalwart form of [Byng]251-byng beside [him]181-jim . In [his]181-jim own brain , if there is room for anything but the desire to evade [Amelia]201-amelia 's eyes , is a dim sense of relief at a suggestion so grotesquely wide of the mark as that made by [the younger Miss Wilson]200-miss wilson . In perfect innocence of the effect produced upon [[her]222-cecilia companions]3661-her companions by [her]222-cecilia bright hypothesis , [Cecilia]222-cecilia goes on to remind [[her]222-cecilia sister]720-her sister of the parallel case of [a very handsome girl whom [they]1046-they had once reckoned among [their]1046-they acquaintance]3663-a very handsome girl whom they had once reckoned among their acquaintance , and who was periodically being found by [[her]222-cecilia family]645-her family with [her]222-cecilia head under the fender . But [Amelia]201-amelia rises but faintly to the reminiscence , and the remainder of the drive is accomplished in a general silence . The next day is the one which had been fixed upon for the expedition to [Certosa]65-certosa . It was only with a very large admixture of wormwood in [his]181-jim prospective pleasure that [Jim]181-jim had ever looked forward to this party , but now [he]181-jim anticipates it with absolute dread . How can [he]181-jim face [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth and [[her]193-elizabeth mother]3300-her mother , with that ominous phrase of the "[201-amelia] screw loose " still ringing in [his]181-jim ears ? [He]181-jim feels a traitor towards [them]1046-they , in that [he]181-jim has , however unwillingly , overheard it . To add to [his]181-jim mental uneasiness is the fact of [his]181-jim having as yet not broken to [Amelia]201-amelia [his]181-jim intentions with regard to the disposal of [his]181-jim afternoon . [Amelia]201-amelia 's eyes have for years had the habit of covertly watching [him]181-jim to read [his]181-jim wishes almost before [they]1046-they rose ; but in [their]1046-they gaze yesterday [he]181-jim had , unless misled by [his]181-jim guilty conscience , detected a new quality , a quality of alarm and enlightenment . [He]181-jim will get over the communication of [his]181-jim piece of news as early in the day as may be ; so , having finished breakfast before [Byng]251-byng has put in [his]181-jim , as usual , tardy appearance , [he]181-jim takes [his]181-jim hasty way to [the Anglo - Américain]3323-the anglo - américain . [He]181-jim finds [the family]728-the family [there]455-there in a more placid frame of mind than that which [they]728-the family had presented on one or two of [his]181-jim recent visits . [Sybilla]221-sybilla is expecting [[her]221-sybilla doctor]3669-her doctor , on which occasions [she]221-sybilla always likes to have a more lacy coverlet than usual thrown over [her]221-sybilla languid feet ; a greater efflorescence of pink ribbons about [her]221-sybilla thin throat , and a disposition of pots of lilies about [her]221-sybilla wan head . [Amelia]201-amelia , active and long - suffering as usual , is moving about in patient execution of [her]201-amelia vain and tiresome whimsies . [Cecilia]222-cecilia sits tranquilly in the window , knitting an elaborate pair of [men]512-men 's woollen gloves , not indeed — to do [her]222-cecilia justice — for [anyone in particular]3671-anyone in particular , but with a wise forethought for the accidents and possibilities of life . Since , on this occasion , [[his]181-jim sweetheart]3672-his sweetheart shows no inclination to draw [him]181-jim away into [the dining - room]3328-the dining - room for a tête - à - tête , [Jim]181-jim has to take the bull by the horns , and rush into [his]181-jim subject in a more public manner than [he]181-jim had intended . But the one desire to get it over outbalances all minor considerations . "[201-amelia] [Amelia]201-amelia , " [he]181-jim begins suddenly , and even to [himself]181-jim [his]181-jim voice sounds discourteous and abrupt , "[201-amelia] shall [you]201-amelia want [me]0-i this afternoon ? " The moment that the words are out of [his]181-jim mouth it strikes [him]181-jim that the form into which [he]181-jim has thrown [his]181-jim question is more than necessarily untender . [She]201-amelia stops in the patting of [Sybilla]221-sybilla 's smart pillows , and perhaps there is something a little abrupt too in [her]201-amelia monosyllabic "[201-amelia] Why ? " "[201-amelia] Because , " standing before the fireplace , with [his]181-jim back to [the three women]3674-the three women , and throwing the words over [his]181-jim shoulder , "[201-amelia] because , if [you]201-amelia do not , [Byng]251-byng and [I]0-i were thinking of going to [Certosa]65-certosa . " There is a pause . [He]181-jim hears that [Cecilia]222-cecilia 's needles have stopped clicking ; [her]222-cecilia work has dropped into [her]222-cecilia lap . In another moment [she]222-cecilia will have proposed to come too . "[0-i] With [the Le Marchants]261-the le marchants , " [he]181-jim goes on , shooting out the fateful words like bullets ; "[261-the le marchants] a partie carrée . " Still silence behind [him]181-jim . [He]181-jim can not go on staring for ever at the billets of wood of the unlit fire . [He]181-jim has to turn round and face [[his]181-jim companions]3675-his companions . The only one of [them]3675-his companions whose pleasure or displeasure in [his]181-jim announcement [he]181-jim at all heeds — [Amelia]201-amelia — is stooping over [Sybilla]221-sybilla , rearranging in a high , picturesque tier behind [the invalid]3676-the invalid 's long back , three cushions , and [her]201-amelia face is almost entirely hidden from [him]181-jim by [her]201-amelia attitude . "[261-the le marchants] Of course if it is in the least inconvenient , if [you]1049-you have made any other plans for [me]0-i — if , in fact , [you]1049-you want [me]0-i , " [he]181-jim continues in a tone that is at once apologetic and dogged . "[1049-you] But [I]0-i do not , " cries [she]0-i , answering at last , and with a distinct laugh in [her]0-i voice , a laugh into whose quality [he]181-jim is not anxious too curiously to inquire . "[1049-you] [You]1049-you must not be so conceited as to think that [I]0-i always want [you]1049-you ! In point of fact , [you]1049-you could not have hit upon a day that suited [me]0-i better . [I]0-i am really rather ' throng ' to - day , as [they]1050-they say in [Yorkshire]66-yorkshire . [I]0-i have quite a hundred things to do , and [father]3390-father wants [me]0-i to help [him]3390-father to correct the proofs of [his]3390-father sermon , the sermon [he]3390-father preached at [[Mr. Moffat]262-mr. moffat 's church]1052-mr. moffat 's church on the Holy Innocents ' Day . [He]3390-father has been asked to publish it — is not that flattering ? [Poor father]1053-poor father , [I]0-i believe [he]3390-father will end by being [a popular preacher]1054-a popular preacher — in fact " ( laughing again ) , "[1053-poor father] [the whole family]732-the whole family is going up in [the world]3184-the world ! " There is such a forced mirth in [her]0-i tone that [Jim]181-jim feels much more guiltily uncomfortable than if [she]0-i had treated [him]181-jim to hysterics or sulks . Nor does [his]181-jim satisfaction with [himself]181-jim increase , when , upon [his]181-jim rising to depart , [she]0-i runs out of [the room]442-the room after [him]181-jim , to say to [him]181-jim , while [her]0-i homely face twitches against [her]0-i will , how much [she]0-i hopes that [he]181-jim will enjoy [himself]181-jim ; how perfectly happy [she]0-i shall be without [him]181-jim ; and how eagerly [she]0-i shall look forward to hearing all about it from [him]181-jim to - morrow . "[1053-poor father] It will be almost better than going to [Certosa]65-certosa [herself]65-certosa , " [she]0-i ends . But against the unnatural altitude of this last flight of abnegation nature revolts , and , becoming conscious of a break in [her]0-i voice , [she]0-i hastily retreats and gets back into [the salon]3584-the salon , in time to see [Cecilia]222-cecilia shaking [her]222-cecilia elaborate head , and to hear [her]0-i remarking with slow emphasis , "[65-certosa] Mark [my]0-i words ! There is something odd about [those people]1057-those people , and it is not hysteria ! " With spirits sensibly worsened by [his]181-jim interview , [Burgoyne]181-jim returns to [the Minerva]37-the minerva , and , mounting to [[Byng]251-byng 's bedroom]3679-byng 's bedroom , finds [that young gentleman]3680-that young gentleman stretched upon [his]251-byng bed , gloom in [his]251-byng usually jocund eye , and an open letter lying on the floor beside [him]251-byng . But [Jim]181-jim is far too preoccupied to notice [anybody]3681-anybody 's gloom but [his]181-jim own . "[0-i] [I]0-i came to ask at what hour [we]1058-we are to set off this afternoon ? " [he]181-jim says with a sort of flat moroseness in [his]181-jim tone . "[1058-we] [We]1058-we , indeed ! " rejoins [the other]396-the other with a groan , and rolling over with a sort of petulance on the bed , dishevelling the neatly - smoothed pillow by burrowing [his]251-byng ruffled head in it—"we[1058-we] ! " There is such a heart - rent woe in the accent with which the last monosyllable is pronounced that for a moment [Burgoyne]181-jim has no other idea but that [[his]181-jim young friend]763-his young friend , too , has become aware of the "[1059-you] screw loose , " has heard , perhaps in detail , that story from before whose ominous opening [he]251-byng [himself]251-byng had fled . The thought sends [his]251-byng heart into [his]251-byng throat , so as to render [him]251-byng incapable of asking an explanation of the other 's affliction . "[1058-we] [We]1058-we ! " repeats [Byng]251-byng for the third time , and very indistinctly , as [he]251-byng is now lying entirely on [his]251-byng face . "[1058-we] Why do [you]1059-you go on saying ' [we]1058-we ' in that idiotic way ? " asks [Jim]181-jim at last , recovering [his]181-jim voice — recovering it only to employ it in imitating [the younger man]654-the younger man 's accents , in a manner which displays more exasperation than natural talent for mimicry . It is not a politely - worded inquiry , but it has the desired result of acting as a tonic on [him]181-jim at whom it is aimed , making [him]181-jim not only roll over once again , but actually sit up . "[1059-you] Why do [I]0-i say [we]1058-we ? " repeats [he]181-jim , [his]181-jim young eyes looking lamentably out from under the fall of [his]181-jim tumbled hair—"because[0-i] it is not [we]1058-we ! it is [you]1059-you ! [[You]1059-you lucky dog]1060-you lucky dog , [you]1059-you will have [her]1061-her all to [yourself]1059-you ! " [Jim]181-jim heaves an inaudible sigh of relief . Whatever may be the cause of [[his]181-jim companion]603-his companion 's enigmatical conduct , it is evidently not what [he]181-jim had feared . There is , however , no evidence of relief or any other mild quality in [his]181-jim next remark . "[1059-you] If [you]1059-you would talk less like [an ass]1062-an ass , [I]0-i should have a better chance of knowing what [you]1059-you are driving at ! " The query seems only to renew and deepen the other 's tribulation . [He]181-jim falls back into [his]181-jim former attitude . "[1059-you] [You]1059-you will hold the white wonder of dear [Juliet]263-juliet 's hand ! " [he]181-jim groans . "[1059-you] No , do not go " ( with a sudden and startling change of tone , springing off the bed , as [he]181-jim becomes aware that [[his]181-jim friend]393-his friend is making for the door , unable to bear those rhapsodies , whose full distastefulness to [[their]3687-their hearer]3688-their hearer the utterer little conjectures ) . "[1059-you] [I]0-i 'll tell [you]1059-you ! [I]0-i 'll explain . Why are [you]1059-you in such a deuce of a hurry ? [I]0-i can not go to [Certosa]65-certosa because [I]0-i have just heard from [[my]0-i mother]1063-my mother that [she]1063-my mother is to arrive to - day . [She]1063-my mother will be [here]637-here in another hour . " [Jim]181-jim 's fingers are already on the door handle , but this piece of news arrests [him]181-jim . "[1063-my mother] [[Your]1063-my mother mother]1065-your mother ? [I]0-i did not know that [she]1063-my mother was coming abroad . " "[0-i] No more did [I]0-i ! " "[0-i] It must have been a very sudden thought ! " "[0-i] Very ! " "[0-i] What a delightful surprise for [you]1063-my mother ! " "[0-i] Delightful ! " There is so ludicrous a discrepancy between the adjective and the accent with which it is rendered that [Jim]181-jim bursts into a bitter laugh . "[1063-my mother] [She]1063-my mother would be flattered if [she]1063-my mother could see [your]1063-my mother elation at the prospect of meeting [her]1063-my mother ! " [Byng]251-byng 's blood rushes up under [his]251-byng clear smooth skin at [[his]251-byng friend]393-his friend 's jeer , but [he]251-byng answers , with some dignity : "[1063-my mother] [I]0-i do not think [you]1063-my mother have any right to imply that [I]0-i am not always glad to see [[my]0-i mother]1063-my mother ; [I]0-i do not deny that , if it had been equally convenient to [her]1063-my mother , [I]0-i had rather [she]1063-my mother should have come twenty - four hours later . " [Jim]181-jim feels ashamed of [himself]181-jim , though , being [an Anglo - Saxon]647-an anglo - saxon , [he]181-jim has far too much false shame to confess it directly , and what [he]181-jim means for an amende , when it comes , is of an oblique nature . "[0-i] [I]0-i think far the best plan will be to put off the excursion altogether ; [I]0-i am sure that [I]0-i am not particularly keen about it . " The indignant red has rapidly died out of [Byng]251-byng 's face ; [his]251-byng placability being only to be surpassed by [his]251-byng slowness to take offence . "[0-i] Is it possible ? " [he]251-byng asks in a tone of stupefaction ; then , with a sudden tardy recollection of the rosy fetters in which [[his]251-byng friend]393-his friend is held by [another lady]3692-another lady , [he]251-byng adds—"But[1067-you] , of course , [you]1067-you are not — [I]0-i was forgetting ! " [Jim]181-jim winces . "[0-i] As it is [[your]1067-you party]1068-your party , [you]1067-you had better send up a note at once to [the Piazza d'Azeglio]3491-the piazza d'azeglio . " "[1067-you] No , do not let [us]1070-us both throw them over ! " cries [Byng]251-byng eagerly . "[1067-you] [Heaven]197-heaven knows it was hard enough to persuade [them]1071-them to accept in the first instance . If [you]1067-you go [we]1070-us shall at all events keep [our]1070-us communications open ; and [you]1067-you — [you]1067-you will say something to [her]1072-her for [me]0-i ? " "[1067-you] What kind of something ? " inquires [the older man]3693-the older man carpingly . "[1067-you] Am [I]0-i to tell [her]1072-her only what [a fine fellow]1073-a fine fellow [you]1067-you are in general , or anything more circumstantial ? " "[1067-you] Tell [her]1072-her — — " begins [Byng]251-byng in a rapt voice ; but apparently the sight of [[his]251-byng companion]603-his companion , who has somewhat ostentatiously pulled out a note - book and pencil , and assumed the patient air of one about to write to dictation , dries the stream of [his]251-byng young eloquence ; "[1067-you] tell [her]1072-her — nothing . " replies [Jim]181-jim , leaving [the room]442-the room with this quotation on [his]181-jim lips , rather hastily , for fear lest [the other]396-the other should change [his]181-jim mind . It is five o'clock , the hour fixed for the expedition to [Certosa]65-certosa , and in the entresol of 12 bis , [Piazza d'Azeglio]241-piazza , [Mrs.]3697-mrs. and [Miss Le Marchant]240-miss le marchant are sitting — hatted , gloved , and en - tout - cas - ed — in expectation of the arrival of [[their]3698-their double escort]3699-their double escort . [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth 's afternoon has , so far , not been a lazy one , as [[her]193-elizabeth little cousin]3700-her little cousin [Bertie]215-bertie and [his]215-bertie dog have again been good enough to pay [her]193-elizabeth a lengthy visit , and [the former]3701-the former has insisted upon a repetition of the musical performance of the other day , though with truncated rites . Without the powerful aid of [Byng]251-byng , [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth has found it a task considerably beyond [her]193-elizabeth strength to hold a large collie , poised on [his]251-byng hind - legs , on a music - stool . [He]251-byng has jumped down repeatedly , and now lies on [his]251-byng back — an attitude in which experience has taught [him]251-byng [he]251-byng is less attackable than in any other — sawing the air with [his]251-byng fore - paws , and lifting [his]251-byng lip in a deprecating grin . "[1067-you] Where is [Mr. Byng]251-byng ? " cries [Bertie]215-bertie fretfully , baulked in [his]215-bertie efforts to make [[his]215-bertie wily victim]3702-his wily victim resume the perpendicular . "[251-byng] [I]0-i want [Mr. Byng]251-byng ! Why does not [Mr. Byng]251-byng come ? " "[251-byng] Perhaps if [you]1074-you went to the window , " suggests [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant , in that patiently coaxing voice in which [we]3703-we are wo nt to address [a tiresome child]3704-a tiresome child on a visit , instead of the buffet which [we]3703-we should bestow upon it were it resident—"perhaps[1074-you] if [you]1074-you went to the window and looked out , [you]1074-you would see [him]251-byng coming round the corner of [the Piazza]3537-the piazza . " The suggestion is at once accepted , and [the child]1006-the child , balancing [his]1006-the child fidgety body on a chair , and craning [his]1006-the child neck over the window - ledge , is shouting shrill pieces of information as to [the passers - by]3706-the passers - by to [[his]1006-the child friends]3200-his friends within [the room]442-the room . Presently [he]1006-the child shrieks out in triumph : "[251-byng] [I]0-i see [him]251-byng ! [He]251-byng is just coming into sight ! [He]251-byng is walking so fast ! No!"—a moment later , with a changed and disgusted note , as a nearer view corrects the first impression—"it[251-byng] is not [he]251-byng at all ! It is only the other one ! " "[1076-the other one] Only the other one ! " It is quite impossible that the sound of [the child]1006-the child 's voice can reach down to the open portal of [No . 12 bis]3710-no . 12 bis , at which [Jim]181-jim has now arrived , and it is also certain that [neither of [the ladies whom [he]181-jim has come to visit]3712-the ladies whom he has come to visit]3711-neither of the ladies whom he has come to visit is likely to word [her]3712-the ladies whom he has come to visit surprise at [his]181-jim having arrived alone with the frank brutality which is confined to the utterances of infancy ; and yet [Jim]181-jim , as [he]181-jim presents [himself]181-jim , announced by [Annunziata]264-annunziata , [the hard - featured possessor of a lovely name]3713-the hard - featured possessor of a lovely name , is quite as conscious , as if [he]181-jim had overheard [the boy]3714-the boy 's slighting remark , of being "[1076-the other one] only [the other one]1076-the other one ! " Before [he]181-jim can begin [his]181-jim apologies , [the eager little boy]3715-the eager little boy has run up to [him]181-jim . "[1076-the other one] Where is [Mr. Byng]251-byng ? [I]0-i want [Mr. Byng]251-byng ! Why has not [he]251-byng come ? [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth wants [Mr. Byng]251-byng ! " At this last clause [Burgoyne]181-jim is conscious of a dark , hot flush rising to [his]181-jim face , and , partly to hide it , partly to avoid seeing what the effect of [his]181-jim communication may be upon [her]193-elizabeth for whom it is meant , [he]181-jim stoops over [the child]1006-the child , addressing [his]181-jim answer to [him]1006-the child : "[193-elizabeth] [Mr. Byng]251-byng is very sorry , very sorry indeed , but [he]251-byng can not come . " "[193-elizabeth] Can not come ! Why can not [he]251-byng come ? " "[251-byng] Because [he]251-byng has gone to meet [[his]251-byng mammy]1077-his mammy , " replies [Jim]181-jim , trying to speak in a light and playful voice ; "[251-byng] [she]1077-his mammy is to arrive unexpectedly in [Florence]20-florence to - day ; [no good boy]1078-no good boy would leave [his]251-byng mammy when [she]1077-his mammy had come all the way from [England]11-england to see [him]251-byng , would [he]251-byng ? " But to this fustian and copy - book generality [the young gentleman]3717-the young gentleman addressed is too angry to reply . "[251-byng] It is a great disappointment to [Byng]251-byng ; [he]251-byng bid [me]0-i tell [you]1079-you what a great disappointment it is to [him]251-byng ! " says [Jim]181-jim , turning to [the two ladies]3556-the two ladies , and looking apologetically from one to the other . [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth 's head is averted ; but on [[her]193-elizabeth mother]3300-her mother 's features [he]3717-the young gentleman sees , or fancies [he]3717-the young gentleman sees , slight evidences of a feeling not unlike relief . "[251-byng] It is not of the least consequence , " [she]3300-her mother says cheerfully ; "[251-byng] [we]1080-we can go any other day just as well . " [Burgoyne]181-jim 's heart sinks . In these last sentences [he]3717-the young gentleman too surely traces signs of the evasive and would - be - retrograde nature which has all along characterized [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant 's relations with [him]3717-the young gentleman . It has seemed to [him]3717-the young gentleman that [he]3717-the young gentleman has been looking forward to the expedition with sensations of almost unmixed dread , and yet , now that [he]3717-the young gentleman seems to be going to be delivered from it , what [he]3717-the young gentleman experiences certainly does not come under the head of elation . "[1079-you] [You]1079-you wish to give up the excursion ? " [he]3717-the young gentleman asks , in a tone which [he]3717-the young gentleman honestly tries to make as neutral and colourless as [he]3717-the young gentleman can . "[1079-you] Well , [I]0-i thought so — [we]1080-we thought so , did not [we]1080-we , [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth ? " [The person thus addressed]3720-the person thus addressed lifts [her]3720-the person thus addressed head , and all over [her]3720-the person thus addressed features [he]3717-the young gentleman , eagerly scanning them , sees written a warm acquiescence in [her]3720-the person thus addressed motherly decision , an acquiescence which , as [her]3720-the person thus addressed eyes meet [his]3717-the young gentleman — [his]3717-the young gentleman , in which [his]3717-the young gentleman disappointment is written a good deal more plainly than [he]3717-the young gentleman is aware — changes slowly and sweetly into indecision . "[0-i] [I]0-i do not know , " [she]0-i answers , [her]0-i gentle look clouded a little , and yet kindly interrogating [his]3717-the young gentleman ; "[0-i] if [Mr. Burgoyne]198-burgoyne is willing to burden [himself]198-burgoyne with [us]1080-we ; and [Bertie]215-bertie must play at being [a grown - up gentleman]1081-a grown - up gentleman , and help to take care of [us]1080-we ! [Bertie]215-bertie , will [you]215-bertie play at being [a grown - up gentleman]1081-a grown - up gentleman ? " To this proposition [Bertie]215-bertie assents warmly , and begins thrasonically to recount to inattentive ears the high and singular deeds with which [he]215-bertie will celebrate [his]215-bertie arrival at maturity . But , as [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant puts a strenuous veto upon [his]215-bertie adoption as [escort]3721-escort , and as [[his]215-bertie nurse]3722-his nurse appears at the same juncture to fetch [him]215-bertie , [he]215-bertie and [his]215-bertie dog are presently removed ; and [the other three]3723-the other three set off without [him]215-bertie . [Burgoyne]198-burgoyne has chartered [a fiacre]3420-a fiacre , with a horse as little lame as is ever to be found in [Florence]20-florence , and in [this vehicle]3725-this vehicle [they]3723-the other three are presently rolling along .
