[None of [them]3723-the other three]3726-none of them are in very exuberant spirits . [Burgoyne]198-burgoyne is as well aware as if [her]189-mrs. le marchant sensitive lips had put the fact into words , that for [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth the pleasure of the outing has evaporated with the absence of [Byng]251-byng , and that it is only the soft - hearted shrinking of a sweet nature from inflicting mortification on [a fellow - creature that has set [her]193-elizabeth opposite to [him]215-bertie in [her]193-elizabeth white gown]3727-a fellow - creature that has set her opposite to him in her white gown . [He]215-bertie has never seen [her]193-elizabeth dressed in white before , and says to [himself]215-bertie that it was for [Byng]251-byng 's sake that [she]193-elizabeth has made [herself]193-elizabeth so summer - fine . But even if it be so , it is not [Byng]251-byng who is profiting by it . It is for [him]215-bertie , not [Byng]251-byng , that the large Italian light is glorifying its thin fabric . [Lily]265-lily - pure , snow - clean [she]265-lily looks , sitting under [her]265-lily sunshade ; and [he]215-bertie sits over against [her]193-elizabeth in a stupid silence . It seems to [him]215-bertie as if [his]215-bertie only safety were in silence , as if , did [he]215-bertie speak at all , [he]215-bertie must put into brutal words the brutal questions that are dinging in [his]215-bertie head , that seem knocking for utterance against the gate of [his]215-bertie set teeth . "[215-bertie] What is the ' screw loose ' ? How is [she]1083-she an ' [unfortunate girl]1084-unfortunate girl ' ? Why have [they]1085-they ' never held up [their]1085-they heads since ' ? Since what ? " [He]215-bertie looks , in a fierce perplexity , from one to the other of those delicately poised heads , held aloft with such modest dignity . Surely it is beyond the bounds of possibility that any heavily hideous shame or leaden disgrace can ever have weighed upon [them]1085-they ! Probably the intensity of [his]215-bertie thought has given an intensity to [his]215-bertie look , of which [he]215-bertie is unaware ; for [he]215-bertie presently finds the soft veiled voice of [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth — Elizabeth who has hitherto been as mute as [himself]215-bertie — addressing [him]215-bertie : "[1085-they] How very grave [you]1086-you look ! [I]0-i wonder what [you]1086-you are thinking of ? " The question , striking in so strangely pat , brings [him]215-bertie back with a start . For a second an almost overpowering temptation assails [him]215-bertie to tell [her]193-elizabeth what is the object of [his]215-bertie thought , to answer [her]193-elizabeth with that whole and naked truth which [we]3728-our can so seldom employ in [our]3728-our intercourse with [[our]3728-our fellow - men]3729-our fellow - men . But one glance at [her]193-elizabeth innocent face , which has a vague trouble in it , chases the lunatic impulse , though [he]215-bertie dallies with the temptation to the extent of saying : "[0-i] Would [you]0-i really like to know ? Do [you]0-i really wish [me]0-i to tell [you]0-i ? " [He]215-bertie looks at [her]193-elizabeth penetratingly as [he]215-bertie puts the question . Before either [his]215-bertie eyes or [his]215-bertie manner [she]193-elizabeth shrinks . "[0-i] Oh , no — no ! " [she]193-elizabeth cries with tremulous haste , "[0-i] of course not ! [I]0-i was only joking . What business have [I]0-i with [your]0-i thoughts ? [I]0-i never wish to know [people]3155-people 's thoughts ; if [their]3155-people looks and words are kind , that is all that concerns [me]0-i ! " [He]215-bertie relapses into silence ; but [her]193-elizabeth words , and still more the agitated manner in which they are pronounced , make a vague yet definite addition to the disquiet of [his]215-bertie soul . By setting off at so judiciously late an hour as five o'clock , [they]3730-they have avoided the greater part of the flood of tourists which daily sets towards [Certosa]65-certosa , and which [they]3730-they meet , tightly packed in [crowded vehicles]3731-crowded vehicles , sweeping [Florence]20-florence - wards in a choking cloud of white dust ; so that on reaching [the Certosa Monastery]3732-the certosa monastery , sitting so grandly on [[its]3732-the certosa monastery hilltop]3733-its hilltop , [they]3730-they have the satisfaction of finding that [it]3732-the certosa monastery is temporarily all [their]3730-they own — all [their]3730-they own but for the few white - frocked figures and tonsured heads which an economico - democratic Government has left to hint what in [its]3732-the certosa monastery palmy days was the state of that which is now only [a Government museum]3734-a government museum . [A burly monk]3735-a burly monk receives [them]3730-they . [He]3735-a burly monk does not look at all a prey to the pensive sorrow one would expect at the desecration of [his]3735-a burly monk holy things and the dispersion of [his]3735-a burly monk fraternity . Probably , in [his]3735-a burly monk slow peasant mind there is room for nothing but self - congratulation at [his]3735-a burly monk being [one of the few — only fifteen in all — left to end [their]3730-they days in [the old home]3737-the old home]3736-one of the few — only fifteen in all — left to end their days in the old home . [He]3735-a burly monk leads [them]3730-they stolidly through [chapels]618-chapels and [refectory]3739-refectory — [the now too roomy refectory]3740-the now too roomy refectory , where [the poor remnant of [Carthusians]266-carthusians]3741-the poor remnant of carthusians dine together only on Sundays — through [meagrely furnished cells]3742-meagrely furnished cells , in one of which [he]3735-a burly monk matter - of - factly lets down the front flap of a cupboard to show what forms [his]3735-a burly monk daily dining - table except on the happy Sunday , to which [he]3735-a burly monk must look forward so warmly . "[1088-you] Must not [he]1088-you love [Sunday]267-sunday ! " cries [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth , with sparkling eyes . "[1088-you] Do not [you]1088-you long to know what [they]1089-they have for dinner on Sundays ? Do [you]1088-you think [he]1088-you would mind telling [us]1090-us ? " [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth 's spirits are going up like quicksilver . It is evident , despite the delicate melancholy of [her]193-elizabeth face , that [she]193-elizabeth is naturally of an extremely joyous and enjoying nature , and gifted with a freshness of sensation which belongs ordinarily rather to the green age at which [Jim]181-jim first remembers [her]193-elizabeth , than to the mature one which [he]181-jim knows for a certainty that [she]193-elizabeth has now reached . [She]193-elizabeth is filled with such a lively and surprised delight at all the little details of arrangement of the monastic life that [he]181-jim is at last impelled to say to [her]193-elizabeth , something wonderingly : "[1088-you] But [you]1088-you must have seen hundreds of [monasteries]1091-monasteries before ? " "[1088-you] Not one . " "[1088-you] But there are , or were , such swarms of them all over [Italy]18-italy . " "[0-i] [I]0-i dare say . [I]0-i was never in [Italy]18-italy before . " "[0-i] Not really ? " [She]193-elizabeth lifts up [her]193-elizabeth hand , and waves it at [him]181-jim with an air of hasty deprecation of further question , growing suddenly grave . "[0-i] Do n't ask [me]0-i whether [I]0-i have been here or there , or whether [I]0-i have done this or that . [I]0-i have never been anywhere or done anything . " [Her]193-elizabeth desire for a cessation of all inquiries as to [her]193-elizabeth doings is obviously so earnest that [Jim]181-jim of course complies with it . Once or twice before [he]181-jim has been struck by [her]193-elizabeth strange want of acquaintance with facts and phenomena , which would have come as a matter of course within the range of observation of [every woman of [her]193-elizabeth age and station]3743-every woman of her age and station . Against [his]181-jim will , a horrid recollection flashes upon [him]181-jim of a novel [he]181-jim had once read , in which [the hero]3744-the hero exhibits a singular ignorance of any events or incidents that had occurred within the ten years preceding the opening of the story — an ignorance which towards the end of the third volume was accounted for by its transpiring that [he]181-jim has spent the intervening period in [a convict prison]3745-a convict prison ! [He]181-jim drives the grotesque and monstrous idea with scourges out of [his]181-jim mind ; but it recurs , and recurs to be displaced by another hardly less painful , if in some degree more probable . Can it be possible that the crushing blow which has fallen upon [the Le Marchant family]3641-the le marchant family , and upon [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth in particular , whitening [the mother]579-the mother 's hair , and giving that tear - washed look to [the daughter]3748-the daughter 's sweet eyes — can it be possible that that heavy stroke was insanity ? Can [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth have been out of [her]193-elizabeth mind ? Can [she]193-elizabeth have spent in [confinement]3749-confinement any of that past , from all allusion to which [she]193-elizabeth shies away with a sensitiveness more shrinking than that of [He]181-jim is so much absorbed in [his]181-jim tormenting speculations about [her]193-elizabeth that for the moment [he]181-jim forgets [her]193-elizabeth bodily presence ; and it is only [her]193-elizabeth voice , [her]193-elizabeth soft sane voice , that brings [him]181-jim back to a consciousness of it . [They]3750-their have been led into [a salon]3751-a salon , in which , as [[their]3750-their guide]3752-their guide tells [them]3750-their , [the confraternity]3753-the confraternity used to receive [any "[0-i] personage " that came to visit [them]3750-their]3754-any " personage " that came to visit them . Alas , [no personage]3755-no personage ever visits the poor frocked remnant now ! It is [a charming lightsome room]3756-a charming lightsome room , that gives [one]501-one no monastic idea , with pretty airy fancies of flower - wreaths and arabesques , and dainty dancing figures painted on wall and ceiling and doors . One of these latter is half open , and through it comes an exquisite sudden view of [the hills]858-the hills , with [their]858-the hills sharp - cut shadows and [their]858-the hills sunlit slopes ; of shining Florence at [their]3750-their feet , of the laugh of young verdure , and the wedded gloom and glory of cypress and poplar filling the foreground . Upon [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth 's small face , turned suddenly towards [him]1093-he , seems reflected some of the ineffable radiance of the Tuscan light . "[0-i] When next [I]0-i dream of [heaven]1092-heaven , " [she]0-i says , in [her]0-i tender , vibrating voice , "[0-i] it will be like this . Do [you]1093-he ever dream of [heaven]1092-heaven ? [I]0-i often do , and [I]0-i always wake crying because it is not true ; but"—with a joyful change of key—"I[1093-he] will not cry any more without better cause . Since [I]0-i came [here]637-here [I]0-i have found [earth]754-earth beautiful and delightful enough for [me]0-i ! " [He]1093-he looks back at [her]0-i , hardly hearing [her]0-i words , but chiding [himself]1093-he fiercely for the disloyal thought which [he]1093-he has entertained , however unwillingly ; the thought that [the foul fiend of madness could ever , even temporarily , have defiled the temple of those eyes whence reason and feeling , so sweetly wedded]3759-the foul fiend of madness could ever , even temporarily , have defiled the temple of those eyes whence reason and feeling , so sweetly wedded , are shining out upon [him]1093-he , unworthy as [he]1093-he is of [their]3760-their rays . "[0-i] Since [you]0-i came here ? " [he]1093-he repeats in a sort of dreamy interrogation ; "[0-i] only since [you]0-i came here ? " "[1097-you] [You]1097-you must not take [me]0-i up so sharply ! ' " Presently [they]3761-their pass into [the still , cloistered garden]3762-the still , cloistered garden , in whose unmown grass - squares gray - blue flowers are blowing , beside whose walks pale pink peonies are flushing , and round whose well the grave rosemary bushes are set . Through [the whole place]3763-the whole place is an atmosphere of deep peace , of silence , leisure , dignity . It is virtually a tête - à - tête , as [[their]3761-their tonsured guide]3764-their tonsured guide , seeing [their]3761-their evident harmlessness , has left [them]3761-their to [their]3761-their own devices ; and [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant has sat down to rest upon a camp - stool which [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth has been carrying ever since [they]3761-their left [the carriage]3765-the carriage . [It]3766-it has fidgeted [Jim]181-jim to see [her]193-elizabeth burdened with it ; for let [a man]386-a man be ever so little in love with [a woman]536-a woman , [his]386-a man tendency always is to think [her]193-elizabeth as brittle as spun glass , to believe that any weight , however light , will bruise [her]193-elizabeth arm — any pebble , however tiny , wound [her]193-elizabeth tender foot . [He]386-a man has offered to relieve [her]193-elizabeth of it , but [she]193-elizabeth has refused — playfully at first — telling [him]386-a man [she]193-elizabeth is sure that [he]386-a man will lose it ; and afterwards , when [he]386-a man insists , more gravely , though with gentle gratitude , saying that it would never do for [her]193-elizabeth to get into the habit of being waited upon , and that [she]193-elizabeth always carries [mammy]1029-mammy 's things . It is perhaps absurd that [a woman of six - and - twenty]3565-a woman of six - and - twenty should speak of [[her]3565-a woman of six - and - twenty mother]3300-her mother as "[0-i] mammy , " yet the homely and childish abbreviation seems to [him]386-a man to come "[0-i] most fair and featously " from [her]193-elizabeth lips . [They]3772-they stay a long time in [the sun - kissed garden]3773-the sun - kissed garden , considering that there is after all not very much to see there . But [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth 's light steps , that to - day seem set to some innocent dancing - tune , are loath to leave it ; [she]193-elizabeth must smell the great new peonies , monthly - rose - coloured , faintly perfumed ; [she]193-elizabeth must steal a sprig of rosemary "[0-i] to put into [her]1099-her coffin when [she]1099-her dies , " at which [he]386-a man catches [his]386-a man breath , shuddering ; [she]193-elizabeth must peep into the well . [He]386-a man insists on [her]193-elizabeth holding [his]386-a man hand for safety as [she]193-elizabeth leans over to do so ; [her]193-elizabeth little fingers grip [his]386-a man tight as [she]193-elizabeth cranes [her]193-elizabeth neck and bends [her]193-elizabeth lissom body . But what a small handful [they]3772-they are , compared to those other fingers — those kind , useful , but undoubtedly solid fingers — which [he]386-a man has held perfunctorily through many a matter - of - fact hour . By - and - by [they]3772-they stray away together out of the bounteous air of [the hilltop]3597-the hilltop into [a semi - underground church]3775-a semi - underground church , to see the fifteenth and sixteenth century monuments , which look as fresh as if [their]3772-they marble had left [[its]3776-its home in [Carrara]68-carrara but yesterday]3777-its home in carrara but yesterday . [They]3772-they stand looking down at [those three kin who lie side by side before the high altar]3778-those three kin who lie side by side before the high altar , [each with head dropped a little sideways on the shoulder , as if overcome by sudden sleep]3779-each with head dropped a little sideways on the shoulder , as if overcome by sudden sleep . [They]3772-they step on into [the side chapel]874-the side chapel , where that yet nobler mitred figure , fashioned by [Donatello]268-donatello 's hand , stretches [his]386-a man prone length above [his]386-a man border of fruit and flowers , among which lies a carved skull , through whose empty eye - holes — strange and grisly fancy contrasting with so much beauty — a mocking ribbon runs . [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth is perfectly silent the whole time , but no flood of talk could make [Jim]181-jim half so conscious of [her]193-elizabeth presence , palpitating with sympathy and feeling , could give half the confidence [he]181-jim enjoys that [she]193-elizabeth will introduce no allusion to either [Kensal Green]69-kensal green or Woking , as it is but too probable that [the excellent companion of most of [his]181-jim Florentine rambles]3781-the excellent companion of most of his florentine rambles would have done . [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth has been perfectly silent , yet at last [she]193-elizabeth speaks . It is in [the Chapter House]3782-the chapter house , where , as most of [us]3783-they have done , [they]3772-they have suddenly come upon [another tomb]3784-another tomb , [the tomb of one lying full - length on [the pavement before the altar]3786-the pavement before the altar , with no separating edge of marble or wrought - iron railing to keep [him]386-a man from the foot of [the passer - by]3787-the passer - by]3785-the tomb of one lying full - length on the pavement before the altar , with no separating edge of marble or wrought - iron railing to keep him from the foot of the passer - by . [He]386-a man lies there , portrayed with such an extraordinary vividness of life about [his]386-a man prostrate figure and [his]386-a man severe , powerful face , that [one]501-one feels inclined to speak low , lest [he]386-a man should lift [his]386-a man white lids and look rebuke at [us]3783-they . In the lines about [his]386-a man mouth there is a hint of sardonic mirth . Is [he]386-a man — hearing [our]3783-they foolish chatter — touched with a grave contemptuous amusement at it ? Or is [he]386-a man keeping in [his]386-a man sleep the memory of some four hundred years old jest ? [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth has involuntarily crept close to [Burgoyne]181-jim 's side , with the gesture of [a frightened child]3789-a frightened child . "[0-i] Are [you]1100-you sure that [he]1101-him did not stir ? " [she]193-elizabeth asks tremulously under [her]193-elizabeth breath . [Her]193-elizabeth next thought is that [[her]193-elizabeth mother]3300-her mother must see [him]1101-him too , [this wonderful living dead man]3791-this wonderful living dead man , and [they]3783-they presently set forth to return to [the garden]3792-the garden to fetch [her]3300-her mother . But apparently [she]0-i has grown tired of waiting for [them]3783-they , for , as [they]3783-they enter the cloistered enceinte , [they]3783-they see [her]0-i advancing to meet [them]3783-they . "[1100-you] [I]0-i would not be left alone with [him]1101-him at night for the wealth of [the Indies]1102-the indies , " [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth is saying , with a half - nervous laugh . "[0-i] Oh , [mammy]1029-mammy , [you]1029-mammy would never have forgiven [me]0-i if [I]0-i had let [you]1029-mammy go without seeing [him]1101-him ! Why , what is this?"—with a sudden change of key—"what[1029-mammy] has happened ? " For as [they]3783-they draw near to [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant [they]3783-they see that [her]0-i walk is a staggering one , and that the usually healthy , clear pallor of [her]0-i face is exchanged for a livid whiteness . " In the agitation of the moment [she]0-i has unconsciously returned to the familiar address which [she]0-i used always to employ towards [him]181-jim in [their]1105-their boy - and - girl days . " replies [the girl]3289-the girl in a heart - rent voice , raining kisses on [[her]3289-the girl mother]3300-her mother 's white face . " Perhaps it is through the vivifying rain of those warm kisses , but a little colour is certainly beginning to steal back into [the elder woman]3305-the elder woman 's cheek , and [she]0-i draws a long breath . " [Burgoyne]181-jim complies , though it is not without reluctant misgivings that [he]181-jim withdraws the efficacious support of [his]181-jim own solid arm , and leaves [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth 's poor little limb to bear the whole weight of [[her]193-elizabeth mother]3300-her mother 's inert body . [[Their]3800-their guide]3752-their guide has , as before mentioned , disappeared ; and [Jim]181-jim has not the slightest idea in which direction to seek [him]181-jim . [The stranger]3804-the stranger is in clerical dress ; and , as [he]181-jim turns to nod farewell to [the monk]3805-the monk , [Jim]181-jim recognises in [his]181-jim features those of [the Devonshire clergyman , whom [he]181-jim had last seen , and so unwillingly heard , by the well - brim of [the Bellosguardo villa]3807-the bellosguardo villa]3806-the devonshire clergyman , whom he had last seen , and so unwillingly heard , by the well - brim of the bellosguardo villa . In a second a light has flashed into [his]181-jim mind . [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant is evidently partially recovered . But such a face ! [He]181-jim can scarcely believe it is the same that laid itself — hardly less bloomily fair than they — against the faint peony buds half an hour ago ; a face out of which [the innocent glad shining has been blown by some gust of brutal wind]3822-the innocent glad shining has been blown by some gust of brutal wind — scared , blanched , miserable . "[0-i] Oh , yes , [I]0-i am better , much better — quite well , in fact , " says [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant , pushing away the offered glass , and speaking with a ghastly shadow of [her]0-i former even cheerfulness . " [He]181-jim silently holds out the water to [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth , and [she]193-elizabeth , without attempting to take the tumbler into [her]193-elizabeth own trembling hand , drinks . "[0-i] [I]0-i am afraid [you]193-elizabeth must have thought [me]0-i but slow , " [he]181-jim says , feeling that [he]181-jim is dragging in the piece of information [he]181-jim is anxious to give [them]3823-them with an awkward head - and - shoulder - ness : "[193-elizabeth] but at first [I]0-i could n't find [[our]1109-our monk]1110-our monk , and when [I]0-i did , [he]1110-our monk was engaged — [he]1110-our monk was talking to [a visitor]1111-a visitor — [a clergyman]3215-a clergyman . "[1114-an elderly , gray - haired , english clergyman , who was just in the act of going away] Was [he]1114-an elderly , gray - haired , english clergyman , who was just in the act of going away — was [he]1114-an elderly , gray - haired , english clergyman , who was just in the act of going away — [an acquaintance of [yours]1116-you]1115-an acquaintance of yours ? " [He]181-jim had thought that [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant was already as colourless as [a woman]536-a woman could be ; but as [he]181-jim speaks , [he]181-jim sees [her]1116-you face take on a new degree of pallor . [She]1116-you struggles unsteadily to [her]1116-you feet . "[1114-an elderly , gray - haired , english clergyman , who was just in the act of going away] It is — it is getting late ! " [she]1116-you says indistinctly ; "[1114-an elderly , gray - haired , english clergyman , who was just in the act of going away] [we]1122-we — ought — to be — going [home]401-home ! " Even as [she]1116-you speaks [she]1116-you makes an uncertain step forward , but it is so uncertain that [he]181-jim catches [her]1116-you by the arm . "[1114-an elderly , gray - haired , english clergyman , who was just in the act of going away] [You]1116-you are not fit to move yet , " [he]181-jim says with kind imperativeness ; "[1116-you] rest five minutes longer ; it is not late , really — the sun is quite high still . " Convinced , either by [the young man]643-the young man 's eloquence , or , as is more likely , by the shaking of [her]1116-you own limbs , [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant sits down again . [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth has risen to [her]193-elizabeth feet , and now stands beside [[her]193-elizabeth mother]3300-her mother . [She]193-elizabeth has said nothing , but [he]181-jim can see [her]193-elizabeth trembling from head to heel . [He]181-jim hears [her]193-elizabeth voice now addressing [him]181-jim , but in so subdued a key that [her]193-elizabeth words are almost lost in the low blowing of the faint south wind that is fondling the blades of the unshorn grass . "[1116-you] Did [you]1116-you say that [he]1124-he was gone ? Are [you]1116-you sure of it ? " "[1116-you] Yes , yes , quite sure ! [I]0-i saw [him]1124-he go . " "[1116-you] Did [you]1116-you — did [you]1116-you happen to hear where [he]1124-he was staying ? " "[1116-you] No , but"—with [the greatest eagerness—"I]3832-the greatest eagerness—"i[1116-you] can easily find out ; nothing can be simpler . " [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth is standing quite close to [him]181-jim , so close that [he]181-jim can see [her]193-elizabeth poor little heart leaping under the thin white gown , whose simple finery had piqued [him]181-jim earlier in the day . [She]193-elizabeth has apparently , in [her]193-elizabeth new terror , forgotten that there is any cause for concealing from [him]181-jim the occasion of it . [She]193-elizabeth turns instinctively to [him]181-jim , as [a hurt child]3833-a hurt child to [the nearest bystander]3834-the nearest bystander . It seems to [him]181-jim the most natural thing in [the world]3184-the world that [she]193-elizabeth should . [They]1126-we are both recalled to [themselves]1126-we by [[her]193-elizabeth mother]3300-her mother 's voice . "[1125-you] [You]1125-you must think that [we]1126-we have lost [our]1126-we wits , " [she]0-i says with a sickly smile ; "[1125-you] but even if [we]1126-we have , [I]0-i do not know what right [we]1126-we have to impose upon a — [a comparative stranger like [you]1125-you]1127-a comparative stranger like you , the task of helping [us]1126-we to gratify [our]1126-we — [our]1126-we idle curiosity . " "[1127-a comparative stranger like you] But [I]0-i am not [a comparative stranger]1128-a comparative stranger ! " cries [Jim]181-jim vehemently ; by this time — [he]181-jim does not know how — [he]181-jim is holding a hand of each of [the trembling women]3837-the trembling women in [his]181-jim . "[0-i] [I]0-i am not [a stranger]473-a stranger at all ! [I]0-i am [a friend]1130-a friend ! Why will not [you]1131-you treat [me]0-i as [one]501-one ? Why will not [you]1131-you let [me]0-i help [you]1131-you ? " [He]181-jim glances with pitying , affectionate eagerness from one to other of [the woebegone faces on either side of [him]181-jim]3838-the woebegone faces on either side of him . The tears have come in sudden flood to [the elder woman]3305-the elder woman , and are pouring over [her]3305-the elder woman white cheeks , stopping the passage of [her]3305-the elder woman voice ; but [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth 's fair eyes are drearily dry , and speech comes clear and hopeless from [her]3305-the elder woman . "[1131-you] [You]0-i are very good to [us]1133-us ! " [she]0-i says , giving the hand that holds [hers]3305-the elder woman a little pressure , which [he]181-jim feels to be as cold as it is grateful ; "[0-i] at least , [I]0-i see that [you]0-i want to be very good to [us]1133-us if [we]1133-us would let [you]0-i ; but as to helping [us"—with]3840-us"—with a slight despairing shrug—"no[501-one] [one]501-one can do that ; [no one]819-no one but [God]214-god , and [sometimes"—drawing a long , half - sobbing breath—"I]3841-sometimes"—drawing a long , half - sobbing breath—"i[214-god] think that it would pass even [His]1136-his power . " There are few things more difficult than when one 's mind is full of the interests , cares , and sorrows of [one set of [friends]3843-friends]3842-one set of friends , to have to empty it suddenly of [them]3842-one set of friends , and refill it as suddenly with the entirely different , and perhaps discrepant interests , cares , and sorrows of an altogether alien set . Seldom in the course of [their]1133-us old and tried friendship has [Jim Burgoyne]181-jim felt less disposed for the company and conversation of [[his]181-jim valued ally]3844-his valued ally , [Mrs. Byng]203-byng , than when [he]181-jim knocks at the door of [[her]203-byng sitting - room]3845-her sitting - room on the morning following the excursion to [Certosa]65-certosa . [He]181-jim can not talk to [her]203-byng about [the Le Marchants]261-the le marchants , seeing that [she]203-byng has never even heard of [their]1133-us existence ; and if out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaketh , [his]181-jim talk upon any other topic must be scant and jejune indeed . The only cheerful side which [his]181-jim prospective visit turns to [him]181-jim is , that if [he]181-jim were not with [Mrs. Byng]203-byng , [he]181-jim would be with [Amelia]201-amelia ; and that the friendlily indifferent eyes of [the former]3701-the former will , at all events , be less likely than the hungrily loving ones of [the latter]423-the latter to detect that [he]181-jim has not slept a wink , and that [he]181-jim has not the remotest idea what [he]181-jim is talking about . If [he]181-jim were to follow [his]181-jim inclination , [he]181-jim would be bestowing [his]181-jim company this morning upon [neither friend]3848-neither friend nor [sweetheart]3849-sweetheart , but would be ransacking [Florence]20-florence for the piece of information [he]181-jim had yesterday promised [those two woebegone women]3850-those two woebegone women to procure for [them]3850-those two woebegone women . Even into the very midst of [his]181-jim heartfelt sore compassion for [them]3850-those two woebegone women , there pierces a shamed unwilling flash of elation at the thought of what a stride to intimacy [his]181-jim being entrusted with this commission implies , of what an opening to indefinitely numerous future visits [it]3851-it affords . [His]181-jim determination to conduct the search is at present a good deal more clearly defined than the method in which that search is to be effected . [He]181-jim can consult [Galignani]247-galignani as to the names and whereabouts of [new arrivals]427-new arrivals ; but [they]247-galignani could do that much for [themselves]247-galignani . [He]181-jim could examine [the visitors]784-the visitors ' books of [the different hotels]3854-the different hotels ; but [Florence]20-florence , though [a little city]3855-a little city , is rich in [hostelries]3856-hostelries , and this course would take time . [He]181-jim could consult [Mr. Greenock]259-mr. greenock , [the head and fount of all Florentine gossip]3857-the head and fount of all florentine gossip , and who , since [he]259-mr. greenock had seen [him]259-mr. greenock in conversation with the object of [his]259-mr. greenock inquiries , would probably be able to satisfy [them]247-galignani ; but [his]181-jim acquaintance with [the good - natured newsmonger]3858-the good - natured newsmonger is not sufficiently intimate for [him]181-jim to be able to pay [him]259-mr. greenock a morning visit with any air of probability of having been impelled thereto by a desire for [his]181-jim company ; and , moreover , [he]181-jim shrinks with a morbid fear from any action which may lead , however obliquely , to [his]181-jim being [himself]181-jim apprised of the terrible secret which — it is no longer mere matter of conjecture — lies couched somewhere in [those two poor creatures]3859-those two poor creatures ' past . And meanwhile [he]181-jim knocks at [Mrs. Byng]203-byng 's door , and is quickly bidden enter by a cheerful English voice , the welcoming alacrity of whose tones shames [his]181-jim own want of pleasure in the meeting . But [he]181-jim is too unfortunately honest to express a joy [he]181-jim does not experience , and only says , with a slight accent of reproach as [he]181-jim takes [her]203-byng ready hand , heartily held out : "[1137-you] [You]1137-you should not spring these surprises upon [us]1138-us . " [She]203-byng laughs a little guiltily . "[1139-you] It — it was a sudden thought ; [you]1139-you see [I]0-i — [I]0-i had never seen [Perugia]70-perugia . " [He]181-jim laughs too . "[0-i] [Poor Perugia]70-perugia ! [I]0-i think it would have blushed unseen for a good many more years if [you]1139-you had not begun to doubt the efficiency of [my]0-i chaperonage . Confess ! [you]1139-you have come to look after [the precious baby - boy]1140-the precious baby - boy , have not [you]1139-you ? " [His]181-jim tone is , as [he]181-jim himself feels , not quite a pleasant one ; but [the mother]579-the mother is scarcely more prone to take offence than [the son]3861-the son ; and [she]0-i answers with an amiably hasty disclaimer : "[1139-you] It was not that [I]0-i felt the least want of confidence in [you]1139-you — [you]1139-you must not think that ; but — but [I]0-i had one of [my]0-i presentiments ! [you]1139-you know that [I]0-i am always a little superstitious ; and three nights running an owl came and hooted quite close under [my]0-i window ! " "[1139-you] As long as [I]0-i have known [[your]1139-you wood]1141-your wood , it has had owls ; and as long as [I]0-i have known them , they have hooted . " "[1139-you] In the wood , yes , of course , and [I]0-i like to hear them ; but this one was close under [my]0-i window . " [Jim]181-jim 's only answer is to lift [his]181-jim hands and shoulders in protest against [[his]181-jim friend]393-his friend 's weak - mindedness . "[0-i] [I]0-i had quite made up [my]0-i mind that something had happened , " continues [she]0-i , not much abashed by [his]181-jim scorn ; "[0-i] and it was the greatest relief when [I]0-i first caught sight of [him]1142-he at [the station]661-the station yesterday , looking just as usual , a little thinner perhaps — does not [he]1142-he strike [you]1139-you as a little thin ? " "[1139-you] And how is [Amelia?"—her]270-amelia?"—her cheerful eyes resting in friendly and half - inquisitive interest on [his]181-jim sombre face . "[203-byng] [Jim]181-jim breaks into an unavoidable smile . " How frightfully quickly [your]203-byng mind moves ! It leaps like a kangaroo ! [I]181-jim never said that [she]201-amelia would not resign the precious boon of [[my]181-jim society]3866-my society ; on the contrary , [I]181-jim am sure that nothing would give [her]201-amelia greater pleasure , but — but — what will [Willy]271-amelia say to [my]181-jim monopolizing [you]203-byng ? "[181-jim] At the excessive disingenuousness of this speech [his]181-jim conscience gives [him]181-jim a severe prick , recalling to [his]181-jim mind the attitude of prostrate affliction — stretched face downwards on [his]181-jim bed — in which [[his]181-jim young friend]763-his young friend had received the news of [[his]181-jim parent]1146-his parent 's prospective approach . " [Willy]271-amelia has an engagement this morning , "[1148-her] [she]1148-her answers more slowly , and with less radiance than has hitherto marked [her]1148-her utterances ; " nothing could be sweeter and dearer than [he]181-jim was , and [he]181-jim is going to take [me]1148-her somewhere this afternoon — to [Fiesole]71-fiesole or [Petraia]72-petraia , or somewhere else delightful ; but this morning [he]181-jim has an engagement . [He]181-jim did not tell [me]1148-her what it was , and [I]1148-her did not like to tease [him]181-jim with questions . "[181-jim] [Jim]181-jim shakes [his]181-jim head , while a rather deeper shade than habitually lies upon it settles on [his]181-jim careworn forehead . " So that [I]203-byng rather counted upon [you]181-jim , "[203-byng] continues [Mrs. Byng]203-byng , turning with a somewhat crestfallen air to the window . " And [you]181-jim did not count in vain , "[181-jim] replies [Burgoyne]181-jim , with a sort of forced gallantry . It has flashed upon [him]181-jim that [he]181-jim will have to consent under penalty of giving a detailed account of the reasons for [his]181-jim inability , and that therefore [he]181-jim had better make a virtue of necessity , and do it with a good grace . After all , the deferring for a couple of hours of [his]181-jim researches can not be of any great consequence to [the persons in whose behalf those researches are set on foot]1150-the persons in whose behalf those researches are set on foot . To a suspicious ear there might be something dubious in the sudden and galvanized alacrity of [his]181-jim assent ; but not a shadow of doubt crosses [Mrs. Byng]203-byng 's mind as to [her]203-byng old and tried ally being as pleased to avail [himself]181-jim of an opportunity for enjoying [her]203-byng society as [he]181-jim has always showed [himself]181-jim during the twenty years and more of [their]1151-their acquaintance . Protected by this happy misconception , [she]203-byng sets off , all smiles , though at the outset of the expedition [she]203-byng finds that [she]203-byng has to modify [her]203-byng project ; and that [Burgoyne]181-jim shows [himself]181-jim restive as to bric - à - brac shops , and declines peremptorily to be any party to buying [himself]181-jim a wedding present . [He]181-jim puts [his]181-jim objection upon the semi - jocose ground that [he]181-jim shall be unable to avoid overhearing the price of [her]203-byng intended gift , and that [his]181-jim modesty could not stand the strain of helping [her]203-byng to haggle over it . Perhaps , however , deep in [his]181-jim heart is an unconscious feeling that to receive nuptial offerings gives an almost greater body and certainty to [his]181-jim on - striding fate than even the buying of dinner - services and saucepans . So [they]1151-their go to [the Accademia delle Belli Arti]73-the accademia delle belli arti instead , it having occurred to [Jim]181-jim that in [a picture - gallery]1152-a picture - gallery there will be less opportunity for conversation , less opening for interested inquiries on [[his]181-jim companion]603-his companion 's part as to [Amelia]271-amelia and the minutiæ of [his]181-jim future life with [her]203-byng , than there would be in [the green walks of [the Cascine]35-the cascine]1154-the green walks of the cascine , or on [the slopes of [Fiesole]71-fiesole]1155-the slopes of fiesole . To [Mrs. Byng]203-byng , who is of almost as enjoying a nature as [[her]203-byng son]600-her son , and whose spirits have been raised to a pitch even higher than [their]1151-their usual one , by the disproof of [her]203-byng presentiments , it is all one where [she]203-byng goes , so that [she]203-byng is taken somewhere , to see something . [They]1151-their stare up at [the big young David]1157-the big young david , and stand before [Fra Angelico]244-fra angelico 's ineffably happy Paradiso , which yet brings the tears to [the looker]3611-the looker 's eyes , perhaps out of sheer envy of [the little blissful saints]1159-the little blissful saints dancing and frolicking so gaily , or pacing so softly in the assured joy of [the heavenly country]1160-the heavenly country . [The room in which [she]203-byng and [[her]203-byng joyous mates]1162-her joyous mates]1161-the room in which she and her joyous mates stand , with [their]1151-their odd smiles , is one of the smaller of [the gallery]1163-the gallery . [The sweet Francia saints in the picture hung on the wall]1166-the sweet francia saints in the picture hung on the wall directly opposite , and [the rapt Madonna]1167-the rapt madonna , must surely smell [them]1166-the sweet francia saints in the picture hung on the wall . [Jim]181-jim 's eyes are still on the " Spring , "[181-jim] and [he]181-jim is thinking half absently how little kinship [she]203-byng has with [the goitred green women , whom [[his]181-jim nineteenth - century disciples]1171-his nineteenth - century disciples present to [the confiding British public]1172-the confiding british public as representatives of [Sandro Botticelli]213-botticelli 's manner]1170-the goitred green women , whom his nineteenth - century disciples present to the confiding british public as representatives of sandro botticelli 's manner , when [his]181-jim attention is diverted by hearing the voice of [Mrs. Byng]203-byng at [his]181-jim elbow addressing [him]181-jim in an excited tone : " Why , there 's [Willy]271-amelia ! A sense of indignation at having been tricked out of [his]181-jim compassion — who had ever seemed to need it less than the suave little figure about whose blonde head a Tuscan sunbeam , stolen through the easement , is amorously playing?—makes [him]181-jim forget to answer the question addressed to [him]181-jim , until it is repeated in a still more urgent key . But do not be afraid ; [we]1185-we know [[our]1185-we places]1186-our places , [we]1185-we are not going to offer to join [you]1183-the then indicated parent ! " "[1184-he] What should [I]0-i be afraid of ? " replies [the young man]643-the young man , the colour — always as ready as [a school miss]3882-a school miss 's to put [him]643-the young man to shame — mantling in [his]643-the young man handsome smooth cheeks . "[0-i] [I]0-i am like [the Spanish hidalgo]1187-the spanish hidalgo , who never knew what fear was till [he]1187-the spanish hidalgo snuffed a candle with [his]1187-the spanish hidalgo fingers . So [you]1183-the then indicated parent and [Jim]181-jim are having a happy day among the pictures . Do not [you]1183-the then indicated parent like ' [Spring]273-spring ' ? [I]0-i love [her]1188-her , though [I]0-i am sure [she]1188-her was [a real baggage]1189-a real baggage ! " But this ingenious attempt to divert the current of [[his]1183-the then indicated parent parents]3883-his parents ' ideas into another channel is scarcely so successful as it deserves . "[1188-her] Will not [you]1183-the then indicated parent introduce [me]0-i to [her]1188-her ? " [she]0-i asks eagerly , and not heeding , evidently not even hearing , the empty question contained in the last half of [his]1183-the then indicated parent speech ; "[1188-her] does [she]1188-her know that [I]0-i am [[your]1183-the then indicated parent mother]1065-your mother ? Will not [you]1183-the then indicated parent introduce [me]0-i to [her]1188-her ? " It seems a simple and natural request enough , and yet [the young man]643-the young man perceptibly hesitates . [He]643-the young man even tries to turn it off by a clumsy and entirely pointless jest . [I]0-i am really afraid that [my]0-i acquaintance with [her]1188-her scarcely justifies such a liberty ! " A look of surprise and of natural annoyance clouds the cheerful eagerness of [Mrs. Byng]203-byng 's face . "[1188-her] Is that a joke , [dear]3358-dear ? " [she]0-i asks , with a rather vexed smile ; "[1188-her] it is not a very good one , is it ? " "[181-jim] Of course not , of course not , " replies [he]1183-the then indicated parent , with a stammering unreadiness , which contrasts somewhat ludicrously with the acquiescence conveyed by [his]1183-the then indicated parent words , "[181-jim] [I]0-i shall be delighted , only — — " "[0-i] Only what ? Ah , here [they]3452-your friends come ! [they]3452-your friends save [us]1193-us the trouble of going after [them]3452-your friends . " As [she]0-i speaks , indeed , [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant and [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth are seen nearing [the little group]3885-the little group ; but it is soon apparent that this movement on [their]3452-your friends part is by no means owing to any wish or even willingness to make [Mrs. Byng]203-byng 's acquaintance . It is indeed solely due to there being no egress from [the room]442-the room at that end of [it]442-the room where [they]3452-your friends have been standing , so that , if [they]3452-your friends wish to leave [it]442-the room , [they]3452-your friends must necessarily retrace [their]3452-your friends steps and pass [the three persons who are so busily discussing [them]3452-your friends]3887-the three persons who are so busily discussing them . In a moment [they]1194-they are through the doorway and out of sight . [Mrs. Byng]203-byng looks after [them]1194-they , with [her]203-byng mouth open . "[3452-your friends] [They]1194-they — [they]1194-they — are obliged to go [home]401-home , [they]1194-they — [they]1194-they are in a great hurry ! "[0-i] Are [you]0-i quite sure that [she]1197-she is all right ? "[1197-she] Perhaps — who knows?"—laughing unmirthfully—"perhaps[1197-she] [she]1197-she was not sure that [you]0-i were all right ! " "[1197-she] Tous les hommes se haïssent naturellement . Je mets en fait que s'ils savaient exactement ce qu'ils disent , les uns des autres , il n'y aurait pas quatre amis dans le monde . " Although [Mrs. Byng]203-byng always speaks of [Miss Wilson]200-miss wilson as "[271-amelia] [Amelia]271-amelia , " and is acquainted with every detail of [that young lady]3895-that young lady 's uneventful history — thanks to a long series of direct and interested questions , addressed through a considerable number of years , to [[her]203-byng friend]3896-her friend [Jim]181-jim , as to [[his]181-jim betrothed]605-his betrothed — [she]203-byng has no personal acquaintance with [the latter]423-the latter . [She]203-byng is so determined , however , to repair this omission , now that so highly favourable an opportunity is presented as [their]3899-their common stay in [the same small city]3900-the same small city , that [Jim]181-jim is powerless to hinder [her]203-byng from arranging a joint expedition of [the two parties]3901-the two parties — [herself]203-byng and [[her]203-byng son]600-her son on the one side , and [Jim]181-jim with [[his]181-jim future wife and sister - in - law]3903-his future wife and sister - in - law on the other , to [Careggi]274-careggi , on the afternoon of the same day as [he]181-jim had witnessed [her]203-byng abortive attempt to add [Elizabeth Le Marchant]193-elizabeth and [[her]203-byng mother]3300-her mother to the list of [[her]203-byng acquaintances]3905-her acquaintances . [Amelia]271-amelia , is , for a wonder , free from [home]401-home claims , [Sybilla]221-sybilla being more than usually bright , [a kind friend]3907-a kind friend having lately provided [her]271-amelia with a number of the Lancet , containing a detailed account of an operation , which it seems not over - sanguine to expect [she]271-amelia may [herself]271-amelia be able to undergo . [We]3908-we all have [our]3908-we Blue Roses , and to "[271-amelia] undergo operation , " as [she]271-amelia technically phrases it , is [Sybilla Wilson]221-sybilla 's Blue Rose . [Cecilia]222-cecilia is likewise disengaged . The latter circumstance is matter for not unmixed rejoicing to [Jim]181-jim , [Cecilia]222-cecilia 's future connection with [himself]181-jim being too close for [him]181-jim to relish the thought of [her]222-cecilia somewhat pronounced wooing of [Byng]203-byng being exposed in all its naïveté to the clear if good - humoured eyes of [[Byng]203-byng 's mother]946-byng 's mother . But in this [he]181-jim wrongs [Cecilia]222-cecilia . The garden - party at [the villa on [Bellosguardo]61-bellosguardo]3910-the villa on bellosguardo had proved to [her]222-cecilia that the fruit is hung too high for [her]222-cecilia fingers to reach , and that philosophy , which had enabled [her]222-cecilia genuinely to relish the wedding - cake of [the man who had jilted [her]222-cecilia]3911-the man who had jilted her , now teaches [her]222-cecilia to lay to heart the sarcastic advice offered [her]222-cecilia by [Jim]181-jim , to look at [the young man]643-the young man as [poor women]3405-poor women look at diamonds . Beyond one or two trifling gallantries , for which [no one]819-no one can judge [her]222-cecilia harshly , [she]222-cecilia leaves [him]181-jim alone , even though out of good - nature , and from inveterate force of habit , [he]181-jim gives [her]222-cecilia several openings to make love to [him]181-jim . The day is one of even [Italy]18-italy 's best , an air as soft as feathers , and full of April odours — a bright gay sun . The vines are rushing into leaf ; they that ten days ago looked such hopeless sticks ; little juicy leaves uncurling and spreading on each , and the mulberry trees , round which they twine , are rushing out too , at the triumphant call of the spring . [The party]3587-the party being of the unmanageable number five , has to be divided between two fiacres , whereof [Mrs. Byng]203-byng , in pursuance of [her]203-byng determination to know [Amelia]271-amelia , insists upon occupying the first in tête - à - tête with [Miss Wilson]200-miss wilson , while [Cecilia]222-cecilia and [the two men]409-the two men fill the other . [The latter makes but a silent load]3917-the latter makes but a silent load . [Byng]203-byng is , for [him]181-jim , out of spirits , and finding that [Cecilia]222-cecilia has virtually abandoned [her]222-cecilia suit , is glad to lapse into [his]181-jim own reflections . [His]181-jim example is followed by [Jim]181-jim , whose temper is ruffled by being again obliged to defer the quest [he]181-jim is still feverishly anxious to pursue , despite the shock of the morning 's meeting at [the Accademia]3918-the accademia . [They]409-the two men reach [the villa]3598-the villa , and leave [[their]409-the two men vehicles]3920-their vehicles , glad to think that [two of [the perennially tired Florentine cab - horses]3922-the perennially tired florentine cab - horses]3921-two of the perennially tired florentine cab - horses will have a pause of rest , and , having shaken off [a tiresome would - be laquais de place]3923-a tiresome would - be laquais de place , desirous to embitter for [them]409-the two men the sweet day and place , [they]409-the two men stray at will through [the garden]3792-the garden among the clipped laurels , the cypresses , the gorgeous red rhododendrons , while beds of mignonette send forth such a steady wave of poignant sweetness as makes the sense ache with ecstasy of pleasure ; and over [the conservatory]3925-the conservatory hangs a wistaria so old , so magnificent , with such a Niagara of giant flower bunches , as takes an English breath away . [They]409-the two men go over [the villa]3598-the villa itself , pass through [the room]442-the room , and by the bed where [Lorenzo]275-lorenzo , with the grotesque grim face , [Lorenzo the Magnificent]275-lorenzo , gave [his]275-lorenzo last sigh . It would make [Death]276-death even more difficult to face than [he]275-lorenzo is already , if [one]501-one thought [one]501-one should have to meet [him]275-lorenzo under such a catafalque . As [they]409-the two men issue out again from [the house]986-the house 's shadow into [the sun - drenched garden]3931-the sun - drenched garden , [Mrs. Byng]203-byng joins [Burgoyne]181-jim , who is walking a little apart . "[271-amelia] [I]0-i like [Amelia]271-amelia , " [she]0-i says confidentially , "[271-amelia] such [a nice pillowy sort of woman]1198-a nice pillowy sort of woman ; not too clever , and oh , [Jim]181-jim , poor soul , how fond [she]271-amelia is of [you]181-jim ! " It must always be pleasant to hear that the one absolutely good thing which this life has to offer is lavishly heaped upon [us]3932-us by [the person with whom [we]3932-us are to pass that life]3933-the person with whom we are to pass that life ; and perhaps pleasure is the emotion evidenced by the silent writhe with which [Jim]181-jim receives this piece of information . "[271-amelia] Not , of course , that [she]271-amelia told [me]0-i so in so many words , " continues [[his]181-jim friend]393-his friend , perceiving that [her]0-i speech is received in a silence that may mean disapproval of any intrusion into the sanctuary of [his]181-jim affections ; "[271-amelia] but [one]501-one can see with half an eye : poor [Amelia]271-amelia , [she]271-amelia beamed all over when [I]0-i said one or two little civil things about [you]181-jim ! [She]271-amelia worships the very ground [you]181-jim tread on ! " [He]181-jim writhes again . "[271-amelia] [I]0-i hope that that is one of [your]181-jim figures of speech , " [he]181-jim answers constrainedly . The not unnatural result of the tone in which [he]181-jim utters this sentence , no less than the words themselves , is to quench the fire of [Mrs. Byng]203-byng 's benevolent eulogies ; and , as [she]271-amelia can not at once hit upon another topic , and is by no means sure that [her]271-amelia countenance does not betray the rather snubbed dismay produced by the reception of [her]271-amelia amenities , [she]271-amelia is not sorry when [Jim]181-jim presently leaves [her]271-amelia . Being , however , of a very sanguine disposition , and seeing [him]181-jim a little later sitting peacefully on a garden - seat beside [his]181-jim fiancée , [she]271-amelia hopes that [her]271-amelia words , though not very handsomely received at the time , may bear fruit later for [Amelia]271-amelia 's benefit . "[1200-he] And [he]1200-he always was very undemonstrative , " [she]271-amelia adds to [herself]271-amelia consolatorily . "[1200-he] [Nobody]3337-nobody would have guessed that [he]1200-he was delighted to see [me]0-i this morning ; and yet , of course , [he]1200-he was . " The sun is growing visibly lower , and [the Ave Maria]3935-the ave maria comes ringing solemnly from [the city]850-the city . The seat to which [Jim]181-jim has somewhat remorsefully led [[his]181-jim lady]3937-his lady - love is a stone bench , shaded by a honeysuckle bower , close to [a fountain]3938-a fountain . The fountain is not playing now ; but round about [it]3938-a fountain first a marten wheels , dipping in the water the end of [her]271-amelia fleet wings ; then a little bat prematurely flits , for it is still broad daylight . Broad indeed and bounteous is the daylight of [Italy]18-italy . Around [them]3939-them is the lush unmown grass ; full of homely field - flowers , buttercups , catch - flies , daisies , ragged robins , while from some bush near by a nightingale is pouring out all the infinite variety of [her]271-amelia ravishing song . [She]271-amelia says so many different things that [one]501-one never can feel sure that [one]501-one has heard all that [she]271-amelia has to say . [Jim]181-jim leans back listening , with [his]181-jim hands behind [his]181-jim head , steeped in a half - voluptuous sadness . [He]181-jim is oppressed by the thought of [Amelia]271-amelia 's great love . Is [the nightingale]3942-the nightingale 's splendid eloquence really the voice of the poor dumb passion beside [him]181-jim , lent to [Amelia]271-amelia to plead [her]271-amelia cause ? The high - flown poetry of the idea fills [his]181-jim heart with an imaginative yearning kindness towards [her]271-amelia . [He]181-jim is in the act of turning to face [her]271-amelia , with a more lover - like speech on [his]181-jim lips than has hovered there for years , when [Amelia]271-amelia [herself]271-amelia anticipates [him]181-jim . "[1200-he] And to think that it is only [April]204-april ! " [she]271-amelia says , with an air of prosaic astonishment . "[204-april] Last [April]204-april [we]1202-we had four inches of snow on [the front drive]1203-the front drive . It was when [Cecilia]222-cecilia had [the mumps]1204-the mumps . " "[222-cecilia] When [Cecilia]222-cecilia had [the mumps]1204-the mumps ? " repeats [Burgoyne]181-jim in a rather dazed voice . " This is the form into which are frozen the love - words that [the nightingale and the perfume of the Tuscan flowers]3943-the nightingale and the perfume of the tuscan flowers and [the Ave Maria]277-the ave maria had so nearly brought to [his]181-jim tongue . But [she]271-amelia is blessedly ignorant of what [[Cecilia]222-cecilia 's mumps]3945-cecilia 's mumps have robbed [her]271-amelia , and presently again strikes athwart [the nightingale]3942-the nightingale 's song with the placid remark : "[222-cecilia] [I]0-i like [[your]0-i friend]3412-your friend very much ; [I]0-i think that [she]3412-your friend is [a very nice woman]1208-a very nice woman . " "[3412-your friend] And [she]3412-your friend is so fond of [you]0-i , " continues [Amelia]271-amelia . [He]181-jim laughs . " What effect the flat fatuity , as it seems to [Jim]181-jim [himself]181-jim , of this last observation has upon [Amelia]271-amelia , does not appear , since [she]271-amelia receives it in silence ; and again [the Ave Maria]277-the ave maria and the bird divide between [them]3947-their [the province of sound]3948-the province of sound . As the great sun droops , the honeysuckle above [their]3947-their heads seems to give out more generously its strong clean sweetness . [The rest of the party]3949-the rest of the party have drifted away out of sight and hearing ; but by - and - by [their]3947-their voices are again heard and [their]3947-their returning forms seen . As [they]3947-their draw near , it appears that [their]3947-their original number of three has been augmented by the addition of [two men]429-two men ; and a still nearer approach reveals who [the two men]409-the two men are . [Mrs. Byng]203-byng leads the way , talking animatedly to [Mr. Greenock]259-mr. greenock , who is evidently [an old acquaintance]3952-an old acquaintance . [Byng]203-byng trails after [them]3947-their by [himself]203-byng , and the rear is brought up by [Cecilia]222-cecilia and a portly clerically - dressed figure , whom [Jim]181-jim at once recognises as [the Devonshire clergyman]3953-the devonshire clergyman , [his]181-jim failure in obtaining information about whom has embittered and fidgeted [his]181-jim whole day . Here then is the opportunity [he]181-jim has sought brought to [his]181-jim very hand . And yet [his]181-jim first feeling , as [he]181-jim sees the complacent priestly face , and the deliberate black legs pacing beside [Cecilia]222-cecilia , is one of dismay . There is nothing unlikely in the supposition that [he]181-jim may have been presented to [her]222-cecilia at the garden - party at [the Bellosguardo villa]3807-the bellosguardo villa ; and yet [he]181-jim now realizes with a shock of surprise that [they]3947-their are acquainted , and , if acquainted , then at liberty to converse upon whatever subject may best recommend itself to [them]3947-their . [He]181-jim is absolutely powerless to put any check upon [their]3947-their talk , and yet at this very moment [he]181-jim may be narrating to [her]222-cecilia that story which [his]181-jim own loyalty had forbidden [him]181-jim to overhear . [The first couple]3955-the first couple has passed , so absorbed in eager question and answer that [they]3955-the first couple do not even see [Burgoyne]181-jim and [[his]181-jim betrothed]605-his betrothed . [Mrs. Byng]203-byng left [London]1-london only three days ago , and [Mr. Greenock]259-mr. greenock might return thither at any moment that [he]259-mr. greenock chooses ; and yet [they]3947-their are talking of it with a wistful fondness that might have beseemed [Dante]278-dante questioning some chance wayfarer to [Ravenna]74-ravenna as to the prosperity of [his]278-dante Florence . [The second pair]3957-the second pair 's voices are lower pitched , and their topics therefore less easy to ascertain ; yet by [Cecilia]222-cecilia 's gratified and even hopeful air [they]3947-their are evidently agreeable ones . But though agreeable , there is no evidence of [their]3947-their being , by [their]3947-their riveting ear and eye , of the nature [he]181-jim dreads . [They]3947-their also are so absorbed in each other as to have no attention to spare for [the quiet silent persons sitting on the stone bench]3958-the quiet silent persons sitting on the stone bench . [Amelia]271-amelia looks after [them]3947-their with a benevolent smile . [Her]271-amelia sense of humour is neither keen nor quick , but there is a touch of very mild sarcasm in [her]271-amelia voice , as [she]271-amelia says , watching [[her]271-amelia sister]720-her sister 's retreating figure : "[3412-your friend] [Cecilia]222-cecilia has found [a new friend]3510-a new friend , [a clergyman]3215-a clergyman again ; do [you]1211-you know what [his]3510-a new friend name is ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i believe it is [Burton]279-mr. burton or [Bruton]280-bruton , or something of the sort , " replies [Jim]181-jim reluctantly , feeling as if even in admitting knowledge of [the stranger]3804-the stranger 's surname [he]181-jim were letting out a dangerous secret . "[279-mr. burton] [I]0-i should have thought that [she]222-cecilia had had enough of [the Church]3445-the church , " [he]181-jim adds with a very much more pronounced accent of satire than [Miss Wilson]200-miss wilson 's . "[222-cecilia] [She]222-cecilia has not taken [my]0-i advice of sticking to [the laity]1213-the laity . Shall [we]1214-we — shall [we]1214-we follow [them]1213-the laity ? " This last suggestion is the result of a vague , uneasy feeling that , by keeping within earshot , [he]181-jim may exercise some check upon [their]1214-we conversation . "[1214-we] Why should [we]1214-we ? " replies [Amelia]271-amelia , for once in [her]271-amelia life running counter to a proposition of [[her]271-amelia lover]699-her lover 's , and turning [her]271-amelia meek eyes affectionately upon [him]181-jim ; "[1214-we] [we]1214-we are so well here , are not [we]1214-we ? and"—laughing—"we should spoil sport . "[1214-we] As [Jim]181-jim can allege no adequate reason for pursuing [Cecilia]222-cecilia and [her]222-cecilia latest spoil , [he]181-jim has unwillingly to acquiesce , and to content [himself]181-jim with following [them]1213-the laity with [his]181-jim eyes , to gain what reassurance [he]181-jim can from the expression of [their]1213-the laity backs . But the peaceful if melancholy restfulness that had marked the first part of [his]181-jim abode on the stone seat is gone , past recall . [He]181-jim moves [his]181-jim feet fidgetily on the gravel ; [he]181-jim gets up , and throws pebbles into the fountain ; [he]181-jim snubs [an officious little Italian boy who brings [Amelia]271-amelia a small handful of flowers plucked out of the emerald grass]1215-an officious little italian boy who brings amelia a small handful of flowers plucked out of the emerald grass . [Amelia]271-amelia does not share [[her]271-amelia lover]699-her lover 's uneasiness , as indeed why should [she]271-amelia ? [She]271-amelia puts the expected tip into [the young Tuscan]281-the young tuscan 's dirty brown hand , and leans [her]271-amelia head enjoyingly on the back of the stone seat . " [I]271-amelia think [I]271-amelia like to come to these sort of places with [you]181-jim even better than to picture - galleries , "[271-amelia] [she]271-amelia says with an intonation of extreme content . " Do [you]222-cecilia , [dear]3358-dear ? "[181-jim] replies [he]181-jim absently , with [his]181-jim uneasy eyes still searching the spot at which [Cecilia]222-cecilia and [[her]222-cecilia escort]3893-her escort had disappeared . " Of course [you]222-cecilia are quite right : ' [God]214-god made [the country]3375-the country , and [man]542-man made the — — ' Ah ! "[181-jim] The substitution of this ejaculation for the noun which usually concludes the proverb is due to the fact of [the couple [he]181-jim is interested in having come back into sight , retracing [their]1219-they steps]1218-the couple he is interested in having come back into sight , retracing their steps , and again approaching . It is clear as [they]1219-they come near that the desire to explore [the villa grounds]1220-the villa grounds has given way , in this case , to the absorption of conversation . With a pang of dread , [Jim]181-jim 's sharpened faculties realize , before [they]1219-they are within earshot , that [they]1219-they have exchanged the light and banal civilities which had at first employed [them]1219-they for talk of a much more intimate and interesting character . [Cecilia]222-cecilia is generally but an indifferent listener , greatly preferring to take the lion 's share in any dialogue ; but now [she]222-cecilia is all silent attention , only putting in , now and again , a short eager question , while [[her]222-cecilia companion]540-her companion is obviously narrating — narrating gravely , and yet with a marked relish . Narrating what ? [Jim]181-jim tells [himself]181-jim angrily that there are more stories than one in [the world]3184-the world ; that there is no reason why , because [[Cecilia]222-cecilia 's clerical friend]1223-cecilia 's clerical friend is relating to [her]222-cecilia something , it must necessarily be that particular something which [he]181-jim dreads so inexpressibly ; but [he]181-jim strains [his]181-jim ears as [they]1219-they pass to catch a sentence which may relieve or confirm [his]181-jim apprehensions . [He]181-jim has not to strain them long . It is [Cecilia]222-cecilia who is speaking , and in [her]222-cecilia eagerness [she]222-cecilia has raised [her]222-cecilia voice . " [You]181-jim may depend upon [me]222-cecilia ; [I]222-cecilia assure [you]181-jim [I]222-cecilia am as safe as [a church]3965-a church ; if [I]222-cecilia had chosen [I]222-cecilia might have made a great deal of mischief in [my]222-cecilia day , but [I]222-cecilia never did . [I]222-cecilia always said that [she]222-cecilia had a history . [I]222-cecilia do not pretend to be [a physiognomist]3966-a physiognomist , but [I]222-cecilia said so the first time [I]222-cecilia saw [her]222-cecilia . "[222-cecilia] It is clear that [the clergyman]3644-the clergyman 's hesitation , already perhaps more coy than real , is unable to withstand the earnestness of [Cecilia]222-cecilia 's asseverations of [her]222-cecilia own trustworthiness . [He]3644-the clergyman has already opened [his]3644-the clergyman mouth to respond when an unexpected interruption arrests the stream of [his]3644-the clergyman eloquence . [Jim]181-jim has sprung from [his]181-jim bench , and thrust [himself]181-jim unceremoniously between [the two interlocutors]1225-the two interlocutors . [You]3289-the girl were maintaining the other day that wistaria has no scent ; come and smell it ! "[181-jim] It is in vain that [Cecilia]222-cecilia protests that [she]222-cecilia has already seen quite as much of the wistaria as [she]222-cecilia wishes ; that [she]222-cecilia had never denied the potency of its perfume ; that [her]222-cecilia legs are giving way beneath [her]222-cecilia from fatigue . [He]181-jim is conscious that [Cecilia]222-cecilia is swelling beside [him]181-jim with feelings no less wounded , even for some moments before [she]222-cecilia speaks . " [You]181-jim rather cut [your]181-jim own throat , "[222-cecilia] [she]222-cecilia says , in an affronted voice , " when [you]181-jim interrupted [me]222-cecilia and [Mr. Burton]279-mr. burton so rudely ; [he]279-mr. burton was on the point of telling [me]222-cecilia something very interesting about [[your]181-jim dear friends]3969-your dear friends [the Le Marchants]261-the le marchants ; [he]279-mr. burton knows all about [them]3969-your dear friends ; [he]279-mr. burton has known [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth ever since [she]193-elizabeth was [a child]3970-a child . It is really not late , not much beyond canonical calling hours , and [he]699-her lover is almost sure that [they]1242-they dine at eight . [His]699-her lover face is set in the direction of [the Piazza d'Azeglio]3491-the piazza d'azeglio , as [he]699-her lover addresses these reassuring remarks to [himself]699-her lover . This is no case of self - indulgence , or even of friendly civility . It is a question of common humanity . Why should [he]699-her lover leave [them]1242-they to endure [their]1242-they suspense for a whole night longer than [they]1242-they need , merely to save [himself]699-her lover the trouble of a walk beneath the darkly splendid sky - arch , through [the cheerful streets]1244-the cheerful streets , still full of [leisurely foot - passengers]1245-leisurely foot - passengers , of the sound of cracking whips and [rolling carriages]1246-rolling carriages ? [He]699-her lover reaches [No . 12 bis]3710-no . 12 bis , and finds [[the porter]3201-the porter 's wife]1249-the porter 's wife sitting at the door of [[her]1249-the porter 's wife loge]1250-her loge , and smiling at [him]699-her lover with all [her]1249-the porter 's wife white teeth , as if [she]1249-the porter 's wife knew that [he]699-her lover had come on some pleasant errand . [He]699-her lover climbs the naked stone stairs , and rings the bell . The intelligence baffles [him]699-her lover , as [he]699-her lover had not at all expected it . Probably [his]699-her lover disconcertment is written not illegibly on [his]699-her lover features , as [Annunziata]264-annunziata begins at once to inform [him]699-her lover that [the signore]1253-the signore are gone to drive in [the Cascine]35-the cascine , and that [she]264-annunziata expects [them]1253-the signore back every moment . The table — since [they]1253-the signore have obviously but one sitting - room — is spread for [their]1253-the signore simple supper — a coarse white cloth , a wicker - covered bottle of rough Chian wine , and a copper pot full of delicately odorous Freesias . [He]699-her lover wanders restlessly about [the room]442-the room , looking at the photographs . [Tom]190-tom — can it be [Tom?—with]283-tom?—with a moustache , [Charles]199-charles lamb with a beard and a bowie - knife , [Rose]191-rose dandling [[her]191-rose baby]1260-her baby , [Miriam]192-miriam hanging over [[her]192-miriam new husband]1261-her new husband — all [his]699-her lover little playfellows ! How far the wave of time has rolled [them]1253-the signore away from [him]699-her lover ! [He]699-her lover strolls to the window whence , at sunset , the green shutters have been thrown back , and stares out at [the Piazza garden]1262-the piazza garden , where the twilight is taking all the colour out of the Judas flowers , thence to the piano upon which [Schubert]284-schubert 's " Trockne Blumen "[699-her lover] stands open . Absently [he]699-her lover repeats aloud the song 's joyous words : Is [her]1263-her " Winter aus "[699-her lover] ? Judging by the look in [her]1263-her eyes , it has been a long and cruel one . If [he]699-her lover wishes to put the question to [her]1263-her , [she]1263-her comes in just in time to answer it — enters laggingly , as [one tired , blinking a little from the sudden crude lamplight after the soft feather - handed dusk]1264-one tired , blinking a little from the sudden crude lamplight after the soft feather - handed dusk . [She]1263-her is evidently unprepared to find [anyone]3161-anyone in [the room]442-the room , and gives a frightened jump when [she]1263-her sees [a man]386-a man 's figure approaching [her]1263-her . Even when [she]1263-her recognises [him]386-a man the scared look lingers . It is clear that in [her]1263-her sad experience surprises have been always synonymous with bad news . The white apprehension written on [her]1263-her small face makes [him]699-her lover so cordially repent of [his]699-her lover intrusion , that [his]699-her lover explanation of [his]699-her lover presence is at first perfectly unintelligible . " [I]699-her lover hope [you]1263-her will excuse [my]699-her lover taking such a liberty . "[181-jim] " [He]699-her lover told an — [an acquaintance of [mine]699-her lover]3870-an acquaintance of mine ; [he]699-her lover was complaining of the discomfort of [[his]699-her lover hotel]760-his hotel , and , on [her]3870-an acquaintance of mine recommending [him]699-her lover to change it , [he]699-her lover answered that it was not worth while , as [he]699-her lover was leaving [Florence]20-florence to - morrow . "[181-jim] Again from the chair beside [him]181-jim comes that long low sigh . This time there can be no question as to its quality . It is as of a spirit lifting [itself]1276-itself from under a leaden load . For a few moments no other sound breaks the stillness . Then [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant speaks again in a constrained voice : " [We]3991-we are extremely obliged to [you]181-jim for having taken so much trouble for [us]3991-we , and it must seem very strange to [you]181-jim that [we]3991-we should be so anxious to hear that this — [this person]3992-this person has left [Florence]20-florence ; but in so small a place one is sure to be always coming into collision with those whom [one]501-one would rather avoid , and there are reasons which — which make it very — painful to [us]3991-we to meet [him]3992-this person . "[189-mrs. le marchant] So saying , [she]189-mrs. le marchant tums away precipitately , and leaves [the room]442-the room hastily , by another door from that by which [they]1278-they both entered , and which evidently communicates with [an adjoining bedroom]1279-an adjoining bedroom . [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth remains lying back in [her]193-elizabeth chair , looking as white as the tablecloth . [She]193-elizabeth is always white , but usually it is a creamy white , like meadow - sweet . Out of [her]193-elizabeth eyes , however , has gone the distressed look of fear , and in them is dawning instead a little friendly smile . " [You]1280-he must have thought [us]3991-we rather impostors when [you]1280-he saw [us]3991-we at [the Accademia]39-the accademia this morning , after leaving [us]3991-we apparently so shattered overnight , "[193-elizabeth] [she]193-elizabeth says , with a somewhat deprecating air . " [I]1280-he was very glad to find [you]193-elizabeth so perfectly recovered , "[1280-he] [he]1280-he replies , but [he]1280-he does not say it naturally . " [I]193-elizabeth think [we]3991-we are a little like india - rubber balls , [mammy]1029-mammy and [I]193-elizabeth , "[193-elizabeth] continues [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth ; " [we]3991-we have great recovering powers ; if [we]3991-we had not "[193-elizabeth] ( stopped for a second by a small patient sigh ) " [I]193-elizabeth suppose that [we]3991-we should not be alive now . "[193-elizabeth] [He]1280-he does not interrupt [her]193-elizabeth .
