"[193-elizabeth] [His]1488-his conscience , at the unintentional reproach of this patient supposition , reminds [him]1488-his of its existence by a sharp prick . How many times has [her]1489-her poor vanity suffered the bruise of being long first at [the rendezvous]1434-the rendezvous ? " [I]193-elizabeth discovered that chair by the window under the curtain , the one where [you]181-jim found [me]193-elizabeth . "[193-elizabeth] " Well ? "[193-elizabeth] " It was so quiet there , as [everybody]3181-everybody was in [the garden]3792-the garden , that [I]193-elizabeth suppose [I]193-elizabeth fell asleep ; at least [I]193-elizabeth remember nothing more until suddenly [I]193-elizabeth heard [Mrs. Byng]203-byng 's voice saying — — "[193-elizabeth] " Saying what ? "[193-elizabeth] " [[Her]203-byng son]600-her son was with [her]203-byng — [he]600-her son had brought [her]203-byng in to have some tea ; it was to [him]600-her son that [she]203-byng was speaking ; [she]203-byng was asking [him]600-her son about [me]193-elizabeth , where [I]193-elizabeth was ? where [he]600-her son had left [me]193-elizabeth ? whether [he]600-her son had seen [me]193-elizabeth lately ? And then [she]203-byng said , ' [Poor Amelia]201-amelia , [Jim]181-jim really does neglect [her]203-byng shamefully ; and yet [one]501-one can not help being sorry for [him]600-her son , too ; it was such child - stealing in the first instance , and [he]600-her son is evidently dead - sick of [her]203-byng ! It is so astonishing that [she]203-byng does not see it ! ' "[193-elizabeth] There is something almost terrible in the calm distinctness with which [Amelia]201-amelia repeats the sentences that had laid the card - house of [her]201-amelia happiness in the dust . Certainly [she]201-amelia keeps [her]201-amelia promise to [him]1491-you to the letter ; [she]201-amelia gives no lightest sign of breaking down . There is not a tear in [her]201-amelia eye , not a quiver in [her]201-amelia voice . After a moment 's pause , [she]201-amelia continues : " And then [he]1491-you , [Mr. Byng]251-byng , answered , ' [Poor soul]4077-poor soul , it — it is odd ! [She]201-amelia must have the hide of a hippopotamus . ' "[201-amelia] [Amelia]201-amelia has finished [her]201-amelia narrative , repeating [the young man]643-the young man 's galling comment , with the same composure as [[his]643-the young man mother]3511-his mother 's humiliatingly compassionate ones ; and for a space [[her]201-amelia sole auditor]1494-her sole auditor is absolutely incapable of making any criticism upon it . [He]1491-you is forbidden , if [he]1491-you had wished it , to offer [her]201-amelia even the mute amends of a dumb endearment , by the reappearance on the scene of [a couple of the sun - scorched peasant torments]1495-a couple of the sun - scorched peasant torments with [their]1495-a couple of the sun - scorched peasant torments straw hand - screens . It is not likely that [those so lately bought]1496-those so lately bought should have worn out already ; but yet [they]1496-those so lately bought renew [their]1496-those so lately bought importunities with such a determined obstinacy , as if [they]1496-those so lately bought knew this to be the case ; and it is not until [they]1496-those so lately bought are lightened of two more , that [they]1496-those so lately bought consent once again to retire , leaving the warm bright plateau to [the lovers]775-the lovers — if indeed [they]1496-those so lately bought can be called such . " [She]3511-his mother was perfectly right , "[201-amelia] says [Amelia]201-amelia , still speaking quite quietly ; " it is astonishing that [I]201-amelia should not have seen it ; and it was child - stealing ; [you]1491-you were barely twenty - one , and [I]201-amelia — [I]201-amelia was not very young for [a woman]536-a woman even then — [I]201-amelia was twenty - three . [I]201-amelia ought to have known better . "[201-amelia] For once in [his]1498-his life [Burgoyne]181-jim is absolutely bereft of speech . It is always a difficult matter to rebut a charge of being dead sick of [a woman]536-a woman without conveying an insult in the very denial ; and when there lies a horrid substratum of truth under the exaggeration of the accusation , the difficulty becomes an impossibility . " However , it might have been much worse , "[200-miss wilson] continues [Miss Wilson]200-miss wilson ; " just think if [I]200-miss wilson had overheard it only after [I]200-miss wilson had married [you]1491-you , when [I]200-miss wilson knew that there was nothing but death that could rid [you]1491-you of [me]200-miss wilson . [I]200-miss wilson thank [God]214-god [I]200-miss wilson have heard it in time . "[200-miss wilson] [His]181-jim throat is still too dry for [him]181-jim to speak ; but [he]181-jim stretches out [his]181-jim arm to encircle [her]200-miss wilson in a mute protest at that thanksgiving over [her]200-miss wilson own shipwreck ; but , for the first time in [her]200-miss wilson life , [she]200-miss wilson eludes [his]181-jim caress . " Child - stealing , "[200-miss wilson] [she]200-miss wilson repeats , under [her]200-miss wilson breath ; " and yet"—with[200-miss wilson] a touching impulse of apology and deprecation—"you seemed old for [your]1491-you age ; [you]1491-you seemed so much in earnest ; [I]200-miss wilson think [you]1491-you really were;"—a[200-miss wilson] wistful pause—"and afterwards , though of course [I]200-miss wilson could not help seeing that [I]200-miss wilson was not to [you]1491-you what [you]1491-you were to [me]200-miss wilson , yet [I]200-miss wilson thought — [I]200-miss wilson hoped that if [I]200-miss wilson waited — if [I]200-miss wilson was patient — if [no one else]4079-no one else — [no one more worthy of [you]1491-you]4080-no one more worthy of you came between us"—another[200-miss wilson] and still wistfuller delay in [her]200-miss wilson halting speech—"you might grow a little fond of [me]200-miss wilson , out of long habit ; [I]200-miss wilson never expected [you]1491-you to be more than a little fond of [me]200-miss wilson ! "[200-miss wilson] [He]1500-you has entirely hidden [his]1500-you face in [his]1500-you two hands , so that [she]200-miss wilson is without that index to guide [her]200-miss wilson as to the effect produced by [her]200-miss wilson words , and [he]1500-you continues completely silent . Whether , even after [her]200-miss wilson rude awakening , [she]200-miss wilson still , deep in [her]200-miss wilson heart , cherishes some pale hope of a denial , an explaining away of the reported utterances , who shall say ? It is with a half - choked sigh that [she]200-miss wilson goes on : " But [you]1500-you could not ; [I]200-miss wilson am not so unjust as not to know that [you]1500-you tried [your]1500-you best . [Poor fellow]4081-poor fellow ! it must have been uphill work for [you"—with]4082-you"—with[200-miss wilson] a first touch of bitterness—"labouring to love [me]200-miss wilson , for eight years ; is it any wonder that [you]1500-you failed ? and [I]200-miss wilson was so thick - skinned [I]200-miss wilson did not see it — the ' hide of a hippopotamus ' indeed ! There could not be a juster comparison ; and now all [I]200-miss wilson can do is to beg [your]1500-you pardon for having spoilt eight of [your]1500-you best years — [your]1500-you best years"—with[200-miss wilson] slow iteration ; " but come"—more[200-miss wilson] lightly—"you have some very good ones left too ; [you]1500-you are still quite young ; for [a man]386-a man [you]1500-you are quite young ; the harm [I]200-miss wilson have done [you]1500-you is not irreparable ; [I]200-miss wilson think"—with[200-miss wilson] an accent of reproach—"you might ease [my]200-miss wilson mind by telling [me]200-miss wilson that the harm [I]200-miss wilson have done [you]1500-you is not irreparable ! "[200-miss wilson] Thus appealed to , it is impossible for [him]1501-his any longer to maintain [his]1501-his attitude of disguise and concealment . [His]1501-his hands must needs be withdrawn from before [his]1501-his face ; and , as [he]1501-his turns that face towards [her]1502-her , [she]1502-her perceives with astonishment , almost consternation , that there is an undoubted tear in each of [his]1501-his hard gray eyes . " And what about the harm [I]1501-his have done to [you]1502-her ? "[1501-his] [he]1501-his asks under [his]1501-his breath , as if having no confidence in [his]1501-his voice ; " what about the eight best years of [your]1502-her life ? "[1501-his] A look of affection , so high and tender and selfless , as to seem to remove [her]1502-her love out of the category of [the mortal]1503-the mortal and the transitory , dawns and grows in [her]1502-her wan face . " Do not fret about them , "[1502-her] [she]1502-her answers soothingly , " they were — [they]4084-they always will have been — the eight best years of [my]1502-her life . They were full of good and pleasant things . Do not forget — [I]1502-her would not for worlds have [you]1501-his forget — [I]1502-her shall never forget [myself]1502-her — that [they]4084-they all came to [me]1502-her through [you]1501-his ! "[1502-her] At [her]1502-her words , most innocent as they are of any intention of producing such an effect , a hot flush of shame rises to [his]1501-his very forehead , as [his]1501-his memory presents to [him]1501-his the successive eras into which these eight good years had divided themselves : six months of headlong boyish passion ; six months of cooling fever ; and seven years of careless , intermittent , matter - of - course , half - tenderness . " Through [me]1501-his ? "[1501-his] [he]1501-his repeats , with an accent of the deepest self - abasement ; " [you]1502-her do not mean to be ironical , [dear]3358-dear ; [you]1502-her were never such a thing in [your]1502-her life ; [you]1502-her could not be if [you]1502-her tried ; but if [you]1502-her knew what a sweep [you]1502-her make [me]1501-his feel when [you]1502-her say the sort of thing [you]1502-her have just said!—and so it is all to come to an end , is it ? Good as these eight years have been , [you]1502-her have had enough of them ? [You]1502-her do not want any more like them ? "[1501-his] [She]1502-her says neither yes nor no . [He]1501-his remains unanswered , unless the faint smile in [her]1502-her weary eyes and about [her]1502-her drooped mouth can count for a reply . " And all because [you]1502-her have heard [some fool]4086-some fool say that [I]1501-his was tired of [you]1502-her ? "[1501-his] The tight smile spreads a little wider , and invades [her]1502-her pale cheeks . " Worse than tired ! sick ! sick to death ! "[1502-her] [She]1502-her is looking straight before [her]1502-her , at the landscape simmering in the climbing sun , the divine landscape new and young as it was before [duomo and bell - tower]1504-duomo and bell - tower sprang and towered heavenwards . Why should [her]1502-her gaze dwell any more upon [him]1501-his ? [She]1502-her has renounced [him]1501-his , [her]1502-her eyes must fain renounce [him]1501-his too . As [he]1501-his hears [her]1502-her words , as [he]1501-his watches [her]1502-her patient profile , the sole suffering thing in the universal morning joy , a great revulsion of feeling , a great compassion mixed with as large a remorse pours in torrent over [his]1501-his heart . These emotions are so strong that they make [him]1501-his deceive even [himself]1501-his as to [their]1505-their nature . It seems to [him]1501-his as if scales had suddenly fallen from [his]1501-his eyes , showing [him]1501-his how profoundly [he]1501-his prizes the now departing good , telling [him]1501-his that life can neither ask nor give anything better than the undemanding , selfless , boundless love about to withdraw its shelter from [him]1501-his . [His]1501-his arm steals round [her]1502-her waist , and not once does it flash across [his]1501-his mind — as , to [his]1501-his shame be it spoken , it has often flashed before — what a long way it has to steal ! " Am [I]1502-her sick of [you]1501-his , [Amelia]201-amelia ? "[1502-her] [She]1502-her makes no effort to release [herself]1502-her . It does [him]1501-his no harm that [she]1502-her should once more rest within [his]1501-his clasp . But [she]1502-her still looks straight before [her]1502-her at [lucent Firenze]235-firenze and [her]1502-her olives , and says three times , accompanying each repetition of the word with a sorrowful little head - shake : " Yes ! yes ! YES ! "[1501-his] [He]1501-his will compel [her]1502-her to look at [him]1501-his , [his]1501-his own [Amelia]201-amelia . Have not all [her]1502-her tender looks been [his]1501-his for eight long years ? [He]1501-his puts out [his]1501-his disengaged hand , and with it determinately turns [her]1502-her poor quivering face round so as to meet [his]1501-his gaze . " Am [I]1501-his sick of [you]1502-her , [Amelia]201-amelia ? "[1501-his] In the emotion of the moment , it appears to [him]1501-his as if there were something almost ludicrously improbable and lying about that accusation , in which , when first brought against [him]1501-his , [his]1501-his guilty soul had admitted more than a grain of truth . [Her]1502-her faded eyes turn to [his]1501-his , like flowers to their sun ; the veracity of [his]1501-his voice and of [his]1501-his eager gray orbs — still softened from their habitual severity by the tears that had so lately wet them — making such a hope , as , five minutes ago , [she]1502-her had thought never again to cherish , leap into splendid life in [her]1502-her sick heart . " Is it possible ? "[1502-her] [she]1502-her murmurs , almost inaudibly , " do [you]1501-his mean — that [you]1501-his are not ? "[1502-her] [They]1506-they go down [the hill]1467-the hill , past [the cottages]1451-the cottages , and [the incurious peasants]1509-the incurious peasants , hand in hand , [her]1502-her soul running over with a deep joy ; and [his]1501-his occupied by an unfamiliar calm , that is yet backed by an ache of remorse , and by — what else ? That " else "[1501-his] [he]1501-his [himself]1501-his neither could nor would define . [He]1501-his spends the whole of that day with [Amelia]201-amelia , both lunching and dining with [her]201-amelia and [[her]201-amelia family]645-her family ; a course which calls forth expressions of unaffected surprise , not at all tinctured with malice — unless it be in the case of [Sybilla]221-sybilla , who has never been partial to [him]1501-his — from each of [them]1506-they . " [We]1506-they have been thinking that [Jim]181-jim was going to jilt [you]201-amelia , [Amelia]201-amelia ! "[222-cecilia] [Cecilia]222-cecilia has said with graceful badinage ; nor , strange to say , has [she]222-cecilia been at all offended when [Jim]181-jim has retorted , with equal grace and much superior ill - nature , that on such a subject [no one]819-no one could speak with more authority than [she]222-cecilia . The large white stars are making the nightly sky almost as gorgeous as the day 's departed majesty had done , ere [Jim]181-jim finds [himself]181-jim back at [[his]181-jim hotel]760-his hotel . "[181-jim] " Goes ? " And [she]203-byng refused ? "[203-byng] [Byng]203-byng looks down , and begins to kick the banisters — they are still on the stairs — idly with one foot . " [Mother]256-mother is so unselfish that it is always difficult to make out what [she]203-byng really wishes ; but — but [I]203-byng do not quite see of what use [I]203-byng should be to [her]203-byng if [I]203-byng did go . "[203-byng] There is a moment 's pause ; then [Burgoyne]181-jim speaks , in a dry , hortatory [elder brother]1522-elder brother 's voice : " If [you]203-byng take [my]181-jim advice [you]203-byng will go [home]401-home . "[181-jim] The disinterested counsel of [wise elder brothers]1523-wise elder brothers is not always taken in the spirit it merits ; and there is no trace of docile and unquestioning acquiescence in [Byng]203-byng 's monosyllabic — " Why ? " The same kind of mischief that [you]203-byng have been getting into during the past week ? "[643-the young man] [he]643-the young man inquires slowly . Is not it a richly deserved one ? "[643-the young man] Perhaps it may be that [[his]643-the young man young friend]763-his young friend 's reported metaphor of the " hippopotamus hide "[643-the young man] has not served to render [him]643-the young man any dearer to [Jim]181-jim ; but there is certainly no great suavity in [his]643-the young man reply : " Why should [I?—it]4096-i?—it is no concern of [mine]643-the young man . " [I]643-the young man hear , "[643-the young man] [he]643-the young man begins—"Willy tells [me]1528-the lady he has come to visit — [I]1528-the lady he has come to visit am very sorry to hear — — "[1528-the lady he has come to visit] " Oh , there is no great cause for sorrow , "[1528-the lady he has come to visit] rejoins [she]1528-the lady he has come to visit quickly , as if anxious to disclaim a grief which might be supposed to check or limit [her]1528-the lady he has come to visit conversation—"poor [dear old auntie!—the people who love [her]1528-the lady he has come to visit best]4098-dear old auntie!—the people who love her best could not wish to keep [her]1528-the lady he has come to visit in the state [she]1528-the lady he has come to visit has been in for the last year ; oh , dear!"—sighing—"how[1528-the lady he has come to visit] very dismal the dregs of life are ! do not [you]643-the young man hope , [Jim]181-jim , that [we]1529-we shall die before [we]1529-we come to be ' happy releases ' ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i do indeed , " replies [he]643-the young man gravely ; "[0-i] [I]0-i expect to be sick — dead - sick of life long before [I]0-i reach that stage of it . " [He]643-the young man looks at [her]1528-the lady he has come to visit resentfully as [she]1528-the lady he has come to visit speaks , but [she]1528-the lady he has come to visit has so entirely forgotten [her]1528-the lady he has come to visit own application of the accented adjectives to [his]643-the young man feelings for [Amelia]201-amelia , that [she]1528-the lady he has come to visit replies only by a rather puzzled but perfectly innocent glance . "[0-i] [I]0-i never was so unwilling to leave any place in [my]0-i life , " [she]1528-the lady he has come to visit goes on presently , pursuing [her]1528-the lady he has come to visit own train of thought ; "[0-i] [I]0-i do not know how to describe it — a sort of presentiment . " [He]643-the young man smiles . "[0-i] And yet [I]0-i do not think that there are any owls in [the Piazza]241-piazza to hoot under [your]0-i windows ! " "[0-i] Perhaps not , " rejoins [she]1528-the lady he has come to visit , with some warmth ; "[0-i] but what is still more unlucky than that happened to [me]0-i last night ; [they]1530-they passed the wine the wrong way round the table at the MacIvors . [I]0-i was on thorns ! " "[0-i] And [you]0-i think that the wine going the wrong way round the table gave [[your]0-i aunt]1531-your aunt a stroke ? " inquires [Jim]181-jim , with an irritating air of asking for information . [Mrs. Byng]203-byng reddens slightly . "[0-i] [I]0-i think nothing of the kind ; [I]0-i draw no inference ; [I]0-i only state a fact ; it is a very unlucky thing to send the wine round the wrong way : if [you]0-i had not spent [your]0-i life among grizzly bears and [cannibals]1532-cannibals [you]0-i would have known it too ! " "[1533-no cannibals in the rocky mountains] There are [no cannibals in [the Rocky Mountains]90-the rocky mountains]1533-no cannibals in the rocky mountains , " corrects [Jim]181-jim quietly ; and then [they]4099-they both laugh , and recommence [their]4099-they talk on a more friendly footing . "[1533-no cannibals in the rocky mountains] [I]0-i am not at all happy about [Willy]222-cecilia . " "[222-cecilia] No ? " "[222-cecilia] It is not [his]1534-his health so much — [his]1534-his colour is good , and [his]1534-his appetite not bad . " "[1535-the fat boy in ' pickwick] But [he]1534-his is not [himself]1534-his ; there is something odd about [him]1534-his ! " "[1534-his] Indeed ! " "[1534-his] Have not [you]0-i noticed it yourself?—do not [you]0-i think that there is something odd about [him]1534-his ? Does not [he]1534-his strike [you]0-i as odd ? " "[1534-his] Odd ? " repeats [Burgoyne]181-jim slowly , reflecting in how extremely commonplace a light both the virtues and vices of [[his]181-jim fellow - traveller]4100-his fellow - traveller have always presented [themselves]4101-themselves to [him]181-jim ; "[222-cecilia] it would never have occurred to [me]0-i that [Willy]222-cecilia was odd ; [I]0-i cannot"—smiling—"encourage [you]0-i in the idea that [you]0-i have added one to the number of [the world]3184-the world 's eccentrics . " ' [Children]4103-children are avenues to misfortune , ' as [somebody]4104-somebody said , and [I]0-i think that , whoever [he]1534-his was , [he]1534-his was right . ' "[0-i] " Why should [you]0-i credit [Jacob]295-jacob with any such intention ? "[0-i] " [I]0-i do not half like leaving [him]295-jacob [here]637-here by [himself]295-jacob . "[0-i] " Oh yes , [I]1537-i do — [I]1537-i count [you]0-i as a great deal ; that is why [I]1537-i was so anxious to speak to [you]0-i before [I]1537-i went ; of course [I]1537-i do not expect [you]0-i to take upon [yourself]0-i the whole responsibility of [him]295-jacob , but [you]0-i might keep an eye upon [him]295-jacob . "[1537-i] [He]1537-i shrugs [his]1537-i shoulders . " As [I]1537-i have to keep the other eye upon [myself]1537-i , [I]1537-i am afraid that the effort would but make [me]1537-i squint . "[0-i] " [Stevenson]246-stevenson thinks that it does not much matter whom [we]4112-we marry , whether ' [noisy scullions]4113-noisy scullions , ' or ' acidulous vestals . ' "[1537-i] " [I]1537-i do not care what [Stevenson]246-stevenson thinks : ever since [Willy]222-cecilia was in [Eton]92-eton jackets , [I]1537-i have had a nightmare of [his]295-jacob bringing [me]1537-i [home]401-home as [daughter - in - law]4115-daughter - in - law [some poor little governess]4116-some poor little governess with [her]193-elizabeth nose through [her]193-elizabeth veil , and [her]193-elizabeth fingers through [her]193-elizabeth gloves ! " [I]203-byng think [you]1537-i overrate [his]295-jacob magnanimity ; [I]203-byng never saw [him]295-jacob at all tender to [anyone whose gloves were not beyond suspicion]4117-anyone whose gloves were not beyond suspicion . "[203-byng] [Mrs. Byng]203-byng laughs constrainedly . " Well , if [she]203-byng has not holes in [her]203-byng gloves , [she]203-byng may have holes in [her]203-byng reputation , which is worse . "[203-byng] [Jim]181-jim draws in [his]181-jim breath hard . The tug of war is coming , as the preceding leading remark , lugged in by the head and shoulders , sufficiently evidences . At all events [he]181-jim will do nothing to make its approach easier or quicker . [He]181-jim awaits it in silence . " These [Le Marchants]261-the le marchants — as [they]261-the le marchants are [friends of yours]4118-friends of yours — [I]181-jim suppose that [I]181-jim ought not to say anything against [them]261-the le marchants ? "[181-jim] " [I]181-jim am sure that [you]203-byng are too well - bred to do anything of the kind , "[181-jim] replies [he]181-jim precipitately , with a determined effort to stop [her]203-byng mouth with a compliment , which [she]203-byng is equally determined not to deserve . " [I]203-byng do not think [I]203-byng am ; [I]203-byng am only well - bred now and then , when it suits [me]203-byng ; [I]203-byng am not going to be well - bred to - night . "[203-byng] " [I]181-jim am sorry to hear it . "[181-jim] " Whether [they]261-the le marchants are [friends of yours]4118-friends of yours or not , [I]181-jim do not like [them]261-the le marchants . "[181-jim] " [I]181-jim do not think that that matters much , either to [you]181-jim or to [them]261-the le marchants . "[181-jim] " [I]181-jim have an instinct that [they]261-the le marchants are [adventuresses]4120-adventuresses . "[181-jim] " [I]181-jim know for a certainty "[181-jim] — with growing warmth—"that [they]261-the le marchants are nothing of the kind . "[181-jim] " Then why do not [they]261-the le marchants go out anywhere ? "[181-jim] " Because [they]261-the le marchants do not choose . "[181-jim] " Because [no one]819-no one asks [them]261-the le marchants , more likely ! Why were [they]261-the le marchants so determined not to be introduced to [me]181-jim ? "[181-jim] " How can [I]181-jim tell ? Perhaps"—with[181-jim] a wrathful laugh—"they did not like [your]1539-you looks ! "[1538-i] [She]1538-i echoes [his]1539-you false mirth with no inferior exasperation . " Who is ill - bred now ? "[1538-i] [Her]1538-i tone calls [him]1539-you back to a sense of the ungentleman - likeness and puerility of [his]1539-you conduct . " [I!"—he]1538-i[1538-i] replies contritely—"undoubtedly [I]1538-i ! but — — "[1538-i] " Do not apologize , "[1538-i] interrupts [she]1538-i , recovering [her]1538-i equanimity with that ease which [she]1538-i has transmitted to [[her]1538-i son]600-her son ; " [I]1538-i like [you]1539-you for standing up for [them]261-the le marchants if [they]261-the le marchants are [[your]1539-you friends]3452-your friends ; and [I]1538-i hope that [you]1539-you will do the same good office for [me]1538-i when [someone]529-someone sticks pins into [me]1538-i behind [my]1538-i back ; but come now , let [us]4124-we be rational ; surely [we]4124-we may talk quietly about [them]261-the le marchants without insulting [each other]607-each other , may not [we]4124-we ? "[1538-i] " [I]1538-i do not know ; [we]4124-we can try . "[1538-i] " [I]1538-i suppose"—a[1538-i] little ironically—"that [you]1539-you are not so sensitive about [them]261-the le marchants but that [you]1539-you can bear [me]1541-me to ask a few perfectly harmless questions ? "[1541-me] [He]1541-me writhes . " Of course ! of course ! what are [they]261-the le marchants to [me?—they]261-the le marchants are nothing to [me]1541-me ! "[1541-me] A look of incredulity , which [she]1542-me perhaps does not take any very great pains to conceal , spreads over [her]1542-me face . " Then [you]1539-you really will be doing [me]1542-me a great service if [you]1539-you tell [me]1542-me just exactly all [you]1539-you know about [them]261-the le marchants , good and bad . "[1542-me] " All [I]181-jim know about [them]261-the le marchants , "[181-jim] replies [Jim]181-jim in a rapid parrot - voice , as if [he]181-jim were rattling over some disagreeable lesson—"is that [they]261-the le marchants were extremely kind to [me]181-jim ten years ago ; that [they]261-the le marchants had [a beautiful place in [Devonshire]5-devonshire]4126-a beautiful place in devonshire , and were universally loved and respected : [I]181-jim hear that [they]261-the le marchants have let [their]261-the le marchants place ; so no doubt [they]261-the le marchants are not so much loved and respected as [they]261-the le marchants were ; and now [you]4127-you know as much about the matter as [I]181-jim do ! "[181-jim] This last clause is not always true . For example , there is very little sighing in the farewells made to [Mrs. Byng]203-byng by [the two young men who see [her]203-byng off at [the Florence Railway Station]1544-the florence railway station]1543-the two young men who see her off at the florence railway station . And [Mrs. Byng]203-byng [herself]203-byng has been too much occupied in manœuvring to get a few last private words with each of [[her]203-byng escort]3893-her escort to have much time for sighing either . [She]203-byng would have been wounded if [[her]203-byng old friend]1546-her old friend [Jim]181-jim had not come to see the last of [her]203-byng , and [she]203-byng would have been broken - hearted if [[her]203-byng son]600-her son had not paid [her]203-byng this final attention ; and yet each necessarily destroys the tête - à - tête [she]203-byng is burning to have with the other . It is indelicate to implore [[your]1548-your adored child]1549-your adored child not to go to the devil in the presence of [an intimate friend]1550-an intimate friend , and it would give a not unnatural umbrage to [that child]1551-that child if [you]1548-your urged [the guardian friend]1552-the guardian friend to check [his]1552-the guardian friend downward tendency while [he]1552-the guardian friend [himself]1552-the guardian friend is standing by . Nor do [[her]203-byng two companions]1553-her two companions at all aid [her]203-byng in [her]203-byng strategy ; rather , [they]1553-her two companions show a tendency to unite in baffling [her]203-byng , hanging together round [her]203-byng like [a bodyguard]1554-a bodyguard , and effectually hindering the last words which [she]203-byng is pining to administer . Only once for a very few minutes does [she]203-byng succeed in outwitting [them]1553-her two companions , when [she]203-byng despatches [Willy]222-cecilia to [the bookstall]1555-the bookstall to buy papers for [her]203-byng — an errand from which [he]1552-the guardian friend returns with an exasperating celerity . The instant that [his]1552-the guardian friend back is turned , [Mrs. Byng]203-byng addresses [[her]203-byng companion]540-her companion in an eager voice of hurry and prayer : " [You]540-her companion will keep an eye upon [him]1552-the guardian friend ? "[203-byng] Silence . " [You]540-her companion will keep an eye upon [him]1552-the guardian friend — promise ? "[203-byng] " [I]203-byng do not know what ' keeping an eye upon [him]1552-the guardian friend ' means in [your]540-her companion vocabulary ; often [you]540-her companion and [I]203-byng do not use the same dictionary ; until [I]203-byng know , [I]203-byng will not promise . "[203-byng] " [You]540-her companion will look after [him]1552-the guardian friend ; do , [Jim]181-jim ! "[203-byng] " [Fiddlesticks]296-fiddlesticks , with [your]540-her companion unimaginative , unemotional nature — — "[203-byng] " H'm ! "[203-byng] " Certainly , if [you]540-her companion wish it ; [I]203-byng will telegraph , ' [Willy]222-cecilia rushing Ruin . ' At five - and - twenty centimes a word , it will cost [you]540-her companion sevenpence halfpenny ; not dear at the price , is it ? "[203-byng] [The mother]579-the mother reddens . " [You]540-her companion have become a very mauvais plaisant of late , [Jim]181-jim ; oh dear [me]579-the mother ! here [he]181-jim is back again , [tiresome boy]4130-tiresome boy ! "[579-the mother] It is with feelings tied into a knot of complications , which [he]1558-he scarcely seeks to unravel , that [Burgoyne]181-jim walks away from [the station]661-the station , and from [the good - natured staunch woman , whose last few moments in [fair Firenze]1561-fair firenze [he]1558-he has done [his]1558-he best to embitter]1560-the good - natured staunch woman , whose last few moments in fair firenze he has done his best to embitter . [He]1558-he is glad that [she]1560-the good - natured staunch woman , whose last few moments in fair firenze he has done his best to embitter is gone , and [he]1558-he is sorry that [she]1560-the good - natured staunch woman , whose last few moments in fair firenze he has done his best to embitter is gone . [He]1558-he is remorseful at [his]1558-he gladness , and [he]1558-he is ashamed of [his]1558-he sorrow , knowing and acknowledging that it results from no regret for [her]1560-the good - natured staunch woman , whose last few moments in fair firenze he has done his best to embitter companionship , which [he]1558-he had been wo nt to prize ; but to the consciousness that [she]1560-the good - natured staunch woman , whose last few moments in fair firenze he has done his best to embitter had stood like [an angel with a drawn sword between [[her]1560-the good - natured staunch woman , whose last few moments in fair firenze he has done his best to embitter son]600-her son and [the Piazza d'Azeglio]3491-the piazza d'azeglio]1562-an angel with a drawn sword between her son and the piazza d'azeglio . Both angel and drawn sword are steaming away now , covered by a handsome travelling cloak down to the heels in a coupé toilette , and [the road to [the Piazza]3537-the piazza]1565-the road to the piazza lies naked and undefended , open to the light feet that are so buoyantly treading the flags beside [him]1558-he . The step of youth is always light , but there is something aggressively springy in [Byng]203-byng 's this morning ; and though [he]1558-he does not say anything offensively cheerful , there is a ring in [his]1558-he voice that makes [[his]1558-he kind friend]1567-his kind friend long to hit [him]1558-he . [He]1567-his kind friend , [the kind friend]1568-the kind friend , is thankful when [their]1569-their ways part , without [his]1567-his kind friend having done [him]1558-he any bodily violence . " [You]1558-he are late to - day , "[222-cecilia] says [Cecilia]222-cecilia , as [he]1567-his kind friend enters [the salon]3584-the salon , giving [him]1558-he a nod of indifferent friendliness , while [Sybilla]221-sybilla crossly asks [him]1558-he to shut the door more quietly , and [Amelia]201-amelia lays [her]201-amelia hand lingeringly in [his]1558-he , with a silent smile of rapture ; " [we]1569-their began to think [you]1558-he had had a relapse . [I]201-amelia was just telling [Amelia]201-amelia that the pace had been too good to last — ha , ha ! "[201-amelia] [Burgoyne]181-jim has always found it difficult to laugh at [Cecilia]222-cecilia 's jokes , and [his]181-jim now perfect intimacy with [her]222-cecilia relieves [him]181-jim from the necessity of even feigning to do so . " [I]181-jim have been seeing [Mrs. Byng]203-byng off , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim replies , with that slight shade of awkwardness in [his]181-jim tone which has accompanied [his]181-jim every mention of [the mother]579-the mother or [son]1572-son since [his]181-jim explanation with [[his]181-jim betrothed]605-his betrothed . " [You]222-cecilia let [her]203-byng go without getting that wedding present out of [her]203-byng , after all ? "[222-cecilia] cries [Cecilia]222-cecilia , who is in a rather tryingly playful mood . " Gone , is [she]203-byng ? "[221-sybilla] says [Sybilla]221-sybilla , with a somewhat ostentatious sigh of resentful relief ; " well , [I]221-sybilla , for one , shall not cry . [I]221-sybilla am afraid that [she]203-byng was not very simpatica to [me]221-sybilla ; [she]203-byng was so dreadfully robust . Perhaps , now that [she]203-byng is no longer here to monopolise [him]181-jim , [we]4131-we shall be allowed to see something more of [that nice boy]4132-that nice boy . "[221-sybilla] [No one]819-no one answers . [Not one of [[her]221-sybilla three listeners]1576-her three listeners]1575-not one of her three listeners is at the moment disposed to chant or even echo praises of [the " nice boy]4133-the " nice boy . "[221-sybilla] [Sybilla]221-sybilla perversely pursues the subject . " [I]221-sybilla dare say that [he]181-jim has a delicacy about coming without a special invitation , "[221-sybilla] [she]221-sybilla says , " where there is [an invalid]3326-an invalid ; but [you]4135-you might tell [him]181-jim that on [my]221-sybilla good days [no one]819-no one is more pleased to see [[their]819-no one friends]4137-their friends than [I]221-sybilla ; it does not even send [my]221-sybilla temperature up ; [you]4135-you might tell [him]181-jim that on [my]221-sybilla good days [Dr. Coldstream]297-dr. coldstream says it does not even send [my]221-sybilla temperature up ! "[221-sybilla] Again [no one]819-no one answers . " [You]181-jim do not seem to be listening to what [I]221-sybilla am saying , "[221-sybilla] cries [Sybilla]221-sybilla fractiously ; " will [you]181-jim please tell [him]181-jim , [Jim]181-jim ? "[221-sybilla] [Jim]181-jim lifts [his]181-jim heavy eyes from the ugly carpet on which they have been resting , and looks distastefully back at [her]221-sybilla . " [I]181-jim do not think that [I]181-jim will , [Sybilla]221-sybilla , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim replies slowly ; " [I]181-jim do not think [he]181-jim cares a straw whether [your]221-sybilla temperature goes up or down . [I]181-jim think that [he]181-jim does not come here because — because [he]181-jim has found metal more attractive elsewhere . "[181-jim] [He]181-jim makes this statement for no other reason than because it is so intensely unpleasant to [him]181-jim , because [he]181-jim realizes that [he]181-jim must have to face the fact it embodies , and to present it not only to [himself]181-jim , but to [others]736-others . And each day that passes proves to [him]181-jim more and more conclusively that it is a fact . [He]181-jim asks [Byng]203-byng no question as to the disposition of [his]181-jim day . [He]181-jim sees but little of [him]181-jim , having , indeed , changed the hours of [his]181-jim own breakfast and dinner in order to avoid having [his]181-jim appetite spoilt by the sight of so much unnecessary radiance opposite [him]181-jim ; but [he]181-jim knocks up against [him]181-jim , flower - laden , at the Strozzi steps ; [he]181-jim notes the splendour of [his]181-jim ties and waistcoats ; [he]181-jim grows to know the [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth - look on [his]181-jim face , when [he]181-jim comes singing [home]401-home at evening , as [one]501-one knows the look of the western clouds that the sun 's red lips have only just ceased to kiss , though no sun is any longer in sight ; and yet [he]181-jim does not interfere . [He]181-jim has received from [[the young man]643-the young man 's mother]4034-the young man 's mother a hasty letter , pencilled in [the train]675-the train , not an hour after [she]4034-the young man 's mother had quitted [him]181-jim ; another more leisurely , yet as anxious , from [Turin]298-turin ; a third from [Paris]93-paris , and lastly a telegram from [Charing Cross]299-charing cross . All bear the same purport . " Write ; keep an eye upon [him]643-the young man ! "[298-turin] " Write ; keep an eye upon [him]643-the young man ! Write ! "[181-jim] And yet , though a full week has passed , though [he]181-jim sees [the son of [[his]181-jim old ally]1585-his old ally]1584-the son of his old ally drifting , faster than ever autumn leaf drifted on [a flush October river]1586-a flush october river , to the whirlpool [she]1585-his old ally had dreaded for [him]181-jim , yet [he]181-jim sends [her]1585-his old ally never a word . [He]181-jim writes [her]1585-his old ally long letters , it is true , covers telegram - forms with pregnant messages , but they all find [their]1587-their ultimate home in the wood fire . When the moment comes , [he]181-jim finds it impossible to send [them]1587-their , since , upon searching [his]181-jim heart for the motives that have dictated them , [he]181-jim finds those motives to be no fidelity to an ancient friendship , no care for [the boy]3714-the boy 's welfare , but , simply and nakedly , the satisfaction of [his]181-jim own spite , the easing of [his]181-jim own bitter jealousy . So the Florentine post goes out daily , bearing no tale of [Byng]203-byng 's backslidings to [[his]181-jim native land]1589-his native land , and [Jim]181-jim , brushing past [him]181-jim , answering [him]181-jim curtly , never going nearer to [the Piazza d'Azeglio]3491-the piazza d'azeglio than [the Innocenti]300-the innocenti — [a good long street]1591-a good long street off — devotes [himself]181-jim to the frantic prosecution of a suit long since won , to the conquest of a heart for eight weary years hopelessly , irrecoverably , pitiably [his]181-jim . [His]181-jim presence at [the Anglo - Américain]3323-the anglo - américain is so incessant , and [his]181-jim monopolizing of [Amelia]201-amelia so unreasonable , that [Sybilla]221-sybilla — for the first time in [her]221-sybilla life really a little neglected — alternately runs up [her]221-sybilla pulse to 170 and drops it to 40 . " And then [you]806-her future brother - in - law wonder that [I]222-cecilia am anxious to be married , "[222-cecilia] says [Cecilia]222-cecilia , accompanying [[her]222-cecilia future brother - in - law]806-her future brother - in - law to the door , on the day on which the latter phenomenon has occurred , and wiping the angry tears from [her]222-cecilia plump cheeks . " [I]181-jim make no secret of it , [I]181-jim am madly anxious , [I]181-jim would marry [anyone]3161-anyone , [I]181-jim am desperate . Just think what [my]181-jim life will be when [Amelia]201-amelia is gone ; and though of course [I]181-jim shall be a great deal with [her]201-amelia — [she]201-amelia has promised that [I]181-jim shall be almost always with [her]201-amelia "[181-jim] ( [Jim]181-jim winces)—"yet of course it ca n't be the same thing as having [a home of [your]4140-you own]4139-a home of your own . "[222-cecilia] " [We]4141-we will do [our]4141-we best for [you]4140-you , "[181-jim] replies [he]181-jim , with a rather rueful smile and a sense of degradation ; " but [you]4140-you know , [[my]181-jim dear]3176-my dear [Cis]222-cecilia , [anybody]3681-anybody can lead a horse to [the water]3621-the water , but it is not so easy to make [him]3681-anybody drink . "[181-jim] " That is quite true , "[222-cecilia] replies [Cecilia]222-cecilia , one of whose most salient merits is an extreme unreadiness to be affronted , wiping [her]222-cecilia eyes as [she]222-cecilia speaks , " and [I]222-cecilia have no luck ; such promising things turn up , and then come to nothing . Now , that clergyman the other day , whom [we]4141-we met at [the Villa Careggi]4145-the villa careggi — such [a pleasant gentlemanlike man]4146-a pleasant gentlemanlike man — [he]4146-a pleasant gentlemanlike man was on the look - out for [a wife]3321-a wife , [he]4146-a pleasant gentlemanlike man told [me]222-cecilia so [himself]4146-a pleasant gentlemanlike man , and [I]222-cecilia know so much about the working of [a parish]4148-a parish , and next day [he]4146-a pleasant gentlemanlike man was off , Heaven knows where ! "[222-cecilia] [Jim]181-jim gives a slight shudder . " [I]181-jim do not think [you]222-cecilia had any great loss in [him]4146-a pleasant gentlemanlike man , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim says hastily ; then , seeing [her]222-cecilia surprised air , " [I]181-jim mean , [you]222-cecilia know , that it is always said that [a man]386-a man is a better judge of [another man]4150-another man than [a woman]536-a woman is , and [I]181-jim did not like [his]4146-a pleasant gentlemanlike man looks ; give [us]4152-us time , and [we]4152-us will do better for [you]222-cecilia than that . "[181-jim] [Cecilia]222-cecilia can no longer accuse [her]222-cecilia future relation of any slackness in the matter of expeditions . There is something of fever in the way in which [he]181-jim arrives each morning , armed with some new plan for the day , giving [no one]819-no one any peace until [his]181-jim project is carried out . It seems as if [he]181-jim must crowd into the last fortnight of [Amelia]201-amelia 's stay in [Florence]20-florence all the sight - seeing , all the junkets , all the enjoyment which ought to have been temperately spread over the eight years of [their]1595-they engagement . One day — all nearer excursions being exhausted — [they]1595-they drive to [Monte Senario]94-monte senario , [that sweet and silent spot]1596-that sweet and silent spot , happily too far from [Florence]20-florence for the swarm of [tourists]1597-tourists to invade , where [earth - weary men]1598-earth - weary men have set up a rest scarcely less dumb than [the grave in [a lonely monastery of the Order of La Trappe]1600-a lonely monastery of the order of la trappe]1599-the grave in a lonely monastery of the order of la trappe . Through [the Porta San Gallo]1601-the porta san gallo , along [the Bologna Road]1602-the bologna road [they]1595-they go . It is a soft summer morning , with not much sun . Up , past [the villas and gardens , where the Banksia roses and wistarias]1603-the villas and gardens , where the banksia roses and wistarias are rioting over wall , and berceau and pergola , climbing even the tall trees . Round the very head of [one young poplar two rose - trees — a yellow and a white one]1604-one young poplar two rose - trees — a yellow and a white one — are flinging [their]1604-one young poplar two rose - trees — a yellow and a white one arms ; flowered so lavishly that hardly a pin 's point could be put between the blossoms . Up and up , a white wall on either hand . The dust lies a foot thick on [the road]3320-the road ; thick too on the monthly roses , just breaking into full pink flush ; thick on [themselves]1595-they as the endless mulecarts come jingling down [the hill]1467-the hill with bells and red tassels , and a general air of what would be jollity were not that feeling so given the lie to by [the poor jaded , suffering beasts]1607-the poor jaded , suffering beasts . Up and up , till [they]1595-they leave stone walls and [villas]1608-villas and [oliveyards]1609-oliveyards behind [them]1595-they , and are away among [the mountains]911-the mountains . At [a very humble little house that has no air of an inn]1611-a very humble little house that has no air of an inn [they]1595-they leave [the carriage]3765-the carriage , and climb up [a rocky road]1613-a rocky road , and through a perfumed pine - wood , to where [the Trappist Monastery]1614-the trappist monastery stands , in [its]1614-the trappist monastery perfect silence and isolation , on [its]1614-the trappist monastery hilltop , looking over [its]1614-the trappist monastery fir - woods at [the ranges of [the Apennines]51-the apennines]1615-the ranges of the apennines , lying one behind the other in the stillness of the summer - day ; looking to distant [Florence]20-florence , misty and indistinct in [[her]20-florence Arno plain]1616-her arno plain ; looking to [Fiesole]71-fiesole , dwarfed to a molehill 's dimensions . " [I]222-cecilia am told that [one of [the brothers]4154-the brothers]4153-one of the brothers is [an Englishman]4155-an englishman ; [I]222-cecilia did not hear [his]4153-one of the brothers name , but [he]4153-one of the brothers is certainly English , "[222-cecilia] says [Cecilia]222-cecilia , as [they]1617-they mount the shallow , grass - grown steps to [the monastery]3802-the monastery door . " If [I]222-cecilia send up word that [I]222-cecilia am [a fellow - countrywoman]4156-a fellow - countrywoman , perhaps [he]4153-one of the brothers will come out and speak to [me]222-cecilia ; [I]222-cecilia am sure that it would be a very nice change for [him]4153-one of the brothers , [poor fellow]4081-poor fellow ! "[222-cecilia] And it is the measure of the amount of [Cecilia]222-cecilia 's acquaintance with the rules of the Order , that it is only half in jest that [she]222-cecilia makes the suggestion . But [she]222-cecilia does not repeat it to [the lay - brother who stands , civil yet prohibitory , at the top of the flight]1619-the lay - brother who stands , civil yet prohibitory , at the top of the flight , and who , in answer to [Burgoyne]181-jim 's halting questions as to where [they]1617-they may go , politely answers that [they]1617-they may go anywhere — anywhere , bien entendu , outside . So [they]1617-they wander aimlessly away . [They]1617-they push open a rickety gate , and passing an old dog , barking angry remonstrances at [them]1617-they from the retirement of a barrel , step along [a grassy path that leads [they]1617-they know not whither]1620-a grassy path that leads they know not whither . [Two more young lay - brothers]1621-two more young lay - brothers meet [them]1617-they , with [their]1621-two more young lay - brothers hands full of leopard's - bane flowers , which [they]1621-two more young lay - brothers have been gathering , probably to deck [their]1621-two more young lay - brothers altar with . [Amelia]201-amelia has passed [her]201-amelia hand through [Jim]181-jim 's arm — since [his]181-jim late increased kindness to [her]201-amelia [she]201-amelia has been led to many more little freedoms with [him]181-jim than [she]201-amelia had hitherto permitted [herself]201-amelia — and though [she]201-amelia is very careful not to lean heavily or troublesomely upon [him]181-jim , yet the slight contact of [her]201-amelia fingers keeps [him]181-jim reminded that [she]201-amelia is there . Perhaps it is as well , since to - day [he]181-jim is conscious of such a strange tendency to forget everything , past , present , and to come . Has one of [the monks]1622-the monks ' numb hands been laid upon [his]181-jim heart to lull it into so frozen a quiet ? To - day [he]181-jim feels as if it were absolutely impossible to [him]181-jim to experience either pleasure or pain ; as if to hold [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth in [his]181-jim own arms , or see [her]193-elizabeth in [Byng]203-byng 's , would be to [him]181-jim equally indifferent . [His]181-jim apathy in this latter respect is to be put to the test sooner than [he]181-jim expects . Not indeed that [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth is lying in [Byng]203-byng 's arms — it would be a gross misrepresentation to say so , [she]193-elizabeth being , on the contrary , most decorously poised on [a camp - stool]3793-a camp - stool — least romantic of human resting places — when [they]1624-they come suddenly upon [her]193-elizabeth and [him]181-jim in the course of [their]1624-they prowl round the inhospitable walls . [She]193-elizabeth is sitting on [her]193-elizabeth camp - stool , and [he]181-jim is lying on [his]181-jim face in the grass , just not touching [her]193-elizabeth slim feet . [The advancing party]1625-the advancing party perceive [the couple]1626-the couple advanced upon before [the latter]423-the latter are aware of [their]1626-the couple nearness ; long enough for [the former]3701-the former to realize how very much de trop [they]1626-the couple will be , yet not long enough to enable [them]1626-the couple to escape unnoticed . [Jim]181-jim becomes aware of the very second at which [Amelia]201-amelia recognises [the unconscious pair]1629-the unconscious pair , by an involuntary pinch of [her]201-amelia fingers upon [his]181-jim arm , which a moment later [she]201-amelia hastily drops . [His]181-jim own first feeling on catching sight of [them]1629-the unconscious pair — no , not [his]181-jim very first — [his]181-jim very first is as if [someone]529-someone had run a darning - needle into [his]181-jim heart — but almost [his]181-jim first is to shout out to [them]1629-the unconscious pair in loud warning : " Be on [your]1629-the unconscious pair guard ! [we]1629-the unconscious pair are close to [you]1629-the unconscious pair ! "[181-jim] [He]181-jim will never forgive either [himself]181-jim or [them]1629-the unconscious pair if [they]1629-the unconscious pair ignorantly indulge in any endearment under [his]181-jim very eyes . But [they]1629-the unconscious pair do not . There are no interlacing arms to disentwine , nothing to make [them]1629-the unconscious pair spring apart , when at length [they]1629-the unconscious pair look up and take in the fact — an unwelcome fact it must needs be — of [their]1629-the unconscious pair invasion . On hearing approaching footsteps , [Byng]203-byng rolls over on [his]181-jim back in the grass ; on perceiving that most of the footsteps are those of [ladies]1631-ladies , [he]181-jim springs to [his]181-jim feet . [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth remains sitting on [her]193-elizabeth camp - stool . " What a coincidence ! "[222-cecilia] cries [Cecilia]222-cecilia , breaking into a laugh . [They]1629-the unconscious pair are all grateful to [her]222-cecilia for the remark , though it is rather a silly one , as there is no particular coincidence in the case . [Burgoyne]181-jim is irritatedly conscious that [Amelia]201-amelia is covertly observing [him]181-jim , and before [he]181-jim can check [himself]181-jim [he]181-jim has thrown over [his]181-jim shoulder at [her]201-amelia one of those snubbing glances from which , for the last ten days , [he]181-jim has painstakenly and remorsefully refrained . It is not a happy moment to look at poor [Amelia]201-amelia , as [she]201-amelia has not yet cooled down from the heat of [her]201-amelia climb through the fir - wood — a heat that translates itself into patchy flushes all over [her]201-amelia face , not sparing even [her]201-amelia forehead . [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth is flushed too . [She]193-elizabeth has not met [Miss Wilson]200-miss wilson since [she]193-elizabeth had declined [Burgoyne]181-jim 's offer of bringing [[his]181-jim betrothed]605-his betrothed to see [her]193-elizabeth , and in [her]193-elizabeth deprecating eyes there is a guilty and tremulous recollection of this fact . But below the guilt and the deprecation and the tremor , what else is there in [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth 's eyes ? What of splendid and startling , and that comes but once in a lifetime ? Rather than be obliged to give a name to that vague radiance , [Jim]181-jim turns [his]181-jim look back upon [his]181-jim own too glowing dear one . " Did [you]193-elizabeth come here all alone ? [[You]193-elizabeth two all alone]4158-you two all alone ? What fun ! "[222-cecilia] asks [Cecilia]222-cecilia , with an air of delighted curiosity . Again [[her]193-elizabeth companions]3661-her companions inwardly thank [her]193-elizabeth . It is the question that [both]541-both — though with different degrees of eagerness — have been thirsting to ask . " Alone?—oh no ! "[193-elizabeth] replies [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth , with that uneasy , frightened look that [Burgoyne]181-jim has always noticed on [her]193-elizabeth face when [she]193-elizabeth has been brought into unwilling relation with [strangers]538-strangers . "[201-amelia] It is not always that generous actions meet [their]1641-their meed of gratitude from [those for whose sake]1642-those for whose sake [they]1641-their are performed ; and , though [Burgoyne]181-jim recognises the magnanimity of [his]181-jim fiancée 's line of conduct , thankfulness to [her]201-amelia for it is not the feeling uppermost in [his]181-jim mind when , a few moments later , [he]181-jim finds [himself]181-jim standing in uneasy tête - à - tête over the seated [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth . "[181-jim] [He]181-jim complies , taking care to occupy a quite different six feet of herbage from that which still bears the imprint of [Byng]203-byng 's lengthy limbs . The grass grows cool and fresh , full of buttercups and tall blue bugle ; out of them [the gray monastery]1643-the gray monastery wall rises , in its utter lifeless silence , with [its]1643-the gray monastery small barred windows . Was ever [any building]1644-any building , within which is human life , so unutterably still ? As [he]181-jim leans [his]181-jim elbow among the king - cups , [Jim]181-jim says to [himself]181-jim that [the lovers]775-the lovers had chosen [their]775-the lovers place well and wisely — that the consciousness of the austere , denied lives going on so close behind [them]775-the lovers , in [their]775-the lovers entire joylessness , must have given an added point , a keener edge to the poignancy of [their]775-the lovers own enjoyment of the sweet summer day outside . Nearer stands a colony of purple orchises , and from [them]1648-them the eye travels away to [the silent fir - wood]1649-the silent fir - wood , to [the range of misty hills]1650-the range of misty hills and [the distant plain]1651-the distant plain , touched now and again by a vague hint of sunshine , that makes one for the moment feel sure that [one]501-one has detected Duomo or Campanile . How many hill ranges there are ! One can count six or seven , like the ridges in [a gigantic ploughed field]1653-a gigantic ploughed field , one behind another — all solemnly beautiful on this windless day of grave and ungaudy sweetness . " Have [you]643-the young man missed [me]643-the young man very much ? "[643-the young man] The woman addressed seems in no hurry to answer . Then [she]193-elizabeth speaks with a sort of soft self - remonstrance : " Oh , surely ! "[643-the young man] " Is there ? All the same , [I]643-the young man am sorry that [you]700-the young woman did not come . "[643-the young man] This simple and unsophisticated implication of a liking for [him]643-the young man would have warmed again the uneasy heart that [her]700-the young woman former speech had chilled had not [he]643-the young man , under the superficial though genuine regret of [her]700-the young woman face , seen , still shining with steady lustre , that radiance which has as little been called forth by , as it can be dimmed by [him]643-the young man or anything relating to [him]643-the young man . And so [he]643-the young man passes by in silence the expression of that sorrow which [he]643-the young man bitterly knows to be so supportable . The still spirit of the day seems to have touched the very birds . [They]1659-their sing a few low notes in veiled , chastened voices from the fir - wood , and again are silent . The clock tells the hours in [quarters]1660-quarters to [the doomed lives inside [the monastery]3802-the monastery]1661-the doomed lives inside the monastery , self - doomed to suffering and penance and incarceration , even with the winning blue of the Tuscan sky above [their]1659-their tonsured heads , with [the forget - me - nots]1663-the forget - me - nots pressing [their]1659-their feet , and the nightingales singing endless love - songs to [them]1659-their from [the little dark forest]1664-the little dark forest nigh at hand . " [I]193-elizabeth suppose , "[193-elizabeth] says [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth presently , in a reflective tone , " that the fact is , when [people]3155-people are in [your]643-the young man position — [I]193-elizabeth mean on the brink of a great deep happiness — [they]3155-people forget all lesser things ?
