"[1671-i] It does not for an instant cross [his]181-jim mind either to doubt or to affect uncertainty as to who [the friends of whom [she]1671-i speaks]1672-the friends of whom she speaks may be ; but the suggestion is so profoundly unwelcome to [him]181-jim , that not even the certainty of mortifying [the unselfish creature before [him]181-jim]1673-the unselfish creature before him can hinder [him]181-jim from showing it . [Her]1671-i countenance falls . " [You]181-jim are not glad ? "[1671-i] [she]1671-i asks crestfallenly , " [you]181-jim are not pleased ? "[1671-i] It is impossible for [him]181-jim to say that [he]181-jim is , and all that is left to [him]181-jim is to put [his]181-jim vexation into words that may be as little as possible fraught with disappointment to [[his]181-jim poor hearer]1674-his poor hearer 's ear . " [I]1671-i — [I]1671-i — had rather have had [you]181-jim to [myself]1671-i . "[1671-i] " Would [you]181-jim really ? "[1671-i] [she]1671-i asks , in the almost awed tones of one who , from being quite destitute , has had [the Koh - i - Noor]1675-the koh - i - noor put into [his]181-jim hand , and whose fingers are afraid to close over the mighty jewel ; " would [you]181-jim really ? then [I]1671-i am sorry [I]1671-i asked [them]4175-them ; but"—with[1671-i] intense wistfulness—"if [you]181-jim only knew how [I]1671-i long to give [you]181-jim a little pleasure , a little enjoyment — [you]181-jim who have given [me]1671-i so infinitely much . "[1671-i] If [Miss Wilson]200-miss wilson were ever addicted to the figure of speech called irony , [she]1671-i might be supposed to be employing it now ; but one glance at [her]1671-i simple face would show that it expressed nothing but adoring gratitude . [Her]1671-i one good fortnight has spread its radiant veil backwards over [her]1671-i eight barren years . [He]181-jim takes [her]1671-i hand , and passes the fingers across [his]181-jim lips , murmuring indistinctly and guiltily behind [them]1676-them : " Do [I]181-jim really make [you]1671-i happy ? "[181-jim] " Do you?"—echoes[1671-i] [she]1671-i , while the transfiguring tears well into [her]1671-i glorified pale eyes—"I should not have thought it possible that so much joy could have been packed into any fortnight as [I]1671-i have had crammed into [mine]1671-i ! "[1671-i] [They]1677-they have to set off to [Vallombrosa]95-vallombrosa at seven o'clock in the morning , an hour at which few of [us]1678-our are at [our]1678-our cleverest , handsomest , or [our]1678-our best tempered ; nor is the party of six , either in its proportion of [women]502-women to [men]512-men — four to two — or in its component parts , [a very well adjusted one]1681-a very well adjusted one . [They]1677-they are too numerous to be contained in [one carriage]1682-one carriage , and are therefore divided into two separate bands — three and three . Whether by [some manœuvre of the well - meaning Amelia]1683-some manœuvre of the well - meaning amelia , or by some scarcely fortunate accident , [Burgoyne]181-jim finds [himself]181-jim seated opposite to [[his]181-jim betrothed]605-his betrothed and to [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth ; while [Byng]203-byng follows in [the second vehicle]1685-the second vehicle as vis - à - vis to [Cecilia]222-cecilia and [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant . There is a general feeling of wrongness about the whole arrangement — a sense of mental discomfort equivalent to that physical one of having put on [your]1686-your clothes inside out , or buttoned [your]1686-your buttons into unanswering buttonholes . [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant 's face , as [Burgoyne]181-jim catches sight of it now and then , as some turn in [the road]3320-the road reveals the inmates of [the closely - following second carriage]1688-the closely - following second carriage to [his]181-jim view , wears that uneasy and disquieted look which always disfigures it when there is any question of [her]193-elizabeth being brought into personal relation with [strangers]538-strangers . And [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth , of whom [he]181-jim has naturally a much nearer and more continuous view , is plainly ill - at - ease . [Miss Wilson]200-miss wilson has not thought it necessary to mention to [[her]200-miss wilson lover]699-her lover how strong had been the opposition to [her]200-miss wilson plan on the part of [the objects of it]1691-the objects of it ; nor , that it was only because [her]200-miss wilson proposal was made vivâ voce , and therefore unescapable , that it had been reluctantly accepted at last . At first [Burgoyne]181-jim had attributed [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth 's evident ill - at - easeness to [her]193-elizabeth separation from [Byng]203-byng ; but [he]181-jim presently discovers that it is what [she]193-elizabeth possesses , and not what [she]193-elizabeth lacks , that is the chief source of [her]193-elizabeth malaise . During the latter part of [his]181-jim own personal intercourse with [her]193-elizabeth [she]193-elizabeth had been , when in [his]181-jim company , sometimes sad , sometimes wildly merry ; but always entirely natural . Strange as it may seem , it is obviously the presence of [Amelia]201-amelia that puts constraint upon [her]193-elizabeth . Before the spirit of that most unterrifying of [[God]214-god 's creatures]1692-god 's creatures , [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth 's " stands rebuked . "[181-jim] Once or twice [he]181-jim sees [her]193-elizabeth inborn gaiety — that gaiety whose existence [he]181-jim has so often noted as it struggles up from under the mysterious weight of sorrow laid upon it — spurt into life , only to be instantly killed by the reassumption of that nervous formal manner which not all [Amelia]201-amelia 's gentle efforts can break through . A very grave trio [they]1693-they drive along through the grave day . For it is , alas ! a grave day — overcast , now turning to rain , now growing fair again awhile . Not a grain of [Italy]18-italy 's summer curse , [her]193-elizabeth choking white dust , assails [their]1693-they nostrils . It must have rained all night . Through [the suburbs]1694-the suburbs by [the river]449-the river , crossing and recrossing that ugly iron interloper [the railway]668-the railway ; by [the river flowing at the foot of [the fair green hills]1698-the fair green hills]1697-the river flowing at the foot of the fair green hills , so green , so green on this day of ripe accomplished spring . [The whole country]1699-the whole country is one giant green garland , of young wheat below and endless vine necklaces above — necklaces of new juicy , just - born , yet vigorous vine - leaves . [The very river]1700-the very river runs green with the reflection of the endless verdure on [its]1700-the very river banks . [The road]3320-the road is level as far as [Pontassieve]96-pontassieve , [the town through which [they]1693-they roll , and then [it]3320-the road begins to mount]1702-the town through which they roll , and then it begins to mount — mounts between [garden - like hills , dressed in vine leaves and iris - flowers]1703-garden - like hills , dressed in vine leaves and iris - flowers , and the dull fire of red clover ; while [the stream]1704-the stream twists in flowing companionship at [the valley bottom]1705-the valley bottom , until [they]1693-they turn abruptly away from [it]1704-the stream , up into [a steep and narrow valley]1706-a steep and narrow valley , almost a gorge , and climb up and up one side of [it]1704-the stream , turning and winding continually to break the steepness of the ascent . However broken , [it]3320-the road is steep still . But who would wish to pass at more than a foot 's pace through this great sheet of lilac irises wrapping [the mountain side]1707-the mountain side , past this bean - field that greets the nostrils with its homely familiar perfume , along this wealthy bit of hedge , framed wholly of honeysuckle in flower ? At sight of [the latter]423-the latter [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth gives a little cry . " Oh , what honeysuckle ! [I]193-elizabeth must have some ! [I]193-elizabeth must get out ! Tell [him]798-the elder man to stop ! "[193-elizabeth] In a moment [her]193-elizabeth commands are obeyed ; in another moment [Byng]203-byng has sprung out of [the second carriage]1709-the second carriage and is standing beside [her]193-elizabeth . The door of [[Byng]203-byng 's vehicle]1710-byng 's vehicle is stiff apparently , and a sardonic smile breaks over [the elder man]798-the elder man 's face as [he]798-the elder man hears the noise of the resounding kicks administered to it by [the younger one]1712-the younger one 's impatient foot . But [he]798-the elder man need not have been in such a hurry — [no one]819-no one interferes with [his]798-the elder man office of rifling the hedge of its creamy and coral bugles . [Burgoyne]181-jim gets out of [the carriage]3765-the carriage ; but it is only to walk to [the other one]1076-the other one and assume [Byng]203-byng 's vacated seat . " Are [you]181-jim going to change places ? "[201-amelia] [Amelia]201-amelia has asked rather chapfallenly as [he]181-jim leaves [her]201-amelia ; and [he]181-jim has given [her]201-amelia hand a hasty pressure , and answered affectionately — " It will not be for long , [dear]3358-dear ; but [you]3358-dear know"—with[181-jim] an expressive glance , and what [he]181-jim rather too sanguinely hopes looks like a smile in the direction of the flower - gatherers—"fair play is a jewel ! "[181-jim] If [his]181-jim departure from [the one vehicle]1716-the one vehicle is deplored , it is not welcomed at the other . [Cecilia]222-cecilia asks the same question as [[her]222-cecilia sister]720-her sister had put , though the intonation is different . " Are [you]181-jim going to change places?"—adding—"do[181-jim] not [you]181-jim think [we]1718-we did very well as [we]1718-we were ? " But probably [he]181-jim is too much occupied in wrestling with the stiff door to hear [her]201-amelia , for [he]181-jim makes no answer beyond getting in . The only reward that [he]181-jim receives for [his]181-jim piece of self - sacrifice is a rapturous look of gratitude from [Byng]203-byng , when [he]181-jim perceives the changed position of [his]181-jim affairs , and that recompense [Jim]181-jim had far rather have been without . [They]1718-we are off again . Being now second in [the little procession]4177-the little procession , [Burgoyne]181-jim has but meagre and difficult views of the first ; but now and again , when [the road]3320-the road describes an acuter angle than usual , [he]181-jim can by turning [his]181-jim whole body , under pretext of admiring the view , snatch a glimpse of [all three occupants]4179-all three occupants leaning [their]4179-all three occupants heads sociably together , evidently in bright light talk . After all , [he]181-jim had deceived [himself]181-jim . It is [he]181-jim and not [Amelia]201-amelia who had made [her]201-amelia shy . Even when [he]181-jim can not see [her]201-amelia , there come to [his]181-jim ears little wafts of laughter , in which [her]201-amelia voice is mixed . [He]181-jim catches [himself]181-jim trying to recall whether [she]201-amelia had laughed even once during the period of [his]181-jim being [[her]201-amelia companion]540-her companion . There is not much mirth in [[his]181-jim own carriage]4181-his own carriage . What a kill - joy [he]181-jim has grown ! [Cecilia]222-cecilia , though [her]222-cecilia heart is as pure as the babe unborn of any serious designs on [Byng]203-byng , of which indeed [she]222-cecilia has long seen the fruitlessness , yet thinks [a sulky brother - in - law]4182-a sulky brother - in - law - elect but a poor exchange for [a handsome young acquaintance]4183-a handsome young acquaintance , whom neither [his]181-jim good manners nor the amount of [his]181-jim intimacy allow to sit opposite to [her]222-cecilia in grumpy silence . [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant is obviously as ill at ease as was [[her]189-mrs. le marchant daughter]3525-her daughter when in [his]181-jim fellowship , though in this case a little observation shows [him]181-jim that [he]181-jim counts for nothing in [her]189-mrs. le marchant discomfort of mind , but that [she]189-mrs. le marchant is watching the other half of the party with an anxiety as keen , if almost as covert , as [his]181-jim own . [She]189-mrs. le marchant is too well - bred indeed not to endeavour to keep up a decent show of conversation , but as [neither of [[her]189-mrs. le marchant companions]3661-her companions]4185-neither of her companions makes any effort to second [her]189-mrs. le marchant , an ever - deepening silence falls upon [them]3661-her companions as [they]3661-her companions advance , nor , as the day grows older , is the weather calculated to exhilarate [their]3661-her companions spirits . The sky 's frown becomes more and more pronounced the higher [they]3661-her companions mount . Through [a village]4187-a village nobly seated on [[its]4187-a village hilltop]3733-its hilltop , but , like [most Italian townlets]4189-most italian townlets , squalid enough on a nearer view — up and up — up and up — till [they]3661-her companions reach what were once groves of stately chestnuts , but where the hungry Tuscan axe has left nothing but twigs and saplings , but never a spreading tree ; then on into [the fir - woods]4190-the fir - woods , which are [woods]4191-woods indeed , though even here the hatchet 's cruel tooth has begun to bite . No sooner is [their]3661-her companions dark umbrage reached than the mist , that has been hanging with threatening lowness above [the travellers]4192-the travellers ' heads , comes down close , blinding , clinging like wet flannel , and as thick . "[181-jim] Perhaps it will lift , " [Jim]181-jim says , with a sort of dismal unlikely hopefulness as [he]181-jim strains [his]181-jim eyes , trying to look down [the straight solemn fir aisles]4193-the straight solemn fir aisles , with [their]3661-her companions files upon files of tall stems , that seem to be seen only as if through a thick gauze . Neither of [[his]181-jim companions]3675-his companions has the spirit necessary to echo the supposition . [The road]3320-the road winds endlessly , steeper and steeper up through the mist . [The tired horses]4196-the tired horses step wearily , and [the unfortunate pleasure - seekers]4197-the unfortunate pleasure - seekers are beginning to think that the muffled monotony of firs , of [winding road]4198-winding road , of [painfully labouring horses]4199-painfully labouring horses , will never end , when [the vetturino]4200-the vetturino turns round with a smile on [his]4200-the vetturino fog - wet face , and says , "[181-jim] Vallombrosa ! " Under other circumstances , the announcement might have been cheering , might have excited a poetic curiosity ; but as it is , the hood of [the vehicle]1229-the vehicle — necessarily raised some miles back — is so far poked forward that nothing is to be seen but a pour of rain — the rain has begun to descend in torrents — a glass - door in a house - wall opening to admit [them]3661-her companions , and [a waiter]678-a waiter holding up a green umbrella to protect [their]3661-her companions descent . Neither [he]181-jim nor [the landlord]4203-the landlord , nor yet [the chambermaid]4204-the chambermaid , show any signs of mirth or wonder at [their]3661-her companions arrival among the clouds on such a day . [They]3661-her companions are used to [mad Inglese]4205-mad inglese . And amongst [the mad Inglese]302-the mad inglese [themselves]3661-her companions there is certainly no temptation to mad merriment . On such an occasion there is nothing to do but eat , so [they]3661-her companions lunch dismally in [a long , bare dining - room]4206-a long , bare dining - room , with a carpetless floor , a table laid for a grossly improbable number of [guests]4207-guests , and a feeling of searching cold . Having spun out [their]3661-her companions scanty meal to the utmost limits of possibility , and washed it down with the weakest red wine that ever lived in a wicker bottle , [they]3661-her companions pass into [a funereal salon]4208-a funereal salon , to which [the waiter]4209-the waiter invites [them]3661-her companions . [Someone]529-someone makes the cheering announcement that [they]3661-her companions have as yet been [here]637-here only half an hour , and that [the horses]4212-the horses must have two full hours to bait before there can be any question of beginning the return journey . And then [they]3661-her companions amble about [the room]442-the room , looking at the dreadful lithographs of [Italy]18-italy 's plain King and [fair Queen on the walls]4214-fair queen on the walls ; at the venerable journals and gaudy English storybook , so dull as to have been forgotten by [its owner]487-its owner , on the table . [Their]3661-her companions spirits are not heightened by a pervading sense as of being in [a cellar]1324-a cellar , minus the wine . The equipment of [this pleasant apartment]4217-this pleasant apartment is completed by a half - dead nosegay of what must once have been charming mountain blossoms . The sight decides [them]3661-her companions . [They]3661-her companions must go out . Perhaps even through this opaque cloud [they]3661-her companions may dimly see the mountain flowers growing , the mountain brooks dashing , which [John Milton]303-john milton has told [them]3661-her companions that — [They]3661-her companions all catch at the suggestion , when made by [Byng]203-byng , and presently sally forth to see as much of [Vallombrosa]95-vallombrosa as a fog that would not have disgraced [the Strand]97-the strand , as a close blanket of almost confluent rain , and as umbrellas held well down over [their]3661-her companions cold noses , will let [them]3661-her companions ; [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant alone declines to be one of [the party]3587-the party , and is left sitting , swaddled in all the superfluous wraps , on a horsehair chair in [the salon]3584-the salon , to stare at the wall and at [King Humbert]304-king humbert 's ugly face , until such time as [[her]189-mrs. le marchant companions]3661-her companions see fit to release [her]189-mrs. le marchant . It is no wonder that [Burgoyne]181-jim overhears [her]189-mrs. le marchant eagerly whispering to [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth a request that [she]189-mrs. le marchant will not stay too long away . And [Elizabeth , whose spirits have gone up like a rocket at the prospect of a taste of the fresh air]4221-elizabeth , whose spirits have gone up like a rocket at the prospect of a taste of the fresh air , and who knows what else , lays [her]4221-elizabeth , whose spirits have gone up like a rocket at the prospect of a taste of the fresh air little face , crowned with a deer - stalking cap , against [[her]4221-elizabeth , whose spirits have gone up like a rocket at the prospect of a taste of the fresh air mother]3300-her mother 's , and promises , and skips away . At first [they]3661-her companions all five keep together , wet but sociable . [They]3661-her companions ask [their]3661-her companions way to [the Paradiso]4223-the paradiso — the name sounds ironical — and set off climbing up through [the fir - wood]4224-the fir - wood in the direction indicated ; along a path which in fair weather must be heavenly with piny odours , but which is now only a miry alternative of dripping stones and muddy puddles . Through the mist [they]3661-her companions see indeed fair flowers gleaming , yellow anemones , unfamiliar and lovely , but they are too drenched to pluck . The sound of falling water guides [them]3661-her companions to where [the clear brook]4225-the clear brook — clear even to - day — falls in little cascades down [the hill]1467-the hill 's face between the pines . How delicious to sit on [its]4225-the clear brook flat stones some hot summer 's noon , with [your]4227-your hands coolly straying among its grasses , or dabbling in its bright water ; but to - day [they]3661-her companions can but look at it sadly from the low bridge , saying sighingly , "[181-jim] If ! " [They]3661-her companions reach the goal , some cross , and all floundering , [the ladies with draggled skirts and cold , dank ankles]4228-the ladies with draggled skirts and cold , dank ankles . [The Paradiso]4223-the paradiso is [a little house]4230-a little house , [a dépendance apparently of [the hotel below]4232-the hotel below]4231-a dépendance apparently of the hotel below — apparently also tenantless and empty . [It]4223-the paradiso is built on [the bare rock]4233-the bare rock , looking sheer down on — what ? on a blanket of fog . What does , what can , that maddening blanket conceal ? Oh , if [they]3661-her companions could but tear it in pieces , rend it asunder , hack it with knives , by any means abolish its unsightly veil from over the lovely face [they]3661-her companions will now , with all [their]3661-her companions climbing , all [their]3661-her companions early rising , never see ! But will not [they]3661-her companions ? Even as [they]3661-her companions look , despairingly straining [their]3661-her companions eyes , in the vain effort to pierce that obscure and baffling veil , there is a movement in it , a stirring of the inert mass of vapour ; a wind has risen , and is blowing coldly on [their]3661-her companions brows , and in a moment , as it seems , the maddening wet curtain is swept away and up , as by some God - hand , the hand of some spirit that has heard [their]3661-her companions lament and has pitied [them]3661-her companions and said , "[1719-they] [They]1719-they have come from afar ; it is [their]1719-they only chance ; let [us]1720-us show it to [them]1719-they . " The curtain has rolled up and up , the sombre fir - wood starts out , and [the emerald meadows]4234-the emerald meadows , [the lowest and nearest range of hills]4235-the lowest and nearest range of hills , then the next , and then the next , and then the furthest and highest of all . There [they]3661-her companions stand revealed , even [the city]850-the city , [Florence]20-florence , far away . [They]3661-her companions can make out [her]20-florence Duomo , small and dim with distance , yet certainly there ; in the sudden effulgence all [the valley]1312-the valley alight and radiant . Range behind range stand [the hills]858-the hills ; belated vapour wreaths floating , thin as lawn , up [their]858-the hills flanks ; wonderful dreamy patches of radiance on [the far slopes]4239-the far slopes ; marvellous amethysts starring [their]858-the hills breasts . Mystery and beauty , colour and space , sky and [lovely land]4240-lovely land , where , five minutes ago , there was nothing but choking fog . [Burgoyne]181-jim stands as in a trance , vaguely conscious — trance - wise too — that [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth is near [him]181-jim ; all [his]181-jim soul passed into [his]181-jim eyes ; stands — how long ? [He]181-jim hardly knows . Before that fair sight time seems dead ; but even as [he]181-jim yet looks , smiling as [one]501-one smiles at anything surpassingly lovely , the cloud - wreaths float downwards again , wreaths at first , then great volumes , then one universal sheet of vapour , impenetrably dense as before . Vanished are [the Apennine slopes]4242-the apennine slopes , sun - kissed and dreamy ; vanished [the distant [Arno]45-arno plain]4243-the distant arno plain ; vanished even [the near pines]4244-the near pines . [He]181-jim can scarce see [his]181-jim hand before [him]181-jim . And yet [he]181-jim can see [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth 's face transfigured and quivering , lifted to [his]181-jim — yes , to [his]181-jim — though [Byng]203-byng is on [her]203-byng other side ; [her]203-byng eyes full of tender tears of ravishment , while [her]203-byng low voice says sighingly : "[1720-us] It is gone ; but [we]1721-they have seen it ! Nothing can ever take that from [us]1721-they ! nothing ! nothing ! " And although the next moment [she]203-byng is reabsorbed into the fog and [Byng]203-byng , though for the rest of the deplorable walk [he]181-jim scarce catches sight again of the little brown head and the soaked deer - stalking cap , yet it makes a gentle warmth about [his]181-jim chilled heart to think that , in [her]203-byng moments of highest emotion , it is [her]203-byng impulse to turn to [him]181-jim . Not once again , so long as [they]1721-they remain at [Vallombrosa]95-vallombrosa , does the envious cloud - blanket lift ; and , after slopping about for some time longer , in the vain hope that it will , [Burgoyne]181-jim and [[his]181-jim two female relatives - elect]4245-his two female relatives - elect return to [the inn]4246-the inn , all fallen very silent . [The other two members of the party]4247-the other two members of the party have disappeared into the fog . At the door of [the hotel]1144-the hotel [they]1721-they find [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant , who has broken from [her]189-mrs. le marchant cerements , and is looking anxiously out . As [she]189-mrs. le marchant catches sight of [them]1721-they the look of tension on [her]189-mrs. le marchant face lessens . "[3469-the others] Oh , here [you]1722-you are ! " says [she]189-mrs. le marchant . "[3469-the others] [I]0-i am so glad ; and the others — no doubt [the others]3469-the others are close behind . " "[3469-the others] [We]1724-us know nothing about [the others]3469-the others , " replies [Cecilia]222-cecilia , with some ill - humour , taking upon [her]222-cecilia the office of spokeswoman , which neither of [[her]222-cecilia companions]3661-her companions seems in any hurry to assume ; "[3469-the others] [the others]3469-the others took French leave of [us]1724-us an hour ago . Oh dear , how wet [I]0-i am ! What a horrible excursion ! How [I]0-i detest [Vallombrosa]95-vallombrosa ! " [Amelia]201-amelia is to the full as wet as [[her]201-amelia sister]720-her sister ; nothing can well be more lamentable than the appearance of either ; and upon [Amelia]201-amelia 's face there is , in addition to a handsome share of splashes of rain , a look of mortification and crestfallenness ; but [she]201-amelia now puts in [her]201-amelia word , with [her]201-amelia usual patience and thoughtful good - temper . "[0-i] [I]0-i do not think [you]1727-you need be in the least anxious about [them]3469-the others , " [she]0-i says , observing the immediate relapse into what seems an exaggerated concern following instantly upon [Cecilia]222-cecilia 's remark on [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant 's features ; "[3469-the others] [they]3469-the others were with [us]1724-us not long ago . [We]1724-us were certainly all together not so long ago ; [they]3469-the others were with [us]1724-us at [the Paradiso]4223-the paradiso — [they]3469-the others were certainly with [us]1724-us at [the Paradiso]98-the paradiso ? " turning with an interrogative air to [Burgoyne]181-jim . "[3469-the others] Yes , [they]3469-the others were certainly with [us]1724-us at the Paradiso , " [he]181-jim assents , not thinking it necessary to add why [he]181-jim is so very certain as to this fact . "[3469-the others] [They]3469-the others must have so much inducement to loiter this charming weather , " cries [Cecilia]222-cecilia , with an exasperated laugh . "[3469-the others] Oh , how wet [I]0-i am ! [I]0-i do not expect that [we]1724-us shall any of [us]1724-us forget [Vallombrosa]95-vallombrosa in a hurry ! [I]0-i shall go and ask [the chambermaid]4204-the chambermaid to lend [me]0-i some dry shoes and stockings . " With these words [she]0-i walks towards the staircase and climbs it , leaving a muddy imprint on each step to mark [her]0-i progress as [she]0-i mounts . [Amelia]201-amelia does not at once follow [her]222-cecilia example . [She]201-amelia remains standing where [she]201-amelia was , [her]201-amelia arms hanging listlessly by [her]201-amelia sides , and the expression of crestfallenness deepened on [her]201-amelia fagged face . [[Her]1730-her lover]699-her lover is touched by [her]201-amelia look , and , going up to [her]1730-her , lays [his]699-her lover hand kindly and solicitously on [her]1730-her shoulder . "[4204-the chambermaid] Umbrellas are not what they were in [my]0-i days , " [he]699-her lover says , trying to smile . "[1730-her] [You]1730-her are quite as wet as [Cis]222-cecilia , though [you]1730-her do not proclaim [your]1730-her sufferings nearly so loudly . Had not [you]1730-her better go and see whether [the chambermaid]4204-the chambermaid owns two pairs of dry stockings ? " [She]1730-her lifts [her]1730-her eyes with wistful gratitude to [his]699-her lover . "[4204-the chambermaid] This is [my]0-i treat , " [she]0-i says slowly ; "[0-i] [my]0-i first treat to [you]0-i ; oh , poor [Jim]181-jim ! " There is a depth of compassion in [her]0-i tone as disproportioned to the apparent cause as had been [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant 's anxiety for [[her]0-i daughter]3525-her daughter 's return , and beneath it [he]699-her lover winces . "[181-jim] Why do [you]0-i pity [me]0-i ? " [he]699-her lover inquires half indignantly . "[0-i] Am [I]0-i — What do [I]0-i care for a little rain ? " Adding cheerfully , "[0-i] [You]0-i shall give [me]0-i a second treat , [dear]3358-dear ; [we]1733-ourselves will come here again by [ourselves]1733-ourselves when the sun shines . " "[1733-ourselves] By [ourselves]1733-ourselves — when the sun shines ! " echoes [she]0-i , as if repeating a lesson ; and then [she]0-i goes off docilely , in obedience to [his]699-her lover suggestion , in search of dry raiment . [He]699-her lover rejoins [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant , whose unaccountable fears have led [her]0-i beyond [[the house]986-the house 's shelter]4254-the house 's shelter out into the rain , where [she]0-i stands looking down that river of mud which represents [the road by which [she]0-i hopes to see [the truants]4256-the truants reappear]4255-the road by which she hopes to see the truants reappear . "[0-i] [I]0-i think [you]0-i are unnecessarily alarmed , " [he]699-her lover says , in a reassuring and remonstrating tone . "[0-i] What harm could have happened to [them]1734-them ? " [She]0-i does not answer , [her]0-i eyes , into which the rain is beating under [her]0-i umbrella brim , still fixed upon [the empty road]4257-the empty road . "[0-i] Is [she]0-i — is [she]0-i apt to take cold ? " [he]699-her lover asks , [his]699-her lover own tone catching the infection of [her]0-i vague and nameless disquiet . "[0-i] Yes — no — not particularly , [I]0-i think . Oh , it is not that!"—her composure breaking down into an unaffected outburst of distress . "[0-i] It is not that ! Do not [you]0-i understand ? Oh , how unwilling [I]0-i was to come here to - day ! It is — do not [you]0-i see ? Oh , [I]0-i should not mind in the least if it had been [you]0-i that were with [her]0-i ! " "[0-i] If it had been [I]0-i that was with [her]0-i ? " repeats [Jim]181-jim slowly , not at the first instant comprehending , nor even at the second quite taking in the full , though unintentional , uncomplimentariness of this speech ; which , however , before [[his]699-her lover companion]603-his companion again takes up [her]0-i parable , has tinglingly reached — what ? [His]699-her lover heart , or only [his]699-her lover vanity ? [They]4259-they lie very close together . "[0-i] Why did not [he]1735-him go [home]401-home with [[his]1735-him mother]3511-his mother ? " pursues [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant , still in that voice of intense vexation . "[0-i] It would have been so much more natural that [he]1735-him should , and [I]0-i am sure that [she]0-i wished it . " "[0-i] [You]0-i are making [me]0-i feel extremely uncomfortable , " says [Burgoyne]181-jim gravely ; "[0-i] when [I]0-i remember that it was [I]0-i who introduced [him]1735-him to [you]0-i . " "[0-i] Oh , [I]0-i am not blaming [you]0-i ! " replies [she]0-i , with an obvious effort to resume [her]0-i usual courteous manner . "[0-i] Please do not think that [I]0-i am blaming [you]0-i . How could [you]0-i help it ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i thought [you]0-i liked [him]1735-him . " "[0-i] Oh , so [I]0-i do — so [we]1738-we both do ! " cries [the poor woman]553-the poor woman agitatedly . "[0-i] That is the worst of it ! If [I]0-i did not like [him]1735-him , [I]0-i should not mind ; at least , [I]0-i should not mind half so much . " "[0-i] [I]0-i am very sorry , " [he]1735-him begins ; but [she]553-the poor woman interrupts [him]1735-him . "[0-i] Do not be sorry , " [she]553-the poor woman says remorsefully ; "[0-i] [you]0-i have nothing to say to it . [I]0-i do not know , [I]0-i am sure"—looking gratefully at [him]1735-him through the rain—"why[0-i] [I]0-i am always regaling [you]0-i with [my]0-i worries ; but [you]0-i are so dependable — [we]1738-we both feel that [you]0-i are so dependable . " "[0-i] Am [I]0-i ? " says [he]1735-him , with a melancholy air that does not argue much gratification at the compliment . "[0-i] Do not be too sure of that . " But [she]553-the poor woman does not heed [his]1735-him disclaimer . "[0-i] [We]1738-we have been so happy here , " [she]553-the poor woman goes on ; "[1738-we] [I]0-i do not mean here"—looking round with an involuntary smile at the envelope of wet vapour that encases [them]1738-we both—"but[20-florence] at [Florence]20-florence ; so peacefully , blessedly happy , [she]0-i and [I]0-i — [you]0-i do not know"—with an appealing touch of pathos—"what[0-i] [a dear little companion]1739-a dear little companion [she]0-i is!—so happy that [I]0-i naturally do not want [our]1738-we memory of [the place]1740-the place to be spoilt by any painful contretemps . [You]0-i can understand that , can not [you]0-i ? " It is senseless of [him]1735-him ; but yet , little as [he]1735-him can comprehend why it should be so , the idea of [Byng]203-byng 's love being described as a "[0-i] painful contretemps " presents itself not disagreeably to [his]1735-him mind . For whatever mysterious reason , it is apparent that even [[Byng]203-byng 's own mother]4261-byng 's own mother can not be much more adverse to [his]1735-him suit than is [the lady before [him]1735-him]4262-the lady before him . "[0-i] [I]0-i can perfectly enter into [your]0-i feelings , " [he]1735-him answers , with sympathetic gravity ; "[0-i] but do not [you]0-i know that ' a watched pot never boils ' ? As long as [you]0-i are looking for them , they will never appear ; but the moment that [your]0-i back is turned [they]1741-they will probably come round the corner at once . " "[1741-they] [I]0-i think it is the truest proverb in [the world]3184-the world , " [she]0-i says , with an impatient sigh ; but [she]0-i allows [him]1735-him to guide [her]0-i and [her]0-i umbrella back to [the inn]4246-the inn . [Burgoyne]181-jim 's prediction is not verified ; probably [he]1735-him had no very great faith in it [himself]1735-him . [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant 's back has , for the best part of an hour , been turned upon [the mountain road]4264-the mountain road , and [the stragglers]4265-the stragglers have not yet rejoined [the main body]4266-the main body . There has been plenty of time for [Cecilia]222-cecilia to be thoroughly dried , warmed , comforted , and restored to good humour ; for [the vetturino]4200-the vetturino to send in and ask whether [he]4200-the vetturino shall not put the horses to ; for [Amelia]201-amelia to exhaust all [her]201-amelia little repertory of soothing hypotheses ; for [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant to stray in restless misery from salon to [salle - à - manger]4268-salle - à - manger and back again , and for [Burgoyne]181-jim to pull gloomily at a large cigar in [the hall]4269-the hall by [himself]181-jim before at length the voices of [the truants]4256-the truants are heard . [Burgoyne]181-jim being , as [I]1741-they have said , in [the hall]4269-the hall , and therefore nearest the door of entrance , has the earliest sight of [them]4256-the truants . [His]181-jim first glance tells [him]181-jim that the blow apprehended by [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant has fallen . Of [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth , indeed , [he]181-jim scarcely catches a glimpse , as [she]193-elizabeth passes [him]181-jim precipitately , hurrying to meet [[her]193-elizabeth mother]3300-her mother , who , at the sound of [her]193-elizabeth voice , has come running into [the outer room]4273-the outer room . But [Byng]203-byng ! [Byng]203-byng has not experienced so many very strong emotions in [his]181-jim short life as to have had much practice in veiling them from the eyes of [others]736-others when [they]736-others come , and the gauze now drawn over [his]181-jim intolerable radiance is of the thinnest description . Again that earnest desire to hit [him]181-jim hard assails [the elder friend]4275-the elder friend . "[1741-they] Why , [you]1743-you are back before [us]1744-we ! " cries [the young man]643-the young man . "[1743-you] Yes , [we]1744-we are back before [you]1743-you , " replies [Burgoyne]181-jim ; and if the penalty had been death , [he]181-jim could not at that moment have added one syllable to the acrid assent . "[1743-you] Are [we]1744-we late ? " asks [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth tremulously ; "[0-i] [I]0-i am afraid [we]1744-we are late — [I]0-i am afraid [we]1744-we have kept [you]1743-you waiting ! Oh , [I]0-i am so sorry ! " [She]193-elizabeth looks with an engaging timidity of apology from one to other of [the sulky countenances around [her]193-elizabeth]4277-the sulky countenances around her ; and [Burgoyne]181-jim stealing a look at [her]193-elizabeth , [their]1744-we eyes meet . [He]181-jim is startled by the singularity of expression in [hers]193-elizabeth . Whatever it denotes , it certainly is not the stupid simplicity of rapture to be read , in print as big as a poster 's , in [Byng]203-byng 's . And yet , among the many ingredients that go to make up that shy fevered beam , rapture is undoubtedly one . "[0-i] Did [you]1743-you lose [yourselves]1743-you ? Did [you]1743-you go further into [the wood]1745-the wood ? " asks [Cecilia]222-cecilia , with a curiosity that is , considering the provocation given , not unjustifiable . [They]1744-we both reply vaguely that [they]1744-we had lost [themselves]1744-we , that [they]1744-we had gone deeper into [the wood]1745-the wood . It is obvious to the meanest intelligence that neither of [them]1744-we has the slightest idea where [they]1744-we have been . "[1743-you] [I]0-i may as well tell [the driver]1442-the driver to put the horses in , " says [Burgoyne]181-jim , in a matter - of - fact voice , glad of an excuse to absent [himself]181-jim . When [he]181-jim comes back , [he]181-jim finds [the Le Marchants]261-the le marchants standing together in the window , talking in a low voice , and [Byng]203-byng hovering near [them]261-the le marchants . It is evident to [Jim]181-jim that [the elder woman]3305-the elder woman has no wish for converse with [the young man]643-the young man ; but in [his]643-the young man present condition of dizzy exhilaration , [he]643-the young man is quite unaware of that fact . [He]643-the young man approaches [her]3305-the elder woman indeed ( as [the unobserved watcher]4281-the unobserved watcher notes ) with a dreadful air of filial piety , and addresses [her]3305-the elder woman in a tone of apology it is true , but with a twang of intimacy that had never appeared in [his]643-the young man voice before . "[0-i] [You]1747-you must not blame [her]1748-her ; indeed [you]1747-you must not ! it was entirely [my]0-i fault . [I]0-i am awfully sorry that [you]1747-you were alarmed , but indeed there was no cause . What did [you]1747-you think had happened ? Did [you]1747-you think"—with an excited laugh of triumph and a bright blush—"that[1747-you] [I]0-i had run off with [her]1748-her ? " The speech is in extremely bad taste , since , whatever may be the posture of affairs between [himself]643-the young man and [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth , it is morally impossible that [[her]193-elizabeth mother]3300-her mother can yet be enlightened as to it ; the familiarity of it is therefore premature and the jocosity ill - placed . [No one]819-no one can be more disposed to judge it severely than its unintended auditor ; but even [he]643-the young man is startled by the effect it produces . Without making the smallest attempt at an answer , [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant instantly turns [her]189-mrs. le marchant shoulder upon [the young man]643-the young man — a snub of which [Jim]181-jim would have thought so gentle - mannered [a person]1281-a person quite incapable , and walks away from [him]643-the young man with so determined an air that not even [a person in the seventh heaven of drunkenness]4286-a person in the seventh heaven of drunkenness can mistake [her]189-mrs. le marchant meaning . Nor does [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth 's conduct offer [him]643-the young man any indemnification . [She]193-elizabeth follows [[her]193-elizabeth mother]3300-her mother a little more slowly ; and , as [she]193-elizabeth passes [Jim]181-jim , [he]181-jim sees that [she]193-elizabeth is shaking violently , and that [her]193-elizabeth face is as white as chalk . A sort of generous indignation against [the mother]579-the mother for spoiling [the poor little soul]4289-the poor little soul 's first moments of bliss mixes curiously in [his]181-jim mind with a less noble satisfaction at the reflection that there are undoubtedly breakers ahead of [Byng]203-byng . "[1747-you] How — how are [we]1749-they to divide ? " cries [Cecilia]222-cecilia , as [they]1749-they all stand at the door while [the two carriages]4290-the two carriages drive up . [No one]819-no one answers . The arrangement seems planned by [no one in particular]4292-no one in particular , and yet , as [he]181-jim drives down [the hill]1467-the hill , [Burgoyne]181-jim finds [himself]181-jim sitting opposite the two [Misses Wilson]255-the misses wilson . [He]181-jim is thankful that the raised hood and unfurled umbrellas of the second equipage prevent [his]181-jim having any ocular evidence of the ecstasy that that wet leather and that dripping silk veil . But even this consolation is not long left [him]181-jim . As [they]1749-they leave the fir - wood , [they]1749-they come out of the clouds too , into clear , lower air . Hoods are pushed back and umbrellas shut . The horses , in good heart , with homeward - turned heads , pricked with emulation by [another carriage]4294-another carriage ahead of [them]1749-they , trot cheerfully down [the road]3320-the road — [the road]3320-the road with all its bent - elbow turnings — down , down , into [the valley beneath]4297-the valley beneath . But the clouds that have rolled away off the evening sky seem to have settled down with double density upon the spirit of [Burgoyne]181-jim and [[his]181-jim companions]3675-his companions . Even the fountain of [Cecilia]222-cecilia 's chatter is dried . Once [she]222-cecilia says suddenly à propos de bottes : "[1750-she] [She]1750-she must be years older than [he]1751-he ! " To which [Amelia]201-amelia quickly rejoins — "[1750-she] But [she]1750-she does not look it . " It is almost the only remark [she]222-cecilia makes during the long drive , and [Burgoyne]181-jim is thankful to [her]222-cecilia for [her]222-cecilia silence . Conscious of and grateful for [her]222-cecilia magnanimity as [he]181-jim is , there is yet something that jars upon [him]181-jim in [her]222-cecilia intuition of [his]181-jim thoughts , and in [her]222-cecilia eager championship of [that other woman]4299-that other woman . [He]181-jim looks out blankly at the flowers , wetly smiling from [field]4300-field and bank , at the endless garden of embracing vines and embraced mulberries , joining [their]4301-their young leafage ; at [the stealing river]4302-the stealing river and [the verdurous hill - sides]4303-the verdurous hill - sides . In vain for [him]181-jim [Italy]18-italy 's spring laughter broadens across the eternal youth of [her]222-cecilia face . On reaching [Florence]20-florence and [the Anglo - Américain]82-the anglo - américain , [he]181-jim would fain enter and spend the evening with [[his]181-jim betrothed]605-his betrothed . [He]181-jim has a feverish horror of being left alone with [his]181-jim own thoughts , but [she]222-cecilia gently forbids [him]181-jim . "[1750-she] It would not be fair upon [father]3390-father and [Sybilla]221-sybilla , " [she]222-cecilia says . "[1750-she] [I]0-i am afraid [they]1753-they have not been getting on very well téte - à - téte together all this wet day , and [I]0-i should not be much good to [you]1754-he in any case . [I]0-i feel stupid . [You]1754-he will say"—smiling—"that there is nothing very new in that ; but [I]0-i am quite beyond even [my]0-i usual mark to - night . Good - night , [dear]3358-dear ; [I]0-i humbly beg [your]1754-he pardon for having caused [you]1754-he to spend such a wretched day . [I]0-i will never give [you]1754-he another treat — never , never ! it was [my]0-i first and last attempt . "[0-i] [She]0-i turns from [him]1754-he dejectedly , and [he]1754-he is [himself]1754-he too dejected to attempt any reassuring falsities . [She]0-i would not have believed [him]1754-he if [he]1754-he had told [her]0-i that it had not been a wretched day to [him]1754-he , and the publicity of [their]1755-their place of parting forbids [him]1754-he to administer even the silent consolation of a kiss . And yet [he]1754-he feels a sort of remorse at having said nothing , as the door closes upon [her]0-i depressed back . [Backs]306-backs can look quite as depressed as faces . The lateness of [their]1755-their start [home]401-home has thrown [their]1755-their return late . [Burgoyne]181-jim reflects that [he]1754-he may as well dine at once , and then trudge through [his]1754-he solitary evening as best [he]1754-he may . Heaven knows at what hour [Byng]203-byng may return . Shall [he]1754-he await [his]1754-he coming , and so get over the announcement of [his]1754-he bliss to - night , or put the dark hours between [himself]1754-he and it ? [He]1754-he decides in favour of getting it over to - night , up to whatever small hour [he]1754-he may be obliged to attend [[his]1754-he friend]393-his friend 's arrival . But [he]1754-he has not to wait nearly so long as [he]1754-he expects . [He]1754-he has not to wait at all , hardly . A passing movement of involuntary admiration traverses [the other]396-the other 's heart as [he]1754-he looks at [him]1754-he . This is how [the human animal]1762-the human animal ought to — was originally intended to — look ! How very far [the average specimen]1763-the average specimen has departed from the type ! There is not much trace of admiration , however , in the tone which [he]1754-he employs for [his]1754-he one brief word of interrogation : " Already ? "[203-byng] That at least is not [your]181-jim fault , " replies [Burgoyne]181-jim dryly ; "[1765-she] [you]181-jim have done [your]181-jim best to avert that catastrophe . " But to speak to [the young man]643-the young man now is of as much avail as to address questions or remonstrances to one walking in [his]643-the young man sleep . "[181-jim] If [she]1765-she had allowed [me]0-i , [I]0-i would have lain on [her]1765-she threshold all night ; [I]0-i would have been the first thing that [her]1765-she heavenly eye lit on ; [I]0-i would — " But [Burgoyne]181-jim 's phial of patience is for the present emptied to [the dregs]4311-the dregs . "[0-i] [You]181-jim would have made a very great fool of [yourself]181-jim , [I]0-i have not the least doubt . Why try to persuade [a person]1281-a person of what [he]1281-a person is already fully convinced ? But as [Miss Le Marchant]240-miss le marchant happily did not wish for [you]181-jim as [a doormat]1767-a doormat , perhaps it is hardly worth while telling [me]0-i what [you]181-jim would have done if [she]1765-she had . " The sarcastic words , ill - natured and unsympathetic as they sound in [[their]4312-their own speaker]4313-their own speaker 's ears , yet avail to bring [the young dreamer]4314-the young dreamer but a very few steps lower down [his]4314-the young dreamer ladder of bliss . "[0-i] [I]0-i beg [your]181-jim pardon , " [he]4314-the young dreamer says sweet - temperedly ; "[181-jim] [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i am [a hideous bore]1768-a hideous bore to - night ; [I]0-i suppose [one]501-one must always be a bore to [other people]4010-other people when [one]501-one is tremendously happy . " "[0-i] It is not [your]181-jim being tremendously happy that [I]0-i quarrel with , " growls [Burgoyne]181-jim , struggling to conquer , or at least tone down , the intense irritability of nerves that [[his]181-jim friend]393-his friend 's flights provoke . "[0-i] [You]181-jim are perfectly right to be that if [you]181-jim can manage to compass it ; but what [I]0-i should be glad to arrive at is [your]181-jim particular ground for it in the present case . " The question , sobering in its tendency , has yet for sole effect the setting Byng off again with spread pinions into the empyrean . "[0-i] What particular ground [I]0-i have ? " [he]181-jim repeats , in a dreamy tone of ecstasy . "[181-jim] [You]181-jim ask what particular ground [I]0-i have ? Had ever [anyone]3161-anyone cause to be so royally happy as [I]0-i ? " [He]181-jim pauses a moment or two , steeped in a rapture of oblivious reverie , then goes on , still as [one only half waked from a beatific vision]4316-one only half waked from a beatific vision : "[3161-anyone] [I]0-i had a prognostic that to - day would be the culminating day — something told [me]0-i that to - day would be the day ; and when [you]181-jim gave [me]0-i up [your]181-jim seat in [[her]1773-her carriage]1774-her carriage — how could [you]181-jim be so magnificently generous ? How can [I]0-i ever adequately show [you]181-jim [my]0-i gratitude ? " "[181-jim] Yes , yes ; never mind that . " "[181-jim] Then , later on , in the wood"—his voice sinking , as that of one who approaches [a Holy of Holies—"when[181-jim] that blessed mist]4317-a holy of holies—"when that blessed mist wrapped [her]1773-her round , wrapped [her]1773-her lovely body round , so that [I]0-i was able to withdraw [her]1773-her from [you]181-jim , so that [you]181-jim did not perceive that [she]1773-her was gone — were not [you]181-jim really aware of it ? Did not it seem to [you]181-jim as if the light had gone out of the day ? When [we]1775-we stood under those dripping trees , as much alone as if — " "[0-i] [I]0-i do not think that there is any need to go into those details , " interrupts [Burgoyne]181-jim , in a hard voice ; "[0-i] [I]0-i imagine that in these cases history repeats itself with very trifling variations ; what [I]0-i should be glad if [you]181-jim would tell [me]0-i is , whether [I]0-i am to understand that [you]181-jim have to - day asked [Miss Le Marchant]240-miss le marchant to marry [you]181-jim ? " [Byng]203-byng brings [his]181-jim eyes , which have been lifted in a sort of trance to the ceiling , down to the prosaic level of [[his]181-jim Mentor]1336-his mentor 's severe and tight - lipped face . "[240-miss le marchant] When [you]181-jim put it in that way , " [he]181-jim says , in an awed half - whisper , "[181-jim] it does seem an inconceivable audacity on [my]0-i part that [I]0-i , who but a few days ago was crawling at [her]240-miss le marchant feet , should dare to - day to reach up to the heaven of [her]240-miss le marchant love . " [Burgoyne]181-jim had known perfectly well that it was coming ; but yet how much worse is it than [he]181-jim had expected ! "[181-jim] Then [you]181-jim did ask [her]240-miss le marchant to marry [you]181-jim ? " But [Byng]203-byng has apparently fled back on the wings of fantasy into [the wet woods of [Vallombrosa]95-vallombrosa]4319-the wet woods of vallombrosa , for [he]181-jim makes no verbal answer . "[240-miss le marchant] [She]240-miss le marchant said yes ? " asks [Burgoyne]181-jim , raising [his]181-jim voice , as if [he]181-jim were addressing [someone deaf]4320-someone deaf . "[240-miss le marchant] Am [I]0-i to understand that [she]240-miss le marchant said yes ? " At the sound of that hard naked query [the dreamer]4321-the dreamer comes out of [[his]181-jim enchanted forest]4322-his enchanted forest again . "[0-i] [I]0-i do not know what [she]240-miss le marchant said ; [I]0-i do not think [she]240-miss le marchant said anything , " [he]181-jim answers , murmuring the words laggingly ; while , as [he]181-jim goes on , the fire of [his]181-jim madness spires high in [his]181-jim flashing eyes . "[240-miss le marchant] [We]1776-we have got beyond speech , [she]240-miss le marchant and [I]0-i ! [We]1776-we have reached that region where hearts and intelligences meet without the need of those vulgar go - betweens — words . " There is a moment 's pause , broken only by the commonplace sound of an electric bell rung by [some inmate of [the hotel]1144-the hotel]4323-some inmate of the hotel . "[240-miss le marchant] And has [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant reached [that region]1777-that region too ? " inquires [Jim]181-jim presently , with an irony [he]181-jim can not restrain . "[189-mrs. le marchant] Does [she]240-miss le marchant , too , understand without words , or have [you]0-i been obliged , in [her]240-miss le marchant case , to employ those vulgar go - betweens ? " "[240-miss le marchant] [She]240-miss le marchant must understand — [she]240-miss le marchant does — undoubtedly [she]240-miss le marchant does ! " cries [Byng]203-byng , whose drunkenness shares with the more ordinary kind the peculiarity of believing whatever [he]181-jim wishes to be not only probable but inevitable . "[240-miss le marchant] Who could see [us]1776-we together and be in uncertainty for a moment ? And [[her]240-miss le marchant mother]3300-her mother has some of [her]3300-her mother fine instincts , [her]3300-her mother delicate intuitions ; not , of course , to the miraculous extent that [she]3300-her mother possesses them . In [her]3300-her mother they amount to genius ! " "[0-i] No doubt , no doubt ; but did [you]0-i trust entirely to [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant 's instincts , or did [you]0-i broach the subject to [her]240-miss le marchant at all ? [You]0-i must have had time , plenty of time , during that long drive [home]401-home . " "[0-i] Well , no , " answers [Byng]203-byng slowly , and with a slight diminution of radiance . "[0-i] [I]0-i meant to have approached it ; [I]0-i tried to do so once or twice ; but [I]0-i thought , [I]0-i fancied — probably it was only fancy — that [she]240-miss le marchant wished to avoid it . " "[240-miss le marchant] To avoid it ? " "[240-miss le marchant] Oh , not in any offensive , obvious way ; it was probably only in [my]0-i imagination that [she]240-miss le marchant shirked it at all — and [I]0-i did not make any great efforts . It was all so perfect"—the intoxication getting the upper hand again—"driving[1780-you] along in that balmy flood of evening radiance — did [you]1780-you see how even the tardy sun came out for us?—with that divine face opposite to [me]0-i ! Such a little face!"—his voice breaking into a tremor . "[1780-you] Is not it inconceivable , [Jim]181-jim , how so much beauty can be packed into so tiny a compass ? " [Burgoyne]181-jim has all the time had [his]181-jim brushes in [his]181-jim hand , the brushes with which [he]181-jim has been preparing [himself]181-jim for [his]181-jim solitary dinner . [He]181-jim bangs them down now on the table . How can [he]181-jim put a period to the ravings of [this maniac]4325-this maniac ? And yet not so maniac either . What gives the sharpest point to [his]181-jim present suffering is the consciousness that [he]181-jim would have made quite as good [a maniac]4326-a maniac [himself]181-jim if [he]181-jim had had the chance . This consciousness instils a few drops of angry patience into [his]181-jim voice , as , disregarding the other 's high - flown question , [he]181-jim puts one that is not at all high - flown [himself]181-jim . "[181-jim] Then [you]0-i have not told [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant yet ? " But the smile that the memory — so fresh , only half an hour old — of [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth 's loveliness has laid upon [Byng]203-byng 's lips still lingers there ; and makes [his]181-jim response dreamy and vague . "[189-mrs. le marchant] No , not yet ; not yet ! [She]189-mrs. le marchant had taken one of [her]189-mrs. le marchant gloves off ; [her]189-mrs. le marchant little hand lay , palm upward , on [her]189-mrs. le marchant knees almost all the way ; once or twice [I]0-i thought of taking it , of taking possession of it , of telling [[her]189-mrs. le marchant mother]3300-her mother in that way ; but [I]0-i did not . It seemed — out in the sunshine , no longer in the sacred mist of that blessed wood — too high an audacity , and [I]0-i did not ! " [He]181-jim stops , [his]181-jim words dying away into a whisper , [his]181-jim throat 's too narrow passage choked by the rushing ocean of [his]181-jim immense felicity . [Burgoyne]181-jim looks at [him]181-jim in silence , again with a sort of admiration mixed with wrath . How has [this commonplace , pink - and - white boy]4327-this commonplace , pink - and - white boy managed to scale such an altitude , while [he]181-jim [himself]181-jim , in all [his]181-jim life , though with a better intelligence , and , as [he]181-jim had thought , with a deeper heart , had but prowled around the foot ? Why should [he]181-jim try to drag [him]181-jim down ? On [the peak of [that great Jungfrau of rapture]4329-that great jungfrau of rapture]4328-the peak of that great jungfrau of rapture [no human foot]4330-no human foot can long stand . "[0-i] As [I]0-i told [you]1782-you , [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant turned [me]0-i away from [their]1783-their door , " pursues [Byng]203-byng . "[189-mrs. le marchant] It struck [me]0-i — [I]0-i could not pay much attention to the fact , for was not [I]0-i bidding [her]189-mrs. le marchant good - night — taking farewell of those heavenly eyes?—did [you]1782-you ever see such astonishing eyes?—for four colossal hours — but it struck [me]0-i that [[her]189-mrs. le marchant mother]3300-her mother 's manner was a little colder to [me]0-i than it usually is . It had been a little cold all day — at least , so [I]0-i fancied . Had the same idea occurred to [you]1782-you ? " [Burgoyne]181-jim hesitates . "[1782-you] But even if it were so , " continues [Byng]203-byng , [his]181-jim sun breaking out again in full brilliancy from the very little cloud that , during [his]181-jim last sentence or two , had dimmed its lustre , "[189-mrs. le marchant] how can [I]0-i blame [her]189-mrs. le marchant ? Does one throw [one]501-one 's self into the arms of [the burglar who has broken open one]1786-the burglar who has broken open one 's safe and stolen one 's diamonds ? " [Burgoyne]181-jim still hesitates . The morning light will certainly see [him]181-jim tumbling at the least some few kilometres down . [He]181-jim decides generously to leave [him]181-jim in present possession of [his]181-jim peak ; but yet , so inconsistent is human nature , [his]181-jim next speech can have no drift but that of giving a slight jog to [[his]181-jim friend]393-his friend 's towering confidence . "[1076-the other one] Do [you]1799-you know — it seems incomprehensible now — but there was a moment when [I]0-i was madly jealous of [you]1799-you ? "[1801-we] Indeed ! " [he]181-jim says grimly . "[1801-we] [I]0-i should have thought [you]1799-you might have found a more interesting subject of conversation . " The adjective , as applied to [himself]181-jim by [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth and [[her]193-elizabeth mother]3300-her mother , has not the merit of novelty in [the hearer]717-the hearer 's ears , which is perhaps the reason why the elation that [he]181-jim must naturally feel on hearing it does not translate itself into words . Joy"—repeating the word over reflectively—"it[0-i] is a big thing to wish [anyone]3161-anyone . " The extreme dampness of [his]181-jim tone arrests for a few minutes [Byng]203-byng 's jubilant pæan . " "[240-miss le marchant] Older ! " cries [Byng]203-byng , with almost a shout of angry derision at the suggestion . "[240-miss le marchant] What have creatures like [her]240-miss le marchant to do with age ? [I]0-i neither know nor care what [her]240-miss le marchant age is ! If [you]0-i know , do not tell [me]0-i ! [I]0-i will not listen ! Upon that exquisite body time and change are powerless to work [their]1806-their hideous metamorphoses ! Thank God , [I]0-i have never spoken unkindly to [her]240-miss le marchant in all [my]0-i life ! " "[0-i] [You]0-i would have been [a sweep]1811-a sweep if [you]0-i had ! " interjects [Jim]181-jim . "[0-i] [I]0-i never heard [her]240-miss le marchant give any reason for it , did [you]0-i ? It was as baseless as it was senseless . " After a pause , [his]181-jim voice taking on again its inflection of confident , soaring triumph : "[240-miss le marchant] But it can not last — it is absolutely beyond the wildest bounds of possibility that it can last ! After five minutes ' [talk mother]1812-talk mother will be at [her]240-miss le marchant feet ; [I]0-i know [[my]0-i mother]1063-my mother so well ! Not one of [her]1063-my mother exquisite ways will be lost upon [her]1063-my mother , and [she]1063-my mother will do [her]1063-my mother very best to win [her]1063-my mother ! [Jim]181-jim , [I]0-i ask [you]181-jim — [I]0-i put it to [you]181-jim quietly and plainly — [I]0-i know [you]181-jim think [I]0-i am mad , but [I]0-i am not — [I]0-i am speaking quite rationally and coolly — but [I]0-i ask [you]181-jim — [you]181-jim , [an impartial bystander]1814-an impartial bystander — do [you]181-jim think that [any human being , anything made of flesh and blood]1815-any human being , anything made of flesh and blood , could resist [her]1063-my mother — [her]1063-my mother when [she]1063-my mother puts [herself]1063-my mother out to please — [her]1063-my mother at [her]1063-my mother very best ? " As [Burgoyne]181-jim is conscious of not being in a position to answer this question with much satisfaction to [himself]181-jim , [he]181-jim leaves it unanswered . A new day has awaked , and [Firenze]235-firenze , fresh - washed after yesterday 's rain , smelling through all [[her]1063-my mother streets of lilies]4344-her streets of lilies , laughs up , wistaria - hung , to a fleckless sky . If poor [Amelia]201-amelia had but deferred [her]201-amelia treat for twenty - four hours , what [a different Vallombrosa]4345-a different vallombrosa would [she]201-amelia and [[her]201-amelia companions]3661-her companions have carried [home]401-home in [their]3661-her companions memories ! [Amelia]201-amelia 's treat ! "[0-i] [I]0-i shall not forget [Amelia]201-amelia 's treat in a hurry ! " [Burgoyne]181-jim says to [himself]0-i , as [he]181-jim sits appetiteless over [his]181-jim solitary breakfast . "[0-i] [I]0-i had better go and tell [her]201-amelia the result of it . " As [he]181-jim makes this reflection , [he]181-jim rises with some alacrity , and , leaving [his]181-jim scarcely - tasted coffee and [his]181-jim not - at - all - tasted omelette , walks out of [the salle - à - manger]4348-the salle - à - manger . [His]181-jim motive for so early a visit to [the Anglo - Américain]3323-the anglo - américain is less an excessive eagerness to proclaim [his]181-jim piece of news than the thought that by so doing [he]181-jim will , at least for a few hours , escape the necessity of being in [[his]181-jim young friend]763-his young friend 's company . As to where [that young friend]4351-that young friend at present is , whether , after having wandered about [the town]407-the town all night , [he]181-jim is now sleeping late , or whether [he]181-jim is already off to persecute [poor Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant for that maternal blessing which [she]189-mrs. le marchant has so little inclination to give , [Jim]181-jim is ignorant . All [he]181-jim knows is that such another dose of Byng 's erotic eloquence as [he]181-jim had to swallow last night will leave [him]181-jim ( [Burgoyne]181-jim ) either [a murderer]4353-a murderer or suicide . Owing to [his]181-jim arrival at [the Anglo - Américain]82-the anglo - américain so much sooner than usual , [he]181-jim finds [himself]181-jim coming in for the ceremony of [Sybilla]221-sybilla 's installation for the day in [the drawing - room]3329-the drawing - room . There is always a little pomp and fussy bustle about this rite . [Sybilla]221-sybilla totters in ( grave doubts have occasionally crossed the minds of [[her]221-sybilla family]645-her family as to whether [she]221-sybilla does not in reality possess a pair of excellent and thoroughly dependable legs ) , supported on one side by [Amelia]201-amelia and on the other by [[her]221-sybilla maid]4356-her maid . [Cecilia]222-cecilia goes before with an air cushion , and [Mr. Wilson]202-mr. wilson follows , when [he]181-jim does not turn restive — which is sometimes the case — with a duvet . To - day , as [I]0-i have said , this rite is in full celebration when [Jim]181-jim arrives , but it is being performed with mutilated glories . The rite is going forward , but [the high priest]4357-the high priest is absent . [That ministrant]4358-that ministrant , upon whose arm [the sufferer]4359-the sufferer is wo nt to lean far the most heavily ; [she]4358-that ministrant upon whom devolves the whole responsibility of arranging the three cushions behind the long limp back ; the properly covering the languid feet ; the nice administering of the reviving cordial drops that are to repair the fatigue of the transit from [bedroom]4360-bedroom to [sitting - room]4361-sitting - room — [that most important and unfailing ministrant]4362-that most important and unfailing ministrant is nowhere to be seen . [No artist]4363-no artist wishes [his]4363-no artist picture to be viewed in an inchoate , unfinished stage , nor is [Sybilla]221-sybilla at all anxious to have [the public]4364-the public admitted to the sight of that eminent work of art [herself]221-sybilla until [she]221-sybilla is stretched in faint , moribund , graceful completeness on [her]221-sybilla day - bed . At the moment of [Burgoyne]181-jim 's entry [she]221-sybilla has just reached that unbecoming point , where [she]221-sybilla is sitting sideways on [her]221-sybilla sofa , before [her]221-sybilla wasted limbs — [Burgoyne]181-jim is one of [those heretics who have never believed that [they]4365-those heretics who have never believed that they are wasted are wasted]4365-those heretics who have never believed that they are wasted — have been carefully lifted into [their]4365-those heretics who have never believed that they are wasted final posture of extension upon the Austrian blanket . It is , of all moments , the one at which interruption is least welcome ; nor is [the intruder]4366-the intruder at all surprised at being greeted by [the invalid]3676-the invalid with a more than sub - acid accent . "[0-i] [[My]0-i dear]3176-my dear [Jim]181-jim , already ! Why [you]181-jim become more matinale every day ! [you]181-jim are [the early bird]1817-the early bird indeed ! [You]181-jim do not"—with an annoyed laugh—"give[1817-the early bird] [us]1818-us poor worms a chance of being beforehand with [you]181-jim . " "[0-i] [I]0-i am very sorry if [I]0-i am too soon , " replies [he]181-jim , [his]181-jim eyes wandering away from the fretful features before [him]181-jim in search of others upon which [he]181-jim knows [he]181-jim shall find written no complaint of [his]181-jim prematureness—"but[0-i] [I]0-i came to —— Where 's [Amelia]201-amelia ? " "[222-cecilia] Where is [she]201-amelia ? "[222-cecilia] [She]201-amelia is not well , " replies [Cecilia]222-cecilia shortly , [her]222-cecilia rosy face rosier than usual , either with the joy of imminent battle , or with the exertion of swaddling , under protest , [the invalid]3676-the invalid 's now elevated legs . "[222-cecilia] Not well ! [Amelia]201-amelia not well , " echoes [he]181-jim , in a tone of incredulity . During all the years of [their]1824-their acquaintance not once has [he]181-jim heard [[his]181-jim patient]4369-his patient sweetheart complain of ache or pain . Manlike , [he]181-jim has therefore concluded that [she]201-amelia can never have felt either . "[201-amelia] It is very thoughtless of [her]201-amelia , " says [Cecilia]222-cecilia , with a not altogether amiable laugh , and giving a final irritated slap to [Sybilla]221-sybilla 's coverlet—"considering[201-amelia] how much illness [we]1824-their already have in [the house]986-the house ; ha ! ha ! but it is true all the same : [she]201-amelia is not well , not at all well ; [she]201-amelia is in bed . " "[201-amelia] In bed ! " "[201-amelia] [She]201-amelia must have caught a chill yesterday on that disgusting excursion ; driving [home]401-home that long distance in wet shoes and stockings . " "[201-amelia] But [I]0-i thought , [I]0-i hoped that — [I]0-i asked [her]201-amelia to change them . " [The human animal]1762-the human animal is the most adaptive of created beings ; but even it requires some little time to adjust itself to entirely new conditions of existence .
