"[2148-she] [I]0-i saw [you]2153-you go into [the church]3445-the church , " says [Mrs. Byng]203-byng , [her]0-i smile growing somewhat diffident as [she]0-i sees the solemnity of [his]181-jim face , "[2153-you] so [I]0-i thought [I]0-i would follow [you]2153-you ; do [you]2153-you mind ? shall [I]0-i go away ? " [He]181-jim would , of [the two]4644-the two , have preferred that [she]0-i had not followed [him]181-jim , that [he]181-jim had been given five more minutes to [himself]181-jim ; but [he]181-jim naturally does not say so . "[0-i] Since [we]2155-we are [here]637-here , shall [we]2155-we go into [the cloisters]2157-the cloisters ? " and [he]181-jim assents . [A small Dominican monk , with a smile and a bunch of keys]4645-a small dominican monk , with a smile and a bunch of keys , is opening a door to [some strangers]4646-some strangers , prowling like [[our]2155-we friends]3256-our friends about [the church]3445-the church . [The latter]423-the latter follow , [the little monk]4650-the little monk enveloping [them]423-the latter too in [his]4650-the little monk civil smile . Down some steps into the great cloister , under whose arches pale frescoes cover the ancient walls — where in [Florence]20-florence are there not frescoes?—and the hands that painted [them]2157-the cloisters seem all to have wielded [their]2157-the cloisters brushes in that astounding fifteenth century , which was to [Florence]20-florence 's life what May is to [Italy]18-italy 's year . For some moments [they]2155-we stand silent , side by side , perhaps picking out familiar scenes from among the sweet faded groups — [a slim Rebecca]4651-a slim rebecca listening to [Eliezar]324-eliezar 's tale , and looking maiden pleasure at [his]324-eliezar gifts ; a shivering [Adam]325-adam and [Eve]326-eve chased out of [Paradise]117-paradise ; an [Adam]325-adam and [Eve]326-eve dismally digging and stitching respectively ; Old Testament stories that time has blurred , that weather — even in this dry air — has rubbed out and bedimmed , and that yet , in many cases , still tell [their]2155-we curious faint tale decipherably . "[0-i] Good news this evening , [I]0-i hope ? " says [Mrs. Byng]203-byng presently , growing a little tired of [[her]0-i companion]540-her companion 's taciturnity , being indeed always one of [those persons who are of opinion that the gold of which silence is said to be made]4653-those persons who are of opinion that the gold of which silence is said to be made has a good deal of alloy in it . "[0-i] [I]0-i am to see [her]2158-her to - morrow . " [He]324-eliezar speaks almost under [his]324-eliezar breath , either because [he]324-eliezar has no great confidence in [his]324-eliezar voice , if [he]324-eliezar employ a higher key , or because there seems to [him]324-eliezar a certain sanctity in this promised meeting on the kindly hither side of the grave which has so lately yawned . [Mrs. Byng]203-byng is much too old and intimate a friend of [Jim]181-jim 's not to have been pretty well aware of the state of [his]324-eliezar feelings during the past eight years , though certainly not through any communication from [him]324-eliezar . So it is , perhaps , scarcely to be wondered at that [she]203-byng presently says , in a tone tinged with admiring surprise : "[0-i] How fond [you]0-i are of [her]2158-her ! " [He]324-eliezar receives the remark in a jarred silence , [his]324-eliezar eye resting on the square of neglected graves in [the middle of [the cloister]4655-the cloister]4654-the middle of the cloister , how unlike [[our]4656-our turfy quads and lawns]4657-our turfy quads and lawns . [A commonplace nineteenth century photographer]4658-a commonplace nineteenth century photographer , with [his]4658-a commonplace nineteenth century photographer vulgar camera planted on the time - worn stones , is evidently trying to persuade [the little monk]4650-the little monk to pose for [his]4658-a commonplace nineteenth century photographer picture . [The gentle - looking Fra]4660-the gentle - looking fra laughs , and draws up [his]4660-the gentle - looking fra cowl , then lowers it again , folding [his]4660-the gentle - looking fra arms , and trying various postures . "[0-i] [You]0-i are so much fonder of [her]2158-her than [you]0-i were ! " This speech — though such is certainly far from [the good - natured speaker]4661-the good - natured speaker 's intention — stings [Burgoyne]181-jim like a whip - lash . "[0-i] [I]0-i was always fond of [her]2158-her — [I]0-i always thought [her]2158-her [the very best woman in [the world]3184-the world]2159-the very best woman in the world ; [you]0-i know!"—with an accent of almost anguished appeal—"that[0-i] [I]0-i always thought [her]2158-her [the very best woman in [the world]3184-the world]2159-the very best woman in the world . " "[0-i] Oh , yes ; of course , [I]0-i know [you]0-i did , " replies [she]0-i , astonished and concerned at the evident and extreme distress of [his]4662-his tone . "[0-i] That is not quite the same thing as being fond of [her]2158-her , is it ? But"—with a laugh that is at once uneasy and reassuring—"what[327-tilburina] does that matter now ? Now [your]0-i fondness for [her]2158-her is as indisputable as [Tilburina]327-tilburina 's madness ; and , for [my]0-i part , [I]0-i always think [people]3155-people get on quite as well , if not better , afterwards , if [they]3155-people do not begin quite so volcanically . " But [her]0-i light and well - meant words fail to remove the painful impression from [[her]0-i hearer]4663-her hearer 's mind . Has [she]0-i , during all these years , been crediting [him]4662-his with a wish for [Amelia]201-amelia 's death , that [she]0-i should be so much astonished at [his]4662-his thankfulness for [her]2158-her being given back to [him]4662-his ? "[3155-people] [I]0-i believe that this illness is the best thing that could have happened to [you]2164-you both , " continues [Mrs. Byng]203-byng , feeling uncomfortably that [she]203-byng has not been happy in [her]203-byng choice of a topic , and yet unable to leave it alone . "[0-i] It will have drawn [you]2164-you so much together : in fact"—again laughing [nervously—"I]4664-nervously—"i[0-i] think [we]2165-we are all looking up . As [I]0-i told [you]2164-you , after the first shock , [Willy]222-cecilia really was rather glad to see [me]0-i ; and [you]2164-you would not believe how discreetly [I]0-i handle the burning subject — yes , everything is on the mend , and [we]2165-we are all going to have a lovely time , as [the Yankees]2166-the yankees say ! " The words are scarcely out of [Mrs. Byng]203-byng 's mouth before [she]203-byng adds , in a changed key , and with an altered direction of the eyes — "[2166-the yankees] Is [this person]3992-this person looking for [you]2164-you ? [He]3992-this person seems to be coming straight towards [us]2165-we . " [Jim]181-jim turns [his]181-jim head at [her]203-byng speech , and at once recognises in the figure hastening towards [them]2165-we [the porter of [the Anglo - Américain hotel]809-the anglo - américain hotel]4665-the porter of the anglo - américain hotel . [The man]1436-the man looks strangely , and carries a slip of paper , unfolded and open , in [his]1436-the man hand . In a second [Jim]181-jim has sprung to [his]181-jim side , has snatched the paper , and is staring at its contents . They are hardly legible , scrawled tremblingly with a pencil , and for a moment [he]181-jim can not make them out . Then , as [he]181-jim looks , in one horrible flash their import has sprung into [his]181-jim eyes and brain . "[3992-this person] [She]2168-she is gone ; come to [us]2165-we ! " [Mrs. Byng]203-byng is reading too , over [his]181-jim shoulder . In going over the scene in memory afterwards , [he]181-jim believes that [she]203-byng gives a sort of scream , and says , "[2168-she] Oh , what does it mean ? It is not true ! " But at the time [he]181-jim hears , [he]181-jim knows nothing . [He]181-jim is out of [the church]3445-the church ; [he]181-jim is in [the fiacre]3657-the fiacre waiting at the door : [he]181-jim is tearing through [the streets]1311-the streets , with the hot summer air flowing in a quick current against [his]181-jim face . [He]181-jim thinks afterwards at what a pace the horse must have been going , and how [the poor jade]4671-the poor jade must have been lashed to keep it up to that useless speed . At the time [he]181-jim thinks nothing , [he]181-jim feels nothing . [He]181-jim rushes through [the court of [the hotel]1144-the hotel]4672-the court of the hotel , rushes through what seem to be [people]3155-people ; [he]181-jim thinks afterwards that [they]3155-people must have been [waiters]4675-waiters and [chambermaids]4676-chambermaids , and that there came a sort of compassionate murmur from [them]3155-people as [he]181-jim passed . [He]181-jim is up the stairs , [the three flights]4677-the three flights ; as [he]181-jim tears up , three steps at a time , there comes across [his]181-jim numbed intelligence a flash of wonder why [they]3155-people always give [Amelia]201-amelia [the worst room]4678-the worst room . [He]181-jim is at that door , outside which [he]181-jim has spent so many hours of breathless listening ; [he]181-jim need no longer stay outside [it]4679-it now . It is open , inviting [him]181-jim in . [He]181-jim is across that , as yet , unpassed threshold , that threshold over which [he]181-jim was to have stepped in careful , soft - footed joy to - morrow . [He]181-jim has pushed through [the people]1465-the people — why must there be people everywhere?—of whom [the room]442-the room seems full , unnecessarily full ; [he]181-jim is at the bedside . Across the foot [a figure]4682-a figure seems thrown — [he]181-jim learns afterwards that that is [Sybilla]221-sybilla . [Another figure]4683-another figure is prostrate on the floor , heaving , in dreadful dry sobs ; that is [Cecilia]222-cecilia . [A third]1950-a third is standing upright and tearless , looking down upon what , an hour ago , was [[his]181-jim most patient daughter]4685-his most patient daughter . [They]1465-the people have left [her]4685-his most patient daughter alone now — have ceased to tease [her]4685-his most patient daughter . [They]1465-the people no longer hold a looking - glass to [her]4685-his most patient daughter pale mouth , or beat [her]4685-his most patient daughter tired feet , or pour useless cordials between [her]4685-his most patient daughter lips . [They]1465-the people have ceased to cry out upon [her]4685-his most patient daughter name , having realized that [she]4685-his most patient daughter is much too far away to hear [them]1465-the people . Neither does [he]181-jim cry out . [He]181-jim just goes and stands by [the father]2096-the father , and takes [his]181-jim thin old hand in [his]181-jim ; and together [they]1465-the people gaze on [that poor temple]4687-that poor temple , out of which the spirit that was so much too lovely for it has fleeted . Later on [they]1465-the people tell [him]181-jim how it came about ; later on , when [they]1465-the people are all sitting huddled in [the little dark salon]4688-the little dark salon . [Cecilia]222-cecilia is [the spokeswoman]4689-the spokeswoman , and [Sybilla]221-sybilla puts in sobbing corrections now and again . "[2169-her] [She]2169-her was sitting up the moment before ; [the nurse]2170-the nurse was holding [her]2169-her propped up — [she]2169-her said [she]2169-her was so tired of lying . [She]2169-her had been quite laughing , [the nurse]2170-the nurse said . " "[2170-the nurse] Almost laughing , " corrects [Sybilla]221-sybilla , who has forgotten to lie down upon [her]221-sybilla sofa , and is sitting on a hard chair like anyone else . "[2170-the nurse] Quite laughing , " continues [Cecilia]222-cecilia , "[2170-the nurse] at [her]2169-her own arm for being so thin . [She]2169-her had pushed up [her]2169-her sleeve to look at it , and had said something — something quite funny , only [the nurse]2170-the nurse could not remember the exact words — and then , all in a minute , [she]2169-her called out , in quite an altered voice , ' The salts ! Quick ! Quick ! ' and [her]2169-her head just fell back , and [she]2169-her was gone ! " "[2169-her] And [she]2169-her had not bid one of [us]2173-they good - bye ! " cries [Sybilla]221-sybilla , breaking into a loud wail . Then comes a dreadful and incongruous flash of that ridiculous , which is the underlining to all [our]2173-they tragedies , across [Jim]181-jim 's mind at this last lament . The going , "[2169-her] taking no farewell , " naturally seems to [Sybilla]221-sybilla the most terrible feature in the whole case , to [her]221-sybilla who has so repeatedly taken heartrending last farewells of [[her]221-sybilla family]645-her family . "[2169-her] Who would ever have thought that [I]0-i should have survived [her]2169-her ? " pursues [Sybilla]221-sybilla , still sobbing noisily , and without the least attempt at self - control . [Cecilia]222-cecilia , who is sitting with [her]222-cecilia head on [her]222-cecilia arms resting on the table , lifts [her]222-cecilia tear - blurred face and answers this apostrophe in a voice choked with weeping . "[181-jim] [Jim]181-jim always did ; [he]181-jim always said that [you]2174-you would see [us]2173-they all out . " Again that dreadful impulse towards mirth assails [Burgoyne]181-jim . Is it possible that , at such an hour , [he]181-jim can feel a temptation to laugh out loud ? But , later again , this horrible mood passes ; later , when [they]2173-they have all grown more composed , when [their]2173-they tears run more gently , when [their]2173-they voices are less suffocated , and [they]2173-they are telling [each other]607-each other little anecdotes of [her]2169-her , aiding [each other]607-each other 's memories to recall half - effaced traits of [her]2169-her homely kindness , of [her]2169-her noiseless self - denials , of [her]2169-her deep still piety . [They]2173-they bring out [her]2169-her photographs , mourning over [their]2173-they being so few , and such old and long - ago ones . There are effigies by the dozen of [Cecilia]222-cecilia , and even touching presentments of [Sybilla]221-sybilla stretched in wasted grace upon [her]2169-her day bed ; but it had never occurred to [anyone]3161-anyone — least of all to [Amelia]201-amelia [herself]2169-her — that there is any need for [her]2169-her image to be perpetuated . And now [they]2173-they are searching out , as treasures most precious , the scanty faded likenesses that exist of [her]2169-her , planning how they can be enlarged , and repeated , and daintily framed , and generally done homage and tender reverence to . [Jim]181-jim listens , occasionally putting in a low word or two , when appealed to to confirm or correct the details of some little story about [her]2169-her . But it seems to [him]181-jim as if [his]181-jim anguish only begins when the stream of [their]2173-they reminiscences turns into the channel of [her]2169-her love for [him]181-jim . "[181-jim] Oh , [Jim]181-jim , [she]2175-she was fond of [you]181-jim ! [We]2176-we were none of [us]2176-we anywhere , compared to [you]181-jim ; [she]2175-she worshipped the ground [you]181-jim trod upon . [We]2176-we all knew — did not [we]2176-we , [Sybilla?—did]328-sybilla?—did not [we]2176-we , [father?—when]2177-father?—when [you]181-jim used to be away for so long , and wrote to [her]2175-she so seldom —— Oh , [I]0-i know!"—hastily—"that [you]181-jim were not to blame , that [you]181-jim were in out - of - the - way places , where there was no post : but there were sometimes long gaps between [your]181-jim letters ; and [we]2176-we always knew — did not we?—when [she]2175-she had heard from [you]181-jim by [her]2175-she face , long before [she]2175-she spoke . "[0-i] Next it is — " How [she]2175-she fired up if [anyone]3161-anyone said anything slightingly of [you]181-jim : [she]2175-she never cared in the least if [one]501-one abused [herself]2175-she ; [she]2175-she always thought [she]2175-she quite deserved it ; but if [anybody]3681-anybody dared to say the least disparaging thing of [you"—it]4697-you"—it[221-sybilla] is pretty evident , though at the moment in [his]2178-he agony of preoccupation the idea does not occur to [Jim]181-jim , that this has not been an uncommon occurrence—"she was like a lioness at once . "[181-jim] " The saddest thing of all , "[221-sybilla] says [Sybilla]221-sybilla , taking up the antiphonal strain , " is that [she]2175-she should have died just as [she]2175-she was beginning to be so happy ! "[221-sybilla] Just beginning to be so happy ? And [he]2178-he might have made [her]221-sybilla heavenly happy so easily , since [she]221-sybilla asked so little — for eight years . The groan [he]2178-he utters is low in proportion to the depth of the fountain whence it springs , and [they]2179-they do not hear it . If [they]2179-they did , [they]2179-they would in mercy stop ; instead , [they]2179-they go on . " Did [you]181-jim ever see anything so radiant as [she]2175-she was — that last fortnight ? [She]2175-she used to say that [she]2175-she was quite ashamed of being so much more fortunate than [anyone else]1328-anyone else , [she]2175-she seemed always trying to make up to [us]2179-they for not being so happy as [she]2175-she . Oh , [she]2175-she was happy that last fortnight ! "[2179-they] This time [he]2178-he does not groan , [he]2178-he seems to [himself]2178-he to have passed into that zone of suffering which can not be expressed or alleviated by the utterance of any sound . Perhaps , by - and - by , [Cecilia]222-cecilia dimly divines something , some faint shadow of what [he]2178-he is enduring ; for [she]222-cecilia begins with well - intentioned labour to try to assert lamely that [Amelia]201-amelia had always been happy , well , fairly happy , as happy as [most people]3423-most people . [You]2181-you could not expect , in [this dreadful world]2182-this dreadful world , to be always in the best of spirits , but [she]201-amelia had never complained . And , oh ! that last fortnight [she]201-amelia had been happy , it was a pleasure to see [her]201-amelia ! And , oh , what a comfort it must be now to [Jim]181-jim to think that it was all owing to [him]181-jim . [She]222-cecilia puts out [her]222-cecilia hand kindly to [him]2178-he as [she]222-cecilia speaks , and [he]2178-he takes it , and silently wrings it in acknowledgment of the endeavour — however clumsy — to lay balm upon that now immedicable wound . [He]2178-he stays most of the night with [them]2183-them ; and when at length , overcome with weariness and sorrow , [they]2183-them rise from [their]2183-them grief - stricken postures to go to bed , [he]2178-he kisses [them]2183-them all solemnly , even [the old man]2082-the old man . [He]2178-he has never kissed any of [them]2183-them before , except once or twice [Cecilia]222-cecilia on some return of [his]2178-he from [the Antipodes]2185-the antipodes , and because [she]222-cecilia seemed to expect it . Three days later [Burgoyne]181-jim leaves [Florence]20-florence ; and , as [his]181-jim arrival in [the City of]2186-the city of [Flowers]118-flowers had been motived by [Amelia]201-amelia alive , so is [his]181-jim departure to companion [her]201-amelia dead . Time has stepped upon another year ; not much more than stepped , since that year 's first month is not yet out ; and [Burgoyne]181-jim has stepped upon another continent before [we]2187-we again rejoin [him]181-jim . There are few , if any of [us]2187-we , who , in the course of [our]2187-we lives , have not had occasion to wish that certain spaces in those lives might be represented by the convenient asterisks that cover them in books ; but this is unfortunately impossible to [Jim]181-jim , as to [the rest of [us]2187-we]2188-the rest of us ; and [he]181-jim has fought through each minute and its minuteful of pain ( happily no minute can contain two minutefuls ) during the seven months that have elapsed since [we]2187-we parted from [him]181-jim . At first those minutes held nothing but pain ; [he]181-jim could not tell [you]2189-you which of them it was that first admitted within its little compass any alien ingredient ; and [he]181-jim was shocked and remorseful when [he]181-jim discovered that any such existed . But that did not alter the fact . [He]181-jim has not sold [his]181-jim guns ; on the contrary , [he]181-jim has bought two new ones , and [he]181-jim has visited [[his]181-jim old friends]2190-his old friends , [the Rockies]21-the rockies . Since [Amelia]201-amelia 's funeral — immediately after which [he]181-jim again quitted [England]11-england — [he]181-jim has seen [no member of [[his]181-jim dead betrothed 's family]2192-his dead betrothed 's family]2191-no member of his dead betrothed 's family , nor has [he]181-jim held any intercourse , beyond the exchange of an infrequent letter , with [Mrs. Byng]203-byng or [[her]203-byng son]600-her son . From the thought of both these latter [he]181-jim shrinks , with a distaste equal in degree , though inspired by different causes . From [Mrs. Byng]203-byng , because [he]181-jim knows that [she]203-byng was aware of [his]181-jim weariness of [his]181-jim poor love — that poor love whom , had [he]181-jim but known it , [he]181-jim had so short a time to be weary of ; and from [Byng]203-byng , because , despite the ocean of sorrow , of remorse , of death that rolls in its hopelessness between [him]181-jim and [her]203-byng , [he]181-jim can not even yet think , without a bitter pang , of [the woman who had inspired [the young man]643-the young man 's hysterical tears and sincere , though silly , suicidal impulses]2194-the woman who had inspired the young man 's hysterical tears and sincere , though silly , suicidal impulses . [Jim]181-jim took that pang with [him]181-jim to [the Rockies]21-the rockies , stinging , even through the overlying load of [his]181-jim other and acknowledged burden of repentant ache and loss , and [he]181-jim has brought it back with [him]181-jim . [He]181-jim packs it into [his]181-jim portmanteau as much as a matter of course as [he]181-jim does [his]181-jim shirts — in fact more so , for [he]181-jim has once inadvertently left [his]181-jim shirts behind , but the pang never . It is the 20th day of January ; here , in [England]11-england , the most consistently detestable month in the year . The good Januaries of [a British octogenarian]2196-a british octogenarian 's life might be counted upon the thumbs of [that octogenarian]2197-that octogenarian 's hands . [The favoured inhabitants of [London]1-london]2198-the favoured inhabitants of london have breakfasted and lunched by gaslight ; have groped [their]2198-the favoured inhabitants of london way along [[their]2198-the favoured inhabitants of london dirty streets]2199-their dirty streets through a fog of as thick and close a fabric as the furs gathered round [their]2198-the favoured inhabitants of london chilled throats ; have , even within [[their]2198-the favoured inhabitants of london houses]2200-their houses , seen [each other]607-each other dimly across a hideous yellow vapour that kills [their]2198-the favoured inhabitants of london expensive flowers , and makes [their]2198-the favoured inhabitants of london unwilling palm - trees droop in homesick sadness . There is no fog about [the Grand Hotel]2202-the grand hotel , [Mustapha Supérieur]119-mustapha supérieur , [Algiers]120-algiers ; no lightest blur of mist to dim the intensity of the frame of green in which its white face is set . It is not so very grand , despite [its]2202-the grand hotel unpromising big name , as [it]2202-the grand hotel stands high aloft on [the hillside]1457-the hillside , looking out over [the bay]2204-the bay and down on [the town]407-the town , looking down more immediately upon [tree - tops]2206-tree - tops , and on [the Governor 's summer palace]2207-the governor 's summer palace . [It]2202-the grand hotel is [an old Moorish house]2208-an old moorish house , enlarged into [an hotel]2209-an hotel , with little arched windows sunk in the thick walls , with red - tiled floors , and balconies , with low white balustrades of pierced brick , up which the lush creepers climb and wave — yes , climb and wave on [this 20th of January]2210-this 20th of january . From [the red - floored balcony over [the creepers]2212-the creepers]2211-the red - floored balcony over the creepers , between the perennial leafage of the unchanging trees , [one]501-one can daily descry in [the azure bay]2214-the azure bay the tiny puff of smoke that tells that [the mail steamer]2215-the mail steamer from [Marseilles]121-marseilles has safely breasted [the Gulf of Lyons]122-the gulf of lyons , threaded [her]2215-the mail steamer away among [the Isles]123-the isles , and brought [her]2215-the mail steamer freight of French and English and American news to the hands and ears of [the various expectant nationalities]2216-the various expectant nationalities . To - day , blown by a gently prosperous wind , [the boat]2217-the boat is punctual . It is [the Eugène Perrère]2218-the eugène perrère , [the pet child of [the Transatlantic Company]2220-the transatlantic company]2219-the pet child of the transatlantic company , [the narrow and strong - engined little vessel which is wo nt to accomplish the transit in a period of time less by an hour than [[her]2218-the eugène perrère brother craft]2222-her brother craft]2221-the narrow and strong - engined little vessel which is wo nt to accomplish the transit in a period of time less by an hour than her brother craft . To - day [she]2218-the eugène perrère has brought [but one guest to [the Grand Hotel]124-the grand hotel , who , having left the bulk of [his]2223-but one guest to the grand hotel , who , having left the bulk of his luggage to be struggled for by arabs , and by the hotel - porter at the douane luggage to be struggled for by [Arabs]2224-arabs , and by [the hotel - porter at [the Douane]125-the douane]2225-the hotel - porter at the douane]2223-but one guest to the grand hotel , who , having left the bulk of his luggage to be struggled for by arabs , and by the hotel - porter at the douane , arrives at [the modest Moorish - faced hostelry]2226-the modest moorish - faced hostelry , having , with British mercifulness , walked up the break - neck green lane that leads from [the steep main road]2227-the steep main road in order to spare the wretched little galled , pumped horse that has painfully dragged [him]2223-but one guest to the grand hotel , who , having left the bulk of his luggage to be struggled for by arabs , and by the hotel - porter at the douane and [his]2223-but one guest to the grand hotel , who , having left the bulk of his luggage to be struggled for by arabs , and by the hotel - porter at the douane bag from [the pier]2228-the pier . [He]2223-but one guest to the grand hotel , who , having left the bulk of his luggage to be struggled for by arabs , and by the hotel - porter at the douane has travelled straight through from [London]1-london — fifty - five hours without a pause — so that it is not to be wondered at that [his]2223-but one guest to the grand hotel , who , having left the bulk of his luggage to be struggled for by arabs , and by the hotel - porter at the douane thoughts turn affectionately towards a wash and a change of raiment . Having extracted from the case of unclaimed letters in the bar two or three that bear the address of [James Burgoyne , Esq .]181-jim , [he]2223-but one guest to the grand hotel , who , having left the bulk of his luggage to be struggled for by arabs , and by the hotel - porter at the douane is ushered to [[his]2223-but one guest to the grand hotel , who , having left the bulk of his luggage to be struggled for by arabs , and by the hotel - porter at the douane room]2111-his room by [the civil little fussy Italian landlord , who , in order to enhance [his]2223-but one guest to the grand hotel , who , having left the bulk of his luggage to be struggled for by arabs , and by the hotel - porter at the douane appreciation of [the apartment provided for [him]2223-but one guest to the grand hotel , who , having left the bulk of his luggage to be struggled for by arabs , and by the hotel - porter at the douane]2231-the apartment provided for him]2230-the civil little fussy italian landlord , who , in order to enhance his appreciation of the apartment provided for him , assures [him]2223-but one guest to the grand hotel , who , having left the bulk of his luggage to be struggled for by arabs , and by the hotel - porter at the douane , in voluble bad French , that only yesterday [he]2223-but one guest to the grand hotel , who , having left the bulk of his luggage to be struggled for by arabs , and by the hotel - porter at the douane had been obliged to turn away [a party of eight]2232-a party of eight . It is not until refreshed by a completed toilette — and who can overrate the joy of a bath after a journey?—that it occurs to [him]2223-but one guest to the grand hotel , who , having left the bulk of his luggage to be struggled for by arabs , and by the hotel - porter at the douane to look out of window . [[His]2223-but one guest to the grand hotel , who , having left the bulk of his luggage to be struggled for by arabs , and by the hotel - porter at the douane room]2111-his room possesses two . One faces [the hill]1467-the hill 's rich - clothed steepness , and a row of orange - trees covered with fruit , and at whose feet tumbled gold balls lie . But the dusk is falling fast , and [he]2223-but one guest to the grand hotel , who , having left the bulk of his luggage to be struggled for by arabs , and by the hotel - porter at the douane can only dimly see the prodigality of green in which [the modest Grand Hotel]2235-the modest grand hotel lies buried . The other window looks out — but a very little way lifted above it , for [the room]442-the room is on the ground floor — upon [the red - tiled terrace]2237-the red - tiled terrace . [It]442-the room is growing very dim too . At the present moment [it]442-the room is empty and deserted , but the chairs studded over [its]442-the room surface in talkative attitudes , as if [sociable twos and threes]2238-sociable twos and threes had drawn together in chat , tell plainly that earlier in the day [it]442-the room had been frequented , and that [several people]2239-several people had been sitting out on [it]442-the room . [Jim]181-jim 's [London]1-london memories are too fresh upon [him]181-jim for [him]181-jim not to find something ludicrous in the idea of sitting out of doors on the 20th of January . How pleasant it would have been to do so to - day in [Hyde Park]126-hyde park ! [He]181-jim turns back to the table with a smile at the idea , and , taking out a writing - case , sits down to scribble a line . [Jim]181-jim 's correspondence is neither a large nor an interesting one . On the present occasion , [his]181-jim note is merely one of reminder as to some trifling order , addressed to [the landlord of [[his]181-jim [London]1-london lodgings]2241-his london lodgings]2240-the landlord of his london lodgings . It does not take [him]181-jim ten minutes to pen , and when it is finished [he]181-jim turns to have one final look out of window before leaving [the room]442-the room . How quickly the dark has fallen ! The empty chairs show indistinct outlines , and the heavy green trees have turned black . But [the terrace]908-the terrace is no longer quite empty . A footfall sounds — coming slowly along [it]908-the terrace . [One of [the waiters]2245-the waiters]2244-one of the waiters , no doubt , sent to fetch in the chairs ; but , no ! [an overworked Swiss waiter , hurried by electric bells]2246-an overworked swiss waiter , hurried by electric bells , and with an imminent swollen table table d'hôte upon [his]2246-an overworked swiss waiter , hurried by electric bells burdened mind , never paced so slowly , nor did [anything male]2247-anything male ever step so lightly . It must be [a woman]536-a woman ; and even now [her]536-a woman white gown makes a patch of light upon the dark background of the quickly on - coming night . [A white gown on the 20th of January]2249-a white gown on the 20th of january ! Again that pleasing sense of the ludicrous tickles [his]181-jim fancy . [She]536-a woman must be one of [the persons who lately occupied the empty chairs]2250-the persons who lately occupied the empty chairs , and have come in search of some object left behind . [He]181-jim recollects having noticed an open book lying on the low parapet . [She]536-a woman has a white gown ; but what more can be predicated of [her]536-a woman in this owl - light ? The radiance from the candle behind [him]181-jim makes a small illuminated square upon [the terrace]908-the terrace , falling between the bars of the window through which [the Moorish ladies]2252-the moorish ladies once darted [their]2252-the moorish ladies dark and ineffectual ogles . Having apparently accomplished [her]536-a woman errand , [the white - gowned figure]2253-the white - gowned figure obligingly steps into the illumined square , and still more obligingly lifts [her]536-a woman face and looks directly up at [him]181-jim . It is clear that the action is dictated only by the impulse which prompts [all seeing creatures]2254-all seeing creatures to turn lightwards , and no gleam of recognition kindles in the eyes that are averted almost as soon as directed towards [him]181-jim . Placed as [he]181-jim is , with [his]181-jim back to the light , [[his]181-jim own mother]2255-his own mother could not have distinguished [his]181-jim features ; and , after [her]536-a woman one careless glance , [the white - gowned lady]2256-the white - gowned lady turns away and disappears again into the gloom . [She]536-a woman has one more oasis of light to traverse before [she]536-a woman reaches [the hotel porch]2257-the hotel porch , just discernible , gleaming in its whitewash , at the far end of [the terrace]908-the terrace ; just one more lit window throws its chequered lustre on the tiles . [He]181-jim presses [his]181-jim face against the bars of [his]181-jim own lattice , and holds [his]181-jim breath until [she]536-a woman has reached and crossed that tell - tale patch . [Her]536-a woman traversing of [it]2259-it does not occupy the tenth part of a second , and yet it puts the seal upon what [he]181-jim already knows . Five minutes later [he]181-jim is standing before the case , hung on the wall of [the entrance hall]2260-the entrance hall , which contains the names and numbers of [the rooms of [the visitors]784-the visitors]2261-the rooms of the visitors , eagerly scanning [them]2261-the rooms of the visitors with eye and finger . [He]181-jim scans [them]2261-the rooms of the visitors in vain . The name [he]181-jim seeks is not among [them]2261-the rooms of the visitors . Had it not been for that five minutes ' delay — that five minutes of stunned and stupid staring out into the dark after [her]536-a woman — [he]181-jim must have met [her]536-a woman in [the hall]4269-the hall . [He]181-jim is turning away in baffled disappointment , when [the little host]2264-the little host again accosts [him]181-jim . [Monsieur]2265-monsieur must excuse [him]2264-the little host , but [he]2265-monsieur must explain that the list of [visitors]810-visitors that [monsieur]2267-monsieur has been so obliging as to peruse is by no means a full or correct one . [Burgoyne]181-jim accepts [his]2267-monsieur apologies in silence . It is seven months since [he]181-jim has pronounced that name aloud , and [he]181-jim appears to have lost the faculty of doing it . [The host]2272-the host comes to [his]181-jim aid . But [monsieur]2267-monsieur only shakes [his]2267-monsieur head , and moves away . [He]2267-monsieur has ascertained that the table d'hôte is at seven , and it is now half - past five . [He]2267-monsieur has , therefore , only an hour and a half of suspense ahead of [him]2267-monsieur . [She]2277-she will surely appear at the table d'hôte ? But will [she]2277-she ? "[2303-his neighbour] And in effect [the obsequious little host]2314-the obsequious little host may be seen hanging anxiously over [the newcomers]2315-the newcomers , evidently asking [them]2315-the newcomers with solicitous civility whether the not particularly appetizing fish ( the strongest point of the blue Mediterranean does not lie in [her]2303-his neighbour fishes , of which some are coarse , some tasteless , and some even lie under the suspicion of having poisonous qualities)—whether it is not to [their]2315-the newcomers liking . At something that [M. Cipriani]330-m. cipriani says [they]2315-the newcomers all laugh . [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth , indeed , throws back [her]193-elizabeth little head , and shows all [her]193-elizabeth perfect teeth , in a paroxysm of the most genuine mirth . It gives [Burgoyne]181-jim a sort of shock to see [her]193-elizabeth laugh . Not a day , scarcely an hour , has passed since [he]181-jim last saw [her]193-elizabeth in which [he]181-jim has not pictured [her]193-elizabeth as doing or suffering , or living through something ; [he]181-jim has never pictured [her]193-elizabeth laughing . It seems to [him]181-jim now but a moment since [he]181-jim was reading [her]193-elizabeth broken - hearted , tear - stained note ; since [he]181-jim was seeing [Byng]203-byng grovelling in all the utter collapse of [his]181-jim ungoverned grief on the floor of the little Florentine entresol . What business has [she]193-elizabeth to laugh ? And how unchanged [she]193-elizabeth is ! How much less outwardly aged than [he]181-jim [himself]181-jim is conscious of being ! Sitting as [she]193-elizabeth now is , in [her]193-elizabeth simple white tea - gown , with one slight elbow rested on the table , [her]193-elizabeth eyes all sparkling with merriment and laughter , bringing into prominence that one enchanting dimple of [hers]193-elizabeth , [she]193-elizabeth does not look more than twenty . But a few moments later [he]181-jim forgives [her]193-elizabeth even [her]193-elizabeth dimple . However [empressé]331-empressé may be [the little landlord]2316-the little landlord , [he]181-jim has to move away after a time ; and the merriment moves away , too , out of [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth 's face . [Jim]181-jim watches it decline , through the degrees of humorous disgust , as [she]193-elizabeth pushes the coarse white fish about [her]193-elizabeth plate , without tasting it ( [she]193-elizabeth was always a very delicate eater ) , into a settled gravity . And now that [she]193-elizabeth is grave [he]181-jim sees that [she]193-elizabeth is aged , almost as much as [he]181-jim [himself]181-jim , after all . [Her]193-elizabeth eyes had ever had the air of having shed in [their]2317-their time many tears ; but since [he]181-jim last saw [her]193-elizabeth , it is now evident to [him]181-jim that the tale of those tears has been a good deal added to . There is no pleasing [him]181-jim . [He]181-jim was angry with [her]193-elizabeth when [he]181-jim thought [her]193-elizabeth gay , and now [he]181-jim quarrels with [her]193-elizabeth for looking sad . As if , in [her]193-elizabeth unconsciousness of [[his]181-jim neighbourhood]3645-his neighbourhood , [she]193-elizabeth was yet determined to give [him]181-jim no cause of complaint , [she]193-elizabeth presently again lays aside [her]193-elizabeth sorrowful looks , and , drawing [her]193-elizabeth chair confidentially nearer to [[her]193-elizabeth mother]3300-her mother 's , makes some remark of an evidently comic nature upon the company into [her]193-elizabeth ear . Was there ever such [an April creature]2323-an april creature ? [Mr. Le Marchant]210-mr. le marchant appears to take no part in the jokes ; [he]210-mr. le marchant goes on eating [his]210-mr. le marchant dinner silently , and [his]210-mr. le marchant back , which is turned towards [Burgoyne]181-jim , looks morose . How is it that [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth 's roving eye has not yet hit upon [himself]210-mr. le marchant ? [He]210-mr. le marchant sees presently that the cause lies in the fact of [her]193-elizabeth look alighting upon old and known objects of entertainment , rather than going in search of new ones . [The fond fat widow beside [him]210-mr. le marchant]2324-the fond fat widow beside him must surely be one of [[her]193-elizabeth favourites]2325-her favourites , and , in point of fact , as [he]210-mr. le marchant feverishly watches to see the inevitable moment of recognition arrive , [he]210-mr. le marchant perceives that [Miss Le Marchant]240-miss le marchant and [[her]240-miss le marchant mother]3300-her mother are delightedly — though not so openly as to be patent to the rest of [the room]442-the room — observing [her]193-elizabeth . And then comes the expected careless glance at [him]210-mr. le marchant , and the no less expected transformation . [Her]193-elizabeth elbows have been carelessly resting on the table , and [she]193-elizabeth has just been pressing [her]193-elizabeth laughing lips against [her]193-elizabeth lightly - joined hands to conceal [their]2328-they merriment . In an instant [he]210-mr. le marchant sees the right hand go out in a silent desperate clutch at [[her]240-miss le marchant mother]3300-her mother 's , and the next second [he]210-mr. le marchant knows that [she]193-elizabeth also has seen [him]210-mr. le marchant . [They]2328-they both stare helplessly at [him]210-mr. le marchant — at least , the one at [him]210-mr. le marchant , and the other beyond [him]210-mr. le marchant ! How well [he]210-mr. le marchant remembers that look of [hers]193-elizabeth over [his]210-mr. le marchant shoulder in search of [someone else]4028-someone else . But yet it is not the old look , for that was one of hope and red expectation . Is there any hope or expectation lurking even under the white dread of this one ? [His]210-mr. le marchant jealous heart is afraid quite to say no to this question , and yet an indisputable look of relief spreads over [her]193-elizabeth face as [she]193-elizabeth ascertains that [he]210-mr. le marchant is alone . [She]193-elizabeth even collects [herself]193-elizabeth enough to give [him]210-mr. le marchant a tiny inclination of the head — an example followed by [[her]240-miss le marchant mother]3300-her mother ; but they are , in both cases , so tiny as to be unperceived , save by [the person to whom [they]2328-they are addressed]2332-the person to whom they are addressed . [He]210-mr. le marchant would not have been offended by the minuteness of [their]2328-they salutations , even had [he]210-mr. le marchant not divined that it was dictated by a desire — however futile — to conceal the fact of [his]210-mr. le marchant presence from [[their]2328-they companion]2333-their companion . [His]210-mr. le marchant heart goes out in all the profundity of [his]210-mr. le marchant former pity towards [them]2328-they , as [he]210-mr. le marchant sees how entirely that one glance at [him]210-mr. le marchant ( for [she]193-elizabeth does not look again in [his]210-mr. le marchant direction ) has dried the fountain of [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth 's poor little jests ; of how white and grave and frightened , and even shrunk , [his]210-mr. le marchant mere presence has made [her]193-elizabeth . Now that [they]2328-they have detected [him]210-mr. le marchant , good breeding , and even humanity , forbid [his]210-mr. le marchant continuing any longer [his]210-mr. le marchant watch upon [them]2328-they . But all the same [he]210-mr. le marchant knows that , for [her]193-elizabeth , there will be no more mirth to - day . " That is what [they]2328-they always do ! "[210-mr. le marchant] cries a voice on [Burgoyne]181-jim 's left hand — the voice of [[his]181-jim other neighbour]2335-his other neighbour , who begins to think that [his]181-jim attention has been usurped quite long enough by [[her]2335-his other neighbour plump rival]2336-her plump rival . " That is what [they]2328-they always do — come long after dinner has begun , and go out long before it has ended . Such swagger ! "[210-mr. le marchant] There is a tinge of exasperation in both words and voice , nor is the cause far to seek . The table in the window is again empty . " Did [you]189-mrs. le marchant see [him]181-jim ? "[193-elizabeth] asks [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth breathlessly , as soon as the door is safely closed upon [them]2338-their , flinging [herself]193-elizabeth down upon [her]193-elizabeth knees beside [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant , who has sunk into a chair , and cowering close to [her]193-elizabeth as if for shelter . " What is [he]181-jim doing [here]637-here ? Why has [he]181-jim come ? When first [I]193-elizabeth caught sight of [him]181-jim [I]193-elizabeth thought that of course — "[193-elizabeth] [She]193-elizabeth breaks off , sobbing ; " and when [I]193-elizabeth saw that [he]181-jim was alone [I]193-elizabeth was relieved ; but [I]193-elizabeth was disappointed too ! Oh , [I]193-elizabeth must be [a fool]3448-a fool — [a bad fool]4706-a bad fool — but [I]193-elizabeth was disappointed ! Oh , mammy ! mammy ! how seeing [him]181-jim again brings it all back ! "[193-elizabeth] " Do not cry , [dear child]4707-dear child ! do not cry ! "[189-mrs. le marchant] answers [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant apprehensively ; though the voice in which [she]189-mrs. le marchant gives the exhortation is shaking too . " [[Your]193-elizabeth father]3331-your father will be in directly ; and [you]193-elizabeth know how angry — — "[189-mrs. le marchant] " [I]193-elizabeth will not ! [I]193-elizabeth will not ! "[193-elizabeth] cries [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth , trying , with [her]193-elizabeth usual extreme docility , to swallow [her]193-elizabeth tears ; " and [I]193-elizabeth do not show it much when [I]193-elizabeth have been crying ; [my]193-elizabeth eyes do not mind it as much as [most people]3423-most people 's ; [I]193-elizabeth suppose"—with[193-elizabeth] a small rainy smile—"because [they]3423-most people are so used to it ! "[189-mrs. le marchant] One of the reasons , though not the sole or even the main one , of [Burgoyne]181-jim 's visit to [Algiers]120-algiers is that [the Wilson family]686-the wilson family are wintering [there]455-there . And yet [he]181-jim dreads the meeting with [them]686-the wilson family inexpressibly . When [they]686-the wilson family last parted , immediately after having stood together round [[Amelia]201-amelia 's open grave]2349-amelia 's open grave , [they]686-the wilson family had all been at a high pressure of emotion , and of demonstrative affectionateness , which nothing in [their]686-the wilson family tastes , habits , or natures could possibly make continuous . [He]181-jim has a horrible fear that [they]686-the wilson family will expect to take up [their]686-the wilson family relations at the same point at which [he]181-jim had left [them]686-the wilson family . [He]181-jim would do it if [he]181-jim could , but [he]181-jim feels that it is absolutely impossible to [him]181-jim . The door of [that room in [his]181-jim memory which is labelled " [Amelia]201-amelia "]4714-that room in his memory which is labelled " amelia "[181-jim] is for ever locked . It is only in deepest silence and solitude that [he]181-jim permits [himself]181-jim now and again to turn the key and sparely and painfully look in . How will [he]181-jim bear it if [they]686-the wilson family insist on throwing the portals wide , dragging its disused furniture to the light , rummaging in its corners ? [He]181-jim sleeps ill on this , [his]181-jim first night of [Africa]128-africa ; and even when at length [he]181-jim succeeds in losing importunate consciousness , [he]181-jim is teased by absurd yet painful dreams , in which [Amelia]201-amelia and [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth jostle each other impossibly with jumbled personalities and changed attributes . Extravagant as [his]181-jim visions are , they have yet such a solid vividness that , at [his]181-jim first waking , [he]181-jim feels a strange sense of unsureness as to which of [the two women that have beset [his]181-jim pillow]2350-the two women that have beset his pillow is the dead , and which [the living one]2351-the living one . In dreams , how often [our]2352-our lost ones , and [those whom [we]2352-our still possess]2353-those whom we still possess , take hands together on equal terms ! Even when [he]181-jim is wide awake , nay more , dressed and breakfasted , that feeling of uncertainty , that something akin to the " Blank misgivings of a creature , Moving about in worlds not realized , "[330-m. cipriani] remains strong enough to drive [him]181-jim once again to the list of [visitors]810-visitors in [the entrance - hall]2355-the entrance - hall , in order to assure [himself]181-jim that [his]181-jim brain has not been the dupe of [his]181-jim eye . [M. Cipriani]330-m. cipriani has been as good as [his]181-jim word . The corrected list , promised overnight , has replaced the incomplete one , and almost the first names that [Jim]181-jim 's eye alights upon are those of " [Mr.]4715-mr. , [Mrs.]4716-mrs. , and [Miss Le Marchant]240-miss le marchant , [England]11-england . "[181-jim] [His]181-jim own name immediately follows , and [he]181-jim takes as a good augury what is merely an accident due to the fact of [[his]181-jim room]2111-his room and theirs being on one floor . [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth is , beyond question , beneath the same roof as [himself]181-jim ; nay , even now [she]193-elizabeth may probably be sunning [herself]193-elizabeth like a white pigeon on [that terrace]2357-that terrace , whose red tiles [he]181-jim sees shining in the morning sun through an open side - door . The thought is no sooner formed than [he]181-jim follows whither it leads [him]181-jim ; but [she]193-elizabeth is not on [the terrace]908-the terrace ; and though a moment ago [his]181-jim nerves were tingling at the thought of speech with [her]193-elizabeth , yet [he]181-jim is conscious of a feeling of relief that [their]2359-their meeting is , for the moment , deferred . What can [he]181-jim say to [her]193-elizabeth ? What can [she]193-elizabeth say to [him]181-jim ? [He]181-jim stands looking down on [the green sea of richly - clothed dark trees beneath [him]181-jim]2360-the green sea of richly - clothed dark trees beneath him — ilex and eucalyptus , and all the unfamiliar verdure of [the soft South]2361-the soft south . From the fiercely - blazing red purple of [a Bougainvillia]2362-a bougainvillia , so unlike the pale , cold lilac blossom , to which in [our]2363-our conservatories [we]2363-our give that name , [his]181-jim eye travels over tree - tops and [snowy villas]2364-snowy villas , [cool summer palace]2365-cool summer palace and [domy mosque]2366-domy mosque , to [the curving bay , round which [the Atlas Mountains]129-the atlas mountains are gently laying [their]129-the atlas mountains arms]2367-the curving bay , round which the atlas mountains are gently laying their arms ; and [Cape Matifou]152-cape matifou , with the haze of day 's young prime about it , is running out into [the Mediterranean]130-the mediterranean . [He]181-jim is alone at first , but presently [other people]4010-other people come forth ; [the old valetudinarian]2369-the old valetudinarian , for once delivered from [[his]2369-the old valetudinarian fostering widow]2370-his fostering widow , sits down with a pile of English newspapers to enjoy [himself]2369-the old valetudinarian in the sun , which does not yet ride so high as to be sun - strokey . [[Jim]181-jim 's last night 's neighbour]2371-jim 's last night 's neighbour in the red shirt comes out too , bonneted and prayer - booked . [She]2371-jim 's last night 's neighbour is going to [church]4060-church ; so is [he]181-jim : but [he]181-jim does not tell [her]2371-jim 's last night 's neighbour so , for fear [she]2371-jim 's last night 's neighbour should offer to accompany [him]181-jim . [She]2371-jim 's last night 's neighbour observes to [him]181-jim that the climate is a fraud ; that this is the first day for three weeks in which [she]2371-jim 's last night 's neighbour is able to go out without a mackintosh and umbrella . " [We]4717-we are not so green for nothing , [I]2371-jim 's last night 's neighbour can tell [you]181-jim , "[2371-jim 's last night 's neighbour] says [she]2371-jim 's last night 's neighbour , with a laugh , and a rather resentful glance at the splendid verdure around [her]2371-jim 's last night 's neighbour , and so leaves [him]181-jim . [He]181-jim , too , as [I]0-i have said , is going to [church]4060-church , and is presently asking [his]181-jim way to [the English chapel]2374-the english chapel . [The Wilson family]686-the wilson family will certainly be [there]455-there , and it has struck [him]181-jim that the dreaded meeting will be robbed of half its painful awkwardness if it takes place in public . At [a church - porch]2377-a church - porch , crowded with [issuing congregation]2378-issuing congregation , [Sybilla]221-sybilla can not fall into hysterics — it is true that [Sybilla]221-sybilla never attends divine service — nor can [Cecilia]222-cecilia weepingly throw [her]222-cecilia arms about [his]181-jim neck . But whatever means [he]181-jim may take to lessen the discomfort and smart of that expected encounter , the thought of it sits like lead upon [his]181-jim spirits , as [he]181-jim walks quickly — it is difficult to descend slowly so steep [a hill]2379-a hill — down [the precipitous lane]2380-the precipitous lane , which is the only mode of approach for [man]542-man or [labouring beast]2382-labouring beast to [the high - perched hotel [he]181-jim has chosen]2383-the high - perched hotel he has chosen . But [he]181-jim is young , and presently the cheerful , clean loveliness of the day and the sight of Nature 's superb vigour work their natural effect upon [him]181-jim . It must , indeed , be an inveterate grief that refuses to be soothed by the influences of [this green Eden]112-that little eden . What a generosity of vegetation , as evidenced by the enormous garlands of great - leaved ivy , waving from tree to tree as for some perpetual fête ! Along [the high hill bank that skirts [this steep by - road]2385-this steep by - road]2384-the high hill bank that skirts this steep by - road , eucalyptus rear [their]2386-their lofty heads and their faintly - scented blossoms , aloe draws [her]222-cecilia potent sword , and thick - fleshed prickly pear displays [her]222-cecilia uncouth malignity . Beneath , what a lush undergrowth of riotous great - foliaged plants — acanthus , and a hundred other green sisters , all flourishing and waxing , so unstinted , so at large ! [He]181-jim has reached [the main road]2387-the main road — [the shady road that leads by a three - mile descent from [Mustapha Supérieur]119-mustapha supérieur to [the town]407-the town]2388-the shady road that leads by a three - mile descent from mustapha supérieur to the town . How shady it is ! Pepper - trees hang [their]2386-their green hair , so thick and fine , over it ; and ilexes hold the thatch of [their]2386-their little dark leaves . Past [[the Governor]2390-the governor 's summer palace]2207-the governor 's summer palace , with [its]2207-the governor 's summer palace snowy dome and Moorish arcades gleaming through [its]2207-the governor 's summer palace iron gates . From [a villa garden]2392-a villa garden a flowering shrub sends a mixed perfume of sweet and bitter , as of honey and hops , from its long yellow flower - tassels to [his]181-jim pleased nostrils . At a sharp turn , where [the hill]1467-the hill falls away more precipitously than before , [the bay]2204-the bay , the mole , the shipping , [the dazzling little city]2395-the dazzling little city , burst upon [him]181-jim — [the little city]2396-the little city swarming up [[her]2396-the little city hill]2397-her hill , from where [the French town]2398-the french town bathes [its]2398-the french town feet in the azure ripples , to where [the Arab town]2399-the arab town loses [the peak of [its]2398-the french town triangle]2400-the peak of its triangle , in [the Casbah]132-the casbah and [the fort of the now execrated Emperor]2401-the fort of the now execrated emperor . Blinding white , ardent blue , profound green — what a pleasant picture for a summer Sunday morning ! And how gay [the road]3320-the road is too , as [the East]133-the east and [the West]2403-the west step along [it]3320-the road together ! Here is [a tram]2404-a tram tearing down the steep incline with five poor little thin horses abreast . [It]2405-it is full of [English church - goers]2406-english church - goers , and yet , oh anomaly ! standing up in the vulgarest of [modern vehicles]2407-modern vehicles , with [his]181-jim slight dark hands grasping [the tramrail]2408-the tramrail , is [a tall Arab , draped with the grave grace of the Vatican Demosthenes]2409-a tall arab , draped with the grave grace of the vatican demosthenes . But alas ! alas ! even upon [him]181-jim [the West]134-the west has laid its claw , for , as [the tram]2410-the tram rushes past , [Jim]181-jim 's shocked eyes realize that [he]181-jim , who in other respects might have fed [the flocks of [Laban]135-laban in [Padan - aram]136-padan - aram]2411-the flocks of laban in padan - aram , wears on [his]181-jim feet a pair of old elastic - sided boots . [He]181-jim had thought [himself]181-jim in good time , but [he]181-jim must have loitered more than [he]181-jim had been aware of , as the bell is silent and [the porch]2424-the porch closed . [He]181-jim has plenty of time to interrogate with [his]181-jim eye the numerous rows of backs before [him]181-jim , as the sermon is long . [Jim]181-jim had known that it would be so from the moment when [the clergyman]3644-the clergyman entered the pulpit with an open Bible — no written sermon — in [his]3644-the clergyman hand . "[202-mr. wilson] And then the meeting is over — that first meeting which [Jim]181-jim had shrunk from with such inexpressible apprehension — as certain to be so fraught with intolerable emotion ; with calls upon [him]181-jim that [he]181-jim would not be able to answer ; with baring of incurable wounds . "[2456-the showy creature beside him , preening herself under her gay sunshade , be the same overwhelmed , shrunk , tear - drenched cecilia whom at their last meeting he had folded in so solemn an embrace] [She]2456-the showy creature beside him , preening herself under her gay sunshade , be the same overwhelmed , shrunk , tear - drenched cecilia whom at their last meeting he had folded in so solemn an embrace ends with a laugh , which [he]2458-he listens to in a silence that is almost stunned . [They]2460-we have been strolling towards [the carriages waiting outside]2461-the carriages waiting outside , and have now reached one , driven by an indigène , [a Moor]2462-a moor , dusky as [Othello]334-othello , solemn as [Rhadamanthus]335-rhadamanthus , and with [his]2458-he serious charms set off by a striped yellow and white jacket and a red sash . " Is not [he]2458-he beautiful ? "[222-cecilia] asks [Cecilia]222-cecilia , with another laugh , alluding to [[her]222-cecilia coachman]2463-her coachman , as [she]222-cecilia and [Burgoyne]181-jim set off upon [[their]2460-we tête - à - tête drive]2464-their tête - à - tête drive , [Mr. Wilson]202-mr. wilson seeing , apparently , no reason in the fact of [his]2458-he ( [Burgoyne]181-jim 's ) appearance on the scene for departing from [his]2458-he invariable custom of walking [home]401-home from [church]4060-church ; " is not [he]2458-he beautiful ? When first [we]2460-we came here [we]2460-we were in mourning ; as if"—catching[2467-i] [herself]2467-i up with a stifled sigh—"there were any need to tell [you]181-jim that ; and [father]3390-father wanted to put [him]2458-he into black , but [I]2467-i would not hear of it : was not [I]2467-i right ? [He]2458-he would have been nothing in black ; it is [his]2458-he red and yellow that give [him]2458-he [his]2458-he cachet . "[2467-i] [Jim]181-jim feels inclined to burst out laughing . There is something so ludicrous in the disproportion between [his]181-jim fears and their fulfilment , in the fact of the whole importance of [Amelia]201-amelia 's death resolving itself into a sash or no sash for [an Arab coachman]2468-an arab coachman , that [he]181-jim has some difficulty in answering in a key of which the irony shall not be too patent : " [I]181-jim think [you]181-jim were perfectly right . "[181-jim] [He]181-jim does not know whether [she]2467-i perceives the dryness of [his]181-jim tone ; [he]181-jim thinks probably not , as [she]2467-i goes on to ask [him]181-jim a great many questions as to [his]181-jim journey , etc . , talking quickly and rather flightily , scarcely leaving room between [her]2467-i queries for [his]181-jim monosyllabic replies , and ending with the ejaculation : " How nice it is to see [you]181-jim again ! "[2467-i] " Thank [you]181-jim . "[181-jim] [His]181-jim acknowledgment seems to [himself]181-jim so curt that , after a moment , [he]181-jim feels constrained to add something to it . That something is the bald and trivial inquiry : " And [you]181-jim — how have [you]181-jim all been getting on ? "[222-cecilia] [Cecilia]222-cecilia shrugs [her]2467-i shoulders . " [We]181-jim are better off than [we]181-jim were ; [you]181-jim know that , of course . [Nobody]3337-nobody ever thought that [[father]3390-father 's brother]4723-father 's brother would have died before [him]4723-father 's brother . Wait till [you]181-jim see [[our]181-jim villa]4724-our villa — it is [one of [the show ones here]4726-the show ones here]4725-one of the show ones here ; and of course it is very pleasant having more money ; but [one]501-one can not help wishing that it had come earlier . "[2467-i] [She]222-cecilia sighs as [she]222-cecilia speaks ; not an ostentatious sigh , but a repressed and strangled one ; and , despite the flower - garden in [her]222-cecilia bonnet , [his]2469-his heart softens to [her]222-cecilia . Perhaps [his]2469-his look has rested on that flower - garden with a more open disapprobation than [he]2469-his knows , for [she]222-cecilia says presently : " [I]222-cecilia think that one may be very bright - coloured outside , and very black inside . [Father]225-father and [I]222-cecilia are sometimes very black inside . "[222-cecilia] " Are [you]2469-his ? "[222-cecilia] " [We]181-jim do very well when [we]181-jim are alone together , [father]3390-father and [I]222-cecilia ; [we]181-jim like to talk about [her]222-cecilia . Dear [me]222-cecilia ! what [a place [Algiers]120-algiers is for dust]4729-a place algiers is for dust ! that is why there are so many [blind people]4730-blind people [here]637-here . How it gets into [one]501-one 's eyes ! "[222-cecilia] [She]222-cecilia puts [her]222-cecilia handkerchief up hastily to [her]222-cecilia face as [she]222-cecilia speaks ; but [Jim]181-jim is not taken in by [the poor little ruse]2470-the poor little ruse , and [he]181-jim listens to [her]222-cecilia in a silence that is almost tender , as [she]222-cecilia goes on : " [Sybilla]221-sybilla begins to cry if [we]181-jim even distantly allude to [her]221-sybilla ; yet [I]181-jim know"—with[181-jim] exasperation—"that [she]221-sybilla talks of [her]221-sybilla by the hour to [strangers]538-strangers — to [[her]221-sybilla new doctor]4734-her new doctor , for instance ; yes , [she]221-sybilla has picked up [a new doctor]4735-a new doctor [here]637-here — [a dreadful little adventurer]4737-a dreadful little adventurer ! " When [I]221-sybilla think — when [I]221-sybilla think of [our]4739-our last meeting ! "[221-sybilla] [she]221-sybilla says hysterically . " Yes , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim says , gasping ; " yes , of course . What [a beautiful villa [you]221-sybilla have [here]637-here]4740-a beautiful villa you have here ! "[181-jim] The observation is a true one , though , for the moment , [he]181-jim has not the least idea whether it is beautiful or not , as [he]181-jim turns [his]181-jim tormented eyes round upon [the delicious little court]2478-the delicious little court , with [its]2478-the delicious little court charming combination of slender twisted marble columns , of mellow - tinted tiles , of low plashing fountain . Originally [it]2478-the delicious little court has been open , roofless to the eye and the breath and the rains of heaven ; but [[its]2478-the delicious little court Northern purchaser]2479-its northern purchaser has covered [it]2478-the delicious little court in with glass , and set low divans and luxuriantly cushioned bamboo chairs about [its]2478-the delicious little court soft - tumbling water . [He]181-jim looks round anxiously for [Cecilia]222-cecilia , but [she]221-sybilla has gone to take off [her]221-sybilla bonnet , and [Mr. Wilson]202-mr. wilson has not yet come in . " It is very beautiful ; and , of course , it is everything for [weary eyes]4742-weary eyes to have such pleasant objects to rest upon . [I]3676-the invalid believe"—with[3676-the invalid] a little laugh—"that [we]4743-we [sick people]3489-sick people really take in most of [our]4743-we nourishment through the eyes . ' "[3676-the invalid] It is needless to say how innocent of the mental ejaculation attributed to [him]181-jim [Jim]181-jim has been , and the consciousness of it makes [him]181-jim inquire with guilty haste : " But [you]3676-the invalid were none the worse ? "[3676-the invalid] [Her]3676-the invalid voice has a suspicious tremble in it which frightens [Jim]181-jim anew . [He]181-jim looks again apprehensively for help towards the two tiers of curving column and rounding arch , which rise in cool grace above each other , and sees , with relief , the figure of [Cecilia]222-cecilia leaning over the balustrade that runs along the upper tier , and looking down upon [him]181-jim . At the same moment [Mr. Wilson]202-mr. wilson enters , and shortly afterwards [they]2482-we all go to luncheon . It is not a very pleasant repast , although [the cool dining - room]2483-the cool dining - room , with [its]2483-the cool dining - room beautiful old pierced stucco ceiling and [its]2483-the cool dining - room hanging brass lamps , contributes [its]2483-the cool dining - room part handsomely towards what should be [their]2482-we enjoyment . " [We]2482-we quarrel more than [we]2482-we used to do , do not [we]2482-we ? " Notre Dame d'Afrique — [Lady of [Africa]128-africa]4760-lady of africa — is [an ugly lady , homely and black]4761-an ugly lady , homely and black ; and [the church that is dedicated to [her]4761-an ugly lady , homely and black]4762-the church that is dedicated to her is ugly too — new and mock - Moorish ; but , like [many another ugly lady]4763-many another ugly lady , being very nobly placed , [she]4761-an ugly lady , homely and black has a great and solemn air .
