Now and again [a woman , clad in humble black that tells of prayers in vain]4795-a woman , clad in humble black that tells of prayers in vain , goes up with [her]4795-a woman , clad in humble black that tells of prayers in vain thin candle , and , lighting it , sticks it in its sconce among the others that burn before the altar . For awhile [Burgoyne]181-jim finds it pleasant after [his]181-jim climb to sit and watch [her]4795-a woman , clad in humble black that tells of prayers in vain , and speculate pityingly with what hope of still possible good to [herself]4795-a woman , clad in humble black that tells of prayers in vain [she]4795-a woman , clad in humble black that tells of prayers in vain is setting [her]4795-a woman , clad in humble black that tells of prayers in vain slender taper alight — now that [her]4795-a woman , clad in humble black that tells of prayers in vain treasure has all too obviously gone down beneath the waves ; to sit and speculate , and smell the heady incense , and listen to the murmur of chanted supplication ; but presently , growing weary of the uncomprehended service , [he]181-jim slips outside to [the little plateau]4796-the little plateau , with [its]4796-the little plateau view straight out — no importunate land - object intervening — towards [the sea]2491-the sea , across which [a little steamer]4798-a little steamer is cutting [her]4795-a woman , clad in humble black that tells of prayers in vain way ; and on the horizon two tiny shining sails are lying . Here , on [this bold headland]4799-this bold headland , it seems as if one were [one]501-one 's self in [mid - ocean]4801-mid - ocean ; and [one]501-one has to lean far over the low wall in order to realize that there is some solid earth between [us]4803-us and it ; that [two full cities of [the dead]4805-the dead]4804-two full cities of the dead — [a Jewish]4806-a jewish and [a Christian]4807-a christian — lie below . From [the land - cemeteries]4808-the land - cemeteries to [the vast sea - cemetery]4809-the vast sea - cemetery — for read by the light of that plain inscription upon which [his]181-jim eyes are resting , what is even the azure Mediterranean but [a grave]4810-a grave ? For the matter of that , what is all life but a grave ? [He]181-jim turns away , and , muttering these words half absently between [his]181-jim lips , begins to make the circuit of [the church]3445-the church ; and in doing so , comes suddenly upon [three persons who are apparently similarly employed]4812-three persons who are apparently similarly employed . [The party]3587-the party consists of [a man]386-a man and [two ladies]4815-two ladies . Being a little ahead of [him]181-jim , [they]4812-three persons who are apparently similarly employed are , for the first moment or two , not aware of [his]181-jim presence , an ignorance by which [he]181-jim , rather to [his]181-jim own discomfiture , profits to overhear a scrap of [their]4812-three persons who are apparently similarly employed conversation certainly not intended for [his]181-jim ears . "[501-one] [I]0-i suppose that [you]2493-you were wool - gathering , as usual ? " [Mr. Le Marchant]210-mr. le marchant is saying , with an accent of cold severity , to [[his]210-mr. le marchant daughter]2083-his daughter ; "[2493-you] but [I]0-i should have thought that even [you]2493-you might have remembered to bring a wrap of some kind for [[your]2493-you mother]1065-your mother ! " [Jim]181-jim starts , partly at having happened so unexpectedly upon [the people]1465-the people before [him]181-jim , partly in shocked astonishment at the harshness both of voice and words . In the old days [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth had been the apple of [[her]193-elizabeth father]3214-her father 's eye , to [oppose whose lightest fancy was a capital offence , for whom no words could be too sugared , no looks too doting]4819-oppose whose lightest fancy was a capital offence , for whom no words could be too sugared , no looks too doting . Yet now [she]193-elizabeth answers , with the sweetest good - humour , and without the slightest sign of surprise or irritation , or any indication that the occurrence is not a habitual one : "[2493-you] [I]0-i can not think how [I]0-i could have been so stupid ; it was inexcusable of [me]0-i . " "[0-i] [I]0-i quite agree with [you]2493-you , " replies [the father]2096-the father , entirely unmollified ; "[2493-you] [I]0-i am sure [you]2493-you have been told often enough how liable to chills insufficient clothing makes [people]3155-people in this beastly climate at sundown . " "[0-i] But it is not near sundown , " breaks in [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant , throwing [herself]189-mrs. le marchant anxiously , and with a dexterity which shows how frequently [she]189-mrs. le marchant is called upon to do so , between [the two others]4821-the two others ; "[0-i] look what a great piece of blue sky the sun has yet to travel . " "[2493-you] [You]2493-you shall have [my]0-i jacket , " cries [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth impetuously , but still with the same perfect sweetness ; "[2493-you] it will be absurdly short for [you]2493-you , but , at least , it will keep [you]2493-you warm . " So saying , [she]193-elizabeth , with the speed of lightning , whips off the garment alluded to , and proceeds to guide [[her]193-elizabeth mother]3300-her mother 's arms into its inconveniently tight sleeves , laughing the while with [her]193-elizabeth odd childish light - heartedness , and crying , "[2493-you] [You]2493-you dear thing , [you]2493-you do look too ridiculous ! " [The mother]579-the mother laughs too , and aids [[her]579-the mother daughter]3525-her daughter 's efforts ; nor does it seem to occur to any of [the three]971-the three that the fatal Southern chill may possibly strike the delicate little frame of [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth , now exposed , so lightly clad in [her]193-elizabeth tweed gown , to its insidious influence . "[2493-you] [I]0-i wish [you]2493-you had a looking - glass to see [yourself]2493-you in ! " cries [she]193-elizabeth , rippling into fresh mirth ; "[0-i] does not [she]0-i look funny , [father]3390-father ! " appealing to [him]3390-father with as little resentment for [his]3390-father past surliness as would be shown by a good dog ( [I]0-i can not put it more strongly ) , and yet , as it seems to [Jim]181-jim , with a certain nervous deprecation . The next moment one of [them]971-the three — [he]3390-father does not know which — has caught sight of [himself]3390-father , and the moment after [he]3390-father is shaking hands with [all three]4826-all three . It is clear that the fact of [his]3390-father presence in [Algiers]120-algiers has been notified to [Mr. Le Marchant]210-mr. le marchant , for there is no surprise in [his]3390-father coldly civil greeting . [He]3390-father makes it as short as possible , and almost at once turns to continue [his]3390-father circuit of [the church]3445-the church , [[his]3390-father wife]755-his wife at [his]3390-father side , and [[his]3390-father daughter]2083-his daughter meekly following . Doubtless [they]971-the three do not wish for [his]3390-father ( [Jim]181-jim 's ) company ; but yet , as [he]3390-father was originally , and without any reference to [them]971-the three , going in [their]971-the three direction , it would seem natural that [he]3390-father should walk along with [them]971-the three . [He]3390-father is hesitating as to whether or no to adopt this course , when [he]3390-father is decided by a very slight movement of [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth 's head . [She]193-elizabeth does not actually look over [her]193-elizabeth shoulder at [him]3390-father , and yet it seems to [him]3390-father as if , were [her]193-elizabeth gesture completed , it would amount to that ; but it is arrested by some impulse before it is more than sketched . Such as it is , it suffices to take [him]3390-father to [her]193-elizabeth side ; and it seems to [him]3390-father that there is a sort of satisfaction mingled with the undoubted apprehension in [her]193-elizabeth face , as [she]193-elizabeth realizes that it is so . [Her]193-elizabeth eyes , as [she]193-elizabeth turns them upon [him]3390-father , have a hungry question in them which [her]193-elizabeth lips seem afraid to put . Apparently [she]193-elizabeth can not get nearer to it than this — very tremblingly and hurriedly uttered , with a timid glance at [[her]193-elizabeth father]3214-her father 's back , as if [she]193-elizabeth were delivering [herself]193-elizabeth of some compromising secret instead of the mere platitude which [she]193-elizabeth so indistinctly vents : "[0-i] A — a — great many things have happened since — since [we]2497-we last met ! " [Her]193-elizabeth eye travels for a moment to [his]3390-father hat , from which , unlike [Cecilia]222-cecilia 's rainbow raiment , the crape band has not yet been removed ; and [he]3390-father understands that [she]193-elizabeth is comprehending [his]3390-father troubles as well as [her]193-elizabeth own in the phrase . "[2498-a great many] [A great many]2498-a great many ! " [he]3390-father answers baldly . [He]3390-father has not the cruelty to wish to keep [her]193-elizabeth on tenterhooks , and [he]3390-father knows perfectly what is the question that is written in the wistful blue of [her]193-elizabeth look , and whom it concerns ; but it would be impertinence in [him]3390-father to take for granted that knowledge , and answer that curiosity which , however intense and apparent , has yet not become the current coin of speech . Probably [she]193-elizabeth sees that [he]3390-father is unable or unwilling to help [her]193-elizabeth , for [she]193-elizabeth makes another tremendous effort . "[0-i] [I]0-i hope that — that — all [[your]0-i friends]3452-your friends are well . " "[2500-all my friends] [All [my]0-i friends]2500-all my friends ! " repeats [he]3390-father , half sadly ; "[2500-all my friends] [they]2500-all my friends are not such a numerous band ; [I]0-i have not many friends left still alive . " [His]3390-father thoughts have reverted to [his]3390-father own loss , for , at the moment , [Amelia]201-amelia is very present to [him]3390-father ; but the words are no sooner out of [his]3390-father mouth than [he]3390-father sees how false is the impression produced by [his]3390-father reply — sees it written in the sudden dead - whiteness of [her]201-amelia cheek and the terror in [her]201-amelia eye . "[0-i] Do [you]0-i mean"—she stammers—"that[0-i] [anybody]3681-anybody — [any of [[your]0-i friends]3452-your friends]2502-any of your friends — is — is lately dead ? " "[0-i] Oh no ! no ! " [he]3390-father cries reassuringly ; "[0-i] [you]0-i are making a mistake ; [nobody]3337-nobody is dead — [nobody]3337-nobody , that is"—with a sigh—"that[0-i] [you]0-i do not already know of . [All [our]2507-our friends]2506-all our friends — [all [our]2507-our common friends]2508-all our common friends — are , as far as [I]0-i know — — " "[193-elizabeth] [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth ! " breaks in [Mr. Le Marchant]210-mr. le marchant 's voice , in severe appellation ; [he]3390-father has only just become aware that [[his]3390-father daughter]2083-his daughter is not unaccompanied , and the discovery apparently does not please [him]3390-father . Without a second 's delay , despite [her]2083-his daughter twenty - seven years , [she]2083-his daughter has sprung forwards to obey the summons ; and [Jim]181-jim has the sense to make no further effort to rejoin [her]2083-his daughter . By the time that [their]2506-all our friends circuit is finished , and [they]2506-all our friends have again reached the front of [the church]3445-the church , vespers are ended , and there is a movement outwards among [the worshippers]4833-the worshippers . [They]2506-all our friends stream — not very numerous — out on [the little terrace]4834-the little terrace . [The priests]4835-the priests follow , [tonsured , but — which looks strange — with beards and whiskers]4836-tonsured , but — which looks strange — with beards and whiskers . [The acolytes]4837-the acolytes , in [their]4837-the acolytes red chasubles , carry a black and white pall , and lay it over the memorial stone below the cross . On either hand stand [a band of decently clad youths]4838-a band of decently clad youths — [sons of drowned seamen]4839-sons of drowned seamen — playing on brass instruments . It is a poor little music , doubtfully in tune ; but surely no rolling organ , [no papal choir]4840-no papal choir , could touch the heart so much as this simple ceremonial . The little Latin cross standing sheer out against [the sea]2491-the sea ; the black pall thrown over the stone that commemorates [[the sea]2491-the sea 's innumerable dead]4843-the sea 's innumerable dead ; [the red - clad acolytes , standing with eyes cast down , holding aloft [their]4837-the acolytes high tapers , whose flickering flame the sea - wind soon puffs out]4844-the red - clad acolytes , standing with eyes cast down , holding aloft their high tapers , whose flickering flame the sea - wind soon puffs out ; and [the sons of [the drowned sailors]4846-the drowned sailors]4845-the sons of the drowned sailors , making [their]4845-the sons of the drowned sailors homely music to the accompaniment of the salt breeze . The little service is brief and [those who have taken part in it]4847-those who have taken part in it are soon dispersing . As [they]4847-those who have taken part in it do so , [Jim]181-jim once more finds [himself]181-jim for a moment close to [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth . The sun has nearly touched [the sea - line]4848-the sea - line by this time , and [he]181-jim sees , or thinks [he]181-jim sees , [her]2509-she shiver . "[193-elizabeth] [You]2509-she are cold , " [he]181-jim says solicitously ; "[2509-she] [you]2509-she will get a chill . " [She]2509-she looks back at [him]181-jim , half surprised , half grateful , at the anxiety of [his]181-jim tone . "[0-i] Not [I]0-i ! " [she]2509-she answers , with a gentle air of indifference and recklessness ; "[193-elizabeth] naught never comes to harm ! " "[0-i] But [you]2509-she shivered ! [I]0-i saw [you]2509-she shiver . " "[0-i] Did [I]0-i ? It was only"—smiling—"that a goose walked over [my]0-i grave . Does [a goose]4849-a goose never walk over [[your]181-jim grave]3981-your grave ? "[0-i] And once more [she]2509-she is gone . [He]2510-he does not see [her]2509-she again that day . Of the three places laid for dinner at [the round table in [the salle à manger]671-the salle à manger]2511-the round table in the salle à manger , only two are occupied ; hers is , and remains , empty . [She]2509-she is not with [[her]2509-she parents]583-her parents , and , what is more , [she]2509-she does not appear to be missed by [them]583-her parents . It fills [Jim]181-jim with something of the same shocked surprise as [he]181-jim had felt on hearing the cold and surly tone in which [she]2509-she had been addressed by [[her]2509-she father]3214-her father , to see how much more , and more genially , [that father]2515-that father talks ; how much less morose [his]2515-that father back looks than had been the case on the previous evening . The next morning rises superb in steady splendour , and [Jim]181-jim , on issuing out on [the little red - tiled terrace]2516-the little red - tiled terrace , finds the whole strength of [the hotel]1144-the hotel gathered upon [it]2516-the little red - tiled terrace . [Even the worst invalids]2518-even the worst invalids , who have not shown [their]2518-even the worst invalids noses outside [[their]2518-even the worst invalids rooms]2519-their rooms for a fortnight , are sunning [themselves]2518-even the worst invalids , wrapped in apparently unnecessary furs . [The Arabs]2520-the arabs and [Turks]339-turks have spread [their]2520-the arabs gay rugs and carpets , and displayed [their]2520-the arabs bits of stuff , [their]2520-the arabs brasswork , and [their]2520-the arabs embroidery . [They]2520-the arabs make a charming garden of colour under the blue . [One]501-one is lying beside [his]501-one wares , in an azure jacket and a rose - red sash , twanging a " gunébri , "[501-one] or little Arab mandolin . Apart from the rest of [the company]1638-the company , at the extreme end of [the terrace]908-the terrace , in [a place which is evidently [hers]2525-her by prescriptive right , close to the balustrade , upon whose blue and white tiled top [her]2525-her books are lying]2524-a place which is evidently hers by prescriptive right , close to the balustrade , upon whose blue and white tiled top her books are lying , [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth is sitting — and sitting alone , [neither truculent father]2526-neither truculent father not frightened [mother]3447-mother barring approach to [her]2525-her . [He]501-one makes [his]501-one way at once to [her]2525-her . " [You]2525-her were not at dinner last night ? "[501-one] " No . "[501-one] " [I]2525-her hope that did not mean that [you]2525-her were ill ? "[2525-her] [Her]2525-her eyes are not lifted to [his]501-one — resting rather on the balustrade , through whose pierced brickwork little boughs of [Bougainvillia]142-bougainvillia are pushing . " No , [I]2525-her was not ill , "[2525-her] [she]2525-her replies slowly ; " but [I]2525-her had made such a figure of [myself]2525-her by crying that mammy thought [I]2525-her had better stay away . When [I]2525-her looked in the glass , "[2525-her] [she]2525-her adds humorously , " [I]2525-her thought so [myself]2525-her . "[2525-her] " There was not much sign of tears about [you]2525-her when [we]4851-we parted at [Notre Dame d'Afrique]139-notre dame d'afrique , "[501-one] [he]501-one says brusquely . " No , but"—with[2525-her] a sudden lifting of [her]2525-her pretty lashes—"you know there is never any medium in [me]2525-her ; [I]2525-her am always either laughing or crying ; and , of course , seeing [you]2525-her again brought — brought things back to [me]2525-her . "[2525-her] [She]2525-her looks wistfully at [him]501-one as [she]2525-her makes this leading remark . [He]501-one can no longer have any doubt as to [her]2525-her wish to embark upon the subject which , even in the three minutes of [their]2528-their meeting on the previous day , [she]2525-her had sought to approach . If [he]501-one is kind , [he]501-one will enter into [her]2525-her wish , [he]501-one will make [her]2525-her path easier for [her]2525-her ; but for the moment [he]501-one does not feel kind — angry , rather , and rebellious . Is [his]501-one intercourse with [her]2525-her to be a mere repetition of that which , although now seven months ago , makes [him]501-one still writhe , in the recollection of [his]501-one latter intercourse with [Byng]203-byng ? Is [he]501-one again to be spitted upon the skewer of reminiscences of [the Vallombrosan wood]2529-the vallombrosan wood ? Never ! [He]501-one looks obstinately away from [her]2525-her — towards where first [an ivied bank]2530-an ivied bank rises , with red gladioli flowering upon it ; then a little space of bare ground , then a row of orange - trees ; then some young stone - pines , holding [their]2531-their heads against the blue to show what an exquisite contrast [they]2531-their make to it ; then , topping , or seeming to top [the hill]1467-the hill , [a white villa]2533-a white villa , with little blue jewels of sky , seen through the interstices of the balustrade on [its]2533-a white villa roof , [its]2533-a white villa whitewash making the solid wall of sapphire behind [it]2533-a white villa look even more desperately and unnameably blue than elsewhere . What a blue ! sapphire ! turquoise ! lapis ! To what poor shifts are [we]2534-we driven to express it ! How could [we]2534-we describe its glory to [a blind person]2535-a blind person ? If to such a one the colour of scarlet is represented by the sound of a trumpet , surely this divine tint above [us]2534-we can be best conveyed by [the whole heavenly hierarchy of burning seraphs and winged angels , harping and quiring together]2536-the whole heavenly hierarchy of burning seraphs and winged angels , harping and quiring together . " [I]193-elizabeth always think , "[193-elizabeth] says [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth , following the direction of [his]501-one eyes—"perhaps it may be fancy — that this particular corner of the sky is much bluer than any other . "[2525-her] There is a shade of disappointment in [her]2525-her tone at [his]501-one failure to take up [her]2525-her challenge , but [she]2525-her is far too gentle to make any further effort in a direction which , for some reason , is disagreeable to [him]501-one ; and since [he]501-one will not follow [her]2525-her inclination , [she]2525-her is pliantly willing to follow [his]501-one . [The Arabs]340-arabs have come up in might to - day , and , no longer fearing rain , have carpeted almost [the whole terrace]2537-the whole terrace with [their]340-arabs wares . They hang over the low wall , and cover the red tiles ; blue and purple , and [Moslem]341-moslem green , and Venetian red ; dazzling white haiks , blinding in the blinding sunshine ; carpets , embroidered jackets , flashing back gold in the gold light . [A pert English miss]2538-a pert english miss is standing over [them]2539-them , and saying disparagingly about each : " [You]501-one can get this 7 - 1/2d . cheaper at [[Whiteley]342-whiteley 's]4852-whiteley 's . "[193-elizabeth] " Indeed ! "[181-jim] [His]181-jim tone is so curt that the stream of [her]193-elizabeth gaiety dries up under it , and [she]193-elizabeth relapses into silence , looking towards [the flashing sea]2546-the flashing sea , and the ficus - tree , that is casting its now grateful shade . " [You]193-elizabeth said just now that seeing [me]193-elizabeth brought things back to [you]193-elizabeth . "[193-elizabeth] It is partly remorse at having snubbed [her]193-elizabeth , and partly perversity , which dictates this sentence on [Jim]181-jim 's part . The perversity is , perhaps , the predominating element in [his]181-jim motive — a perversity which , having chilled [her]193-elizabeth away from the subject when [she]193-elizabeth was eagerly seeking an opening to it , now forces [her]193-elizabeth to return to it . [She]193-elizabeth starts a little . " Yes — yes , "[193-elizabeth] [she]193-elizabeth answers ; " but ' brought things back ' is not quite the right phrase ; they"—her[193-elizabeth] voice growing low and tremulous—"had not very far to come . "[193-elizabeth] The quiver in [her]193-elizabeth voice annoys [him]181-jim almost as much as [Byng]203-byng 's tears used to do . " If [you]193-elizabeth would like to ask [me]181-jim any questions , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim says stiffly , " [I]181-jim am ready to answer them . "[181-jim] " Are [you]181-jim ? "[193-elizabeth] [He]181-jim follows [her]193-elizabeth silently , and neither speaks till [they]2547-they find [themselves]2547-they tête - à - tête in [the private apartment of [the Le Marchants]261-the le marchants]2548-the private apartment of the le marchants . [It]2549-it is on [the rez - de - chaussée]2550-the rez - de - chaussée , [a suite of [three little whitewashed rooms]2552-three little whitewashed rooms , transmogrified from [their]2547-they original hotel nakedness by flowers and brocade bits]2551-a suite of three little whitewashed rooms , transmogrified from their original hotel nakedness by flowers and brocade bits . Three large green jars on the chimney - piece , full of generous rose - branches , and boughs of salvia and iris , and stalwart yellow jessamine , make the air sweetly and lightly perfumed . On the table is a litter of Tauchnitz novels , disastrously old English papers , the little scurrilous Algerian sheet , and , lastly , [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth 's workbasket — the big workbasket which [Jim]181-jim had last seen standing on the floor in [the entresol]990-the entresol , at [the Piazza d'Azeglio]3491-the piazza d'azeglio , with its contents strewn all over [[his]181-jim friend]393-his friend 's prostrate body . At the sight a bitter smile breaks over [his]181-jim face . " [An old acquaintance]3952-an old acquaintance ! "[181-jim] [he]181-jim says , making a mock salutation to it ; " it is in better order than when last [I]181-jim had the pleasure of seeing it . "[181-jim] " Do [you]181-jim mean in [Florence]20-florence ? "[193-elizabeth] [she]193-elizabeth asks , very slowly . " Yes"—still[193-elizabeth] with that acrid smile—"after [you]181-jim were gone , [I]193-elizabeth had the honour of helping to pack it to send after [you]181-jim . By - the - bye , did [you]181-jim find any rust on [your]181-jim scissors and thimble when next [you]181-jim had occasion to use them ? [Poor boy]4870-poor boy ! [he]181-jim cried enough over them to take all the polish off ! "[193-elizabeth] [She]193-elizabeth has sunk down upon the sofa , over which a great woollen haik , dyed with harmonious dull tints , is thrown . " Do not sneer at [me]193-elizabeth ! "[193-elizabeth] [she]193-elizabeth says faintly . " [You]181-jim would not if [you]181-jim knew how [you]181-jim hurt [me]193-elizabeth . Is [he]181-jim — is [he]181-jim — how is [he]181-jim ? "[193-elizabeth] " [He]181-jim is not ill . "[193-elizabeth] The answer ought to be reassuring ; but there is something in the manner in which it is uttered that tells [her]193-elizabeth that it neither is , nor is meant to be so . It is so ominous that [her]193-elizabeth lips , after a feeble effort or two , give up the endeavour to frame any query . All [her]193-elizabeth power of interrogation has passed into those eyes , out of which [[her]193-elizabeth companion]540-her companion has been so brilliantly successful in chasing [their]2557-their transient morning mirth . " When [a man]386-a man , "[181-jim] says [Jim]181-jim gravely , " at the outset of [his]386-a man life , gets such a facer as [he]386-a man did , if [he]386-a man has not a very strong character , it is apt to drive [him]386-a man off the rails , to give [him]386-a man a shove downwards . "[181-jim] " [I]181-jim see ; and [you]181-jim think [I]181-jim have given [him]386-a man a shove downwards ? "[181-jim] " Yes . "[181-jim] There is a pause . [Jim]181-jim 's eyes are resolutely turned away from the face of [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth , upon whose small white area twitches of pain are making cruel disfigurement . [He]181-jim does not want to have [his]181-jim heart softened towards [her]193-elizabeth , so [he]181-jim stares persistently over [her]193-elizabeth head at a Mussulman praying - carpet , which , old and still rich - toned , despite the wearing of pious knees , hangs on the wall . At length [she]193-elizabeth speaks , in a key as low as — were not [the room]442-the room so entirely still — would be inaudible . " If [I]193-elizabeth had married [him]386-a man , [I]193-elizabeth should have given [him]386-a man a much worse shove down . "[193-elizabeth] [Jim]181-jim holds [his]181-jim breath . Is [he]181-jim about to hear from [her]193-elizabeth own lips that secret which [he]181-jim has magnanimously resisted all opportunities of hearing from other sources ? But the words that , after a pause , follow this almost whispered statement are not a confession . They are only an appeal . " [You]193-elizabeth would be doing the kindest thing that [you]193-elizabeth ever did in [your]193-elizabeth life , if [you]193-elizabeth could bring [yourself]193-elizabeth to say that [you]193-elizabeth thought [I]181-jim did it for the best . "[181-jim] [He]181-jim feels that if [he]181-jim submits [his]181-jim eyes to [hers]193-elizabeth , [his]181-jim will must go with [them]2559-them ; [he]181-jim will have no power left of dissent from any request [she]193-elizabeth may choose to make ; so [he]181-jim still stares over [her]193-elizabeth head at a screen which hides the doorless entrance to [the third room of [the little suite]2561-the little suite]2560-the third room of the little suite . One leaf , folded back , gives a peep through [the little chamber]2562-the little chamber , through [its]2562-the little chamber deep - arched window to where a date - palm stands up straight against [the sea]2491-the sea . " [I]181-jim could not possibly say that unless [I]181-jim knew the circumstances of the case , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim answers judicially . [He]181-jim hears a low sigh , not of impatience , but of melancholy acquiescence . " Then [you]193-elizabeth must go on thinking ill of [me]193-elizabeth . "[193-elizabeth] There is such a depth of dejection , as well as such an unalterable sweetness , in [her]193-elizabeth voice , that the words of [little Prince Arthur]286-little prince arthur , addressed to [Hubert]215-bertie , flash upon [his]181-jim mind : After all , what power in [earth]754-earth or sky has appointed [him]181-jim [[her]193-elizabeth executioner]2565-her executioner ? " [I]181-jim do not wish to think ill of [you]193-elizabeth , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim answers sadly . " Good heavens ! do [I]181-jim need to tell [you]193-elizabeth that ? [I]181-jim have tried all along to keep [myself]181-jim from judging [you]193-elizabeth ; but [I]181-jim should not be human — [you]193-elizabeth must know that [I]181-jim should not be human — if [I]181-jim did not ask [myself]181-jim why [you]193-elizabeth did it . "[181-jim] " Why [I]193-elizabeth left [Florence]20-florence ? "[193-elizabeth] " Yes . "[193-elizabeth] [She]193-elizabeth sits stock - still for a moment , the very little colour that there ever was in it retreating out of [her]193-elizabeth face . " If [I]181-jim told [you]193-elizabeth that , [I]181-jim should be telling [you]193-elizabeth everything . "[181-jim] [He]181-jim is looking at [her]193-elizabeth now ; after all , [he]181-jim can not keep [his]181-jim gaze pinned to the screen for ever , and , as [he]181-jim looks , [he]181-jim sees an emotion of so transcendently painful a nature set [her]193-elizabeth little sad features working , that the one impulse that dominates [him]181-jim is to ease [her]193-elizabeth suffering . Poor little docile creature ! [She]193-elizabeth is going to tell [him]181-jim [her]193-elizabeth secret , since [he]181-jim exacts it , though it is only with a rending asunder of soul and body that it can be revealed . [He]181-jim puts out [his]181-jim hand hurriedly , with a gesture as of prohibition . " Then do not tell [me]181-jim . "[181-jim] [She]193-elizabeth sinks back upon [her]193-elizabeth haik with a movement of relief , and puts up [her]193-elizabeth fine handkerchief to [her]193-elizabeth pale lips . There is a perfect silence between [them]2566-them for awhile . At [his]181-jim elbow is a great un - English , unwintry nosegay of asphodel and iris . [He]181-jim passes [his]181-jim fingers absently over the freakish spikes . " How did [he]181-jim take it ? how did [he]181-jim take it at first ? "[181-jim] [Her]193-elizabeth voice , though now tolerably distinct , is stamped with that character of awe which fills [us]2567-us all at approaching a great calamity . " [He]181-jim would not believe it at first ; and then [he]181-jim cried a great deal — oh , an immense deal!"—with[193-elizabeth] an accent of astonishment , even at the recollection of [[his]181-jim friend]393-his friend 's tear - power—"and then — oh , then , [he]181-jim thought of putting an end to [himself]181-jim ! "[181-jim] [Jim]181-jim had meant to have made this relation in a tone of dispassionate narrative , but against [his]181-jim will and intention , as [his]181-jim memory recalls what seem to [him]181-jim the unworthy antics played by [Byng]203-byng 's grief , [his]181-jim voice takes a sarcastic inflection . The horror written on [[his]181-jim auditor]2569-his auditor 's face as [he]181-jim utters the latest clause of [his]181-jim sentence recalls [him]181-jim to [himself]181-jim . " Do not be afraid ! "[181-jim] [he]181-jim says , in a tone which has no longer anything akin to a sneer in it , though it is not devoid of bitterness ; " the impulse was a short - lived one ; [he]181-jim is not thinking of putting an end to [himself]181-jim now , [I]181-jim can assure [you]2569-his auditor of that ; [he]181-jim is only thinking of how [he]181-jim can best amuse [himself]181-jim . Whether [he]181-jim is much more successful in that than [he]181-jim was in the former , [I]181-jim am not so sure . "[181-jim] [Her]2569-his auditor eyes have dropped to [her]2569-his auditor own fragile , ringless hands as they lie on [her]2569-his auditor lap . " [Poor boy]4870-poor boy ! [poor boy]4870-poor boy ! "[2569-his auditor] [she]2569-his auditor says over softly twice , moving [her]2569-his auditor head up and down with a little compassionate movement . At the pity expressed by [her]2569-his auditor gesture , an unjust and unjustifiable hard anger takes harsh possession of [him]181-jim . " It was a pity [you]2569-his auditor let it go so far , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim says austerely ; " [you]2569-his auditor must allow [me]181-jim to say that much ; but [I]181-jim suppose , in point of fact , the ball once set rolling , it was past [your]2569-his auditor power to stop it . "[181-jim] [She]2569-his auditor listens to [his]181-jim philippic , with [her]2569-his auditor head meekly bent . " [I]2569-his auditor did not try , "[2569-his auditor] [she]2569-his auditor answers , in a half·whisper ; then , after a pause , raising [her]2569-his auditor down - dropped eyes , lit with a blue fire of excitement , almost inspiration , to [his]181-jim , " [I]2569-his auditor said to [myself]2569-his auditor , ' If [I]2569-his auditor have any luck , [I]2569-his auditor shall die before the smash comes ; ' and [I]2569-his auditor just lived on from day to day . [I]2569-his auditor had not the heart to stop it ; [I]2569-his auditor knew it would stop of itself before long ; [I]2569-his auditor had never — hardly ever"—correcting[2569-his auditor] [herself]2569-his auditor , as it seems , with a modifying afterthought—"in [my]2569-his auditor life before known what happiness meant ; and oh ! oh ! OH!"—with[2569-his auditor] a groan of deepening intensity at each repeated interjection—"what a big word it is ! "[2569-his auditor] Never — hardly ever — known what happiness meant before ! Why , surely [she]2569-his auditor was happy at [the Moat]8-the moat ! and before [his]181-jim mind 's eye there rises an image of [her]2569-his auditor in [her]2569-his auditor riotous rosy gaiety ; but even as it does , there flashes upon [him]181-jim a comprehension of [her]2569-his auditor speech . It is not the careless merriment of childhood to which [she]2569-his auditor is alluding ; it is to the happiness , par excellence , of life . If this is the case , why did [she]2569-his auditor correct [herself]2569-his auditor and modify [her]2569-his auditor negative with a " hardly "[2569-his auditor] ? A jealous feeling of [someone else]4028-someone else — [someone beside Byng]2571-someone beside byng ; a jealousy none the less keen for being vague — for not knowing on what object it can lay hold — sharpens [his]181-jim tone as [he]181-jim repeats aloud , and with an accent of interrogation , [her]2569-his auditor qualifying adverb : " Hardly ever , that implies — — "[181-jim] But [she]2569-his auditor breaks in hurriedly , as if dreading — and at the same time doubting [her]2569-his auditor own power of baffling — cross - examination upon that subject on whose borders [they]2572-they are continually hovering . " Talking of happiness makes [one]501-one think of unhappiness , does not it ? [We]4875-we both know something about that , do not [we]4875-we ? "[2569-his auditor] [She]2569-his auditor pauses , and [he]181-jim sees that [she]2569-his auditor is alluding to [his]181-jim own sorrow , and that [her]2569-his auditor eye is sounding [his]181-jim to see whether [he]181-jim would wish [her]2569-his auditor to approach it more nearly . [His]181-jim eye , in answer , must give but a dubious beam , since [he]181-jim [himself]181-jim is quite unsure of what [his]181-jim wishes on the subject are ; and [she]2569-his auditor goes on with the haste and yet unsteadiness of one who is treading on swampy ground , that gives beneath [his]181-jim feet . " [We]4875-we saw it in the papers ; [I]2569-his auditor could not believe it at first . It was the last thing [I]2569-his auditor ever expected to happen . [I]2569-his auditor thought of writing to [you]181-jim , but [I]2569-his auditor did not . "[2569-his auditor] [She]2569-his auditor looks at [him]181-jim rather wistfully , and although but two minutes ago [she]2569-his auditor had been confessing to [him]181-jim [her]2569-his auditor passion for [another man]4150-another man , [he]181-jim sees that [she]2569-his auditor is anxious [he]181-jim should tell [her]2569-his auditor that [her]2569-his auditor sympathy would have been precious to [him]181-jim . [He]181-jim feels the same sensation as before of mixed anger and fascination at the ductility of [her]2569-his auditor nature . What business has [she]2569-his auditor to care whether [he]181-jim would have liked to hear from [her]2569-his auditor or not ? " It seemed such a pity that it was [she]2569-his auditor , and not [I]2569-his auditor ! " [I]2569-his auditor said so to [mammy]1029-mammy at the time . Ah , here is [mammy]1029-mammy ! "[2569-his auditor] And , indeed , as [she]2569-his auditor speaks the door opens , and [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant enters in [her]189-mrs. le marchant walking - dress . " [I]181-jim do not know whether [you]193-elizabeth have yet found it so "[181-jim] ( to [Jim]181-jim ) ; " but this is [a slack place]4883-a slack place . "[579-the mother] A moment later , " [I]181-jim am sure [you]3525-her daughter will understand that [I]181-jim do not mean to imply any ill - will to [you]3525-her daughter ; but it is unlucky that [we]4884-we should have happened to meet [you]3525-her daughter here ; it has brought it all back to [her]193-elizabeth , and [she]193-elizabeth was just beginning to pluck up [her]193-elizabeth spirits a little . "[181-jim] " Did [she]193-elizabeth — did [she]193-elizabeth take it so much to heart ? " Did [she]193-elizabeth take it to heart ! "[189-mrs. le marchant] repeats [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant , with the irritation of [one to whom a perfectly senseless and superfluous inquiry]2576-one to whom a perfectly senseless and superfluous inquiry is put ; " why , of course [she]193-elizabeth did ! [I]189-mrs. le marchant thought at one time that [she]193-elizabeth would have gone out of [her]193-elizabeth mind ! "[189-mrs. le marchant] [No one]819-no one can feel less merry than [Jim]181-jim ; and yet [his]181-jim lips at this juncture can not resist the impulse to frame themselves into a gloomy smile . " And [I]181-jim thought that [he]181-jim would have gone out of [his]181-jim mind , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim rejoins . As [he]181-jim speaks , it flashes upon [his]181-jim memory that one of the hypotheses that have formerly occurred to [him]181-jim to account for the mystery that hangs over [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth 's past was that [she]193-elizabeth had been mad ; and though [he]181-jim had long abandoned the idea , [her]193-elizabeth losing [her]193-elizabeth wits now recurs to [him]181-jim with a shock as a possibility . Might not that changeful , mobile , emotional mind lose its balance under the blow either of a sudden calamity or of a long wearing sorrow ? It has escaped — evidently but barely escaped the first . Will it escape the second too ? [His]181-jim heart goes out in a great yearning to [her]193-elizabeth at the thought of what a touching little lunatic [she]193-elizabeth would make ; and , with an oblivion of [his]181-jim own personal feelings , which is generous , if not very lasting , [he]181-jim says compassionately : " It seems a pity — a great pity ! "[181-jim] " A pity ! "[579-the mother] repeats [the mother]579-the mother , with a sort of wrath , down which [he]181-jim detects a broad stripe of agony running ; " [I]579-the mother should think it was a pity ! Pity is a weak word ! The whole thing is piteous ! [her]193-elizabeth whole history ! If [you]181-jim only knew — — "[579-the mother] [She]579-the mother breaks off . [He]181-jim is silent , waiting to see whether that impulse towards confidence in [him]181-jim will go any further ; but it does not . [She]579-the mother has evidently gone beyond [her]579-the mother intention , and is passionately vexed with [herself]579-the mother for having done so . " [They]4885-they were so well suited to [each other]607-each other , "[181-jim] continues [Jim]181-jim slowly , but still generously . Possibly [his]181-jim generosity becomes more easy as [he]181-jim sees how hopeless is the plea upon which [he]181-jim employs it . " Is it — [I]181-jim do not wish to intrude upon [your]579-the mother confidence , but in the interests of [[my]181-jim friend]4887-my friend [you]579-the mother will allow [me]181-jim to say that much — is it quite out of the question ? "[181-jim] " Quite ! quite ! "[579-the mother] replies [the mother]579-the mother , in painful excitement ; " what , poor soul , is not out of the question for [her]579-the mother that has any good or happiness in it ? and that — that more than anything ! If [you]579-the mother have any mercy in [you]579-the mother , do not put it into [her]579-the mother head that it is not ! "[579-the mother] " If it is not in [her]579-the mother head already , [I]181-jim could not put it there , "[181-jim] replies [Jim]181-jim gravely ; " but [I]181-jim will not — [I]181-jim promise [you]579-the mother [I]181-jim will not . "[181-jim] As [he]181-jim speaks , a slight smile touches the corners of [his]181-jim serious mouth as [he]181-jim reflects how entirely easy it is to comply with a request not to urge [Byng]203-byng 's suit upon its object , and how cheaply a character for magnanimity may sometimes be bought . " That is very kind of [you]579-the mother ! "[553-the poor woman] replies [the poor woman]553-the poor woman gratefully ; " and [I]553-the poor woman am sure when [you]579-the mother say a thing [I]553-the poor woman can depend upon [you]579-the mother for it ; and though , of course , it was unlucky [our]4888-our happening to meet [you]579-the mother , yet [you]579-the mother need not see much of [her]553-the poor woman . Although it is not in the least ' out of sight , out of mind ' with her"—sighing—"yet[553-the poor woman] [she]553-the poor woman is very much influenced by the objects around [her]553-the poor woman ; and when [you]2581-you are gone — [I]0-i dare say [you]2581-you do not mean to make a long stay ; this is not a place where there is much for [a man]386-a man to do — for [a man like [you]2581-you]2583-a man like you — — " [She]553-the poor woman breaks off , and [her]553-the poor woman imploring eye invites [him]579-the mother to reassure [her]553-the poor woman by naming a speedy day for [his]579-the mother own departure . But magnanimity may have calls made upon it that exceed its power to answer , and [Jim]181-jim 's silence sufficiently proves that [he]181-jim is not going to allow [himself]181-jim to be seduced into a promise to go . The next morning proves the truth of [Miss Strutt]346-miss strutt 's words that "[0-i] [we]2584-we are not so green here in [Algiers]120-algiers for nothing . " The weather changes some time after dark has fallen . A mighty wind arises . [Jim]181-jim 's slumbers are broken by the fact that [somebody]4104-somebody 's outside shutters bang , loose and noisy all night . The great sign at the top of [the hotel]1144-the hotel swings and creaks and groans . In the morning , as far as can be seen through blurred panes , the trees — eucalyptus , ilex , stone - pine — are all cowering and stooping before the wind 's lash . The fan palm before [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant 's window , with [its]4891-its fans all pinched and bent , is staggering before the gale . One can not conceive what that unlucky tropical product can be doing in [this galley]4892-this galley , and it requires a strong effort of reason and will to resist the conviction that the oranges and lemons are tied upon the shivering trees instead of growing naturally there . "[0-i] And this is ' [Afric]347-afric 's burning strand ' ! " says [Jim]181-jim to [himself]181-jim , over [his]181-jim breakfast in the salle à manger , through whose shut windows the mad rain forces itself ; and the blast , coming to [[his]181-jim wet sister]4893-his wet sister 's aid , bursts them open now and again . The day seems enormously long . [He]181-jim gets through the morning tolerably well with letter - writing , and after the twelve o'clock déjeûner [he]181-jim faces the gale in a determined walk down into [the town]407-the town . Seldom in the course of [his]181-jim wide wanderings has [he]181-jim felt the furious scourge of more tremendous rain . [The side - path]4895-the side - path is whitened with big hailstones ; red torrents tear with ferocious speed and violence down the steep incline . The great acanthus - leaves , and all the plentiful undergrowth , are dripping and rejoicing . Through the blinding white deluge [he]181-jim gets forlorn peeps of the villas that had shone yesterday with the white splendour one associates with [the city of [the saints of [God]214-god]4897-the saints of god]4896-the city of the saints of god ; and instead of , as yesterday , "[347-afric] laced with heaven 's own tinct , " [the Mediterranean]130-the mediterranean is whitening [the bay]2204-the bay 's rounded curve with its angry breakers , and the snow is sprinkling the Atlas crests . [A few Arabs]4899-a few arabs are sitting on the ground under [the Pont d'Isly]4900-the pont d'isly , packed up into whitish woollen parcels , knees to nose , and arms and hands all withdrawn into the protection of the sheltering burnous . But [no one else , who can help it]4901-no one else , who can help it , is [abroad]4902-abroad . It seems to [Jim]181-jim as if [his]181-jim disagreeable tussle with the elements had lasted a long time , and yet , on [his]181-jim return to [the hotel]1144-the hotel , [he]181-jim finds that it is only half - past two . [He]181-jim thinks at first that the clocks must have stopped , but finds , on examination , that they are all ticking , and all unanimous . [His]181-jim drenched condition is at least a resource , necessitating an entire and fundamental change of raiment ; but even this expedient , though dragged out to its utmost possible limit , does not carry [him]181-jim further than three . How is [he]181-jim to dispose of the seven or eight hours that must elapse before [he]181-jim can seek refuge in bed ? [He]181-jim has exhausted [his]181-jim correspondence , which is never a large one , and [he]181-jim has seldom in [his]181-jim life been so short of books . [He]181-jim makes [his]181-jim way through [the hall]4269-the hall , which is crammed with [young people playing battledore]4905-young people playing battledore , and noisily counting ; with [elder persons]4906-elder persons , dreadfully short of a job , looking on and applauding ; to [the salon]3584-the salon , in hopes of there finding a Tauchnitz novel , or even a superannuated Pall Mall or World . But [half a dozen other weather - bound sufferers]4908-half a dozen other weather - bound sufferers have been before [him]181-jim , and the tables are swept clean of all literature save a three - months - old Court Journal . [Miss Strutt]346-miss strutt and [the pert votary of Whiteley]4909-the pert votary of whiteley are sitting shawled , and with [their]4910-their heads close together . By [their]4910-their titters , and the fragments [he]181-jim catches of [their]4910-their talk , [they]4910-their seem to be concocting a practical joke of some kind . [The widow Wadman , shawled too]4911-the widow wadman , shawled too , and [[her]4911-the widow wadman , shawled too valetudinarian]4912-her valetudinarian in a comforter , are stopping over a wood - fire , which refuses to burn , [the souches]4913-the souches being wringing wet . [Jim]181-jim rather injudiciously approaches [them]4910-their , and offers [his]181-jim assistance in piling the damp logs ; but [he]181-jim is so evidently de trop , that [he]181-jim retires discomfited . On the other hand , the invitation in [Miss Strutt]346-miss strutt 's and [her]346-miss strutt coadjutor 's eye is so apparent that [he]181-jim beats a hasty retreat out of [the room]442-the room , in dread lest [he]181-jim should be drawn into [their]4910-their mysterious pleasantry . [He]181-jim never is quite clear afterwards how [he]181-jim gets over the hours that intervene before dinner — whether sleep comes to [his]181-jim aid , or whether [he]181-jim is after all reduced to perusing in the Court Journal the narrative of which direction [the Queen]1316-the queen and Princess [Henry of Battenburg]348-henry of battenburg took [their]4910-their walk in , in October . But at length the welcome bell rings , drowning even , for two minutes , the banging of the wind ; and [the whole hotel]4916-the whole hotel , unwontedly punctual , rushes in answer to its summons . [People who have hitherto scarcely exchanged words]4917-people who have hitherto scarcely exchanged words , have eyed [each other]607-each other with hardly veiled distrust , now show a feverish desire to enter into conversation , to detain [one another]1485-one another after dinner on the steps of [the salle à manger]671-the salle à manger . As the evening advances , [Jim]181-jim sees an intention among [the younger portion of the company]4921-the younger portion of the company to launch out into noisy , romping games , to institute [a Dumb Crambo]4922-a dumb crambo . [He]181-jim feels it is far from impossible that [he]181-jim [himself]181-jim may fall so low as to be drawn into it . [Miss Strutt]346-miss strutt 's eye is on [him]181-jim , but before [he]181-jim succumbs [he]181-jim will make one effort on [his]181-jim own behalf . [He]181-jim embraces a desperate resolution . [He]181-jim has seen [the Le Marchants]261-the le marchants eating [their]261-the le marchants dinner near , and yet hopelessly far from [him]181-jim . [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth had given [him]181-jim one furtive smile , and [[her]193-elizabeth mother]3300-her mother a hurried bow ; this is , to tell the truth , all the encouragement [he]181-jim has to go upon — all that [he]181-jim can find to keep [his]181-jim courage up as [he]181-jim knocks at [their]261-the le marchants door , telling [himself]181-jim that [his]181-jim excuse — that of asking [them]261-the le marchants to lend [him]181-jim a book — is a quite sufficient and legitimate one . [He]181-jim knocks , and [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth 's voice at once answers : "[347-afric] Herein ! " It is clear that [she]193-elizabeth takes [him]181-jim for [the German waiter]4924-the german waiter , [Fritz]349-fritz . [She]193-elizabeth remains in this belief even after [he]181-jim has opened the door , since [she]193-elizabeth does not at first look up . [She]193-elizabeth is alone — not in [the pretty flowered room in which [she]193-elizabeth had yesterday received [him]181-jim]4925-the pretty flowered room in which she had yesterday received him , but in the first and less adorned of the little series — one that [he]181-jim had , on [his]181-jim former visit , cursorily supposed to be chiefly used as [an ante - room]4926-an ante - room — sitting alone at a table , and before [her]193-elizabeth are spread writing - materials , over which [she]193-elizabeth is stooping . An odious and ridiculous thought darts , with a prick , across [his]181-jim mind . Is [she]193-elizabeth sitting here , all alone , in order to write to [Byng]203-byng ? "[0-i] [I]0-i came — — " [he]181-jim begins ; and at the unexpected voice [she]193-elizabeth looks up with a start : "[0-i] Oh , it is [you]0-i ! " [she]193-elizabeth says , in a low key , glancing rather apprehensively at the closed door , which separates [them]4927-them from [the inner room]4928-the inner room , in a manner which tells [him]181-jim that [[her]193-elizabeth parents]583-her parents are within . "[0-i] [I]0-i came"—his voice almost unconsciously sinking to the level [hers]193-elizabeth has indicated to [him—"to]0-i[0-i] ask [you]0-i to lend [me]0-i a book . " "[0-i] A book ! " [she]193-elizabeth repeats doubtfully , with another and still more nervous glance at the shut door ; "[0-i] [I]0-i am afraid that [they]2585-they are all in there . " "[0-i] Oh , it is of no consequence ! " rejoins [Burgoyne]181-jim hastily , unwittingly quoting the words of the immortal [Mr. Toots]350-mr. toots ; "[0-i] it does not matter in the least . " As [he]181-jim speaks , [he]181-jim begins to retreat towards the door , but so slowly as to give [her]193-elizabeth plenty of time to recall [him]181-jim had [she]193-elizabeth so wished . But [she]193-elizabeth does not . [She]193-elizabeth only stands looking uncertain and distressed . [He]181-jim can not take such a melancholy impression of [her]193-elizabeth little face away for the whole night with [him]181-jim — it would give [him]181-jim the blues too seriously after this dismal day — so [he]181-jim takes a step or two forward again . "[0-i] Are not [you]0-i rather lonely ? " [he]181-jim asks , with an expressive look round . [She]193-elizabeth gives a small , uncomplaining smile . "[0-i] Oh no ; [I]0-i do very well . [I]0-i am generally alone at this time of day ; [they]2585-they like to have [their]2585-they evenings to [themselves]2585-they — at least , [father]3390-father likes to have mammy to [himself]3390-father ; [I]0-i am sure it is quite natural . " There is not the slightest trace of any sense of being aggrieved in either words or tone . Again that picture of the adored Elizabeth of former days , of whose prattle [[her]193-elizabeth father]3214-her father was never weary , whose jokes were always considered so unequalled , and whose pre - eminence in favour was so allowed that [her]193-elizabeth intercession and influence were always employed by [the others]3469-the others as certain in [their]3469-the others efficacy , rises before [Jim]181-jim 's eyes . "[2585-they] [They]2585-they are like [lovers]688-lovers still , " continues [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth softly ; "[2585-they] it is very pretty when [people]3155-people are [lovers still]2589-lovers still after nearly thirty years . " "[0-i] And [you]0-i — [you]0-i write letters ? " "[0-i] No , [I]0-i do not ; [I]0-i have [not anyone]2590-not anyone to write to . " A pang of shame at [his]181-jim unworthy suspicion , coupled with a sense of astonishment at [her]193-elizabeth simple confession of friendlessness , prevent [his]181-jim speaking ; and it is [she]193-elizabeth who goes on : "[0-i] [I]0-i was writing an Italian exercise ; [I]0-i began to learn Italian in [Florence"—with]143-florence"—with the inevitable low sigh that always accompanies [her]193-elizabeth mention of that name—"and[0-i] to - day , for something to do , [I]0-i took it up again . It has been a long day , has not it ? Oh , what a long day ! " "[0-i] Long ! " repeats [Jim]181-jim emphatically ; "[0-i] it might choose to call itself a day ; but many a century has been shorter . " "[529-someone] [Someone]529-someone was playing battledore and shuttlecock in [the hall]4269-the hall . [I]0-i wonder to what number [they]529-someone kept it up ? how many years it is since [I]0-i have played battledore and shuttlecock ! " There is a suppressed envy in [her]193-elizabeth tone , which tells how far from disagreeable the innocent noisy pastime to which [she]193-elizabeth alludes would be to [her]193-elizabeth even now . [She]193-elizabeth has sat down again on the straight - backed chair from whose elevation [she]193-elizabeth had commanded [her]193-elizabeth Italian studies ; a large grayish cloak , lined and heavily collared , and bordered with fur , hangs , unfastened at the throat , about [her]193-elizabeth . Out of the dark beaver [her]193-elizabeth delicate neck and head rise , like a pale primrose from out of piled dead oak - leaves in a yet wintry wood . Through the door , which [he]4932-he has left open behind [him]4932-he , come bursts of maniac mirth from the votaries of [Dumb Crambo]351-dumb crambo . "[529-someone] What a noise [they]529-someone are making ! " "[529-someone] [I]0-i should think [they]529-someone were ! " "[529-someone] [I]0-i wonder what [they]529-someone are doing ? " "[529-someone] [I]0-i can inform [you]0-i on that point ; [they]529-someone are playing [Dumb Crambo]351-dumb crambo . " [She]193-elizabeth repeats the words after [him]4932-he with a lingering intonation , in which there again is , or , at least , [he]4932-he thinks that [he]4932-he detects it , a tinge of envy . "[351-dumb crambo] [Dumb Crambo]351-dumb crambo ! " "[351-dumb crambo] Would [you]0-i like to join [them]529-someone ? " "[0-i] No"—slowly—"not quite that ; but — it sounds ridiculous — but [I]351-dumb crambo should like to play [Dumb Crambo]351-dumb crambo again . [We]4933-we used"—in[351-dumb crambo] an affectionate , lingering tone—"to play it when [we]4933-we were [children]4103-children . "[0-i] It is the first time that [she]0-i has ever voluntarily alluded to the Moat , and [he]2593-he calls to mind [her]0-i earnest prohibition addressed to [him]2593-he at [Florence]20-florence against any mention of it . " [I]2593-he know [you]0-i did ; once or twice [I]2593-he played with [you]0-i . "[2593-he] " [You]2593-he ? "[0-i] [She]0-i starts . It is evident that the unimportant fact of [his]2593-he having taken part in [their]2594-they games has quite escaped [her]0-i ; but , a moment later , [her]0-i soft and courteous nature evidently making [her]0-i fear that [he]2593-he will look upon [her]0-i obliviousness as unkind — " Oh yes , to be sure ! "[0-i] Then again lapsing into reminiscence , " What odd words [we]2594-they used to choose sometimes — words that [nobody]3337-nobody could guess ! " Do [you]2593-he think that that can be meant for a pig ? "[193-elizabeth] asks [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth , [her]193-elizabeth line ears pricked in unaffected interest . " Oh!"—with[193-elizabeth] a return of uneasiness—"I wish that [they]2594-they would not make so much noise ; [father]3390-father does so dislike noise . [They]2594-they might as well have put it off till to - morrow . "[193-elizabeth] " Why would to - morrow 's noise be more endurable than to - night 's ? "[193-elizabeth] " It would not have mattered to - morrow ; [father]3390-father will not be [here]637-here ; [he]2593-he is going to [Hammam Rhira]144-hammam rhira . "[181-jim] [Burgoyne]181-jim 's jaw drops . Is this the alternative course decided upon by [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant ? " Do [you]4939-you mean — are [you]4939-you all going to [Hammam Rhira]144-hammam rhira to - morrow?—all going away ? "[189-mrs. le marchant] Is it some effect of light from the rose - shaded lamp that makes it seem to [him]2593-he as if a tiny smile , and a yet smaller blush , swept over [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth 's face at the aghastness of [his]2593-he tone — an aghastness much more marked than [he]2593-he had intended it should be . " Not to - morrow ; [not all of [us]4939-you]4940-not all of us . [Father]225-father and [mammy]1029-mammy are going [there]455-there for a couple of nights to see what [the place]1740-the place is like — [one]501-one hears such contradictory accounts ; and if [they]4945-they are pleased with it — "[2593-he] " Yes ? " And [they]4945-they are going to leave [you]2593-he behind ? "[2593-he] " Why not ? there would not be much use in taking [me]2597-her ; and , as [I]2597-her tell [you]2597-her , [they]4945-they love being tête - à - tête . "[2597-her] " And [you]2593-he love being alone ? "[2593-he] The moment that the question is out of [his]2593-he mouth , [he]2593-he realizes its full unkindness . [He]2593-he is perfectly aware that [she]2597-her does not like being alone ; that [she]2597-her is naturally [a most sociable little being]2598-a most sociable little being ; that , even now , these frightened five minutes of unsatisfactory broken talk with [himself]2593-he have made [her]2597-her look less chilled , less wobegone , less white . [Her]2597-her answer , if it can be looked upon as one , must be taken by [him]2593-he as a rebuke . It is only that [she]2597-her says nervously : " [One]501-one certainly does hear dreadfully plainly here with the door open . "[2597-her] [Her]2597-her tone is of the gentlest , [her]2597-her look no angrier than a dove 's , and yet [he]2593-he would be obtuser than [he]2593-he is if [he]2593-he did not at once comprehend that [her]2597-her remark implies a wish that [he]2593-he should presently shut that door behind [him]2593-he on the outside . [He]2593-he complies . With that newly - gained knowledge as to to - morrow 's [Hammam Rhira]144-hammam rhira , [he]2593-he can afford to comply . The next morning 's light reveals that the weather , pleased with having so indisputably proved its power of being odious , has recovered its good - humour . Beyond the tree - tops a radiant sea is seen laughing far below ; and the wet red tiles on [the little terrace]4834-the little terrace shine like jewels . [A sea]2600-a sea even more wonderful than radiant ; no servile copy of the sky and clouds to - day , but with astonishing colours of its own — a faint yet glorious green for a part of [its]2600-a sea watery breadth ; then what [our]2601-our poverty compels [us]2601-our to call blue ; and then a great tablecloth of inky purple , which looks so solid that the tiny white boats that are crossing it seem to be sailing on [dry land]2602-dry land . From amongst the glossy green of [the wooded hill]2603-the wooded hill , [mosque and campagne]2604-mosque and campagne start out , dazzling , in their recovered lustre ; [one cool entrancing villa]2605-one cool entrancing villa in especial , backed with a broken line of dusky stone - pines , stands , snowy - arcaded , enthroned high up among the verdure . [Jim]181-jim is very anxious to be out of the way at the hour of [the Le Marchants]261-the le marchants ' departure . [He]181-jim has a panic fear of being waylaid by [the mother]579-the mother , and having some earnest supplication addressed to [him]181-jim to abstain , during [her]579-the mother absence , from any converse with [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth . [He]181-jim is not quite clear at what time [they]2607-they will set off , so , to insure [himself]181-jim against mistakes , [he]181-jim resolves to spend the morning and lunch at [the Villa Wilson]145-the villa wilson . Arrived [there]455-there , [he]181-jim is shown by [an Arab man - servant]2609-an arab man - servant into [the court]2480-the court , and , finding [it]2480-the court empty , sinks down into a cane chair , and lets [his]181-jim eyes wander round to the fountain , lullingly dripping into [its]2611-its basin ; to the tiles , the white - arched doorways , carved in low relief , and themselves so low that it must be [a humble - statured person who enters [them]2613-them without stooping . What [a home for love in idleness]2614-a home for love in idleness ! Who can picture any of the vulgar work of [the world]3184-the world done in [such a house]2616-such a house]2612-a humble - statured person who enters them without stooping . what a home for love in idleness ! who can picture any of the vulgar work of the world done in such a house ? any harder labour ever entered upon than a listening to [some lady]2617-some lady singing " with ravishing division to [her]2617-some lady lute "[2617-some lady] ? [The lady who presently joins [Jim]181-jim]2618-the lady who presently joins jim appears , by [her]2618-the lady who presently joins jim ruffled air , to have been engaged upon no such soothing occupation as luting to [a recumbent lover]2619-a recumbent lover . " [You]181-jim will not mind staying [here]637-here ? "[222-cecilia] " [I]222-cecilia can not express how little [I]222-cecilia wish it . "[222-cecilia] " [I]222-cecilia can not think what has happened to Sybilla"—wrinkling[222-cecilia] up [her]2620-her forehead into annoyed furrows—"but [she]2620-her is so dreadfully sprightly when [he]181-jim is [there]455-there ; [she]2620-her never was sprightly with [Dr. Coldstream]297-dr. coldstream , and [he]181-jim is such [an impossible man!—the sort of man who , when first [he]181-jim comes in]4951-an impossible man!—the sort of man who , when first he comes in , always says , ' Well , how are [we]4952-we this morning ? ' Do not [you]181-jim think that it stamps [a man]386-a man to say ' How are [we]4952-we ? ' "[222-cecilia] " [I]222-cecilia think it does . "[222-cecilia] " [He]181-jim talks such nonsense to [her!"—with]4954-her!"—with[222-cecilia] irritation—"he tells [her]2620-her that [he]181-jim , too , is a bundle of nerves ! if [you]181-jim could only see [him]181-jim ! And one day [he]181-jim told [her]2620-her that when first [he]181-jim came [here]637-here [he]181-jim had seen [the Angel of Death]4956-the angel of death waving [his]181-jim fans above [her]2620-her head ! and [she]2620-her swallows it all ! "[222-cecilia] " [I]222-cecilia am not at all surprised . "[222-cecilia] " It makes [me]2621-me sick ! "[2621-me] cries [she]2621-me energetically ; " let [us]2623-they go into [the garden]3792-the garden . "[2621-me] So into [the garden]3792-the garden [they]2623-they go ; both [the new one , whose luxuriant growth of verdure is the outcome of but eight or nine years]2624-the new one , whose luxuriant growth of verdure is the outcome of but eight or nine years ; and the old one , along whose straight walks the feet of [the Moorish ladies]2252-the moorish ladies used to patter under the orange - trees . Beneath [them]2623-they now there are no white bundles of muslin ; only on the ground the oranges lie thick , [no one in [this plenteous land]2627-this plenteous land]2626-no one in this plenteous land thinking it worth while to pick them up . [Jim]181-jim and [[his]181-jim companion]603-his companion pace rather silently to [a pretty Moorish summer - house]2629-a pretty moorish summer - house , dug , a few years ago , by [the English architect]2630-the english architect out of [a farm - house]2631-a farm - house , into which [it]2629-a pretty moorish summer - house had been built . [It]2629-a pretty moorish summer - house is dainty and cool , with a little dome and lovely green and blue tiles ; and an odd small spring , which is taught to wander by tiny snaky channels into a little basin . [They]2623-they go into [the summer - house]2632-the summer - house and sit down . " Yes , it is pretty , "[3289-the girl] says [the girl]3289-the girl absently ! but [her]3289-the girl mind is evidently preoccupied by some other subject than the beauty of the giant bignonia which is expanding the multitude of its orange - red clusters all over a low wall , making it into one burning hedge , and has called forth an exclamation of delight from [Burgoyne]181-jim . What that subject is immediately appears . " Do [you]181-jim know who is in [Algiers]120-algiers — whom [I]181-jim saw driving through [the Place Bressant]4958-the place bressant on Sunday afternoon ? "[181-jim] " Who ? "[181-jim] " [The Le Marchants]261-the le marchants . Ah , [you]181-jim are not surprised!"—rather[181-jim] suspiciously . " [You]181-jim knew already ! "[181-jim] [Jim]181-jim hesitates a second ; then , reflecting that , whether or not [he]181-jim acknowledges the fact now , [Cecilia]222-cecilia is certain to learn it in a day or two at latest , [he]181-jim answers with a slight laugh : " It would be odd if [I]181-jim did not , seeing that [they]261-the le marchants are staying at [[my]181-jim hotel]4959-my hotel . "[181-jim] " [You]181-jim knew that when [you]181-jim went there?"—very[181-jim] quickly . " Of course not!"—with[181-jim] a movement of impatience . A pause . " [I]222-cecilia suppose , "[222-cecilia] says [Cecilia]222-cecilia , rather cautiously , as if aware that [she]222-cecilia is treading on dangerous ground , " that [you]181-jim have not found out why [they]261-the le marchants stampeded from [Florence]20-florence in that extraordinary way ? "[222-cecilia] " [I]222-cecilia always used to like [them]261-the le marchants , "[222-cecilia] continues [Cecilia]222-cecilia pensively ; " at least"—becoming[222-cecilia] aware of an involuntary movement of surprise at this statement on the part of [her]222-cecilia neighbour—"at least , [they]261-the le marchants never gave [me]222-cecilia the chance of liking [them]261-the le marchants ; but [I]222-cecilia always admired [them]261-the le marchants . There are so few nice English [here]637-here this year ; [everybody]3181-everybody says that there never was a year when there were so few nice English ! "[222-cecilia] The tentative towards sociability implied in this last speech is received by [Jim]181-jim in a discouraging silence . [He]181-jim has not the slightest desire to promote any overture on the part of [Cecilia]222-cecilia towards intimacy with [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth . [He]181-jim knows that [they]2634-they would be unsuccessful ; and , moreover , [he]181-jim is conscious that [he]181-jim would be annoyed if [they]2634-they were not . " [I]222-cecilia can fancy that this would be [a very pleasant place]4963-a very pleasant place if [one]501-one had [someone]529-someone to go about with , "[222-cecilia] continues [she]222-cecilia ; " but [father]3390-father grows less and less inclined to move . [Poor dear]3505-poor dear ! [he]181-jim is not so young as [he]181-jim was , and [I]222-cecilia am not quite old enough yet , [I]222-cecilia suppose , to go about alone . "[222-cecilia] [She]222-cecilia makes a rather wistful pause — a pause which [he]181-jim feels that [she]222-cecilia intends [him]181-jim to fill by an offer of [himself]181-jim as [[her]222-cecilia escort]3893-her escort . But none such comes . Realizing this , [she]222-cecilia goes on with a sigh : " There are not many advantages in being old ; but , at least , one is freer , and in a youth spent as [mine]222-cecilia is , there is really not much profit or pleasure . "[222-cecilia] The tone in which [she]222-cecilia makes this lugubrious reflection is so extremely doleful that [Jim]181-jim can not refrain from a laugh . " Cheer up , [old girl]4968-old girl ! there is a good time coming ! It is [a long lane]4969-a long lane that has no turning . "[181-jim] But [he]181-jim contents [himself]181-jim with these vague forms of consolation . [He]181-jim has no engagements of [his]181-jim own . Why , then , is [he]181-jim conscious of so strong a reluctance towards tying [himself]181-jim by any promise to [the broadly - hinting lady beside [him]181-jim]2636-the broadly - hinting lady beside him ? There is another pause , during which [Cecilia]222-cecilia looks down on the floor with a baffled air , and traces the outlines of the tiles with the point of [her]222-cecilia red sunshade . " There is [a band]4970-a band plays twice a week in [the Place de Gouvernement]4971-the place de gouvernement — plays admirably . Now , [I]222-cecilia suppose that there would be nothing odd ; that [no one]819-no one could say anything ; that it would not be the least improper , considering [our]4973-our connection and everything , if [you]222-cecilia were to take [me]222-cecilia to hear it some day ? "[222-cecilia] " [I]181-jim never have the slightest idea of what is improper and what is not , "[181-jim] replies [he]181-jim ; but there is more of alarm than of encouragement in [his]181-jim tone . " No more have I"—laughing[181-jim] rather awkwardly—"but in this case [I]222-cecilia am pretty sure . Tuesdays and Fridays are the days on which [the band]4974-the band plays . "[222-cecilia] " Oh ! "[181-jim] " To - day is Tuesday , is not it ? "[181-jim] " Yes . "[181-jim] Another pause . " [I]181-jim thought that perhaps , if [you]222-cecilia had nothing better to do , [you]222-cecilia might take [me]181-jim to - day ? "[181-jim] The direct proposal which [he]181-jim has in vain tried to avert has come . If [he]181-jim accept it , of what profit to [him]181-jim will the absence of [the Le Marchant parents]2637-the le marchant parents be ? " [I]181-jim am afraid — — "[181-jim] [he]181-jim begins slowly . " [You]181-jim are vamping up an excuse ! "[222-cecilia] cries [Cecilia]222-cecilia , reddening . " [I]222-cecilia see it in [your]181-jim eyes . [You]181-jim can not have made any engagements here yet . "[222-cecilia] " And [they]261-the le marchants have gone to [Hammam Rhira]144-hammam rhira , "[181-jim] replies [he]181-jim precipitately . " At least — — "[222-cecilia] But [she]222-cecilia interrupts [him]181-jim before [he]181-jim can add [his]181-jim conscience clause . " To - morrow , then ? "[222-cecilia] Again [he]181-jim hesitates . The same objections apply with even greater force to the morrow . " But [the band]4974-the band does not play to - morrow . "[222-cecilia] " Oh ! what does that matter ? "[222-cecilia] rejoins [she]222-cecilia impatiently . " [I]222-cecilia had just as soon go somewhere else — [the Arab town]2399-the arab town , [the Kabyle village]4978-the kabyle village , anywhere . "[222-cecilia] [He]181-jim is driven into a corner , and remains there silent so long that there is a distinct element of offence in the tone and large sigh with which [the girl]3289-the girl resumes . " Well , times are changed ! [I]222-cecilia always used to make one in those happy excursions at [Florence]20-florence ; and somehow — thanks to [her]201-amelia , [I]222-cecilia suppose — [I]222-cecilia never felt a bad third . "[222-cecilia] [She]222-cecilia rises as [she]222-cecilia speaks , and takes a couple of huffy steps towards [the house]986-the house ; but [he]181-jim overtakes and stops [her]222-cecilia . The allusion to [Amelia]201-amelia has annoyed and yet stirred in [him]181-jim the sea of remorse , which is always lying but a very little way below the surface in [his]181-jim soul . " Why , [Cis]222-cecilia ! "[181-jim] [he]181-jim says , in a tone of affectionate rallying , " are [we]4979-we going to quarrel at this time of day — [you]222-cecilia and [I]181-jim ?
