"[579-the mother] Thus apostrophized , [Jim]181-jim is compelled to break the silence , which seems to [himself]181-jim to wall [him]181-jim round like a petrifaction . It is to [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth that [he]181-jim offers [his]181-jim hardly - won speech . " [I]181-jim think [I]181-jim need not tell [you]193-elizabeth , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim says gravely , and with passable steadiness , " that [I]181-jim would help [you]193-elizabeth in any way [I]181-jim could . "[181-jim] [She]193-elizabeth stands a moment or two irresolute , [her]193-elizabeth features all quivering as if with pain ; and yet , underlying and under - shining the pain , something that is not pain . Then [she]193-elizabeth puts out a hand impulsively to each . If the one that gives itself to [Burgoyne]181-jim had struck [him]181-jim on the mouth , instead of offering itself with affectionate confidence to [his]181-jim clasp , it could not have hurt [him]181-jim more than do those small fingers that lie in [his]181-jim , trembling with a passion that is not for [him]181-jim . " [You]181-jim are both very good to [me]193-elizabeth , "[193-elizabeth] [she]193-elizabeth says brokenly . " As to [you]181-jim , [mammy]1029-mammy , that is an old story . But [I]193-elizabeth really believe that there is nothing disagreeable that [you]181-jim , too"—with[193-elizabeth] a slight grateful pressure of the lifeless hand that so slackly keeps possession of hers—"would not do for [me]193-elizabeth . But do not think [me]193-elizabeth obstinate if [I]193-elizabeth say that [I]193-elizabeth think — [I]193-elizabeth am sure — that it would be better — that it would hurt [him]181-jim less — if [I]193-elizabeth spoke to [him]181-jim [myself]193-elizabeth . "[193-elizabeth] " It is not a question of what will hurt [him]181-jim least , "[193-elizabeth] cries [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant , with an agony of impatience in [her]193-elizabeth tone . " The thing to be considered is what will hurt [you]181-jim least . [Mr. Burgoyne]198-burgoyne , am [I]193-elizabeth not right ? Do tell [her]193-elizabeth that [I]193-elizabeth am ! Ought not [she]193-elizabeth to think of what will hurt [her]193-elizabeth least ? "[193-elizabeth] But [Jim]181-jim is incapable of coming a second time to [her]193-elizabeth rescue . [His]181-jim eyes are painfully fastened upon [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth , and [he]181-jim is watching the pain fall off , as it were , from [her]193-elizabeth face , and the light spread rosily over it . Some instinct makes [her]193-elizabeth withdraw that hand of [hers]193-elizabeth which [he]181-jim has shown so little eagerness to retain , ere [she]193-elizabeth says , in a low but perfectly firm voice : " Well , then , [I]193-elizabeth think it will hurt [me]193-elizabeth least , too . "[193-elizabeth] Five minutes later [Jim]181-jim has left [the room]442-the room — ostensibly to make arrangements for [[his]181-jim friend]393-his friend 's arrival , in reality because [he]181-jim can not count upon [his]181-jim own self - control if [he]181-jim remain in [it]2852-it . [The survivors of [Elizabeth Le Marchant]193-elizabeth 's acquaintance]2853-the survivors of elizabeth le marchant 's acquaintance remain undecapitated . [The widow - headed Life Guardsman]2854-the widow - headed life guardsman and [the baby - bodied cornet]2855-the baby - bodied cornet lie unregarded on the table , while [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth [herself]193-elizabeth is stretched along the floor , with [her]193-elizabeth face pressed against [[her]193-elizabeth mother]3300-her mother 's knees . [Jim]181-jim has decided to sit up for [[his]181-jim friend]393-his friend . [He]181-jim is perfectly aware that neither will [the two women]2837-the two women go to bed . But [he]181-jim has no desire that [their]2837-the two women vigil should be shared in common . It is equally impossible to [him]181-jim to take part in the noisy mirth of the rest of [the hotel]1144-the hotel , which , having taken the place of [their]2837-the two women measureless daylight ennui , now boils over in ebullient laughter , in dancing , squeaking , and noisily scampering out of [the public drawing - room]2860-the public drawing - room into [the hall]4269-the hall and up the stairs . It is not till the clamour has declined , until , indeed , its total cessation tells [him]181-jim that [the promiscuous revellers]2862-the promiscuous revellers have retired to [[their]2862-the promiscuous revellers apartments]2863-their apartments , that [he]181-jim issues from [his]181-jim , and takes possession of [the now empty smoking - room]2864-the now empty smoking - room , whence [he]181-jim can hear more distinctly than from [[his]181-jim own bedroom]1344-his own bedroom any noise of wheels approaching [the hotel]1144-the hotel . The wind has risen again , and it needs an ear very finely pricked to dissever from its mad singing , and from the storming of the frantic rain , any lesser and alien sound . What a terrific night in which to be out on [the raging sea]2867-the raging sea ! Worse even than that one last week , when [the Moïse]2868-the moïse broke [her]2868-the moïse shaft , and tossed for twenty - four hours at the mercy of the waves . Possibly the weather may have already yesterday been so rough at [Marseille]158-marseille as to prevent [his]181-jim setting off . But the idea — at the first blush eagerly welcomed by [him]181-jim — is dismissed from [his]181-jim mind almost as soon as entertained . If [the boat]2217-the boat has started — and it is only under such heavy penalties that [the mail - boats]2870-the mail - boats do not start , that this contingency hardly ever occurs — [Byng]203-byng will have started too . A terrific bang at the casement seems to come as a comment upon this conviction . [He]181-jim will have started ; but will [he]181-jim ever arrive ? It is said that in eight years during which [they]2871-they have been running [no catastrophe]2872-no catastrophe has ever sent one of [this line of steamers]2873-this line of steamers to the bottom ; but yet [they]2871-they are cranky little craft , with engines too big for [them]2871-they — built rather for speed than safety . The clock has struck , with a repetition that seems strangely frequent through [the sleeping house]2874-the sleeping house : 11 , 11.30 , 12 , 12.30 . " [I]2875-the watcher will give [him]181-jim half an hour more , "[2875-the watcher] says [the watcher]2875-the watcher to [himself]2875-the watcher , " and then [I]2875-the watcher will turn in . "[2875-the watcher] Of this allotted half - hour only five minutes are yet left to run , when , in a lull in the hurricane , the sound which [Jim]181-jim 's hearing has been so long stretched to catch — the sound of wheels on the gravel — is at length audible . During the last two hours [he]181-jim has heard many phantom wheels — many of those ghostly coaches that the wind drives shrieking through the winter nights . But these are real ones . Before [the drowsy porter]2876-the drowsy porter , nodding in [[his]2876-the drowsy porter little den]2877-his little den , can reach the hall - door , [Jim]181-jim has opened it — opened it just in time to admit [a man who , [his]2876-the drowsy porter [pace still further accelerated by the mighty hands of the pushing blast]2879-pace still further accelerated by the mighty hands of the pushing blast , is bounding up the steps]2878-a man who , his pace still further accelerated by the mighty hands of the pushing blast , is bounding up the steps . If any doubt as to [this person]3992-this person 's identity lingered in [Jim]181-jim 's mind , [his]181-jim first words would dispel it . " [She]3992-this person is here ? There is no mistake ? [She]3992-this person is here ? "[396-the other] " How late [you]181-jim are ! "[396-the other] cries [the other]396-the other , apparently regarding [the new arrival]2882-the new arrival 's utterance more as an ejaculation than as a question expecting or needing an answer . " Why are [you]181-jim so late ? Did the engines break down ? "[396-the other] " [She]3992-this person is here ? "[203-byng] repeats [Byng]203-byng insistently , taking no notice of the queries addressed to [him]181-jim . " [You]181-jim have not deceived [me]203-byng ? For mercy 's sake say that [you]181-jim have not deceived [me]203-byng ! "[203-byng] " Why should [I]181-jim deceive [you]203-byng ? "[181-jim] rejoins [Jim]181-jim impatiently . " Yes ; certainly [she]3992-this person is [here]637-here . "[181-jim] [They]2883-they are in [the hall]4269-the hall by now — [the hall which , [the Grand Hotel]124-the grand hotel being gasless]2885-the hall which , the grand hotel being gasless , is lit by only one weak paraffin lamp , which the gust from the door , necessarily still open to admit of the carrying in of [the traveller]2886-the traveller 's bags and rugs , is making even more faint and flickering than its wo nt . " [You]181-jim must have had a fine tossing ! "[2887-his] " [I]2887-his believe [you]203-byng ; [they]2883-they all thought [we]2883-they were going to make a dinner for the fishes — ha , ha ! All but [I.]2887-his [I]2887-his knew better . [I]2887-his knew that [I]2887-his could not come to grief when [she]5077-she had called [me]2887-his to [her]5077-she . "[2887-his] [Byng]203-byng 's hat is rammed down over [his]2887-his brows , and [his]2887-his fur coat turned up so high round [his]2887-his ears that it is impossible in the obscurity to see [his]2887-his face ; but there is something in the tone of [his]2887-his voice — a loud , wild rollicking — that makes the idea cross [Jim]181-jim 's mind that [he]181-jim has been drinking . What a shock it will give to [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth if , in [her]193-elizabeth covert vigil — [he]181-jim has no more doubt that [she]193-elizabeth has been watching than that [he]181-jim has been doing so [himself]181-jim — [she]193-elizabeth overhears that thick , raised voice ! Prompted by this thought , [he]181-jim says hastily : " Come into [the dining - room]3328-the dining - room . [I]181-jim told [them]2888-them to put something to eat for [you]181-jim [there]455-there . "[181-jim] [Byng]203-byng complies ; and when [they]2888-them have reached [the empty salle]2889-the empty salle [à manger , whose whitewash looks weird and unnatural in the chill of the night]2890-à manger , whose whitewash looks weird and unnatural in the chill of the night , [he]181-jim sends [his]181-jim hat skimming down one of the long tables , and , grasping both [Jim]181-jim 's hands in [his]181-jim , cries out , in the same loud tone of intoxicated triumph : " Oh , [[my]181-jim dear old chap]2022-my dear old chap , how good it is to see [your]181-jim ugly old mug again ! If [you]181-jim had known — oh , if [you]181-jim had only known!—what [I]181-jim went through during the twenty - four hours after [I]181-jim sent [you]181-jim that telegram , when through every hour , through every minute and second of every hour , [I]181-jim said to [myself]181-jim , ' It may come now — [my]181-jim death - warrant may come now ! In five minutes it may have come ! ' But it did not , it did not ! [I]181-jim ought to have known"—with[181-jim] an accent of ecstasy—"that of [her]5081-she pitifulness [she]5081-she would relent at last . [She]5081-she is infinitely pitiful , is not [she]5081-she ? but [I]181-jim shall upbraid [her]5081-she a little — oh , do not be afraid ; it will be gently , most gently — for having kept [me]181-jim so long , so inhumanly long , upon [[my]181-jim gridiron]5082-my gridiron ! [I]181-jim had always"—breaking[181-jim] into a rather wild laugh—"something of a tenderness for [St. Lawrence]365-st. lawrence , but during the last seven months [I]2891-me have loved [him]365-st. lawrence like [a brother]5083-a brother ! "[2891-me] [He]2891-me goes on again , with scarcely a pause , or apparently any consciousness of the unresponsive silence of [[his]2891-me auditor]2569-his auditor : " But what does it matter now ? "[2891-me] beginning to stride about with [his]2891-me eyes cast up to the beamed ceiling and [his]2891-me lifted hands locked together—"what does it matter ? ' After long grief and pain , to feel the arms of [[my]2891-me true love]5084-my true love round [me]2891-me once again ! ' [You]181-jim may think that [I]2891-me word it extravagantly , "[2891-me] returning to [Jim]181-jim as [he]181-jim leans downcast and shocked upon one of the chairs of the monotonous table - d'hôte row ; " but in the hope itself , the more than hope , there is nothing extravagant ; [you]181-jim must own that [yourself]181-jim . If [she]5084-my true love had not meant to put an end to [my]2891-me long agony , [she]5084-my true love would not have sent for [me]2891-me ; not to stop [me]2891-me was to send for [me]2891-me . "[2891-me] " [You]181-jim are labouring under a mistake , "[181-jim] says [Jim]181-jim coldly , and yet with an inward quaking as to the effect that [his]181-jim words may produce ; " [she]5084-my true love had not the option of stopping [you]181-jim . By some accident [I]181-jim did not receive [your]181-jim telegram till four hours ago . [She]5084-my true love could not have stopped [you]181-jim if [she]5084-my true love had wished . "[181-jim] The idea , as [I]0-i have already said , has occurred to [Burgoyne]181-jim that [[his]181-jim companion]603-his companion is under the influence of intoxication ; but either this is not the case , or the shock of the last words has the effect of instantly sobering [him]181-jim . " [I]181-jim — [I]181-jim — do not understand , "[181-jim] [he]181-jim says in a voice out of which all the insane exhilaration has been conjured as if by magic ; " [I]181-jim do not follow [you]181-jim . What do [you]181-jim mean ? "[181-jim] " [I]181-jim mean , "[181-jim] replies [Jim]181-jim , in a matter - of - fact , level tone , meant to have a calming effect upon [his]181-jim auditor , " that owing , [I]181-jim suppose , to [my]181-jim name being spelt wrongly — [Bourgouin]364-bourgouin instead of [Burgoyne]181-jim — [your]181-jim telegram was given to [someone else]4028-someone else , and did not reach [me]181-jim till nine o'clock this evening . "[181-jim] [Byng]203-byng puts up [his]181-jim hand to [his]181-jim throat , and , unfastening the collar of [his]181-jim fur coat as if it were strangling [him]181-jim , throws back the coat itself . Now that [he]181-jim sees [him]181-jim freed from enveloping wrap and concealing hat - brim , [Jim]181-jim can realize the full amount of change and deterioration that are visible in [his]181-jim appearance ; can see how bloodshot [his]181-jim eyes are ; how lined [his]181-jim mouth ; and how generally ravaged and dimmed [his]181-jim good looks . " [I]181-jim am to understand , then , that — that [she]5086-she would have stopped [my]181-jim coming if [she]5086-she could . "[181-jim] [Jim]181-jim is silent . [He]181-jim can not answer that question with any certainty even to [himself]181-jim . " [She]5086-she would have escaped [me]181-jim again if [she]5086-she had had the chance ! What am [I]181-jim saying?"—with[181-jim] a sudden access of terror in [his]181-jim tone—"she may have escaped [me]181-jim already ! [She]5086-she may be gone ! Tell [me]181-jim the truth — do not dare to tell [me]181-jim anything but the bare truth . [I]181-jim saw that [you]181-jim hesitated when [I]181-jim asked [you]181-jim whether [she]5086-she was really here . Is [she]5086-she gone ? "[181-jim] " Gone ! "[181-jim] repeats [Jim]181-jim , with an exasperated jerk of the head towards the window , against which the rain and wind are hurling themselves with threefold rage , as if to recapture [the victim]2894-the victim just escaped [them]2895-them . " To - night — in this storm ? How likely ! Come , be rational ; try to keep [your]181-jim head , and let [us]5087-us have a truce to this ranting . [I]181-jim give [you]181-jim [my]181-jim word of honour that [she]5086-she is [here]637-here , under this roof ; asleep , [I]181-jim should hope , if [your]181-jim bellowings have not awoke [her]5086-she . "[181-jim] The latter clause may perhaps come under the head of a pardonable fiction ; at all events , it has , despite its incivility , the desired effect of soothing , to some extent , the agitation of [him]181-jim to whom it is addressed . " Asleep ! "[181-jim] [he]181-jim repeats , while an ecstatic smile breaks over [his]181-jim handsome , dissipated face . " [Good angels]5089-good angels guard [her]5086-she slumbers ! But"—with[181-jim] a rather ominous return of excitement—"are [you]181-jim sure that [she]5086-she is asleep — that [she]5086-she has gone to bed yet ? [They]2895-them used to sit up very late in [Florence]20-florence sometimes . If [she]5086-she has not gone to bed , why should not [I]181-jim see [her]5086-she ; why should not [I]181-jim fall at [her]5086-she feet now — to - night ? "[181-jim] " [[My]181-jim dear boy]3470-my dear boy , "[181-jim] rejoins [Jim]181-jim , with a praiseworthy attempt to answer this modest and sensible proposal with patient good - humour , " have [you]3470-my dear boy any idea what time it is ? [I]181-jim should have thought it might have occurred even to [you]3470-my dear boy that 1.30 A.M. is scarcely a suitable hour for paying a morning call ! Do not be [a fool]3448-a fool ! Pull [yourself]3470-my dear boy together . [I]181-jim swear to [you]3470-my dear boy that [she]5086-she has every intention of seeing [you]3470-my dear boy to - morrow . Come"—trying[181-jim] to laugh—"you will not have long to wait ! It is to - morrow already ; and , meantime , sit down and eat something ; [you]3470-my dear boy must be as empty as a drum . "[181-jim] But to this prudent if homely counsel [Byng]203-byng opposes an obstinate negation , adorned with excited asseverations that food shall never cross [his]181-jim lips until [they]2896-they have pastured upon [[his]181-jim lady]3937-his lady 's pardoning hand . The same prohibition does not , however , apparently apply to drink , as [he]181-jim pours more than half the bottle of happily not very potent wine , prepared for [his]181-jim refreshment , into a tumbler , and tosses it off at a draught . [He]181-jim offers an even stouter refusal to [Burgoyne]181-jim 's suggestion that [he]181-jim should go to bed ; and as [he]181-jim utters it a flash of cunning suspicion comes into [his]181-jim eyes , shocking [[his]181-jim friend]393-his friend with a gleam as of possible and scarcely latent madness . Across [the latter]423-the latter 's brain darts the query , which had proposed itself more than once to [him]181-jim last spring at [Florence]20-florence : " Is there insanity in [Byng]203-byng 's blood "[181-jim] Not certainly on the distaff side , the side of [[his]181-jim eminently sane and wholesome mother]2900-his eminently sane and wholesome mother ; but can [he]181-jim be throwing back to [some distempered ancestor]2901-some distempered ancestor ? " What security have [I]181-jim if [I]181-jim go to bed that [she]2900-his eminently sane and wholesome mother will not steal away from [me]181-jim in the night ? It was in the night — almost in the night — that [she]2900-his eminently sane and wholesome mother stole away from [me]181-jim before . "[181-jim] From this logic it is impossible to move [him]181-jim ; and although , with some return to [his]181-jim old sweet - natured kindliness of manner , [he]181-jim begs [[his]181-jim friend]393-his friend not to think it necessary to keep [him]181-jim company , yet [the latter]423-the latter is far too ill at ease as to [his]181-jim condition , both of mind and body , to comply . [The porter]3201-the porter , having drawn the natural inference that as soon as [the traveller]2886-the traveller has refreshed [his]3201-the porter body [he]3201-the porter will wish to retire to rest , has put out the lights in [the smoking - room]2342-the smoking - room ; [the salle à manger]671-the salle à manger is therefore [the only room in [the hotel where lamps still burn]2909-the hotel where lamps still burn]2908-the only room in the hotel where lamps still burn , and in it [the two men]409-the two men spend the dreary remaining hours of the night , [Byng]203-byng walking up and down like a captive beast , frequently going to the door , opening it , putting [his]181-jim head out into the darkness , and listening suspiciously if , perchance , [he]181-jim may hear the footfall of [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth fleeing away from [him]181-jim even through the hurricane . As the time goes on , [his]181-jim restlessness increases rather than diminishes . [Jim]181-jim has vainly tried to distract [his]181-jim thoughts by putting questions to [him]181-jim as to [his]181-jim pursuits and [companions]2911-companions since [their]409-the two men last parting — by inquiries as to the extent and direction of [his]181-jim travels . Did [he]181-jim get as far as [Palestine]159-palestine ? How long is it since [he]181-jim left [Cairo]160-cairo ? etc . But to all [his]181-jim interrogations [Byng]203-byng gives brief and unsatisfactory answers , putting a final stop to [them]2912-them by breaking out excitedly : " Why do [you]5092-you go on questioning [me]203-byng as to where [I]203-byng have been , and what [I]203-byng have done ? [I]203-byng tell [you]5092-you [I]203-byng have been nowhere , and done nothing ; [I]203-byng believe that [my]203-byng body has been here and there , but [my]203-byng soul has been nowhere ; it has been lying dead ! Would [you]5092-you expect [a man who has been lying six months in [his]181-jim coffin]5093-a man who has been lying six months in his coffin to give [you]5092-you a catalogue of [his]181-jim adventures ? [My]203-byng soul has been dead , [I]203-byng tell [you]5092-you — dead and putrescent . What is the use of putting [me]203-byng through a catechism about its doings ? "[203-byng] Before the long - delaying dawn shows its pale profile upon the deep obscurity , it seems to [Jim]181-jim as if six midwinter nights must have pieced themselves end to end . But it comes at last ; and at last also , by dint of strenuous representations to [[his]181-jim companion]603-his companion as to how unfit [he]181-jim is , in [his]181-jim present travel - stained and disordered condition , to offer [himself]181-jim to [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth 's eyes , [he]181-jim induces [him]181-jim to let [himself]181-jim be led to the bedroom prepared overnight for [him]181-jim , and to refresh [himself]181-jim with a bath and a change of clothes . Even this concession [he]181-jim obtains only in exchange for an exacted promise to seek out [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth at the earliest possible hour at which [she]193-elizabeth may be presumed accessible , and urgently to entreat of [her]193-elizabeth an instant interview with [[his]181-jim friend]393-his friend . [Jim]181-jim feels that [he]181-jim is keeping [his]181-jim word handsomely when , not a minute later than nine o'clock , [he]181-jim finds [himself]181-jim knocking at the door of [[the Le Marchants]2443-the le marchants ' apartment]2916-the le marchants ' apartment — that door with which of late [his]181-jim knuckles have grown so pleasantly and friendlily familiar . It is opened to [him]181-jim by [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth [herself]193-elizabeth , and [he]181-jim follows [her]193-elizabeth silently through [the ante - room]2917-the ante - room into [the little salon]1258-the little salon . Arrived [there]455-there , [he]181-jim looks mournfully round with a sort of feeling as of taking farewell of the familiar objects . It is impossible that [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth can have spent the just - past stormy night in gathering flowers , and yet the flowers have a freshened air . [She]193-elizabeth must have been carefully rearranging them . The bits of brocade , too , [the Turkish embroideries]2920-the turkish embroideries , the haiks , and the praying - carpets , wear a more festal appearance than usual . [The little room]1914-the little room looks decked as if for a gala . [His]181-jim jealous fancy can not but admit that [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth [herself]193-elizabeth is dressed in [her]193-elizabeth ordinary morning gown , but even over it some holiday transmutation has passed . [He]181-jim can not trust [himself]181-jim to verify whether that holiday look is on [her]193-elizabeth face too . " [He]181-jim has come ; [you]193-elizabeth know that , [I]193-elizabeth suppose ? "[193-elizabeth] " Yes . "[193-elizabeth] What a catch in [her]193-elizabeth breath ! [He]181-jim must steal a glance at [her]193-elizabeth . [She]193-elizabeth will think it unnatural if [he]181-jim does not ; and perhaps [his]181-jim eye may not be offended by so much radiance as [he]181-jim feared . In [her]193-elizabeth voice there was something not very distant from a sob . The result of [his]181-jim glance shows itself in what sounds like a reproach . " [I]193-elizabeth do not believe that [you]193-elizabeth went to bed at all . "[193-elizabeth] " Yes , [I]193-elizabeth did ! yes , [I]193-elizabeth did ! "[193-elizabeth] hurrying away eagerly from the subject of [herself]193-elizabeth , as from something irrelevant and importunate ; " and — [he]181-jim — how is [he]181-jim ? How does [he]181-jim look ? Had not [he]181-jim a dreadful crossing ? Does [he]181-jim want to see [me]193-elizabeth ? to see [me]193-elizabeth soon ? to - day ? "[193-elizabeth] There is such a breathless passion in [her]193-elizabeth tone , coupled with something so apologetic for putting [her]193-elizabeth questions to [him]181-jim , that [his]181-jim heart , hitherto half touched , half angered by the pathos of [her]193-elizabeth little preparations , melts wholly towards [her]193-elizabeth . " Of course [he]181-jim wants to see [you]193-elizabeth — wants it very , very much , "[181-jim] replies [he]181-jim ; and , to [his]181-jim credit , replies without any harshness marring the cordial kindness of [his]181-jim tone . " As much as"—with[181-jim] a rather melancholy smile—"you want to see [him]181-jim . No , do not be angry . Why should not [you]193-elizabeth wish to see [each other]607-each other ? "[181-jim] " Oh , there is every reason ! "[193-elizabeth] cries [she]193-elizabeth miserably—"the same reason that there always was . But"—with[181-jim] rising agitation—"where is it to be ? How soon ? When does [he]181-jim wish it ? "[181-jim] " [He]181-jim is waiting outside now . "[193-elizabeth] [She]193-elizabeth starts painfully . " Now ! Oh , [poor fellow]4081-poor fellow ! [we]5096-we must not keep [him]181-jim waiting ; and yet"—stretching[181-jim] out [her]193-elizabeth hand in detention—"tell [me]181-jim , before [he]181-jim comes in — tell [me]181-jim , is [he]181-jim changed ? Is [he]181-jim ? Is [he]181-jim the same as [he]181-jim was ? "[181-jim] [Jim]181-jim hesitates , and the painful perplexity written on [his]181-jim brow is misread by [her]193-elizabeth . " [You]193-elizabeth are vexed with [me]193-elizabeth for teasing [you]193-elizabeth with so many tiresome questions . Oh , forgive [me]193-elizabeth ! [I]193-elizabeth ought not to take advantage of [your]193-elizabeth kindness ; but [we]5096-we have grown to depend upon [you]193-elizabeth so ; and [I]193-elizabeth will promise not to worry [you]193-elizabeth with any other , if [you]193-elizabeth will only answer [me]193-elizabeth this one . Is [he]2922-he changed — much changed ? "[193-elizabeth] " [I]181-jim am afraid , "[181-jim] replies [Jim]181-jim , with the slowness of one who is trying to convey unpleasant tidings in the least unpleasant terms , " that [you]193-elizabeth must be prepared to find [him]2922-he a good deal altered . "[181-jim] " Altered ! How ? "[193-elizabeth] " [I]181-jim do not quite know how to describe it"—uneasily—"but[181-jim] [you]193-elizabeth must not be shocked if [you]193-elizabeth find [him]2922-he a good deal changed in looks ; and [he]2922-he is — [he]2922-he seems , in a very excited state . " [She]193-elizabeth makes a clutch at [his]2922-he hand . "[2922-he] Do [you]181-jim mean"—her voice has sunk to a horror - struck whisper—"that[2922-he] [he]2922-he is — mad ? " "[2922-he] Mad ! Oh , of course not , " with a strained laugh ; "[193-elizabeth] [you]193-elizabeth must not jump to such conclusions . But [I]0-i do not think [he]2922-he is quite [himself]2922-he , that is all . [He]2922-he looks as if [he]2922-he had not eaten or slept for a fortnight ; and if [you]193-elizabeth play such tricks as that with [yourself]193-elizabeth , [you]193-elizabeth must expect to get a little off [your]193-elizabeth balance . " [She]193-elizabeth is still terrifiedly clutching [his]2922-he hand , though with no consciousness of doing so , nor that the fingers so tightly gripped by [her]193-elizabeth are not made of dry stick . "[193-elizabeth] [You]193-elizabeth must not look so frightened , " [he]2922-he says soothingly . "[193-elizabeth] [I]0-i would not have said anything to [you]193-elizabeth , only that [I]0-i thought it better [you]193-elizabeth should be prepared — that it should not take [you]193-elizabeth quite by surprise ; and also because [I]0-i wanted to give [you]193-elizabeth a hint , that [you]193-elizabeth might be a little careful what [you]193-elizabeth say to [him]2922-he , or , at all events , how [you]193-elizabeth say it . " Still [she]193-elizabeth does not speak , and there is scarcely any diminution of the horror of [her]193-elizabeth look . "[193-elizabeth] If [you]193-elizabeth do not mind , [I]0-i think it would be as well to have [someone within call]2923-someone within call , if [he]2922-he — [he]2922-he — became — unreasonable . " "[0-i] Do [you]0-i think , " [she]193-elizabeth asks , with a sort of scorn , "[0-i] that [I]0-i am afraid of [him]2922-he — afraid for [myself]0-i ? " "[0-i] No , that [I]0-i am sure [you]0-i are not ; but [I]0-i can not shake off the idea that — [poor fellow!—he]2924-poor fellow!—he may be on the verge of some grave illness ; and in that sort of case [one]501-one never knows what may happen . So , if [you]0-i do not mind — — " "[0-i] As [you]0-i please , " [she]193-elizabeth answers , docile even now . "[0-i] Do as [you]0-i think best ; and will [you]0-i tell [him]2922-he that [I]0-i am ready to see [him]2922-he ? " The misgivings with which [Jim]181-jim complies with this request are not much allayed by the manner and voice of [him]181-jim who receives it , and who has been raging up and down [the narrow corridor]5097-the narrow corridor . "[0-i] [She]2926-she will not see [me]0-i , [I]0-i suppose ? " "[0-i] On the contrary , [she]2926-she will see [you]0-i now . But stay ! " catching [him]181-jim by the arm as [he]181-jim springs past [him]181-jim . "[2926-she] One moment ! For [God]214-god 's sake control [yourself]0-i ! Behave like [a gentleman]2927-a gentleman . Do not make [her]2926-she a scene ; [she]2926-she is not up to it . " [Byng]203-byng 's answer is to fling resentfully away the detaining hand of [[his]181-jim Mentor]1336-his mentor , while [he]181-jim says , with a furious look coming into [his]181-jim bloodshot eyes : "[2926-she] What do [you]2926-she mean by keeping [me]0-i [here]637-here , preaching to [me]0-i , while [she]2926-she is waiting for [me]0-i ? " The rudeness of both words and actions is so unlike the real [Byng]203-byng , that it is with an even more sinking spirit than before that [Jim]181-jim follows [him]181-jim with [his]181-jim eyes as [he]181-jim passes out of sight into [the salon]3584-the salon . As soon as the door is shut behind [him]181-jim , [he]181-jim [himself]181-jim takes up the position [he]181-jim had suggested in [the ante - room]2917-the ante - room . There are few things more trying to [an active - minded person]5101-an active - minded person than to sit occupationless , vaguely waiting . At first , it is true , the keenness of [Jim]181-jim 's alarm prevents [his]181-jim feeling the ennui which would be the natural result of [his]181-jim situation . Poignantly anxious questions succeed each other in [his]181-jim mind . Has [he]181-jim had any right to permit the interview at all ? How far is [Byng]203-byng accountable for [his]181-jim actions ? What chance is there that [his]181-jim already rocking reason will stand the shock of a meeting which , even in [his]181-jim sanest moments , would have so wildly excited [him]181-jim ? And if not , what may be the consequences ? Grisly headings of newspaper paragraphs write themselves in the air before him—"Homicidal[2926-she] Mania , " "[2926-she] Murder and Suicide . " The details of a tragic story which , illustrated by sensational woodcuts , [he]181-jim had idly read a day or two ago in a venerable Police News , left lying on the smoking - room table , recur to [his]181-jim memory . It was a tale of [a groom who , in an access of jealous madness , had shot [a scullion sweetheart]5103-a scullion sweetheart]5102-a groom who , in an access of jealous madness , had shot a scullion sweetheart through the head , and then blown [his]5102-a groom who , in an access of jealous madness , had shot a scullion sweetheart own brains out . The tale had made but little impression on [him]181-jim at the time — unhappily , it is scarcely possible to take up a journal without the eye alighting upon some such — but it comes back to [him]181-jim now with terrifying vividness . What security is there that such tragedies may be confined to [grooms]5104-grooms and [kitchen - maids]5105-kitchen - maids ? How does [he]181-jim know that [Byng]203-byng has not a revolver hidden in [his]181-jim breast - pocket ? How can [he]181-jim tell that [he]181-jim is not at this very moment drawing it out ? [He]181-jim ( [Jim]181-jim ) ought to have made sure , before exposing [her]5103-a scullion sweetheart to such a peril , that the danger was minimized by [Byng]203-byng 's being weaponless . Is it too late to make sure of that even now ? [He]181-jim takes one step towards the salon door , then hastily retraces it . Pooh ! [he]181-jim is growing as mad as [Byng]203-byng . [They]5106-they will come out and find [him]181-jim eavesdropping . [He]181-jim retreats to the table , which is at the greatest distance allowed by [the room]442-the room 's narrow enceinte from the scene of the drama whose dénouement [he]181-jim is expecting , and , sitting down , takes up a book . It happens to be [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth 's Italian exercise - book , and the sight of it conjures up before [his]181-jim memory [her]5103-a scullion sweetheart forlorn figure stooping disconsolately over the page , wrapped in [her]5103-a scullion sweetheart brown furs , as [he]181-jim had seen it on that rainy night that seems now so distant . [He]181-jim had pitied [her]5103-a scullion sweetheart for being lonely then . Well , whatever else [she]5103-a scullion sweetheart may be , [she]5103-a scullion sweetheart is not lonely now . [He]181-jim catches [his]181-jim breath . It is quite a quarter of an hour since [he]181-jim began [his]181-jim watch . How quiet [they]5106-they are ! There is a murmur of voices , but there is nothing that in the least indicates violence . Before [his]181-jim eyes there flashes in grotesque recollection the hideous picture in the Police News which illustrates the high words with which the catastrophe of [the groom and kitchenmaid]5108-the groom and kitchenmaid had been heralded . [He]181-jim has been making a mountain out of [a mole - hill]5109-a mole - hill ; has been exaggerating [[his]181-jim friend]393-his friend 's emotional temperament , naturally further heightened by sleeplessness and want of food , into incipient insanity . If [he]181-jim were mad , or at all tending that way , would [he]181-jim be talking in the low rational key which [he]181-jim obviously must be ? It is evident that [her]5103-a scullion sweetheart presence , [her]5103-a scullion sweetheart eye , [her]5103-a scullion sweetheart — yes , what more likely?—her touch have soothed and conjured away what of excessive or perilous there was in [his]181-jim emotion . [They]5106-they have been together half an hour now . All danger is certainly over . Why should [he]181-jim any longer continue [his]181-jim officious and needless watch?—superfluously spying upon [them]5106-they ? Relieved as to what [he]181-jim had thought [his]181-jim worst fear , and yet with an uncommon bitterness about [his]181-jim heart , [he]181-jim turns to withdraw , and [his]181-jim hand is already on the lock of the door which leads into [the corridor]5111-the corridor , when suddenly , without any warning , there reaches [his]181-jim ear the noise of a loud , crashing fall , followed — accompanied , rather — by a piercing scream . In infinitely less than a second [he]181-jim finds [himself]181-jim on [his]181-jim knees beside the prostrate body of [Byng]203-byng , who , with blood pouring from [his]181-jim forehead , is stretched upon the floor of [the salon]3584-the salon . Even at this second there flashes upon [him]181-jim , ludicrous and dreadful , the memory of the Police News . This scene has a grotesque likeness to the final one of [the groom and kitchenmaid]5108-the groom and kitchenmaid series , only that in the present case [the heroine]5114-the heroine , instead of staggering backward with the top of [her]5114-the heroine head flying up to the ceiling , is hanging unharmed over [[her]5114-the heroine fallen lover]5115-her fallen lover . "[2926-she] Are [you]2929-her hurt ? " cries [Jim]181-jim in frantic anxiety , looking at [her]2929-her across [the prostrate figure]5116-the prostrate figure , and unable to eradicate from [his]181-jim mind the revolver idea . "[2926-she] Did [he]2930-he hit [you]2929-her ? [I]0-i did not hear a shot . " "[2930-he] Oh no , no ! but [he]2930-he , " fetching [her]2929-her breath in terrible gasps , and hanging over [the bleeding man with that utter abandonment of all disguise]5117-the bleeding man with that utter abandonment of all disguise , in which a great naked grief sweeps away [our]5118-our sophistications—"he[2930-he] is dead ! " "[2930-he] Oh no , [he]2930-he is not , " answers [Jim]181-jim hastily , tearing open [Byng]203-byng 's waistcoat and laying [his]181-jim hand upon [his]181-jim heart . "[2930-he] [He]2930-he has only fainted . Get some water ! Have [you]2929-her got any salts ? No ; do not lift [his]2930-he head"—seeing that [she]2929-her is agonizedly trying to raise [his]2930-he prone head and rest it upon [her]2929-her knees—"he[2930-he] had better be as flat as [he]2930-he can . Quick , some water ! " [She]2929-her does not need to be twice told . In an instant [she]2929-her has sprung to the table , and brought thence the china jug out of which [she]2929-her is wo nt to water [her]2929-her flowers , and also the big cut - glass bottle of smelling - salts with which [Jim]181-jim has often seen poor [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant solacing [herself]2929-her when racked with that neuralgic headache which means worry . [He]2930-he splashes water out of the one upon [Byng]203-byng 's ashy face , and holds the other to [his]2930-he pale nostrils ; while [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth , once more flinging [herself]193-elizabeth upon [her]193-elizabeth knees , wipes the blood from [his]2930-he temples with [her]193-elizabeth little useless gossamer inch of handkerchief . "[2930-he] How did it happen ? " asks [Jim]181-jim rapidly . "[2930-he] What did [he]2930-he do to [himself]2930-he ? " The heads of [the two ministrants]5119-the two ministrants are very close to [each other]607-each other as [they]5119-the two ministrants bend together over [the swooned youth]5121-the swooned youth . [Jim]181-jim can see a little smear of [Byng]203-byng 's blood upon one of [her]0-i white cheeks . The sight gives [him]181-jim a shudder . [Byng]203-byng seems to have made [her]0-i more [his]181-jim own by that gory baptism than by all [his]2930-he frenzied vows and tears . "[2930-he] Oh , [I]0-i do not know , " [she]0-i answers , still fetching both breath and words with difficulty . "[2930-he] [He]2930-he was standing up , and [he]2930-he seemed quite right ; and then , all of a sudden , in a minute , [he]2930-he went down like a log , and hit [his]2930-he forehead against the sharp corner of the table"—with a convulsive shiver at the recollection . "[0-i] [I]0-i ought to have saved [him]2930-he ! [I]0-i ought ; but [I]0-i was not quick enough . [I]0-i stood stock - still , and now [he]2930-he is dead ! [You]0-i say that [he]2930-he is not ; but [I]0-i am sure [he]2930-he is dead ! " "[0-i] Oh no , nonsense ! [he]2930-he is not , " replies [Jim]181-jim brusquely , thinking a certain harshness of manner the best recipe for [her]189-mrs. le marchant . "[2930-he] [He]2930-he is alive , sure enough ; and as for the cut on [his]2930-he forehead , now that [you]0-i have wiped the blood away , [you]0-i can see for [yourself]0-i that it is not at all a deep one . It is merely a big scratch . [I]0-i have often had a worse out hunting from a bramble , in jumping through a hedge . Oh , [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant , here [you]0-i are ! That is all right . [We]2931-we have had an accident , [you]0-i see . [He]2930-he has fallen down in a faint , and given [himself]2930-he a bit of a knock . That is all ; do not be frightened . It looks worse than it is — Oh , [M. Cipriani]2932-m. cipriani , vous voilà ! Envoyez chercher un médecin tout [de suite]2933-de suite ! Il y a un M. Crump"—catching in [his]2930-he destitution at the thought of even [[Sybilla]356-sybilla 's objectionable friend]5122-sybilla 's objectionable friend . But hereupon half a dozen voices — for by this time [even more than that number of [inmates of [the hotel]1144-the hotel]5124-inmates of the hotel]5123-even more than that number of inmates of the hotel have thronged into [the little room]1914-the little room — raise [themselves]5123-even more than that number of inmates of the hotel to pronounce another name — the name of one who both stands higher in medical fame and is more quickly procurable . In search of [him]2930-he [Zameth]366-zameth , [the porter]3201-the porter , is instantly despatched , and meanwhile about [the inanimate body sympathizers]5128-the inanimate body sympathizers stand three deep , until reluctantly dispersed by a hint of a nature so broad as not to be misunderstood from [Jim]181-jim , to the effect that [the patient]4596-the patient would have a better chance of coming to [himself]4596-the patient if [he]4596-the patient were allowed to have a breath of air . By the time [the doctor]1869-the doctor arrives — there is some small delay before [he]2930-he appears — all are got rid of , and , [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant having gone to give directions for having [[Jim]181-jim 's room]5131-jim 's room arranged for [the sick man]5132-the sick man , both because [it]5131-jim 's room is on the ground - floor and also of a better size than that allotted to [him]2930-he , [Jim]181-jim and [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth are once again left tête - à - tête . Once again [they]5123-even more than that number of inmates of the hotel kneel on either side of [the prone figure]5133-the prone figure . How dreadfully dead and how extravagantly long it looks ! Once again [he]181-jim sees that blood - smear on [her]193-elizabeth face . It is just above [her]193-elizabeth one dimple , and stands out in ghastly incongruity over that little pitfall for love and laughter . How passionately [he]181-jim wishes that [he]181-jim might ask [her]193-elizabeth to go and wash it off ! If [he]181-jim did [she]193-elizabeth would not hear [him]181-jim . [She]193-elizabeth has no ears left , no eyes , no sense , save for that livid face , splashed with the water which has not brought [him]181-jim back to life , and with the red drops still slowly trickling from the wound on [his]181-jim brow , and which have stained here and there the damp tendrils of [his]181-jim hair — for that livid face and for the flaccid hands , which [she]193-elizabeth rubs between [her]193-elizabeth own with an ever more terrified energy , as [he]181-jim still gives no sign of returning consciousness . By - and - by [he]181-jim is taken out of [[her]193-elizabeth custody]5134-her custody . [She]193-elizabeth is robbed even of the wretched satisfaction of chafing [his]181-jim poor senseless fingers . On the arrival of [the doctor]1869-the doctor [he]181-jim is carried off , and laid upon the bed that has been made ready for [him]181-jim . [She]193-elizabeth follows [them]5136-them miserably as [they]5136-them bear [him]181-jim staggeringly across [the hall]4269-the hall — [a powerfully - built young man of over six feet high , in the perfect inertness of syncope , is no light weight]5138-a powerfully - built young man of over six feet high , in the perfect inertness of syncope , is no light weight — and looks hungrily over the threshold of [the bedroom]5139-the bedroom ; but when [she]193-elizabeth attempts to cross it [Jim]181-jim puts [her]193-elizabeth gently back . "[2932-m. cipriani] No , [dear]3358-dear , no ! " [he]181-jim says . ( [He]181-jim is almost sure afterwards that for that once in [his]181-jim life [he]181-jim calls [her]193-elizabeth "[3358-dear] [dear]3358-dear . " ) "[3358-dear] [You]3358-dear had better not . [We]2936-we think [he]2937-he is coming round , and if [you]3358-dear are [the first person [he]2937-he sees when [he]2937-he comes to [himself]2937-he]2938-the first person he sees when he comes to himself it might be bad for [him]2937-he — might hurt [him]2937-he . [You]3358-dear would not hurt [him]2937-he , would [you]3358-dear ? " "[3358-dear] No , [I]0-i would not hurt [him]2937-he , " [she]0-i answers slowly . And so turns in [her]0-i utter tractableness , and goes away meekly without a word . It is evening again now , almost the same hour at which [Jim]181-jim and [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth were beheading photographs twenty - four hours ago . Twenty - four hours ! It feels more like twenty - four years . This is what [he]2937-he says to [himself]2937-he as [he]2937-he once again opens the door of [[the Le Marchants]261-the le marchants ' apartment]2916-the le marchants ' apartment . It is the first time during the whole day , except to snatch a couple of mouthfuls of food , that [he]2937-he has left [Byng]203-byng 's side ; and it is only due to the fact that [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant is supplying [[his]2937-he place]5141-his place , and has sent [him]2937-he on a message to [[her]189-mrs. le marchant daughter]3525-her daughter , that [he]2937-he has quitted [his]2937-he post . [He]2937-he knows that [she]189-mrs. le marchant has meant to do [him]2937-he a kindness in despatching [him]2937-he upon this errand ; but [he]2937-he is not sure that it is one . [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth is not in [the salon]3584-the salon , but the screen that masks the door separating [that room]410-that room from [the little alcove beyond]5145-the little alcove beyond is folded back . Over the doorway is a hanging of Eastern embroidery — as to the meaning of the strange gold scrolls that look like Arab letters on whose red ground [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth and [he]2937-he have often idly speculated . [He]2937-he pushes it aside , and sees [her]193-elizabeth standing with [her]193-elizabeth back towards [him]2937-he , the flimsy muslin window - curtains drawn back as [she]193-elizabeth looks out on the night . [The alcove]5146-the alcove is on ordinary occasions scarcely ever occupied , and there is something uneasy and uncomfortable that matches the wretchedness of [her]193-elizabeth other circumstances in finding [her]193-elizabeth standing there alone and idle . The elements have long finished their raging , and fallen to boisterous play . It has been a fine day , and though the sun has long laid down [his]2937-he sceptre , [he]2937-he has passed it on with scarcely diminished , though altered , radiance to [his]2937-he white imitator . It is broad moonlight — startlingly broad . The moon hangs overhead , with never a cloud - kerchief about [her]193-elizabeth great disk . The winds that , loudly sporting , are up and abroad have chased every vapour from the sky , which is full of throbbing white stars . Before [he]2937-he reaches [her]193-elizabeth side [she]193-elizabeth has heard [him]2937-he , and turned to meet [him]2937-he , with a mixed hunger and pitiful hope in [her]193-elizabeth wan face . [She]193-elizabeth thinks that [he]2937-he has come to fetch [her]193-elizabeth . [He]2937-he must kill that poor hope , and [the quicklier]5147-the quicklier the more mercifully . "[0-i] [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant sent [me]0-i . [I]0-i came to tell [you]189-mrs. le marchant that [he]2939-he has recovered consciousness . [You]189-mrs. le marchant see , [you]189-mrs. le marchant were wrong"-with an attempt at a reassuring smile—"he[189-mrs. le marchant] is not dead , after all . [He]2939-he is conscious ; that is to say , [he]2939-he is not insensible ; but [I]0-i am afraid [he]2939-he is not quite [himself]2939-he yet , and [you]189-mrs. le marchant must not — must not mind — must not be frightened , [I]0-i mean — if [he]2939-he begins to shout out and talk nonsense by - and - by : [the doctor]1869-the doctor says it is what [we]2941-we must expect . " "[1869-the doctor] And may [I]0-i — mayn't [I]0-i — will not [you]189-mrs. le marchant let [me]0-i ? " What a quivering voice the hope has , and yet how alive it is ! However clumsily , and with whatever bitter yearnings over the pain [he]2939-he is causing [her]189-mrs. le marchant , [he]2939-he must knock it on the head at once . "[189-mrs. le marchant] Go to him?—impossible ! quite out of the question ! The great object is to keep [him]2939-he perfectly quiet , and if once [he]2939-he caught sight of [you]189-mrs. le marchant — " "[2939-he] But if [he]2939-he is not [himself]2939-he , " interrupts [she]189-mrs. le marchant , with a pathetic pertinacity , "[2939-he] [he]2939-he would not know [me]0-i . [I]0-i could not do [him]2939-he any harm if [he]2939-he did not know [me]0-i , and [I]0-i might do something — oh , ever such a little thing for [him]2939-he ! If [you]189-mrs. le marchant knew what it was to stand here and do nothing — do nothing indeed!"—with a change of tone to one of agonized self - reproach;—"have[3161-anyone] not [I]0-i done enough already ? Oh , would [anyone]3161-anyone have believed that it would be [I]0-i that should kill [him]2939-he ! " [She]189-mrs. le marchant turns back to the window again , and dashes [her]189-mrs. le marchant forehead with violence against the frame . Outside the tall date - palm is shaken through all its plumes by the loud breeze ; it is swaying and waving and blowing , and not less is its solid shadow cut out by the moonshine 's keen knife on [the terrace]908-the terrace , wavering and shaking too , as if convulsed by laughter . [The porch of [the hotel]1144-the hotel]5149-the porch of the hotel — mere whitewash and plaster , as memory and reason tell one that it is — stands out in glorified ivory like the portals of [such a palace]5151-such a palace as [we]5152-we see in vision , when "[0-i] [I]0-i ca n't have [you]189-mrs. le marchant talking such nonsense , " says [Jim]181-jim , in an exceedingly kind and not very steady voice , for [his]181-jim own feelings are horribly harrowed ; and on thinking over the scene afterwards , [he]181-jim can not swear that , at this point , [he]181-jim did not pass a most brotherly arm for one moment round the poor little heaving shoulder , which is shaking almost as much as the palm - tree 's shadow . "[189-mrs. le marchant] [He]2939-he is not going to die ; [he]2939-he is not thinking of dying . [Nobody]3337-nobody has killed [him]2939-he — least of all [you]2944-you . " [She]189-mrs. le marchant makes [him]181-jim no answer , nor lifts [her]189-mrs. le marchant stricken head , over which [he]181-jim looks out , while the ghostly mirth shakes [the landscape]5153-the landscape ; at [his]181-jim wits ' end , in search of consolation . Below waves a sea of foliage , out of which the strong elfin light has stolen all the colour . From [that colourless dark ocean]5154-that colourless dark ocean rises far away to the right the dazzling little snowy dome of [a mosque]5155-a mosque , showing like a transfigured mushroom ; and down below [the rounding bay]5156-the rounding bay is seen laying its foam - lips in white glory on [the land]4108-the land . "[3337-nobody] [Dr. Stephens]367-dr. stephens feels sure that [he]2939-he must have had a sunstroke . [You]2944-you know that [he]2939-he has been in [the East]133-the east . [He]2939-he was a month in [Cairo]160-cairo ; the sun has great power there , even in winter , and [he]2939-he is sure to have exposed [himself]2939-he recklessly . [He]2939-he was on [his]2939-he way [home]401-home — had got as far as [Paris]93-paris , it seems — when [he]2939-he accidentally heard that [you]2944-you were [here]637-here . Since then , no doubt , [he]2939-he has neither eaten nor slept ; so [you]2944-you see how little [you]2944-you are to blame . [You]2944-you know that [I]0-i told [you]2944-you how odd [he]2939-he was before [you]2944-you even saw [him]2939-he . Do not [you]2944-you remember?"—trying to recall every circumstance that may tend to reassure [her—"I]0-i[2944-you] warned [you]2944-you that [you]2944-you would have to be careful what [you]2944-you said to [him]2939-he ? " [His]2939-he words have a very different effect from that intended by [him]2939-he . "[2944-you] Oh , that is why [I]0-i can not forgive [myself]0-i ! " says [she]0-i , with what sounds almost like a cry of physical pain . "[2944-you] [You]2944-you did warn [me]0-i ; [I]0-i had no excuse . In [his]2939-he state [I]0-i ought never — it was murdering [him]2939-he to tell [him]2939-he — " [She]0-i breaks off . To tell [him]2939-he what ? [Jim]181-jim bites [his]181-jim lips hard to hinder [himself]181-jim from putting this question , as [he]181-jim again , in mercy to [her]0-i , looks away from [her]0-i out into the night . The moon has swum over [the housetop]5158-the housetop by now ; but [one]501-one can see [her]0-i handiwork as plainly as ever in the broad argent fringe , like the border of a cloak , that marks where the waves are breaking on [the beach]5160-the beach . [One]501-one often talks of a fringe without really meaning that there is much likeness to [one]501-one ; but to - night [the moon - washed breakers]5163-the moon - washed breakers really do wear that aspect — a fringe of silver with long silver tags and ends . "[2939-he] But [I]0-i was so deceived , " [she]0-i continues , with that wail still in [her]0-i voice ; "[0-i] [he]2939-he was not violent . After what [you]2947-you had told [me]0-i , [I]0-i expected [him]2939-he to be violent ; but [he]2939-he was not : [he]2939-he was quite gentle and quiet , and [he]2939-he did beg so hard , and [I]0-i was so glad to see [him]2939-he again , that [I]0-i felt [I]0-i was giving in — that [I]0-i should give way altogether if [I]0-i did not tell [him]2939-he — tell [him]2939-he at once , without giving [myself]0-i time to think ; and so [I]0-i did"—growing very breathless and incoherent—"and[0-i] in a second ; and then all in a minute , without any warning , just as if [I]0-i had shot [him]2939-he through the head , [he]2939-he went down with a crash . [I]0-i did not see it , for [I]0-i was not looking at [him]2939-he . [I]0-i could not bear to look at [him]2939-he while [I]0-i told [him]2939-he . [I]0-i had both hands over [my]0-i face , and then — and then — [I]0-i heard [him]2939-he fall . " What can [Jim]181-jim say to [her]0-i ? Fear lest any dastardly unchivalrous curiosity may seem to pierce through whatever sympathetic question [he]181-jim might put to [her]0-i keeps [him]181-jim dumb , and stupidly staring at the bowing , ironically merry palm . "[0-i] And now , " [she]0-i goes on , lifting [her]0-i face , and [he]181-jim is shocked to see how livid it is in the moonlight , "[2939-he] [he]2939-he will go out of [the world]3184-the world thinking [me]0-i much worse than [I]0-i really am , for [I]0-i had not time to tell [him]2939-he all . [He]2939-he heard only the bare fact ; [he]2939-he did not hear what excuse [I]0-i had — that [I]0-i was not really so wicked as — as — [he]2939-he will die thinking [me]0-i . " The sob with which [she]0-i ends alarms [him]181-jim by its kinship to a convulsion . "[0-i] [I]0-i do not know what to say to [you]0-i , " [he]181-jim says , desperately making a snatch at [her]0-i two hands , as if by the violence of [his]181-jim grip [he]181-jim could convey to [her]0-i some little portion of the deep compassion that is swelling up in [his]181-jim heart for [her]0-i ; "[0-i] [I]0-i am so much in the dark . No , no , no ! " with a return of that terror lest this ejaculation should seem the outcome of any inquisitiveness ; "[0-i] [I]0-i do not want [you]0-i to tell [me]0-i anything ! What is more , [I]0-i will not listen to [you]0-i if [you]0-i attempt it ; but what there is not the least manner of doubt about is that [his]2939-he fainting had no sort of reference to what [you]0-i said to [him]2939-he : [he]2939-he would have fainted whatever [you]0-i had said to [him]2939-he , or if [you]0-i had said nothing at all . [He]2939-he was as mad as [a hatter]2949-a hatter when [he]2939-he went in to [you]0-i . It is all part of the same thing — over - fatigue , sunstroke . But [he]2939-he is not going to die"—with a hurried trip back to [his]2939-he former strain of consolation—"he[0-i] is not thinking of it ; [I]0-i promise [you]0-i , [I]0-i give [you]0-i [my]0-i word of honour"—becoming perfectly reckless and completely insensate—"that[0-i] [he]2939-he shall not ! " But [she]0-i is too strangled with sobs to make any rejoinder . "[0-i] [He]2939-he shall have the best of nursing , " goes on [Jim]181-jim . "[0-i] [I]0-i have telegraphed for [a nurse]1945-a nurse to [Nice]161-nice . How astonishing it is that in a place of this size [you]0-i can not get [a decent sick - nurse]2951-a decent sick - nurse ! [I]0-i hoped [we]2952-we might have caught the one who nursed [General Smith]368-general smith before — — " [He]181-jim stops abruptly , with a too tardy recollection that the allusion is not a happy once , since [the General]5164-the general died two days ago . Unfortunately , [she]0-i also remembers , as is evidenced by the strong shudder that passes over [her]0-i . "[368-general smith] If [he]2939-he dies , will [he]2939-he be buried in [that deep narrow , red grave that [they]2954-they showed [us]2952-we in [the Protestant cemetery]2955-the protestant cemetery]2953-that deep narrow , red grave that they showed us in the protestant cemetery , and which [they]2954-they said that [they]2954-they always kept open for [English visitors]2956-english visitors ? If [he]2939-he dies ! if [he]2939-he dies ! Oh , if [I]0-i could but have told [him]2939-he ! if [he]2939-he would but have waited for [me]0-i to tell [him]2939-he how it really was ! " Though "[2939-he] [February Fill - dyke]162-february fill - dyke " was never and nowhere truer to [her]0-i name than this year , and in [Algiers]120-algiers — coming laden with wet days to make [the green Sahel]163-the green sahel , if possible , greener than it was before ; yet [the inhabitants of [the Grand Hotel]2202-the grand hotel]5165-the inhabitants of the grand hotel do not again , for a matter of three weeks , relieve [their]5165-the inhabitants of the grand hotel ennui or let off [their]5165-the inhabitants of the grand hotel energies in far from [Dumb Crambo]351-dumb crambo , or loud charade . The voice of [the battledore]5167-the battledore is silent in the entrance - hall , and [the shuttlecock]5168-the shuttlecock sleeps . [M. Cipriani]330-m. cipriani has scarcely had to do more than mention [his]2939-he request that [they]5165-the inhabitants of the grand hotel would lay aside [their]5165-the inhabitants of the grand hotel more noisy pastimes , for [they]5165-the inhabitants of the grand hotel are , most of [them]5165-the inhabitants of the grand hotel , [rather good - natured persons]5169-rather good - natured persons than otherwise , since , indeed , it is quite as uncommon to be very ill - natured as to be very selfless , or very foolish , or very wise . Those of [them]5165-the inhabitants of the grand hotel [who have been fortunate enough to be present at the catastrophe]5170-who have been fortunate enough to be present at the catastrophe have carried away such a moving image of [a wounded Adonis]5171-a wounded adonis , apparently several yards long , stretched upon [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant 's Persian carpet , that [they]5165-the inhabitants of the grand hotel have infected [those less happy persons who know of [him]2939-he only by hearsay with a compassionate interest scarcely inferior to [their]5172-those less happy persons who know of him only by hearsay with a compassionate interest scarcely inferior to their own own]5172-those less happy persons who know of him only by hearsay with a compassionate interest scarcely inferior to their own . [The only person in [the hotel]1144-the hotel who makes much noise]5173-the only person in the hotel who makes much noise is [poor Byng [himself]5175-poor byng himself]5175-poor byng himself , and for awhile [he]5175-poor byng himself falls it with clamour enough to furnish two or three of those bump suppers of which , not so long ago , [he]5175-poor byng himself was a conspicuous ornament . There had never , even when [he]5175-poor byng himself was in [his]5175-poor byng himself wits , been much disguise as to the state of [his]5175-poor byng himself feelings ; now that [he]5175-poor byng himself is out of [them]5176-them , [the whole house]5177-the whole house rings with [his]5175-poor byng himself frantic callings upon the name of [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth , uttered in every key of rage , expostulation , tenderness , and appeal . These cries reach [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth [herself]193-elizabeth as [she]193-elizabeth sits cowering in [that one of [the little suite of rooms which is nearest the door of entrance]5179-the little suite of rooms which is nearest the door of entrance]5178-that one of the little suite of rooms which is nearest the door of entrance — sits there cowering , and yet with the door , through which those dreadful sounds penetrate to [her]193-elizabeth , ajar , in order the better to hear [them]5176-them — cowering , and for several days alone . Owing to various accidents , similar in their results , though differing in character , almost a week elapses from the first breaking out of [Byng]203-byng 's malady before the arrival of either [the hospital nurse]5180-the hospital nurse or of [Mrs. Byng]203-byng . When the latter event occurs , [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant retires from [her]189-mrs. le marchant post at [the sick man]5132-the sick man 's bedside with the same unostentatious matter - of - factness with which [she]189-mrs. le marchant had assumed it , and [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth is no longer alone . But to set against this advantage is the counterbalancing evil that , after the arrival of [[Byng]203-byng 's mother]946-byng 's mother , [she]189-mrs. le marchant can no longer steal out , as [she]189-mrs. le marchant had before done a hundred times a day , to [his]5132-the sick man door , to glean fragments of tidings from any outcomer thence . [She]189-mrs. le marchant is never able to repeat those little surreptitious excursions after that occasion when [Mrs. Byng]203-byng , coming suddenly out upon [her]189-mrs. le marchant , passes [her]189-mrs. le marchant with such speaking , if silent , hostility and scorn in [her]189-mrs. le marchant tired and grief - stricken eyes , that [the luckless spy]5183-the luckless spy slinks back sobbing to [[her]5183-the luckless spy own tender mother]5184-her own tender mother ; and there [Jim]181-jim , flying out a while after to carry [them]5185-them a crumb of reassurance , finds [them]5185-them , to [his]181-jim indignation , mingling [their]5185-them bitter tears . Whatever else [his]5132-the sick man faults may be , [Mr. Burgoyne]198-burgoyne is [a man of [his]5132-the sick man word]5186-a man of his word ; [he]5132-the sick man certainly keeps [his]5132-the sick man promise to [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth that [Byng]203-byng shall be well nursed . [He]5132-the sick man keeps [his]5132-the sick man other promise , too — though that is more by good luck than good management — that [Byng]203-byng shall not die . Whether to hinder [[his]5132-the sick man friend]393-his friend from being made [a liar]5188-a liar , or because [he]5132-the sick man [himself]5132-the sick man is loth to leave [a world which [he]5132-the sick man has found so pretty , cruel , and amusing , [Byng]203-byng]5189-a world which he has found so pretty , cruel , and amusing , byng does not die — [Byng]203-byng lives . By [her]193-elizabeth 25th day [February]369-february has dried [her]193-elizabeth tears , though they still hang on [her]193-elizabeth green lashes , and a great galleon of a sun steers through a tremendous sea of blue , as [Jim]181-jim persuades [[Byng]203-byng 's mother]946-byng 's mother to go out for [her]193-elizabeth first delicious drive in that fresh and satin - soft air of [the Algerian February]5191-the algerian february , which matches [our]5192-our best poets ' May. [He]181-jim takes [her]193-elizabeth along [the Route des Aqueduques]5193-the route des aqueduques , that lovely route which runs high along the hillside among [the villas above [the town]407-the town]5194-the villas above the town , so high as to be on a level with the roofs of [the lofty - standing [Continental and Orient Hotels]165-continental and orient hotels]5196-the lofty - standing continental and orient hotels . [It]5193-the route des aqueduques is [a most twisting road]5197-a most twisting road , which in curves and loops winds about the head of [narrow deep gorges , full of pale olive - trees]5198-narrow deep gorges , full of pale olive - trees , caroubiers , and ilex . Below lies [the red - roofed white town]5199-the red - roofed white town . Slowly [they]5192-our trot past [the campagne of [the "[2939-he] English Milor]5201-the " english milor]5200-the campagne of the " english milor , " "[2939-he] L'Epicier Anglais , " and many others , over whose high walls [bougainvillias]166-bougainvillias light [their]166-bougainvillias now waning purple fires , and big bushes of [fleurs de Marie]5202-fleurs de marie stoop their milky stars . [Mrs. Byng]203-byng 's eyes , sunk and diminished by watching and weariness , have been lying restfully on the delightful spring spectacle — on the great yellow sorrels by [the wayside]5203-the wayside ; [she]203-byng now turns them tear - brimmed to [[her]203-byng companion]540-her companion . "[0-i] [I]0-i could jump out of [my]0-i skin ! " [she]203-byng says shakily . "[0-i] What a sun ! what a sea ! And to think that , after all , [we]2957-we have pulled [him]2958-him through . " [Jim]181-jim 's only answer is a sympathetic pressure of the extremely well - fitting glove nearest [him]181-jim . If [Willy]222-cecilia had died instead of lived , [her]203-byng gloves would have fitted all the same . "[2957-we] But [we]2957-we are not out of [the wood]1745-the wood yet , " continues [she]203-byng , with a shake of the head . "[2957-we] [He]2958-him is cured , or nearly cured , of one disease , but what about the other ? " "[2957-we] What other ? " inquires [he]181-jim , obstinately stupid , and with somewhat of a heart - sinking at the prospect of the engagement which [he]181-jim sees ahead of [him]181-jim . How many elbows [the road]3320-the road makes ! It seems to have been cut in places right through [the wet red rock]5206-the wet red rock , now overhung by such a torrent of vegetation . At the head of one of the deep clefts that run up from [the sea]2491-the sea [they]2957-we pause , and look down upon [a second sea of greenery that would seem to belong to no month less leafy than June]5208-a second sea of greenery that would seem to belong to no month less leafy than june . To June , too , belong the murmur and hum and summer trickle of running water at [the ravine bottom]5209-the ravine bottom . "[0-i] [I]0-i do not see why , if [he]2958-him goes on as swimmingly as [he]2958-him is now doing , " says [Mrs. Byng]203-byng in a restless voice—"why[0-i] [we]2957-we should not get [him]2958-him off in a week , even if [he]2958-him were carried on board [the boat]2217-the boat . " "[0-i] A week ? Is not that rather sanguine ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i do not think so , the sooner the better ; and during that week [I]0-i should think [she]0-i could hardly make any attempt to see [him]2958-him . " "[0-i] Has [she]0-i shown any signs of making one hitherto ? " "[0-i] Well , [no"—rather]370-no"—rather grudgingly . "[0-i] In fact , between [you]2961-you and [me]0-i , considering that it is [they]2962-they who have brought [him]2958-him into this plight , [I]0-i think [they]2962-they might have shown a little more solicitude about [him]2958-him . In the last ten days [I]0-i do not believe that [they]2962-they have been once to the door to inquire . " "[2962-they] [You]2961-you do not seem to be aware , " says [Jim]181-jim , in a voice which , though quiet , is not pacific , "[2961-you] and that is odd , considering how often [I]0-i told [you]2961-you , that until [you]2961-you came [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant nursed [him]2958-him like [a mother]2963-a mother ; not like [a mother]2963-a mother , indeed"—correcting [himself]2958-him with a somewhat malicious intention—"for[2965-mothers] [mothers]2965-mothers grow flurried , and [she]189-mrs. le marchant never did . " "[189-mrs. le marchant] [You]2961-you mean that [she]189-mrs. le marchant nursed [him]2958-him better than [I]0-i do , " in a jealous tone .
