"[0-i] " And [the girl]3289-the girl — [I]2966-they suppose one can hardly call [her]3289-the girl [a girl]690-a girl — looks nice too . "[2966-they] [They]2966-they are passing [the Casbah]2967-the casbah , [the solid Moorish fortifications]2968-the solid moorish fortifications , about which now hang only [a few gaitered , sunburnt , baggy Zouaves]2969-a few gaitered , sunburnt , baggy zouaves . [Jim]181-jim has a silly hope that , if [he]181-jim maintains an entire silence , the current of [[his]181-jim companion]603-his companion 's ideas may drift into another channel ; but [he]181-jim is soon undeceived . " [I]181-jim suppose that [she]3289-the girl must have been quite , quite young when — when those dreadful things happened that [Willy]222-cecilia talked about in [his]181-jim delirium ? "[181-jim] " Is it possible"—indignantly—"that[181-jim] [you]181-jim take the ravings of [a fever - patient au pied de la lettre]2971-a fever - patient au pied de la lettre ? " "[181-jim] No , [I]0-i do not ; but"—with an obstinate sticking to [her]3289-the girl point—"there[181-jim] was a substratum of truth in [them]2972-them ; that was only too evident . " [Jim]181-jim shuts [his]181-jim teeth tight together . [His]181-jim vow of silence is harder to keep than [he]181-jim had thought . "[181-jim] Since [he]181-jim came to [himself]181-jim [he]181-jim has never mentioned [her]603-his companion to [me]0-i , " continues [[his]181-jim companion]603-his companion anxiously ; "[181-jim] has [he]181-jim to [you]181-jim ? " "[181-jim] No . " "[181-jim] [I]0-i quite tremble whenever [he]181-jim opens [his]181-jim lips , lest [he]181-jim should be going to begin the subject , and [one]501-one could not contradict [him]181-jim yet awhile ; [he]181-jim is so quixotic , it is quite likely that [he]181-jim may have some distorted idea that [her]603-his companion being — how shall [I]0-i say?—flétrie — is an additional reason for standing by [her]603-his companion , rehabilitating [her]603-his companion , marrying [her]603-his companion . [He]181-jim is so chivalrous . " [They]5215-they have left [the Prison Civile]5216-the prison civile and [the Zouave Barracks]5217-the zouave barracks behind [them]5215-they . A longer interval than that usually supposed to elapse between a remark and its rejoinder has passed , before [Jim]181-jim can bring [himself]181-jim to utter the following sentence with the calmness which [he]181-jim wishes : "[181-jim] Has it never occurred to [you]603-his companion that [she]603-his companion may be chivalrous too ? " Perhaps [Mrs. Byng]203-byng does not readily find a response to this question ; perhaps it sets [her]203-byng off upon a train of speculation which does not conduce to garrulity . Certain it is that , for the rest of the drive , [she]203-byng is as silent as [Jim]181-jim could wish [her]203-byng . It is a sharp surprise to [him]181-jim two days later to be mysteriously called outside [the sick man]5132-the sick man 's door by [her]203-byng , in order to be informed that [she]203-byng has invited [Miss Le Marchant]240-miss le marchant to accompany [her]203-byng on a drive . "[603-his companion] [I]0-i went to call upon [them]2974-them , " [she]0-i says , avoiding — or so [he]181-jim fancies it — [his]181-jim eye as [she]0-i speaks ; "[0-i] and [I]0-i asked [the girl]3289-the girl to drive with [me]0-i to [the Mole]167-the mole , and get a good blowing about . " "[3289-the girl] How kind of [you]0-i ! " cries [Jim]181-jim , a flash of real pleasure in [his]181-jim serious look ; "[0-i] how like [you]0-i — like [your]0-i real self , that is ! " And [he]181-jim takes [her]0-i hand to thank it by a friendly pressure . But [she]0-i draws it away rather hastily . "[0-i] Oh , it was nothing so very wonderful — nothing to thank [me]0-i for . " [She]0-i seems confused and a little guilty , and escapes with some precipitation from [his]181-jim gratitude . [Mrs. Byng]203-byng is not a woman addicted to double - dealing , and if [she]203-byng ever makes any little essays in that direction , [she]203-byng does them , as on this present occasion , villainously . [Burgoyne]181-jim is not at the hall - door to help [the ladies]5219-the ladies into [the carriage]3765-the carriage when [they]5219-the ladies set off . Perhaps this may be because [he]181-jim is in attendance upon [the invalid]3676-the invalid . Perhaps because — glad as [he]181-jim had at first felt and expressed [himself]181-jim at [their]5219-the ladies friendliness — some misgiving may , upon reflection , have beset [him]181-jim at so strange a conjunction . At all events , it is only [Fritz]349-fritz who throws the light Arab rug over [their]5219-the ladies knees and gives [them]5219-the ladies [his]181-jim encouraging parting smile . [Poor Miss Le Marchant]240-miss le marchant needs [his]181-jim encouragement , for , indeed , it is in a very frightened spirit that [she]240-miss le marchant sets forth on [her]240-miss le marchant pleasuring . But before the horse - bells have jingled to [the bottom of [Mustapha Supérieur]119-mustapha supérieur]5222-the bottom of mustapha supérieur , [her]240-miss le marchant spirits are rising . The sun shines , and [he]181-jim has shone so seldom in [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth 's life that a very few of [his]181-jim beams , whether real or metaphorical , suffice to send up [her]240-miss le marchant quicksilver . [She]240-miss le marchant does not consciously admit for a second the hope that in the present overture on the part of [[her]240-miss le marchant companion]540-her companion lies any significance . But yet a tiny trembling bliss now and then taps at [her]240-miss le marchant heart 's door , and [she]240-miss le marchant pushes it away but feebly . Before [they]5219-the ladies have reached [the Amirauté]168-the amirauté , where [they]5219-the ladies are to get out , [she]240-miss le marchant has thanked [Mrs. Byng]203-byng with such pretty and unsuspecting gratitude for bringing [her]240-miss le marchant , and has made [her]240-miss le marchant laugh so irrepressibly by [her]240-miss le marchant gay and naïve comments upon [the motley passers - by]5224-the motley passers - by , that the latter is filled with a compunctious regret that [a person with such lovely manners , and such a sense of a joke]5225-a person with such lovely manners , and such a sense of a joke , should have made so disastrous a fiasco of [her]240-miss le marchant life as renders necessary the extremely distasteful errand on which [she]240-miss le marchant [herself]240-miss le marchant is at present bound . At [the Amirauté]168-the amirauté , as [I]0-i say , [they]5219-the ladies get out ; and , turning under a groined roof that looks as if [it]5226-it were the crypt of [a church]3965-a church , find [themselves]5219-the ladies presently upon the long stone breakwater that runs out into [the bay]2204-the bay . [It]168-the amirauté was built , [they]5219-the ladies tell [us]5229-us , in old days by [the wretched Christian captives]5230-the wretched christian captives ; but [the sea]2491-the sea has taken care that not much of the original labour of blood and tears has survived . The wind is high , and the sunshine ardent and splendid . On [their]5219-the ladies right as [they]5219-the ladies walk , with the wind officiously helping [them]5219-the ladies from behind , is a world of dancing sapphire , each blue billow white - tipped . On [their]5219-the ladies left are great blocks of masonry , built strong and square , with narrow intervals between to break the might of [the water]3621-the water . How little [their]5219-the ladies strength has availed against that of [their]5219-the ladies tremendous opponent is seen at every step , since nearly half the blocks are overthrown or in semi - ruin ; though the date engraved upon them shows for how few seasons [they]5219-the ladies have been exposed to the ravages of [the tempestuous sea]5233-the tempestuous sea . [They]5219-the ladies walk on to the end , till [they]5219-the ladies can go no further , since , just ahead of [them]5219-the ladies , the waves are rolling in half - fierce play — though the day is all smiles — over [the breakwater]5234-the breakwater ; and even where [they]5219-the ladies stand , [their]5219-the ladies footing is made unsure by lengths of slimy seaweed that set [them]5219-the ladies slipping along . [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth insists upon [the elder woman]3305-the elder woman taking [her]193-elizabeth slight arm — insists upon carrying [her]193-elizabeth wraps , and generally waiting upon and ministering to [her]193-elizabeth . From the bottom of [her]193-elizabeth heart [Mrs. Byng]203-byng wishes that [she]193-elizabeth would not , since every instance of [her]193-elizabeth soft helpfulness , so innocent and spontaneous , makes more difficult the answer to that question which [she]193-elizabeth has been asking [herself]193-elizabeth ever since [they]5219-the ladies set foot upon [the Mole]167-the mole : "[0-i] How shall [I]0-i begin ? " It is unanswered still , when , retracing [their]5219-the ladies steps a little , [they]5219-the ladies sit down under the lee of one of [the half - wrecked blocks]5236-the half - wrecked blocks to enjoy the view . From here [the sea]2491-the sea is [a lake]5238-a lake , [the distant mountains]5239-the distant mountains and [the breakwater]5234-the breakwater seeming — though in reality parted by how wide [a wet waste]5241-a wet waste — to join in embracing [it]2491-the sea . [The mountains]911-the mountains are dim and filmy to - day , [Cape Matifou]152-cape matifou scarcely visible ; but [the Koubah]171-the koubah shows white - domed on [the hillside]1457-the hillside , and all the dazzling water is shot through with blinding light . [The town]407-the town , [Arab - French]5245-arab - french , is dazzling too ; [the arcaded quay]5246-the arcaded quay , [the fortifications]2419-the fortifications , [one]501-one can scarcely look at any of [them]2419-the fortifications . [Two or three steamers]5249-two or three steamers , with a little vapour issuing from [their]5249-two or three steamers ugly black and red funnels , lie moored ; and [other smaller craft]5250-other smaller craft lift [their]5249-two or three steamers spars against the heaven . Near by [a man]386-a man is sitting with [his]386-a man legs dangling over the water , fishing with a line ; and [two or three Arabs]5252-two or three arabs , draped in the dignity of [their]5252-two or three arabs poetic rags , lie couched round a fire that [they]5252-two or three arabs have kindled . Beneath and around [them]5252-two or three arabs is the banging and thundering of [the sea]2491-the sea . August noise ! "[0-i] A voice like the sound of [many waters]2976-many waters . " Could there be a more awful comparison ? Just underneath [them]5252-two or three arabs , where [the sea]2491-the sea has made a greater breach than usual , it is boiling as in a caldron . Looking down and in , [they]2978-we see [the water]3621-the water comparatively quiet for a moment ; then , with a shout of its great jubilant voice , rushing and surging in , tossing its mane . [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth 's eyes are resting on [the heavenly sapphire plain]5256-the heavenly sapphire plain . "[0-i] How blue ! " [she]193-elizabeth says , under [her]193-elizabeth breath ; "[0-i] one can not believe that it is not really blue ; one feels that if [one]501-one took up a little in a spoon it would be just as blue as it is now . " "[0-i] [I]0-i dare say it will not feel so blue when [we]2978-we are on it , " replies [Mrs. Byng]203-byng , lugging in somewhat awkwardly , as [she]0-i feels , the subject which [she]0-i finds it so hard to introduce , "[0-i] as [I]0-i suppose [we]2978-we shall be within a week now . " [Her]0-i charity bids [her]0-i not glance at [[her]0-i companion]540-her companion as [she]0-i speaks , so [she]0-i is not quite sure whether or not [she]0-i gives a start . "[198-burgoyne] [Mr. Burgoyne]198-burgoyne thinks that [I]0-i am sanguine ; but [I]0-i am all for moving [him]198-burgoyne as soon as possible ; it can not be too soon . " [She]0-i tries to throw as much significance as [they]5258-they are capable of holding into the latter words , and feels that [she]0-i has succeeded . "[0-i] Of course [he]198-burgoyne may refuse to go , " continues [she]0-i , with a rather strained laugh . "[0-i] Do [you]2979-you remember [Victor Hugo]372-victor hugo 's definition of [heaven]1092-heaven as a place where [children]4103-children are always little and [parents]2982-parents are always young ? [I]0-i am continually quoting it . But , unfortunately , [one 's children]2983-one 's children will not stay little ; [they]2983-one 's children grow big , and get wills of [their]2983-one 's children own , and it is quite possible [he]198-burgoyne may refuse to go . " "[0-i] Yes ? " almost inaudibly . "[0-i] But"—reddening slightly at the patently - intended application of [her]0-i next sentence—"anyone[0-i] that was fond of [him]198-burgoyne — anyone that liked [him]198-burgoyne really and — and disinterestedly , [I]0-i mean , must see that the only happy course for [him]198-burgoyne would be to go ; that it would be [his]198-burgoyne salvation to get away ; [they]2984-they — [they]2984-they would not try to hinder [him]198-burgoyne . " "[0-i] [I]0-i should think that [no one]819-no one would do that . " There is not a touch of asperity in the dove - soft voice ; but there is a shade of dignity . "[819-no one] When [he]198-burgoyne was ill — while [he]198-burgoyne was delirious " ( "[819-no one] How dreadfully unpleasant it is ! " in an anguished internal aside)—"I[819-no one] could not help hearing — gathering — drawing inferences . " The ardour of the chase has vanquished [her]0-i charity , and [she]0-i is looking at [[her]0-i victim]5259-her victim . But , to do [her]0-i justice , the success of [her]0-i labours shocks [her]0-i . Can [this little aged , pinched face , with its dilated eyes , so full of woe and terror]5260-this little aged , pinched face , with its dilated eyes , so full of woe and terror , be [the same one that dimpled into riotous laughter half an hour ago]5261-the same one that dimpled into riotous laughter half an hour ago at the sight of [the two dirty old men]5262-the two dirty old men , in Jewish gaberdines and with gingham umbrellas , kissing [each other]607-each other by the Mosquée de la Pêcherie ? "[819-no one] Of course it was all incoherent , " [she]0-i goes on hurriedly , snatching at the first expression that occurs to [her]0-i as likely to undo , or at least a little modify , [her]0-i work—"nothing[819-no one] that [one]501-one could make sense of . Only [your]2987-you name recurred so incessantly ; it was nothing but ' [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth , [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth . ' [I]0-i am sure"—with a remorseful if clumsy attempt to be kind , and a most uneasy smile—"that[0-i] [I]0-i do not wonder at it ! " In the narrow interspace between the blocks and [the path]5264-the path — not more than a couple of fingers wide — how [the sea]2491-the sea forces itself ! and up race its foam - fountains , throwing their spray aloft in such mighty play , as if they would hit heaven 's arch . What exhilaration in its great glad noise , superb and battle - ready ! "[0-i] [I]0-i can not express how distasteful a task this is to [me"—in]0-i a tone that certainly gives no reason to doubt the truth of [her]0-i statement ; "[2988-his] but , after all , [I]0-i am [[his]2988-his mother]3511-his mother ; [he]2988-his is all [I]0-i have in [the world]3184-the world , and [I]0-i am sure that [you]2987-you are [the very last person who would wish to do [him]2988-his an injury]2991-the very last person who would wish to do him an injury . " "[2987-you] No ; [I]0-i do not think that [I]0-i would do [him]2988-his an injury . " How curiously still and slow [her]0-i voice is ! [Mrs. Byng]203-byng has resolutely averted [her]0-i eyes , so that [her]0-i purpose may not again be shaken by the sight of the havoc [she]0-i has wrought , and has fixed them upon some sea gulls that are riding up and down upon [the merry waves]5266-the merry waves , making [them]5266-the merry waves , with [their]5266-the merry waves buoyant motion , even more jocund than [they]5266-the merry waves were before . "[0-i] It seems an impossible thing to say to [you]2987-you — a thing too bad to apologize for — but yet [I]0-i must say it"—in a tone of excessive distress , yet firmness . "[0-i] Under the circumstances , it would — would throw a blight over [his]2988-his whole life . " "[0-i] Yes , [I]0-i know that it would ; [I]0-i have always known it ; that is why [we]2992-we left [Florence]20-florence . " "[2992-we] And very good it was of [you]2987-you , too ! Not that [I]0-i am quite certain of the judiciousness of the way in which [you]2987-you did it ; but , however , [I]0-i am sure [you]2987-you meant it for the best . " "[2987-you] Yes , [I]0-i meant it for the best . " The sea - gulls have risen from the billow , and are turning and wheeling in the air . The light is catching [their]5266-the merry waves wings , and making them look like whitest silver . It seems as if [they]5266-the merry waves were at conscious play with it , trying experiments as to how [they]5266-the merry waves can best catch [their]5266-the merry waves bright playfellow , and again shake it off , and yet again recapture it . "[0-i] What [a monster]2993-a monster [you]2987-you must think [me]0-i ! " breaks out [the elder woman]3305-the elder woman presently . Now that the impression has somehow been conveyed to [her]0-i mind that [her]0-i mission is likely to be completely successful , the full brutality of the method by which [she]0-i has accomplished it bursts upon [her]0-i mind . "[2987-you] How treacherous ! luring [you]2987-you out here , under the pretence of friendliness , to say such horrible things to [you]2987-you ! " [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth 's narrow hands are clasped upon [her]193-elizabeth knee , and [her]193-elizabeth small heart - broken , white face is looking out straight before [her]193-elizabeth . "[2993-a monster] No , [I]0-i do not think [you]2987-you [a monster]2993-a monster , " [she]0-i answers—"you[2993-a monster] are [a kind - hearted woman]2995-a kind - hearted woman ! and it must have been very , very unpleasant to [you]2987-you . [I]0-i am quite sorry"—with a sort of smile—"for[3511-his mother] [you]2987-you , having to do it ; but [you]2987-you are [[his]2996-he mother]3511-his mother . If [I]0-i had been [[his]2996-he mother]3511-his mother , [I]0-i should have done the same ; at least , [I]0-i suppose so . " "[0-i] [I]0-i am sure , if things had been different , there is no one that [I]0-i should have — [I]0-i do not know when [I]0-i ever saw anyone whom [I]0-i took such a fancy to . If it had not been for the disparity — [I]0-i mean , if [he]2996-he had been less young and unfit to take upon [himself]2996-he the serious responsibilities of life — — " How deplorably lame even to [Mrs. Byng]203-byng 's ears sound [her]203-byng tardy efforts to place the grounds of [her]203-byng objection on a less cruel basis than that which [she]203-byng has already made so nakedly plain to be [the real one]5268-the real one ! Even [the sweet - mannered Elizabeth]5269-the sweet - mannered elizabeth does not think it necessary to express gratitude for such insulting civilities . "[0-i] [I]0-i do not quite understand what [you]2999-you wish [me]0-i to do , " [she]0-i says , with quiet politeness ; "[2996-he] if [you]2999-you will explain to [me]0-i — — " "[2999-you] Oh , [I]0-i do not want to dictate to [you]2999-you ; please do not imagine [I]0-i could think of being so impertinent ; but , of course , [he]2996-he will be asking for [you]2999-you . Since [he]2996-he came to [himself]2996-he , [he]2996-he has not mentioned [you]2999-you as yet ; but of course [he]2996-he will . [I]0-i am expecting it every moment ; probably [he]2996-he has not felt up to embarking on the subject . [He]2996-he will ask for [you]2999-you — will want to see [you]2999-you . " "[2996-he] And [you]2999-you wish [me]0-i not to see [him]2996-he ? " [Her]0-i delicate suffering mouth quivers ; but [she]0-i is perfectly composed . "[2999-you] Oh , but of course [you]2999-you must see [him]2996-he ! [you]2999-you quite , quite misunderstand [me]0-i ! Much chance there would be"—with a wretched stunted laugh—"of[2999-you] getting [him]2996-he away without a sight of [you]2999-you ! How little [you]2999-you know [him]2996-he ! " [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth does not dispute the fact of [her]193-elizabeth want of acquaintance with [Byng]203-byng 's character , nor does [she]193-elizabeth help [his]2996-he floundering parent by any suggestion . [She]193-elizabeth merely goes on listening to [her]193-elizabeth with that civil white look , while [the sportive sea - mews]5270-the sportive sea - mews still play at hide - and - seek with the sun - rays on [the wide blue fields of heaven]5271-the wide blue fields of heaven . "[2999-you] It is dreadful that [I]0-i should have to say these things to [you]2999-you , " says [Mrs. Byng]203-byng , in a voice of the strongest revolt and ire against [her]0-i destiny—"insult[2996-he] [you]2999-you in this unprovoked way ; but , in point of fact , [you]2999-you are [the only person in [the world]3184-the world]3000-the only person in the world who can convince [him]2996-he that — that — it is impossible — that it can not be . Of course [he]2996-he will be very urgent and pressing , and [I]0-i know how persuasive [he]2996-he is . Do not [you]2999-you suppose that [I]0-i , [[his]2996-he own mother]2255-his own mother , know how hard it is to refuse [him]2996-he anything ? and of course , in [his]2996-he present weak state , it must be very carefully done . [He]2996-he could not stand any violent contradiction . [You]2999-you would have to be very gentle ; dear me!"—with a fresh access of angry remorse—"as[2999-you] if [you]2999-you ever could be anything else . " This compliment also its pale object receives in silence . "[2999-you] [You]2999-you know one has always heard that there are two kinds of ' No , ' " goes on [Mrs. Byng]203-byng with another dwarfish laugh , which has a touch of the hysteric in [it—"a[2999-you] woman]5272-it—"a woman 's ' No , ' as it is called , that means ' Yes ' ; and a ' No ' which [anyone]3161-anyone — which even [he]2996-he — must understand to be final . If [you]2999-you could — [I]0-i dare say [I]0-i am asking [you]2999-you an impossibility — but if [you]2999-you could make [him]2996-he understand that this time it is final ! " There is a silence between [them]5273-them . An unrulier billow than usual , yet more masterless in its Titan play , is hurling itself with a colossal thud and bang against [the causeway]5274-the causeway ; and [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth waits till its clamour is subsided before [she]193-elizabeth speaks . "[2999-you] Yes , " [she]193-elizabeth answers slowly , "[2999-you] [I]0-i understand ; thank [you]2999-you for telling [me]0-i what [you]2999-you wish . " A moment or two later [they]5273-them are on [their]5273-them way back to [the Amirauté]168-the amirauté . [The ocean]4779-the ocean is at [its]4779-the ocean glorious pastimes all around [them]5273-them ; [the hill - climbing , [shining town]5277-shining town]5276-the hill - climbing , shining town smiles upon [them]5273-them from [its]5276-the hill - climbing , shining town slope ; but upon both has fallen a blindness . The feelings of [Mrs. Byng]203-byng are perhaps the least enviable of the two . [They]5273-them are nearly back at the beginning of [the breakwater]5234-the breakwater , when [she]0-i stops short . Probably when cool reflection comes , when [she]0-i is removed from the charm and pathos of [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth 's meek white presence , lovely and unreproachful , [she]0-i will not repent [her]0-i work ; but at the present moment of impulse and remorse [she]0-i feels as if the expunging of the last half - hour would be cheaply purchased by the sacrifice of six months of [her]0-i remaining life . "[0-i] [I]0-i suppose it is not the least use [my]0-i asking [you]3004-you to try and forgive [me]0-i — to make allowances for [me]0-i ? " [she]0-i says , with unsteady - toned humility ; "[3004-you] oh , how [you]3004-you must hate [me]0-i ! If the case were reversed , how [I]0-i should hate [you]3004-you ! How [you]3004-you will hate [me]0-i all [your]3004-you life ! " The tears are rolling down [her]0-i cheeks , and in an instant [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth 's hand has gone out to [her]0-i . As it does so , the grotesque regret flashes across [the elder woman]3305-the elder woman 's mind that [any future daughter - in - law of hers]5280-any future daughter - in - law of hers will be most unlikely to be [the possessor of such a hand]5281-the possessor of such a hand . "[0-i] Why should [I]0-i hate [you]3004-you ? [you]3004-you cannot"—with a heart - wrung smile—"possibly[3004-you] think [me]0-i more undesirable than [I]0-i do [myself]0-i ; and even if it were not so , [I]0-i do not think it is in [me]0-i to hate [anyone]3161-anyone very much . " On [their]5282-they drive [home]401-home [they]5282-they meet with one or two little incidents quite as funny as [the old Jews]5284-the old jews kissing [each other]607-each other ; but this time [they]5282-they do not move [poor Miss Le Marchant]240-miss le marchant to any laughter . Two days later [she]240-miss le marchant is called upon to perform the task [she]240-miss le marchant has undertaken . Probably [she]240-miss le marchant has spent those two days , and also the appertaining nights , in bracing [her]240-miss le marchant mind to it , for [Jim]181-jim can plainly see the marks of that struggle , though [he]181-jim is not aware of its existence , graved upon [her]240-miss le marchant face , on the third morning after the excursion to [the Mole]167-the mole , when [he]181-jim comes in search of [her]240-miss le marchant . [He]181-jim does not find [her]240-miss le marchant in [[her]240-miss le marchant accustomed corner of [the terrace]908-the terrace]5286-her accustomed corner of the terrace , but , looking down over the balustrade , sees [her]240-miss le marchant sitting below and alone on a small tree - shaded plateau that seems to have been levelled for lawn - tennis or bowls . Probably the giggling and chaffering of [the girls on [the terrace]908-the terrace]5288-the girls on the terrace , and the respectful but persistent importunities of [the Omars]5290-the omars and [Ahmeds]5291-ahmeds to buy [their]5291-ahmeds colourful wares outspread on the hot flags have oppressed [her]240-miss le marchant spirits . [Fritz]349-fritz has carried down for [her]240-miss le marchant an arm - chair , a cane table , and a Persian rug for [her]240-miss le marchant feet , and [she]240-miss le marchant looks as if [she]240-miss le marchant were established for the day . Since [Byng]203-byng has been out of danger [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth has returned to [her]193-elizabeth embroidery . [She]193-elizabeth is one of [those women to whom needlework is unaffectedly dear]5292-those women to whom needlework is unaffectedly dear , like [that other sweet woman "[3161-anyone] who was so delicate with [her]3006-her needle]5293-that other sweet woman " who was so delicate with her needle . " Before [she]240-miss le marchant catches sight of [him]349-fritz [he]349-fritz watches for a few moments [her]240-miss le marchant bright bent head and flying white fingers , and is able to perceive how many sighs [she]240-miss le marchant is sewing into the pattern . "[3161-anyone] What a morning ! " [he]349-fritz says , running down [the steps]5294-the steps and joining [her]240-miss le marchant . "[3161-anyone] [No one]819-no one has any excuse for being [an invalid]3326-an invalid to - day , has [he]819-no one ? " There is no second seat , so [he]349-fritz stands beside [her]240-miss le marchant , looking up over [her]240-miss le marchant head at the tall trees above [her]240-miss le marchant , from which immense garlands of ivy are hanging and swinging in the warm breeze . That potent ivy has killed one tree altogether . [She]240-miss le marchant glances up at [him]349-fritz mutely , knowing that [he]349-fritz has not come merely to tell [her]240-miss le marchant that the day is fine . "[819-no one] [We]3009-we can hardly keep [him]819-no one on [his]819-no one sofa ; [he]819-no one is virtually almost well , so well that [he]819-no one is quite up to seeing [people]3155-people . [He]819-no one would like — [he]819-no one has been asking — to see [you]3011-you . " [He]349-fritz had thought [her]240-miss le marchant nearly as pale as it was possible for [her]240-miss le marchant to be when [he]349-fritz had first come upon [her]240-miss le marchant . [He]349-fritz now realizes how many degrees of colour [she]240-miss le marchant then had left to lose . While [he]349-fritz speaks [she]240-miss le marchant has been mechanically pulling [her]240-miss le marchant thread through , and as [he]349-fritz ceases , [her]240-miss le marchant lifted hand stops as if paralyzed , and remains holding [her]240-miss le marchant needle in the air . It has come , then . For all [her]240-miss le marchant two days ' bracing , is [she]240-miss le marchant ready for it ? "[819-no one] Now ? " The whisper in which this monosyllable is breathed is so stamped with a fear that borders on terror , that [his]349-fritz one astonished thought is bow best to reassure [her]240-miss le marchant . "[819-no one] Not if [you]3011-you do not feel inclined , of course — not unless [you]3011-you like . It can perfectly well be put off to another time . [I]0-i can tell [him]3012-him — there will not be the least difficulty in making [him]3012-him understand — that [you]3011-you do not feel up to it this morning : that [you]3011-you would rather have more notice . " "[3012-him] But [I]0-i would not , " [she]240-miss le marchant says , standing up suddenly , and with trembling hands laying [her]240-miss le marchant work down upon the table , and beginning from dainty habit to pin it up in its protecting white cloth . "[0-i] What good would more notice — a year 's notice — do [me]0-i ? " [She]240-miss le marchant turns away from [him]349-fritz and fixes [her]240-miss le marchant unseeing eyes , glassy and dilated , upon a poplar tree that is hanging tasselled catkins out against the sky . Then once again [she]240-miss le marchant faces [him]349-fritz , and [he]349-fritz sees that there are cold beads of agony upon [her]240-miss le marchant forehead . "[0-i] Wish for [me]0-i , " [she]240-miss le marchant says huskily—"wish[0-i] very hard for [me]0-i , that [I]0-i may get through it — that [we]3013-we may both get through it — alive ! " Then , motioning to [him]349-fritz with [her]240-miss le marchant hand not to follow [her]240-miss le marchant , [she]240-miss le marchant walks quickly towards [the hotel]1144-the hotel . It is impossible to [him]349-fritz to stay quiet . [He]349-fritz wanders restlessly away , straying [he]349-fritz knows not whither . [The mimosas]5296-the mimosas are out charmingly in [the gardens]3240-the gardens , sending delicious whiffs of perfume from the soft yellow fluff of [their]5296-the mimosas flowers . The pinky almond - trees are out too , but not till long afterwards does [he]349-fritz know it . By - and - by [he]349-fritz finds [himself]349-fritz strolling , unhindered by [a gardener]5298-a gardener placidly digging , through [the grounds of [a villa]5300-a villa to let]5299-the grounds of a villa to let . Gigantic violets send [their]5296-the mimosas messages to [his]349-fritz nostrils , the big and innumerable blue blossoms predominating over the leaves , which in [England]11-england have to be so carefully searched for them . Superabundant oranges tumble about [his]349-fritz feet ; arum lilies , just discovering the white secret hid in their green sheaths , stand in tall rows on either side of [him]349-fritz ; a bed of broad beans points out the phenomenon of [her]240-miss le marchant February flowers to [him]349-fritz . [He]349-fritz sees and smells none of [them]5296-the mimosas . Have [his]349-fritz senses stolen away with [his]349-fritz heart into [[Byng]203-byng 's bedchamber]5301-byng 's bedchamber ? [They]5296-the mimosas must have done so , or [he]349-fritz could not see with such extraordinary vividness the scene enacting there . [He]349-fritz has [himself]349-fritz helped to place it in such astonishing reality before [himself]349-fritz . Does not [he]349-fritz know the exact position of the chair [she]240-miss le marchant is to occupy ? Did not [he]349-fritz place it for [her]240-miss le marchant before [he]349-fritz went to fetch [her]240-miss le marchant ? Nor can [his]349-fritz reason prevent [his]349-fritz distorted fancy from presenting the interview as one between [happy and confessed lovers]5302-happy and confessed lovers . Even the recollection of [her]240-miss le marchant features , ghastly and with beads of agony dewing them , can not correct the picture of [his]349-fritz mind as [he]349-fritz persistently sees it . That [she]240-miss le marchant meant , when [he]349-fritz parted from [her]240-miss le marchant , to renounce [Byng]203-byng , [he]349-fritz has no manner of doubt . But does not [he]349-fritz know the pliancy of [her]240-miss le marchant nature ? Is not [he]349-fritz convinced that the rock on which [her]240-miss le marchant life has split is [her]240-miss le marchant inability ever to refuse [anyone]3161-anyone anything that [they]3161-anyone ask with sufficient urgency or with enough plausibility to persuade [her]240-miss le marchant that [she]240-miss le marchant can do [them]3161-anyone a kindness by yielding ? How much more , then , will [she]240-miss le marchant be incapable of resisting the importunate passion of [her]240-miss le marchant own heart 's chosen one , freshly risen from a bed of death ? Presently [his]349-fritz restless feet carry [him]349-fritz away out of [the villa grounds]1220-the villa grounds again . [He]349-fritz finds [himself]349-fritz on [the Boulevard Mustapha]172-the boulevard mustapha , and sits down on the low wall by the roadside , staring absently at a broken line of dusky stone - pines , cutting the ardent blue of the African sky on [the hill]1467-the hill opposite , and at [an arcaded campagne throned high up among the verdure]5306-an arcaded campagne throned high up among the verdure . [He]349-fritz knows that it belongs to [an Englishman who made reels of cotton]5307-an englishman who made reels of cotton , and the idle thought saunters across [his]349-fritz mind how strange it is that reels of cotton should wind [anyone]3161-anyone into [such a lofty white Eden]5309-such a lofty white eden ! Can the interview be lasting all this while ? Is not it yet ended ? May not [his]349-fritz tormented fancy see the chair by [Byng]203-byng 's sofa once again empty or occupied by [nurse]3517-nurse or [mother]3447-mother ? Will not [Mrs. Byng]203-byng , will not [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth [herself]193-elizabeth ; have seen the unfitness of taxing [the sick man]5132-the sick man 's faint powers by so extreme a strain upon [them]1220-the villa grounds ? But no sooner has this suggested idea shed a ray of light upon [his]349-fritz darkness than [an opposing one]5313-an opposing one comes and blows it out . Has not [Byng]203-byng a will of [his]349-fritz own ? Will [he]349-fritz be likely so soon to let [her]193-elizabeth go ? Nay , having once recovered [her]193-elizabeth , will [he]349-fritz ever let [her]193-elizabeth out of [his]349-fritz sight again ? The thought restores [him]349-fritz to restless action , and , although with sedulous slowness , [he]349-fritz begins to retrace [his]349-fritz steps towards [the hotel]1144-the hotel . At a point about a quarter of a mile distant from [it]1144-the hotel , [the lane which leads to [the Villa Wilson]5316-the villa wilson]5315-the lane which leads to the villa wilson debouches into [the road]3320-the road , and debouching also into [the road]3320-the road [he]349-fritz sees the figure of [Cecilia]222-cecilia , who , catching sight of [him]349-fritz , as if unable to wait for [him]349-fritz to join [her]222-cecilia , almost runs to meet [him]349-fritz . "[0-i] [I]0-i was coming to call upon [you]3014-you , " says [she]0-i eagerly . "[0-i] Oh!"—with a laugh—"to[0-i] - day [I]0-i really can not stay to think of the proprieties , and [you]3014-you have not been to see [us]3015-us for such centuries ! " "[3014-you] [I]0-i have been nursing [Byng]203-byng . " "[0-i] Oh yes ; [poor man]613-poor man ! How dreadfully ill [he]613-poor man must have been ! [I]0-i was so glad to hear [he]613-poor man was better . " There is such a flat tepidity in the tone of these expressions of commiseration , something so different from the tender alertness of [Cecilia]222-cecilia 's former interest in [their]3015-us object , that [Jim]181-jim , roused out of [his]181-jim own reflections to regard [her]222-cecilia more attentively than [he]181-jim has yet done , sees that [she]222-cecilia is preoccupied by some subject quite alien to [the invalid]3676-the invalid . " [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth 's feeble tap at [Byng]203-byng 's door is instantly answered by [the nurse]2170-the nurse , who , opening it smilingly to admit [her]193-elizabeth , the next moment , evidently in accordance with directions received , passes out [herself]193-elizabeth and shuts it behind [her]193-elizabeth . [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth , deprived of the chaperonage of [her]193-elizabeth cap and apron , and left stranded upon the threshold , has no resource but to cross the floor as steadily as a most trembling pair of legs will let [her]193-elizabeth . [The room]442-the room is [a square one , two of [its]442-the room thick walls pierced by Moorish windows]5324-a square one , two of its thick walls pierced by moorish windows . Drawn up to one of those windows — [the one through which [Jim]181-jim had caught [his]181-jim first glimpse of [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth on the night of [his]181-jim arrival]5325-the one through which jim had caught his first glimpse of elizabeth on the night of his arrival — is [the sick man]5132-the sick man 's sofa . At the side of that sofa [[his]5132-the sick man visitor]5327-his visitor has , all too soon , arrived . [She]0-i had prepared a little set speech to deliver at once — a speech which will give the keynote to the after - interview ; but , alas ! every word of it has gone out of [her]0-i head . Unable to articulate a syllable , [she]0-i stands beside [him]5132-the sick man , and if [anyone]3161-anyone is to give the keynote , it must be [he]5132-the sick man . "[240-miss le marchant] This is very , very good of [you]3039-you . It seems a shame to ask [you]3039-you to come [here]637-here , with all this horrid paraphernalia of physic about ; but [I]0-i really could not wait until [they]3041-they let [me]0-i be moved into [another room]3042-another room . " [She]0-i has not yet dared to lift [her]0-i eyes to [his]5132-the sick man face , in terror lest the sight of the change in it shall overset [her]0-i most unsure composure . Already , indeed , [she]0-i has greedily asked and obtained every detail of the alteration wrought in [him]5132-the sick man . [She]0-i knows that [his]5132-the sick man head is shaved , that [his]5132-the sick man features are sharp , and that [his]5132-the sick man voice is faint ; and when , as [he]5132-the sick man ceases speaking , [she]0-i at last wins resolution enough to look at [him]5132-the sick man , [she]0-i sees that [she]0-i has been told the truth . [His]5132-the sick man head is shaven , [his]5132-the sick man nose is as sharp as a pen , and [his]5132-the sick man voice is faint . [She]0-i has been told all this ; but what is there that [she]0-i has not been told ? What is [his]5132-the sick man voice besides faint ? "[3041-they] Will not [you]3043-you sit down ? It seems monstrous that [I]0-i should be lying here letting [you]3043-you wait upon [yourself]3043-you . Will [you]3043-you try that one ? " pointing to the chair which is figuring at the same moment so prominently in [Jim]181-jim 's tormented fancy . "[3043-you] [I]0-i am afraid [you]3043-you will not find it very comfortable . [I]0-i have not tried it yet , but it looks as hard as a board . " [She]0-i sits down meekly as [he]5132-the sick man bids [her]0-i , glad to be no longer obliged to depend upon [her]0-i shaky limbs , and answers : "[3043-you] Thank [you]3043-you ; it is quite comfortable . " "[3043-you] Would not it be better if [you]3043-you had a cushion?"—looking all round [the room]442-the room for one . [His]5132-the sick man voice is courteous , tender almost , in its solicitude for [her]0-i ease . But is [she]0-i asleep or awake ? Can this be the same voice that poured the frenzy of its heartrending adjurations into [her]0-i ear scarce a month ago ? Can [this long , cool , white saint]5330-this long , cool , white saint — [he]5132-the sick man looks somehow like [a young saint]5331-a young saint in [his]5132-the sick man emaciation and [his]5132-the sick man skull - cap — be [the stammering maniac who , when last [she]0-i saw [him]5132-the sick man , crashed down nigh dead at [her]0-i feet , slain by three words from [her]0-i mouth]5332-the stammering maniac who , when last she saw him , crashed down nigh dead at her feet , slain by three words from her mouth ? " "[0-i] Thank [you]0-i so much . Yes , it is nice ; nice to be Do [you]0-i remember [Keats]374-keats ? [[My]0-i mother]1063-my mother is even more impatient than [I]0-i am . " "[501-one] Well , yes ; [one]501-one does grow a little tired of seeing but"—with a rather forced laugh—"at[501-one] least , [I]0-i have had cause to be thankful that there is no wall - paper to count the pattern of . "[0-i] But [I]0-i must not tire [myself]0-i out before [I]0-i have said what [I]0-i want to say to [you]3049-you , " [he]5333-this polite invalid continues , [his]5333-this polite invalid embarrassment perceptibly deepening , while [his]5333-this polite invalid transparent hand fidgets uneasily with the border of the coverlet thrown over [him]5333-this polite invalid , "[0-i] or"—laughing again—"I[1945-a nurse] shall have that tyrant of [a nurse]1945-a nurse down upon [me]0-i , and — and [I]0-i do wish — [I]0-i have wished so much — so unspeakably — to see [you]3049-you , to speak to [you]3049-you . " [She]0-i sits immovable , listening , while a ray of something — can it be hope ? why should it be hope?—darts across [her]0-i heart . After all , this may be [Byng]203-byng — [her]0-i Byng ; this strange new manner may be only the garment in which sickness has dressed [his]5333-this polite invalid passion — a worn - out garment soon to drop away from [him]5333-this polite invalid in rags and tatters , and in which can not [she]0-i already discern the first rent ? After all , [she]0-i may have need for [her]0-i armour — that armour which , so far , has seemed so pitifully needless . "[0-i] [I]0-i knew that it would be no use asking leave to send for [you]3049-you any sooner ; [they]3051-they would have told [me]0-i [I]0-i was not up to it — would have put [me]0-i off with some excuse ; so [I]0-i kept a ' still sough . " [Her]0-i eyelids tremble , and [she]0-i instinctively puts up [her]0-i hand to cover [her]0-i tell - tale mouth . Surely this is the old language . Surely there is , at all events , a snatch of it in [his]5335-he last words ; and again that prick of illogical joy quickens the beats of [her]0-i fainting heart , though [she]0-i tries to chide it away , asking [herself]0-i why [she]0-i should be in any measure glad that the love which [she]0-i has come here for no other purpose than to renounce , still lives and stirs . "[3049-you] [You]3049-you may think [I]0-i am exaggerating , but in point of fact [I]0-i can not by any expression less strong than the gnaw of downright hunger convey the longing [I]0-i have had to see [you]3049-you . " [He]5335-he pauses with a momentary failure of [his]5335-he still feeble powers . [She]0-i catches [her]0-i breath . Does [he]5335-he see [her]0-i intention , that [he]5335-he plunges , in order to anticipate it , into so hurried a resumption of [his]5335-he interrupted sentence ? "[0-i] To see [you]3049-you , in order to beg — to supplicate [you]3049-you to forgive [me]0-i for [my]0-i conduct to [you]3049-you . " [She]0-i gives an almost imperceptible start . This ending is not what [she]0-i had expected , not the one to defend [herself]0-i against which [she]0-i has been fastening on [her]0-i buckler and grasping [her]0-i shield . "[0-i] [I]0-i do not know what [I]0-i am to forgive , " [she]0-i says , half bewildered . "[0-i] [You]3049-you were not accountable for [your]3049-you actions . [You]3049-you were too ill to know what [you]3049-you were doing . " "[3049-you] Oh , [you]0-i think [I]0-i am alluding to that last time , " cries [he]3049-you , precipitately correcting [her]0-i . "[0-i] No , no ; [you]0-i are right . [I]0-i was not accountable then . [You]0-i might as well have reasoned with a wild beast out of a menagerie . [I]0-i was [a perfect Bedlamite]3052-a perfect bedlamite then . No"—going on very rapidly , as it in desperate anxiety to make [her]0-i comprehend with the least possible delay—"what[3052-a perfect bedlamite] [I]0-i am asking [you]0-i — asking [you]0-i on [my]0-i knees — to forgive [me]0-i for , is [my]0-i whole conduct to [you]0-i from the beginning . " [The two white faces]5337-the two white faces are looking breathlessly into [each other]607-each other , and though of late [he]5339-he has been tussling with death on a bed , and [she]0-i has been walking about , and plying [her]0-i embroidery , and dining at a public table , [hers]0-i is far the whiter of the two . It must be the unwonted exertion of talking so much that makes [him]5339-he bring out [his]5339-he next speech in jerks and gasps . "[0-i] [I]0-i forced [my]0-i acquaintance upon [you]0-i at the very beginning ; [I]0-i watched [you]0-i like [a detective]3053-a detective ; [I]0-i beset [you]0-i wherever [you]0-i went ; [I]0-i pestered [you]0-i with [my]0-i visits . [Jim]181-jim always told [me]0-i that it was not the conduct of [a gentleman]2927-a gentleman , but [I]0-i would not believe [him]181-jim — not even when"—how difficult it is ! [he]181-jim finds it almost as hard work as [[his]181-jim mother]3511-his mother had done upon [the Mole—"not]375-the mole—"not[181-jim] even when , by [my]0-i importunities , [I]0-i had driven [you]0-i away — obliged [you]0-i to rush away almost by night from a place [you]0-i liked — [a place [you]0-i were happy in]3055-a place you were happy in — to escape [me]0-i . And [I]0-i have no excuse to offer [you]0-i — none ; unless , indeed , as [I]0-i sometimes think , [my]0-i mind was off its balance even then . [I]0-i express [myself]0-i wretchedly!"—in a tone of deep distress—"but[0-i] [you]0-i will overlook that , will not [you]0-i ? [You]0-i will — will understand what [I]0-i mean ? " [She]3511-his mother makes an assenting motion with [her]3511-his mother head . At this moment [she]3511-his mother can not speak : [she]3511-his mother will be able to do so again directly , but [she]3511-his mother must have just a minute or two . Yet [she]3511-his mother must not leave [him]5341-he for an instant in doubt that [she]3511-his mother understands [him]5341-he . Oh yes , [she]3511-his mother understands [him]5341-he — understands that [he]5341-he is apologizing for having ever loved [her]3511-his mother ; that [he]5341-he is awkwardly trying to draw the mantle of insanity over even [the Vallombrosan wood]2529-the vallombrosan wood . It is true that [he]5341-he does it with every sign of discomfort and pain ; and [he]5341-he looks away from [her]3511-his mother , as [Mrs. Byng]203-byng , too , had found it pleasanter to do . "[0-i] Do [you]3056-you remember what [Schiller]376-schiller said when [he]376-schiller was dying ? ' Many things are growing clearer to [me]0-i . ' [I]0-i thought a good deal of those words as [I]0-i lay over there"—glancing towards the now neatly - arranged and empty bed . "[3057-they] One night [they]3057-they thought it was all up with [me]0-i — [I]0-i heard [them]3057-they say so . [They]3057-they did not think [I]0-i was conscious , but [I]0-i was ; and it did strike [me]0-i that [I]0-i had made a poor thing of it , and that if ever [I]0-i was given the chance [I]0-i would make a new start . " Again that little assenting movement of [her]3511-his mother fair head . How perfectly comprehensible [he]376-schiller still is ! How well [she]3511-his mother understands that [he]376-schiller is renouncing [her]3511-his mother among the other follies of [his]376-schiller "[3057-they] salad days"—college bear - fights , [music - halls]5343-music - halls , [gambling clubs]5344-gambling clubs . "[0-i] And [I]0-i thought that [I]0-i could not begin better than by falling on [my]0-i knees to [you]3058-his . [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could fall on [my]0-i real knees to [you!"—with]5345-you!"—with a momentary expression of extreme impatience at [his]376-schiller own bodily weakness—"and[3058-his] ask [you]3058-his most humbly and tenderly and reverently to pardon [me]0-i . " [She]0-i looks at [him]3058-his , and sees [his]3058-his wasted face flushing with fatigue and worry and mental suffering . Oh , what a bitter wave of desolateness rolls over [her]0-i ! But [she]0-i smiles . "[3058-his] [I]0-i still do not understand what [I]0-i am to forgive [you]3058-his for . [I]0-i suppose that [you]3058-his could no more help having once thought [you]3058-his loved [me]0-i , than [you]3058-his can help"—she stops abruptly in compassion for the look of acute regret , shame and remorse that crosses [his]3058-his sharp features , and , in [her]0-i mercy to [him]3058-his , gives a different close to [her]0-i phrase from that which its beginning had seemed to bespeak—"than[0-i] [you]3058-his can help having been so ill . " [Her]0-i tone , quite unconsciously to [herself]0-i is inexpressibly touching ; and [Byng]203-byng , weakened by illness , turns [his]3058-his face upon the pillow , and breaks into violent weeping . [[His]3058-his mother]3511-his mother had cried too . It seems to be in [the family]728-the family . [She]0-i has risen — what further is there for [her]0-i to stay for?—and pauses quietly at [his]3058-his side till the paroxysm is past . [Her]0-i standing posture tells [him]3058-his that [she]0-i is going , and [he]3058-his consequently struggles to recover [himself]3058-his in some degree ; but having never cultivated self - control when [he]3058-his was in health , it declines to come at [his]3058-his enfeebled bidding now . "[3058-his] Forgive [me]0-i ! forgive [me]0-i ! " is all [he]3058-his can stammer . [She]0-i looks down upon [him]3058-his with a strange and tender smile , in which for the moment the selfless , pitying sweetness has swallowed up the misery . "[3058-his] Which am [I]0-i to forgive [you]0-i for — for having loved [me]0-i ? or for having ceased to love [me]0-i ? For having been mad ? or for being sane ? Yes , of course [I]0-i forgive [you]0-i from the very bottom of [my]0-i heart ! God bless [you]0-i ! Make haste and get well ! " [She]0-i walks cheerfully to the door , and , reaching it , turns , still wearing that smile , that [he]3058-his may see how perfectly friendly is [her]0-i last look ; but [he]3058-his does not see it . [He]3058-his has rolled over on [his]3058-his face , and the whole sofa is shaking with [his]3058-his sobs . [The Byngs]377-the byngs are gone , having got off just within the time first suggested by [[the sick man]5132-the sick man 's mother]5349-the sick man 's mother . But , after all , [he]3058-his has to be carried on board [the Eugène Perrère]378-the eugène perrère . Since [his]3058-his interview with [Miss Le Marchant]240-miss le marchant , [his]3058-his progress towards recovery has scarcely been so smooth or so fast as before ; and perhaps [[his]3058-his mother]3511-his mother is right to bear [him]3058-his away with what seems such overhaste , even though it be on [men]512-men 's shoulders that [he]3058-his has to make [his]3058-his exit . At all events , [he]3058-his is gone . [The hotel]1144-the hotel — of which [a part of [the inmates]1410-the inmates]5353-a part of the inmates have seen [him]3058-his only prostrate and bleeding , and [the other and larger part]5355-the other and larger part have not seen [him]3058-his at all , but have had [their]1410-the inmates curiosity whetted by the tale of [his]3058-his calamitous arrival , only to have [it]5356-it balked by [his]3058-his hurried departure — crowd into [the entrance - hall]2355-the entrance - hall , some on one pretext , some on another , most on no pretext at all , to see [him]3058-his go . There are only [two of [the visitors]784-the visitors whose faces can not be seen among [the good - naturedly curious and sympathetically pitiful group that watch the exodus of [the little party]5361-the little party]5360-the good - naturedly curious and sympathetically pitiful group that watch the exodus of the little party]5358-two of the visitors whose faces can not be seen among the good - naturedly curious and sympathetically pitiful group that watch the exodus of the little party . Who shall say how [those two]5362-those two spend the hour of [Byng]203-byng 's departure out of [their]5362-those two lives ? [Jim]181-jim has accompanied [the invalid]3676-the invalid to [the quay]2688-the quay to see [the last of [him]3676-the invalid]5365-the last of him ; has stayed with [him]3676-the invalid till the final bell warns [non - passengers]5366-non - passengers off [the boat]2217-the boat ; has left [him]3676-the invalid with all the proper requests and adjurations to let [him]3676-the invalid know how [the sick man]5132-the sick man bears the voyage ; how [they]5362-those two get on , etc . But as [Mrs. Byng]203-byng stands on [the upper deck]5369-the upper deck and watches the trail of churned water lengthening between [her]203-byng and [the dwindling high white town]5370-the dwindling high white town , [she]203-byng has a feeling that [[her]203-byng old friend]1546-her old friend does not like [her]203-byng as well as [he]1546-her old friend did , and that it will never again be quite the same thing between [them]5372-them . [The Byngs]377-the byngs are gone — have been gone a fortnight — and [March]379-march is here . Over [the villa]3598-the villa faces [the begonias]5374-the begonias have broken into riotous flower , and the snowy - blossomed fruit - trees , that have put on their snowy garments but lately , stand out in bright fragility against the heavy green that never , even in January , ceases to wrap itself about [the lovely Moslem town]5375-the lovely moslem town . Every day for the last fortnight , [Jim]181-jim , too , has been going , but [he]181-jim is not yet gone . [His]181-jim guns have arrived ten days ago , and [[his]181-jim friend]393-his friend has expressed by post and wire [his]181-jim weariness of exploring [the bazaars of [Tunis]155-tunis alone]5377-the bazaars of tunis alone . But [he]181-jim is not yet gone to join [that impatient friend]5378-that impatient friend . Why does [he]181-jim still linger in [a place where , as [he]181-jim had justly explained to [Cecilia]222-cecilia]5379-a place where , as he had justly explained to cecilia , there is nothing for [him]181-jim to do ? Why indeed ? It is a question that , by night and day , by the insolence of the staring moonlight which slides in upon [his]181-jim restless open eyes by night , under the fires of the great spring sun at noon , [he]181-jim asks [himself]181-jim . All the answer [he]181-jim can give is that it would be hardly friendly to choose this moment , when [she]222-cecilia is so down in [the world]3184-the world , to leave [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth . [She]222-cecilia is down in [the world]3184-the world ; there can be no mistake about that . Even [[her]222-cecilia father , who has returned from [his]5382-her father , who has returned from his wanderings wanderings]5382-her father , who has returned from his wanderings , must be aware of this fact . Perhaps that is the reason why [he]181-jim no longer snubs [her]222-cecilia as much as [he]181-jim did ; why [he]181-jim even accepts , with some semblance of graciousness , those affectionate and watchful ministrations which [she]222-cecilia tenders [him]181-jim with as gentle an assiduity as in [her]222-cecilia brighter days . But [he]181-jim has still no great appetite for [her]222-cecilia society ; and [she]222-cecilia , unresentfully divining it , gives up to [him]181-jim , without repining , the one great solace of [her]222-cecilia melancholy — [[her]222-cecilia mother]3300-her mother 's company . If [Jim]181-jim were gone , the more part of [her]222-cecilia life would be spent alone . [She]222-cecilia tells [him]181-jim so — tells [him]181-jim , with a sweet flattering smile , how much [his]181-jim comradeship is to [her]222-cecilia . Has [he]181-jim any right to rob [her]222-cecilia of that last prop ? It is only to [himself]181-jim that the breathless clamberings up [the steep short cut to [El Biar]173-el biar]5384-the steep short cut to el biar , deep and brambly as [[her]222-cecilia own Devonshire lanes]5385-her own devonshire lanes , that [the gazings in common over [the pigeon - necked sea]5387-the pigeon - necked sea and [the amaranth hills]5388-the amaranth hills]5386-the gazings in common over the pigeon - necked sea and the amaranth hills , can do any harm . [They]5386-the gazings in common over the pigeon - necked sea and the amaranth hills may put a sting into [his]181-jim own after - life — a sting that all the empty years that follow may be powerless to extract ; but to [her]222-cecilia they serve only as a narcotic to numb the intensity of that ache which the cured madness of [Byng]203-byng has left behind it . Some day , of course , [he]181-jim must leave [her]222-cecilia ; [he]181-jim can not pass [his]181-jim whole life at [her]222-cecilia side ; some day soon leave [her]222-cecilia to walk and sit and study [her]222-cecilia Italian Grammar forlornly alone . But it must not be until [she]222-cecilia has a little plucked up [her]222-cecilia spirits . As soon as [he]181-jim sees any signs of this occurring , [he]181-jim will quit [Algiers]120-algiers — quit it comfortably , with the consciousness of having done a good - natured thing , by which [nobody]3337-nobody is the worse . This is the compromise at which [he]181-jim arrives with the inward adviser — conscience , common - sense , what [you]5390-you will — that is hourly admonishing [him]181-jim to be gone . Does [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth guess that [her]193-elizabeth retention of [the companion]5391-the companion , to whom [she]193-elizabeth so desolately clings , hangs on [her]193-elizabeth remaining always as crushed as the first ten days after those cruel interviews with [the Byngs]377-the byngs , [mother]3447-mother and [son]1572-son , had left [her]193-elizabeth ? If [she]193-elizabeth did , [she]193-elizabeth would probably seek to check the first faint revivings of cheerfulness in [her]193-elizabeth inveterately gay spirit . Instead , while [her]193-elizabeth heart is yet at its sickest , [she]193-elizabeth earnestly tries to foster the tiny seeds of cheerfulness , saying to [herself]193-elizabeth that it is mere selfishness in [her]193-elizabeth to inflict [her]193-elizabeth dismalness upon [[her]193-elizabeth one friend]5394-her one friend ; seeking rather to lift [his]5394-her one friend spirits , which seem scarcely less drooping than [her]193-elizabeth own . Does [he]5394-her one friend enter into [her]193-elizabeth motive ? Does not it rather strike [him]5394-her one friend with a species of shock how superficial must be the nature , how on the surface the suffering , of one who can already begin again to take a mischievous interest in the Widow Wadman 's amours , and to mimic afresh the Cockney twang of [the French Vicomte 's English governess]5395-the french vicomte 's english governess ? It is three weeks to - day since [the Byngs]377-the byngs left . The weather is fine , and a hot sunbeam is lighting up the painful indecision of [Jim]181-jim 's face , as [he]181-jim stands in [[his]181-jim bedroom]799-his bedroom with an open telegram in [his]181-jim hand , which two hours ago was put into it . It is from [[his]181-jim friend]393-his friend at [Tunis]155-tunis , and is conceived in terms which demonstrate that the indignation of [the sender]2836-the sender has got the better of [his]181-jim economy . It contains a stringent representation of [his]181-jim inability any longer to dance attendance upon [Burgoyne]181-jim 's whims , and a peremptory request , answer paid , to be at once informed either that [he]5394-her one friend will join [him]5394-her one friend immediately , or that the idea of [their]5399-their joint excursion has been entirely abandoned . [He]181-jim is standing holding the paper in miserable uncertainty , torn by doubts , rent in twain by conflicting emotions , when the noise of voices and laughter outside [the house]986-the house draws [him]181-jim to the window . [The room [he]181-jim has occupied since [he]181-jim vacated [his]181-jim own for [Byng]203-byng]5401-the room he has occupied since he vacated his own for byng looks out over [the hall]4269-the hall - door , and in front of that door [a small group]5403-a small group is gathered — [the Vicomte]5404-the vicomte , [[his]5404-the vicomte two boys]5405-his two boys , [[his]5404-the vicomte girl]5406-his girl , [[her]5406-his girl governess]5407-her governess , [a coal - black negro who serves as [kitchenmaid]5409-kitchenmaid to [the establishment]5410-the establishment]5408-a coal - black negro who serves as kitchenmaid to the establishment , and — [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth . [They]5403-a small group are all gathered round [a tiny donkey , such a bourriquot as the valiant Tartarin slew , which has evidently been brought up for sale by [[its]5411-a tiny donkey , such a bourriquot as the valiant tartarin slew , which has evidently been brought up for sale by its arab master Arab master]5412-its arab master]5411-a tiny donkey , such a bourriquot as the valiant tartarin slew , which has evidently been brought up for sale by its arab master . Attached to its head gear are two long reins , and holding these reins is [Miss Le Marchant]240-miss le marchant . As [Jim]181-jim looks out , the bourriquot , taking some strange freak into [its]5411-a tiny donkey , such a bourriquot as the valiant tartarin slew , which has evidently been brought up for sale by its arab master little brown head , sets off galloping at a prodigious rate ; and [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth — white gown and blonde hair flying — gallops after it . As [she]193-elizabeth is dragged at racing pace down [the drive]5413-the drive , [her]193-elizabeth immoderate laughter comes borne back on the wind to [the spectator of whom [she]193-elizabeth is unconscious]5414-the spectator of whom she is unconscious . [The latter]423-the latter has turned away from the window , and sat down to [his]181-jim writing - table , where [he]181-jim is scribbling a hasty answer to the missive which has cost [him]181-jim such long deliberation . It does not take a minute to pen now that [he]181-jim has once made up [his]181-jim mind , nor can it be more than five from the moment of the donkey 's start to that when the telegram is on its way to [the Post Office]5416-the post office in [Zameth]366-zameth [the porter]3201-the porter 's hand . The die is cast . When this is the case after long irresolution , there must always be a sense of relief , and perhaps , therefore , it is relief which [Jim]181-jim 's face , thrown down upon [his]181-jim arms rested on the table , expresses . Since [no one]819-no one can see that hidden face , it is impossible to say . [He]181-jim has certainly no wish that [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth should be unhappy . [Her]193-elizabeth patient white misery had filled [him]181-jim with tender pity and ruth ; and yet [her]193-elizabeth laugh , sweet and delicate as it was with all its excess of merriment , rings jarringly in [his]181-jim ears . [She]193-elizabeth is incapable of a great constancy . [He]181-jim had promised [himself]181-jim to stay with [her]193-elizabeth until [her]193-elizabeth spirits were restored . Well , [he]181-jim has kept [his]181-jim promise handsomely . [He]181-jim has done with [her]193-elizabeth and [her]193-elizabeth contradictions now . It will be [someone else]4028-someone else 's turn with [her]193-elizabeth next . Whose ? [The Vicomte]360-the vicomte 's , perhaps . By - and - by [he]181-jim rouses [himself]181-jim . Only a part of [his]181-jim task is yet done . [He]181-jim must tell [them]5420-them that [he]181-jim is going . [He]181-jim finds [Mr.]5421-mr. and [Mrs. Le Marchant]189-mrs. le marchant sitting under the ficus - tree on [the terrace]908-the terrace — [the terrace which , at this hour , [they]5420-them have to [themselves]5420-them]5423-the terrace which , at this hour , they have to themselves . [He]181-jim is leaning back in a wicker chair , with an expression of placid good - humour on [his]181-jim face . Across [his]181-jim knees the hotel cat — a plain and ill - natured animal — lies , loudly purring , while [he]181-jim obligingly scratches [her]189-mrs. le marchant judiciously whenever [she]189-mrs. le marchant indicates a wish for that relaxation . As [Burgoyne]181-jim remembers , [Mr. Le Marchant]210-mr. le marchant had always been on very friendly terms with the beasts of [the field]3523-the field and the fowls of the air . "[380-the escurial] [The train]675-the train sets off at such an unearthly hour to - morrow morning — six o'clock or thereabouts ; it would take three days to get [there]455-there if it did not — that [I]0-i must put [my]0-i things together this afternoon . The path by which [he]5437-neither husband returns is [a rough Arab track]5443-a rough arab track , cut in low steps up [the hill]1467-the hill , each step a mass of fossil - shells — whelk , and scallop and oyster shells , whose inhabitants died — strange thought!—before [Adam]325-adam saw [Eden]112-that little eden 's fair light . It is [a charming road]5445-a charming road , cut , in part , through [the red rock , over which the southern greenery tumbles]5446-the red rock , over which the southern greenery tumbles . [He]5437-neither husband has approached quite close to [her]189-mrs. le marchant before [she]189-mrs. le marchant sees [him]5437-neither husband . [She]189-mrs. le marchant is sitting on a camp - stool by the wayside , looking vacantly before [her]189-mrs. le marchant . [Her]189-mrs. le marchant figure is rather stooped , and [her]189-mrs. le marchant straight back bent , as if it were not worth the trouble to hold it up . Beside [her]189-mrs. le marchant , on the ground , lie a little tin colour - box and water - bottle and a drawing - board . [He]5437-neither husband wishes , with a new pang , that [he]5437-neither husband had not come upon [her]189-mrs. le marchant so suddenly . [He]5437-neither husband is afraid that this is one of the aspects of [her]189-mrs. le marchant that will stick most pertinaciously in [his]5437-neither husband memory . Catching sight of [him]5437-neither husband , [her]189-mrs. le marchant whole sad , listless face lights up . "[0-i] It is [you]3071-you ! [I]0-i was sure [you]3071-you would come . "[0-i] " Are [you]3071-you down on [your]3071-you luck ? "[3071-you] [he]3071-you asks , sitting down by [her]3071-you side ; " [you]3071-you did not seem so"—trying[3071-you] to harden [his]3071-you heart by forcing a recollection of [her]3071-you extravagant gaiety—"a little while ago , when [you]3071-you were prancing after [that jackass]5447-that jackass . "[3071-you] " Is not [he]3071-you [a darling]5448-a darling ? "[3071-you] cries [she]3071-you , hurrying up the end of [her]3071-you sigh to make room for a smile of pleasure . " [I]3071-you want to buy [him]3071-you ; only [I]3071-you am afraid [he]3071-you might die of sea - sickness going [home]401-home . "[3071-you] " Perhaps"—scarcely[3071-you] knowing what [he]3071-you is saying . " [I]3071-you should like to buy a little cart to harness [him]3071-you to — such a one as [I]3071-you saw just now going along [the road]3320-the road , drawn by a tiny bourriquot that might have been [twin brother to [mine]3071-you]5451-twin brother to mine . [Some Arab children]5452-some arab children had dressed out both [him]3071-you and [[his]3071-you cart]5453-his cart with branches of that great yellow fennel — [his]3071-you long ears and [his]3071-you little nose peeped out so pathetically between ; [another child]5454-another child walked after barefoot , waving a great acanthus - leaf . [You]3073-i never saw anything so pretty ! Yes , [you]3073-i must break mine in for [me]3071-you , "[3071-you] smiling again ; " it will not take more than a week , [I]3071-you am sure . "[3071-you] " If it did not take more than a day even , [I]3071-you am afraid [I]3071-you should have to decline the appointment"—seizing[3071-you] this opening to blurt out [his]3071-you news . " [I]3073-i am off at six o'clock to - morrow morning . [I]3073-i — [I]3073-i want to see the Escurial . "[3073-i] [She]3073-i had been almost garrulous about the little donkey , and [he]3071-you had wished to stop [her]3073-i . In that [he]3071-you has undoubtedly succeeded . How the asphodels cover the banks on either hand ! [They]3074-they have come into full flower since last [he]3071-you passed this way : tall branching stem , white blossom , and pinky bud ; here they are in thousands . It is a soft day , on which scents lie heavy , and their strong odour — that is scarcely perfume , and yet has an odd , acrid charm — fills the air . " Everything must come to an end , "[3071-you] [he]3071-you says baldly . [She]3073-i is apparently not going to make any more effort to detain [him]3071-you than had [[her]3073-i mother]3300-her mother . [He]3071-you has every right to come and go where and when [he]3071-you pleases . Since [Amelia]201-amelia died , to [no human being]3076-no human being is [he]3071-you accountable for [his]3071-you actions , and yet there is both guilt and misery in [his]3071-you voice as [he]3071-you utters [his]3071-you platitude . " It has been great good luck for [me]201-amelia that [you]3071-you have stayed so long ; [I]201-amelia know that it is out of pure kindness that [you]3071-you have done it , and it has made all the difference to [me]201-amelia . [I]201-amelia — [I]201-amelia am quite set up again now , thanks to [you]3071-you ; and — and summer is coming on , and [I]201-amelia shall do very well — capitally ! "[201-amelia] [She]201-amelia has detected — what is , indeed , pretty obvious — the deep distress of [his]3071-you face and voice , and , in [her]201-amelia habitual unselfishness , [her]201-amelia one thought is to relieve [him]3071-you of any self - reproachful misgiving that [he]3071-you is doing aught cruel in robbing [her]201-amelia of the support of [his]3071-you companionship . In [her]201-amelia tone is nothing but the meekest gratitude . It is [her]201-amelia misfortune , not [her]201-amelia fault , that in it there is not cheerfulness too . But [her]201-amelia " gentle physic , "[201-amelia] instead of curing , seems to aggravate [his]3071-you ill . " It must come to an end some time or other ! "[3071-you] [he]3071-you murmurs wretchedly , as if to [himself]3071-you . " Yes ! "[3071-you] Dead silence . Below the slight eminence where [they]3077-they sit , [the road]3320-the road winds white , and upon [the opulent low green hills on [its]3320-the road further side]3079-the opulent low green hills on its further side , what a banquet of colour ! On one steep slope the plough is driving [its]3320-the road difficult furrows , turning up the rich red earth , shaded with deeper claret and lighter pink stains . Beneath , a square of stone - pines looks like a green velvet handkerchief spread on [the hillside]1457-the hillside , and over the rest of [the upland eucalyptus]3081-the upland eucalyptus , and olive , and cactus hold [their]3077-they riot of various verdure ; while , on the tiptop of everything , against a weirdly pale - blue sky - field , [a Moorish villa]3082-a moorish villa lifts [its]3082-a moorish villa white flank . How long have [they]3077-they both been staring dully at that fair prospect before [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth again speaks ! — " [You]3071-you were [a very good friend to [me]193-elizabeth]5455-a very good friend to me ! "[193-elizabeth] [She]193-elizabeth had not meant that past tense as an arrow to shoot into [his]3071-you heart ; but it sticks there , barbed . " [I]193-elizabeth do not know how . "[193-elizabeth] " And [friends]3843-friends — real , [good friends]5457-good friends — should not have concealments from [each other]607-each other , should [they]3843-friends ? [They]3843-friends should tell [one another]1485-one another about [themselves]3843-friends ? "[193-elizabeth] " Yes . "[193-elizabeth] A pause . " [I]193-elizabeth have often wished — often tried to tell [you]3071-you about [myself]193-elizabeth ; but [I]193-elizabeth could not . [I]193-elizabeth never could !
