"[193-elizabeth] What a small battlefield those three words make for the anger and agony [they]3083-they express to fight upon ! Another longer pause . [She]3084-her has taken off [her]3084-her hat , and now passes [her]3084-her handkerchief over [her]3084-her damp forehead . " [I]3084-her shall be all right when [I]3084-her have once begun , but it is bad to make a start . "[3084-her] " Do not make it ! do not tell [me]3084-her ! [I]3084-her adjure [you]3071-you not to tell [me]3084-her ! it hurts [you]3071-you too much ! "[3084-her] " It would hurt [me]3084-her more to let [you]3071-you go without telling [you]3071-you . Do [you]3071-you remember"—rushing[3084-her] desperately into [her]3084-her subject—"at the time [you]3071-you stayed with [us]5460-us at [the Moat]558-the moat , that there was a great talk among [us]5460-us of [my]3085-he having [my]3085-he portrait painted ? "[3085-he] [He]3085-he knits [his]3085-he brow in an eager straining of [his]3085-he memory . " Yes , [I]3085-he recollect . "[3085-he] " [Father]225-father was wonderfully proud of [me]3084-her in those days ; it seems impossible to believe it now"—with[3084-her] a passing look of incredulity at [her]3084-her own statement—"but [he]225-father was . "[3084-her] " Yes , yes . "[3085-he] " Do [you]3071-you remember all the arranging and planning as to who was to be [the artist]5462-the artist , and that [he]225-father was to come and stay in [the house]986-the house to paint it ? "[181-jim] [Jim]181-jim has put [his]181-jim hand up to [his]181-jim forehead as if to quicken the return of those faint and distant impressions which are coming out in stronger and stronger colours on memory 's surface . " Yes , yes ; [he]3085-he was not [an Englishman]4155-an englishman , was [he]3085-he ? [We]3086-we used to laugh about him"—adding[181-jim] stroke to stroke in order to convince [her]3084-her of the accuracy of [his]3085-he recollections—"used to call [him]3085-he [the ' distinguished foreigner]5465-the ' distinguished foreigner . ' "[181-jim] " Did [we]3086-we ? Yes"—slowly—"I[181-jim] remember now that [we]3086-we did . Well"—gathering [herself]3084-her up for a supreme effort , panting painfully , and turning [her]3084-her head quite aside so that [he]3085-he may have no glimpse of [her]3084-her face—"he[181-jim] came , and [he]3085-he stayed two months , and at the end of those two months [I]0-i — [I]0-i — ran away with [him]3085-he ! " [One]501-one would have thought that [Jim]181-jim had been in some measure prepared for the just - fallen blow , both by the overheard fragments of [Mr. Greenock]259-mr. greenock 's conversation with [the Devonshire clergyman]3953-the devonshire clergyman at [Florence]20-florence last year ; by the accumulated evidence of there being some blight upon [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth 's life ; and , lastly and chiefly , by the ravings of [Byng]203-byng . But there is something so different from all these , so infinitely more dreadful , in hearing this naked statement from [her]3084-her own lips , that it stuns [him]3085-he as much as if [he]3085-he had never received any hint of that ruinous secret in the background of [her]3084-her life . Having now uttered it , [she]3084-her stops , either to pick up [her]3084-her own spent strength or to give [him]3085-he the opportunity for some question or comment . [He]3085-he makes neither . "[0-i] [I]0-i thought — [I]0-i hoped — that [you]3087-you had guessed , from what [Mr. Byng]251-byng said . [I]0-i believed that when [he]251-byng was not [himself]251-byng — — " Again [she]3084-her breaks off , but still no sound comes from [Jim]181-jim . "[251-byng] [You]3087-you understand , of course , that that was what [I]0-i told [him]251-byng . [I]0-i wanted to tell [him]251-byng the rest , but that time [he]251-byng could not hear it , and the last time [he]251-byng — [he]251-byng — did not care to hear it . " [His]181-jim continued muteness must daunt [her]3084-her , for [she]3084-her here makes a longer pause than before . Indeed , it is only the fear lest [she]3084-her should mean it for a final one that enables [him]181-jim to force out the two husky monosyllables : "[251-byng] Go on . " [She]3084-her is always most obedient , and [she]3084-her now obeys . "[251-byng] [He]251-byng came only two days after [you]3087-you left [us]3088-us ; that was why the sight of [you]3087-you was so — so painful to [us]3088-us at first . It was not [your]3087-you fault , but [we]3088-us could not help mixing [you]3087-you up with [him]251-byng . [You]3087-you remember how [we]3088-us tried to avoid [you]3087-you — how discourteous [we]3088-us were ? [You]3087-you forgave [us]3088-us afterwards , but [you]3087-you must have observed it . " [The listener]5468-the listener makes a slight motion of assent . "[3087-you] [He]251-byng was [a Hungarian]3089-a hungarian , and had been recommended to [father]3390-father by [Sir]3091-sir — — , who , as [you]3087-you know , is always so extraordinarily kind to [struggling artists]3092-struggling artists , and who thought highly of [his]251-byng talent , and wished to get [him]251-byng commissions . [He]251-byng was almost starving in [London]1-london ; that was one great reason , [I]0-i think , why [father]3390-father employed [him]251-byng . " Even at this moment the thought darts across [Jim]181-jim 's mind that [he]181-jim has never known [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth miss an opportunity of implying some praise of [that father whose harshness towards [herself]193-elizabeth [he]181-jim has so often had an opportunity of witnessing]5469-that father whose harshness towards herself he has so often had an opportunity of witnessing . "[3390-father] [He]251-byng was quite young — not more than twenty - three — and [he]251-byng looked very ill when [he]251-byng first came ; indeed , [he]251-byng was really half starved . It has always been the surest passport to [mammy]285-mammy 's heart to be poor and sick and down in [the world]3184-the world , and nothing could have been kinder than [they]3095-they both were to [him]251-byng . " "[3095-they] And well [he]251-byng repaid [their]3095-they kindness , " says [Jim]181-jim , indignation at last giving [him]181-jim words . [She]5470-she puts out [her]5470-she hand , as if to stop [him]181-jim . "[251-byng] Wait , wait ! " [she]5470-she says , almost authoritatively ; "[251-byng] do not abuse [him]251-byng . [He]251-byng seemed very grateful to [them]3095-they , and [they]3095-they all — [we]3096-we all — became quite fond of [him]251-byng . When [he]251-byng grew stronger , [he]251-byng turned out to be very lively and light - hearted — almost as light - hearted as [we]3096-we . " [She]5470-she pauses , pulled up by a deep sigh , at the reminiscence of that young gaiety , then hurries on , as if afraid of [his]181-jim again breaking in upon [her]5470-she narrative with some scathing ejaculation . "[251-byng] Before three weeks were over — [you]3097-you know how cheerful and easy - going [we]3096-we were — [he]251-byng was quite one of [us]3096-we — quite as — as intimate as [you]3097-you were . " [Jim]181-jim stirs uneasily , galled by the comparison . "[251-byng] [He]251-byng was a long time painting [my]0-i picture — could not satisfy [himself]251-byng with the likeness — and began it over again several times . At first there was always someone in [the room]442-the room with [us]3096-we when [I]0-i sat to [him]251-byng , but by - and - by , as [he]251-byng became more and more one of [us]3096-we — as [his]251-byng presence among [us]3096-we grew to be a matter of course — [we]3096-we were allowed often to be tête - à - tête . " [She]5470-she stops to let pass [two Frenchmen]5471-two frenchmen and [a Frenchwoman of [the petit bourgeois class who are sauntering homewards]5473-the petit bourgeois class who are sauntering homewards , frisked about by [two little cheerful curs]5474-two little cheerful curs , and with armfuls of hawthorn]5472-a frenchwoman of the petit bourgeois class who are sauntering homewards , frisked about by two little cheerful curs , and with armfuls of hawthorn — yes ; [real English hawthorn]5475-real english hawthorn — in [their]5472-a frenchwoman of the petit bourgeois class who are sauntering homewards , frisked about by two little cheerful curs , and with armfuls of hawthorn embrace . "[251-byng] It was a very fine autumn , as [you]3099-you may remember , and [we]3096-we used to go out sketching together . [He]251-byng was supposed to give [us]3096-we sketching lessons — [the children]3100-the children and [me]0-i . [The governess]3101-the governess was by way of always being there , but [she]3101-the governess was [a sentimental creature]3102-a sentimental creature , generally straying away by [herself]3101-the governess with a poetry - book , and [we]3096-we were virtually alone . " [Jim]181-jim sees how increasingly , how horribly difficult of relation is the tale as it nears its catastrophe ; but [he]181-jim is quite incapable of helping [her]3101-the governess . "[3101-the governess] [We]3096-we fell in love with [one another"—almost]5477-one another"—almost brusquely—"and[251-byng] [he]251-byng asked [me]0-i to marry [him]251-byng . What did [his]251-byng miserable poverty matter to [us]3096-we ? [He]251-byng knew almost as little of the practical business of life as [I]0-i , and [he]251-byng was full of hope and ambition . [He]251-byng was convinced that [he]251-byng had a future before [him]251-byng . Perhaps [he]251-byng had . Who knows ? " There is mixed with the hurry and shame and anguish of [her]3101-the governess tone such an element of almost regretful compassion as [she]3101-the governess pronounces these last words , that [Jim]181-jim 's jealous wrath awakes . Does [she]3101-the governess , then , love [him]251-byng still ? In [her]3101-the governess heart for how many is there lodging at once ? For [Byng]203-byng ? For this unknown ? For how many more ? "[251-byng] Even [he]251-byng , high - flown as [he]251-byng was , knew that it was impossible that [father]3390-father could permit [our]3096-we marriage if [we]3096-we asked [his]251-byng consent ; but what [he]251-byng laboured to convince [me]0-i of was , that if the thing were once done and irrevocable , [father]3390-father would soon , doting as [he]3390-father did on [me]0-i — [you]3105-you know [he]3390-father did dote on [me]0-i , poor father!—he would soon forgive [us]3096-we ; and [I]0-i , after awhile — oh ! it was after awhile ; do not think it was at once"—with a piteous effort to mitigate the severity of [her]3390-father silent judge—"and[0-i] [I]0-i have always all [my]0-i life been terribly easily persuaded — [I]0-i gave in . " Far away a dull cloud , rain - charged , is settling over [the Kabyle mountains]2697-the kabyle mountains , rubbing out [their]2697-the kabyle mountains toothed ridge . Can [she]3390-father hold out to the end ? [She]3390-father has not reached the worst yet . "[0-i] [We]3096-we were soon given an opportunity . [Father]3390-father and [mother]3447-mother went away for a couple of nights upon a visit , and left [us]3096-we under the nominal chaperonage of [a deaf old aunt of [mother]3447-mother 's]3108-a deaf old aunt of mother 's , and of [the governess]3101-the governess , who , as [I]0-i have told [you]3111-you , was worse than useless . [You]3111-you know that [[our]3096-we railway - station]3112-our railway - station was not more than a mile from [the lodge]3113-the lodge gates ; [we]3096-we had , therefore , no difficulty in slipping away from [the others]3469-the others while [we]3096-we were all out walking , making [our]3096-we way [there]455-there , and getting into [the little branch - line train which caught the [London]1-london express at [Exeter]177-exeter]3116-the little branch - line train which caught the london express at exeter . " [She]0-i has repeatedly put up [her]0-i handkerchief , and passed it over [her]0-i brow , but it is useless . The cold sweat breaks out afresh and afresh . "[0-i] That journey ! [I]0-i did not know that it was the end of [my]0-i life . [We]3096-we both set off laughing and saying to [each other]607-each other what a good joke it was . That was at the beginning , but long and long before [we]3096-we reached [London]1-london — it was not till very late that [we]3096-we did so — [I]0-i would have given all [the world]3184-the world to go back . [I]0-i did not tell [him]3119-he so , because [I]0-i thought it would hurt [him]3119-he , but [I]0-i have often thought since that perhaps [he]3119-he was feeling the same . " Again that touch of almost tender ruth in [her]0-i voice makes [her]0-i auditor writhe . "[3096-we] [We]3096-we went to [an hotel]2209-an hotel . [I]0-i think it must have been in [some very out - of - the - way part of [the town]407-the town]3121-some very out - of - the - way part of the town , probably [the only one [he]3119-he knew of]3123-the only one he knew of , and at first [they]3124-they would not take [us]3096-we in because [we]3096-we had no luggage ; but [they]3124-they consented at last . [I]0-i heard [him]3119-he telling [the landlady]3125-the landlady that [I]0-i was [[his]3119-he sister]723-his sister . [I]0-i suppose [she]3125-the landlady did not believe it , as [she]3125-the landlady looked very oddly at [me]0-i . [I]0-i did not understand why [she]3125-the landlady should ; but it made [me]0-i feel very wretched — so wretched that [I]0-i could scarcely swallow a mouthful of the supper [he]3119-he ordered . [I]0-i do not think that [he]3119-he had much more appetite than [I]0-i ; but [we]3096-we tried very hard to laugh and keep up [each other]607-each other 's spirits . [They]3128-they gave [me]0-i [a very dismal bedroom]3129-a very dismal bedroom — [I]0-i can see it now"—shuddering—"and as [I]3130-i had no change of clothes [I]3130-i lay all night outside [my]3130-i bed . It took a great deal to keep [me]3130-i awake in those days , and , wretched as [I]3130-i was , [I]3130-i slept a good deal . The next morning [I]3130-i awoke , feeling more cheerful . [We]3096-we should be married in the forenoon , return [home]401-home in the afternoon , to spring [our]3096-we surprise upon [the children]3100-the children and [Fräulein]382-fräulein , and be ready to receive and be pardoned by [father]3390-father and [mother]3447-mother on [their]3128-they return to - morrow . It had not occurred to either of [us]3096-we that there would be the slightest difficulty in pursuing this course . [We]3096-we had decided upon at once inquiring the name and address of [the clergyman in [whose parish [the hotel]1144-the hotel was]5484-whose parish the hotel was]5483-the clergyman in whose parish the hotel was — going together to ask for an interview , and beg [him]5483-the clergyman in whose parish the hotel was to marry [us]3096-we at once . [We]3096-we had a vague idea that a licence might be needed , but relied upon [the clergyman]3644-the clergyman also to inform [us]3096-we where that might be got . In one respect [our]3096-we plans had to be at once modified . When [I]3130-i came down [I]3130-i found that there was such a dense fog that [he]5483-the clergyman in whose parish the hotel was would not hear of [my]3130-i venturing out into it , particularly , [he]5483-the clergyman in whose parish the hotel was said , as [my]3130-i staying behind would entail no delay ; since , when [he]5483-the clergyman in whose parish the hotel was had obtained the licence and engaged [the clergyman]3644-the clergyman , [he]5483-the clergyman in whose parish the hotel was would , of course , at once come back to fetch [me]3130-i to [church]4060-church . [I]3130-i gave in , though [I]3130-i had rather have gone with [him]5483-the clergyman in whose parish the hotel was , and fought [my]3130-i way through the fog than stayed behind , alone in [that dreary sitting - room]5489-that dreary sitting - room . [I]3130-i was there nearly all day by [myself]3130-i until late in the afternoon . The fog was so thick that [I]3130-i could not see a finger 's length beyond the window , nor even across [the room]442-the room . [I]3130-i had neither book nor work . [I]3130-i had nothing to do but walk up and down by the flickering light of the bad gas , which was burning all day , and look at [a wretched little dead aucuba]5491-a wretched little dead aucuba in a pot . Sometimes [I]3130-i went out on [the landing]5492-the landing to see if there were any signs of [his]5483-the clergyman in whose parish the hotel was return . [I]3130-i had done this for the fiftieth time , when at last [I]3130-i saw [him]5483-the clergyman in whose parish the hotel was through the gas and the fog , coming up the staircase . [I]3130-i could not wait till [he]5483-the clergyman in whose parish the hotel was had reached [me]3130-i , but called out over the banisters , ' Well ? Well ? ' [His]5483-the clergyman in whose parish the hotel was only answer was a sort of sign to [me]3130-i to go back into [the room]442-the room ; but [I]3130-i did not understand it at first . Not until [I]3130-i saw , coming up the stairs too , a little behind [him]5483-the clergyman in whose parish the hotel was , the face of — of — [that clergyman [you]3130-i saw at [Certosa]65-certosa]5494-that clergyman you saw at certosa — [[our]5495-we clergyman whom [we]5495-we used to make fun of]5496-our clergyman whom we used to make fun of . Oh , why did [we]5495-we ? "[3130-i] [She]3130-i breaks off with a low moan , but at once resumes as if [she]3130-i could not trust [herself]3130-i to pause : " As soon as [I]3130-i caught sight of [him]5483-the clergyman in whose parish the hotel was [I]3130-i ran back ; but it was too late . [I]3130-i knew that [he]5483-the clergyman in whose parish the hotel was had recognised [me]3130-i . [I]3130-i do not , to this day , understand how [he]5483-the clergyman in whose parish the hotel was came to be in [that out - of - the - way place]5497-that out - of - the - way place ; whether it was a most unfortunate coincidence , or whether [he]5483-the clergyman in whose parish the hotel was had seen [us]5495-we in [the train]675-the train or at [Paddington]178-paddington , and tracked [us]5495-we [there]455-there . [I]3130-i ran back , as [I]3130-i have said , into [the room]442-the room ; but [I]3130-i did not really mind much [his]5483-the clergyman in whose parish the hotel was having seen [me]3130-i ; it would all be explained so soon , and [I]3130-i was too much taken up with the bitter disappointment in store for [me]3130-i to give [him]5483-the clergyman in whose parish the hotel was more than a passing thought . Of course [you]5501-you will understand that it was not in the power of [any clergyman]5502-any clergyman to marry [us]5495-we , as neither of [us]5495-we had lived in [the parish]3342-the parish for the requisite time beforehand , nor could [we]5495-we be married at [a registry office]5504-a registry office , as [our]5495-we names had not been entered in [the registrar]5505-the registrar 's book for the legal time . [I]3130-i think [I]3130-i should have broken down altogether when [I]3130-i heard this if [I]3130-i had not had to comfort [him]5483-the clergyman in whose parish the hotel was . [He]5483-the clergyman in whose parish the hotel was was so overwhelmed with the fear that [I]3130-i should think that it was [his]5483-the clergyman in whose parish the hotel was fault — that [he]5483-the clergyman in whose parish the hotel was had not done [his]5483-the clergyman in whose parish the hotel was best . [Heaven]197-heaven knows [I]3130-i had no such hard thought of [him]5483-the clergyman in whose parish the hotel was ! Although [we]5495-we consulted together all that evening , and till late into the night , [we]5495-we could not hit upon any expedient . [He]5483-the clergyman in whose parish the hotel was had been told vaguely that the Scotch marriage law differed from the English , and that in [Edinburgh]42-edinburgh [we]5495-we might be married at once . But [we]5495-we had not enough money to take [us]5495-we [there]455-there . [Our]5495-we whole stock would only just buy an ordinary licence , keep [us]5495-we one day more at [the hotel]1144-the hotel , and take [us]5495-we [home]401-home third class . What should [we]5495-we do ? [We]5495-we did not even try to laugh that evening — that last evening ! "[3130-i] In [her]3131-i voice is the same echo of some pitying sorrow that had before offended [him]3132-him ; but [his]3132-him interest is now too strung up for [him]3132-him to notice it . " [I]3131-i did not once close [my]3131-i eyes that night , and when [I]3131-i came down next morning [I]3131-i had made up [my]3131-i mind to beg [him]3132-him to let [me]3131-i go [home]401-home and ask [father]3390-father to make everything right . [I]3131-i had such confidence that [father]3390-father could set everything right . When [I]3131-i came into [the sitting - room]1315-the sitting - room [he]3132-him was not [there]455-there . [I]3131-i waited for [him]3132-him , and after awhile the breakfast was brought up ; but still [he]3132-him did not come . [I]3131-i waited on . It seemed to [me]3131-i odd that , at such a crisis , when [we]5514-we were both so miserable , [he]3132-him should be able to oversleep [himself]3132-him [I]3131-i am afraid"—with[3131-i] an accent of most regretful remorse—"that [I]3133-i did think hardly of [him]3132-him then . [I]3133-i looked at the clock ; [I]3133-i had been down an hour . [I]3133-i rang for [the waiter]4209-the waiter , and asked [him]4209-the waiter to go and tell [the gentleman]5516-the gentleman this . [He]4209-the waiter was so long in coming back that [I]3133-i lost patience , and went out into [the passage]1878-the passage . [I]3133-i saw [a little group of people]5518-a little group of people gathered round a door some way down it . [They]5518-a little group of people seemed to be whispering and speaking excitedly , and [one chambermaid]5519-one chambermaid was crying . In an instant [I]3133-i was among [them]5518-a little group of people , through [them]5518-a little group of people , in [the room]442-the room . It was [[his]3132-him bedroom]799-his bedroom . [He]3132-him was lying half on , half off the bed . [He]3132-him had evidently not undressed all night , and had taken off nothing but [his]3132-him coat . Before [they]5518-a little group of people could stop [me]3133-i — [I]3133-i believe that [they]5518-a little group of people humanely tried — [I]3133-i had caught a glimpse of [his]3132-him face , and had heard [someone , as if at a great distance off]5522-someone , as if at a great distance off , pronounce the word ' dead ' ! Then everything went away . [I]3133-i believe [I]3133-i crashed down like a log , as [Mr. Byng]251-byng did . When next [I]3133-i came to [myself]3133-i [mammy]285-mammy was leaning over [me]3133-i . [The people in [the hotel]1144-the hotel]5523-the people in the hotel had found a letter in [my]3133-i pocket , with [my]3133-i address , and had telegraphed for [her]5525-her and [father]3390-father . [They]5518-a little group of people took [me]3133-i [home]401-home . [I]3133-i do not remember anything about that , but so [I]3133-i was told afterwards , as [I]3133-i was also told that [he]181-jim had died of deep - seated heart - disease , aggravated by [his]181-jim anxiety about [me]3133-i . [I]3133-i have never brought good - luck to anyone that had to do with [me]3133-i ! "[3133-i] [She]3133-i is crying quietly now . Is it [her]3133-i tale or [her]3133-i tears that have softened [Jim]181-jim 's heart ? [He]181-jim no longer grudges [her]3133-i that tribute to [the lover of [her]3133-i youth]3134-the lover of her youth . " For the first few days after [I]181-jim came [home]401-home [I]181-jim did not feel anything at all , and [I]181-jim saw [nobody]3337-nobody but mammy . At the end of a week [she]3133-i came to [me]181-jim , and told [me]181-jim that [I]181-jim must pull [myself]181-jim together , for that [[my]181-jim father]3383-my father wished [me]181-jim to go with [him]3383-my father to an agricultural meeting at [Exeter]177-exeter , which [we]5531-we were always in the habit of attending . [She]3133-i said that there were reports about [me]181-jim in [the county]5532-the county , which nothing but [my]181-jim appearing in public would contradict [She]3133-i said [she]3133-i knew how hard it was for [me]181-jim , but that [she]3133-i knew , too , that [I]181-jim would try to make the effort for [their]5533-their sakes . For [their]5533-their sakes!"—in[181-jim] a heart - wrung voice—"was not it the least [I]3135-my could do , for [their]5533-their sakes ? [I]3135-my got up ; [my]3135-my legs felt as if they did not belong to [me]3135-my . [She]3133-i dressed [me]3135-my [herself]3133-i — darling mammy!—and [she]3133-i tied on [my]3135-my veil , and — put some rouge on [my]3135-my cheeks ! Think of [mammy]1029-mammy rouging [anyone]3161-anyone ! If [you]5536-you remember , [we]5537-we had had some charades while [you]5536-you were with [us]5537-we , and had bought some rouge for [them]5533-their . And then [she]3133-i took [me]3135-my down to [father]3390-father , and [we]5537-we went — [he]3390-father and [I.]3135-my "[3135-my] [Her]3135-my breath has grown shorter , and [her]3135-my narrative more disjointed ; but [she]3135-my perseveres . Is not [she]3135-my near the end ? " [We]5537-we went — and [we]5537-we walked about — among the shorthorns — and [the prize poultry]5539-the prize poultry — and [the tents]5540-the tents — [father]3390-father and [I]3136-her — and [we]5537-we met [a great many people whom [we]5537-we knew]5542-a great many people whom we knew — [the whole county]5543-the whole county was there — but [we]5537-we were too late . [[Our]5537-we Rector]5544-our rector had been before [us]5537-we with [them]5542-a great many people whom we knew — and [not one of [them]5542-a great many people whom we knew]5545-not one of them would speak to [me]3136-her ! [Not one of [them]5542-a great many people whom we knew]5545-not one of them would have anything to say to [me]3136-her ! And then [we]5537-we went [home]401-home . Oh , [poor father]1053-poor father ! "[3136-her] [She]3136-her has covered [her]3136-her face with [her]3136-her transparent hands . The emotion that [she]3136-her would not permit [herself]3136-her for [herself]3136-her has mastered [her]3136-her at the recollection of [that father]2515-that father 's abasement and agony . " [He]2515-that father was quite right — it was quite natural that [he]2515-that father should not allow [me]3138-she to live at [home]401-home , after that . [He]2515-that father said [I]3138-she must not blight [the children]3100-the children 's lives — must not stand in the light of the others . So [I]3138-she was sent away to live with [some old friends of [mammy's]5552-mammy's]5551-some old friends of mammy's — [two kind old ladies]5553-two kind old ladies — with whom [she]5552-mammy's had been at school ; and [they]5551-some old friends of mammy's were very good to [me]3138-she , and [I]3138-she lived with [them]5551-some old friends of mammy's until , as [Miriam]192-miriam and [Rose]191-rose were married , [father]3390-father thought [I]3138-she could not do [anyone]3161-anyone any more harm , and [he]3390-father let [me]3138-she come [home]401-home again . There ! that is all ! "[3138-she] [She]3138-she stops , [her]3138-she tale ended , sighing with the inexpressible relief of that lifted load . Speech from [him]3139-he now would be no interruption — would be kindly , rather , and welcome . Yet [he]3139-he still stares blankly before [him]3139-he . Why has [she]3138-she told [him]3139-he that painful tale ? Is it that [he]3139-he may carry a more lenient judgment of [her]3138-she through the rest of [his]3139-he life — that life to be finally severed from [hers]3138-she ? Or is it with some hope that that told tale may keep [him]3139-he for ever beside [her]3138-she ? [She]3138-she does not love [him]3139-he . [She]3138-she loves [Byng]251-byng . But , as [he]3139-he has often told [himself]3139-he , [she]3138-she is not of the stuff of which great constancies are made . And , since [Byng]251-byng has forsaken [her]3138-she , whom has [this pliant creature]3140-this pliant creature , that nature made so clinging and circumstances so lonely , left to throw [her]3138-she tendrils round , except [him]3139-he ? [She]3138-she does not love [him]3139-he , and yet in the depth of [his]3139-he heart [he]3139-he knows that , if [he]3139-he wished it , [he]3139-he could make [her]3138-she love [him]3139-he . Shall [he]3139-he wish it ? Shall [he]3139-he stay — stay to have those exquisite eyes , tear - washed , and yet laughing , watching for [his]3139-he lightest wish ; that tripping step keeping time to [his]3139-he up [the hills]858-the hills and through [the valleys of life]3142-the valleys of life ; that delicate sympathy , soaring with [his]3139-he highest thoughts , and yet playing with [his]3139-he lightest fancies ? Shall [he]3139-he ? [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth is looking down upon the asphodels , stooping to stroke , as if it were a sentient thing , a great plumy plant , like a sort of glorified fennel , out of whose fluthery breast a puissant sheath rises , from which an unfamiliar flower is pushing . What a fascination there is in this alien vegetation , in which every shut calyx holds a delightful secret ! Shall [he]3139-he ? For [himself]3139-he , [he]3139-he believes [her]193-elizabeth story implicitly , feeling , indeed , with a shock of mixed surprise and remorse , what a past want of faith in [her]193-elizabeth is evidenced by [his]3139-he unspeakable relief at its being no worse a one . But who else will believe it ? And the more penetratingly sweet , the more poignantly dear [she]193-elizabeth is to [him]3139-he , the sharper to [him]3139-he will be the agony of the eye averted from [her]193-elizabeth , the suspicious whisper , or the contemptuous smile . Is [his]3139-he heart stout enough , is [his]3139-he courage high enough , to support and uphold [her]193-elizabeth through [her]193-elizabeth life 's long contumely ? Dares [he]3139-he undertake that hard task ? Dares [he]3139-he ? [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth is never one apt to take offence , or [she]193-elizabeth might resent [his]3139-he delay in making any observation on [her]193-elizabeth ended story . Probably [she]193-elizabeth divines that whatever may be the cause of [his]3139-he slowness , it is certainly not want of emotion . At length [his]3139-he tardy speech makes itself heard . " [I]3139-he do not know how — [I]3139-he have not words strong enough with which to thank [you]193-elizabeth for telling [me]3139-he . "[3139-he] " [I]193-elizabeth did not want [[my]193-elizabeth one friend]5557-my one friend to go away thinking more hardly of [me]193-elizabeth than [he]5557-my one friend need , "[193-elizabeth] [she]193-elizabeth answers , with a poor , small smile . This is one of the bitterest cups to which [her]193-elizabeth lips have ever been set in the course of [her]193-elizabeth sad history . [His]3139-he next sentence is almost inaudible . " [I]3139-he could not well think much better of [you]3139-he than [I]3139-he have done all along . "[3139-he] [He]3139-he knows , without seeing it , that [her]193-elizabeth trembling hand makes a half - motion to go out to [him]3139-he at those kind - sounding words , but it is drawn back again before the action has passed much beyond the stage of a project . The wind has fallen . With how almost disagreeable a strength does the sharp and pungent smell of the innumerable asphodels assail the nostrils . The light grows lower . Dares [he]3139-he ? Has [he]3139-he the steady selfless valour that will be needed to fight through many years by the side of this forlorn creature against an enemy uglier — and , oh ! how much more potent!—than any of the fierce forest creatures in contest with which [he]3139-he has so often lightly perilled [his]3139-he life ? Dares [he]3139-he ? [He]3139-he has never been lacking in self - reliance — been , perhaps , too little apt to blench at the obstacles strewn in [his]3139-he life - path . Is [he]3139-he going to blench now ? Whether it be to [his]3139-he credit or [his]3139-he shame , the answer does not come all at once . Dares [he]3139-he ? The response comes at last — comes slowly , comes solemnly , yet comes certainly : " Yes . "[3139-he] [He]3139-he can never again laugh at [Byng]251-byng for [his]3139-he tears , for [he]3139-he is undoubtedly crying [himself]3139-he now . " [Elizabeth]193-elizabeth ! [Elizabeth!"—he]383-elizabeth!"—he[251-byng] can not get further than that at first—"you — [you]193-elizabeth are [the worst - used woman in [the world]3184-the world]5558-the worst - used woman in the world ! and [I]251-byng — [I]251-byng have not the least desire to see the Escurial !
